text.ori_cn: 栖守道德者，寂寞一时；依附权势者，凄凉万古。故达人观物外之物，思身后之身，宁受一时之寂寞，毋取万古之凄凉。
text.man_en: If you strive to make Truth your home, You may sometimes be lonely; But fawning on the powerful and influential, You will feel the chill of solitude for the ages.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who abide by morality will be lonely for a while; those who cling to power will be desolate for ages. Therefore, a person with great ability to look at things outside the body, think of the body behind, would rather suffer the loneliness of the moment, not to take the bleakness of the ages.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who live in morality will be lonely for a while; those who rely on power will be desolate forever. Therefore, an expert looks at things outside of things and thinks about the body behind him. He would rather suffer the loneliness of a moment than the desolation of eternity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who adhere to morality may experience loneliness for a time, whereas those who depend on power may face desolation for eternity. Therefore, the wise observe things beyond the material, contemplate their eternal selves, and prefer temporary loneliness over eternal desolation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你努力以真理为家，你有时可能会感到孤独；但如果你向有权有势的人献媚，你就会感到万古孤独的寒意。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你努力让真理成为你的家，你有时可能会感到孤独；但阿谀奉承，却会感受到千古孤独的寒意。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你努力让真理成为你的家园，你有时可能会感到孤独；但若谄媚权贵，你将感受到历久弥新的孤寒。

text.ori_cn: 涉世浅，点染亦浅；历事深，机械亦深。故君子与其练达，不若朴鲁；与其曲谨，不若疏狂。
text.man_en: When you step but lightly through the world, You are but lightly affected by it; But when you pass through events with a deeper tread, Their tricks and schemes are profound. Thus the gentleman knows Simplicity is better than a show of dexterity. Thus he knows A rude singlemindedness is better than a distorted show of manners.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world is shallow, the dye is also shallow; experience is deep, the machinery is also deep. Therefore, a gentleman should not be as simple as a simple man; and he should not be as loose as a man who is not as strict as a man who is not as crazy as a man who is not as strict.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you have a shallow experience in the world, your experience will be shallow; if you have a deep history, your mechanics will be deep. Therefore, a gentleman is worse than being simple and ruthless than being sophisticated; instead of being cautious, he is worse than being careless and arrogant.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those inexperienced in the world show fewer stains; those who have seen much bear deeper complexities. Therefore, a gentleman would rather be straightforward than sophisticated; he would prefer to be unrestrained than overly cautious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你步履轻盈地走过这个世界时，你对它的影响只是轻描淡写；但当你步履深沉地走过各种事件时，它们的诡计和阴谋就会变得深奥莫测。因此，君子知道，简洁胜于灵巧。因此，他知道粗鲁的一意孤行胜过扭曲的礼仪表演。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你轻轻地走过这个世界时，你也只是轻轻地受到它的影响；但当你深入了解事件时，他们的诡计和阴谋却是深刻的。因此，君子知道简洁胜于巧夺天工。因此他知道，粗鲁的专一，胜过扭曲的举止。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你轻轻地踏过世界时，你只是轻轻地受到影响；但是当你用更深的步伐穿越事件时，它们的诡计和阴谋就更加深沉。因此，君子知道简单比炫耀技巧更好。因此他知道，粗鲁的单纯比扭曲的礼仪更好。

text.ori_cn: 君子之心事，天青日白，不可使人不知。君子之才华，玉韫珠藏，不可使人易知。
text.man_en: The gentleman's disposition Is like the clear sky, the bright sun, And he should not hide it from others. The gentleman's outstanding abilities Are like concealed jewels or gems stored away: He should not easily reveal them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The affairs of a gentleman's heart, the sky is green and the sun is white, and must not be made unknown. The talent of a gentleman is hidden in a jade bush and a pearl, and must not be made known to others.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman's thoughts are as bright as the sky and as white as the sun, and cannot be kept unknown to others. The talent of a gentleman is hidden in jade and pearls, and cannot be easily understood by others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman's thoughts and intentions are as clear as the blue sky and bright sunlight, they should not be hidden from others. A gentleman's talent is like jade buried and pearls hidden, it should not be easily discerned by others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 君子的性情就像晴朗的天空、灿烂的阳光，不应该对他人隐瞒。君子的杰出才能就像隐藏起来的珠宝或储藏起来的宝石：不可轻易示人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子之气，如晴天明日，不可以瞒于人。君子的杰出才能，就像隐藏的珠宝或珍藏的宝石，不应该轻易暴露出来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子的性情如同晴朗的天空，明亮的太阳，他不应该掩饰自己。君子的卓越才能如同隐藏的珍宝或储藏的宝石，不应轻易显露。

text.ori_cn: 势利纷华，不近者为洁，近之而不染者为尤洁；智巧机械，不知者为高，知之而不用者为尤高。
text.man_en: Those with power, fame, wealth, and extravagance— By not coming close to them a man stays pure. Yet the man who can approach and not be affected is the purest of all. Those who are clever, artful, and full of guile — By not knowing them a man stays highminded. Yet the man who can know and still not use them is the most highminded of all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The one who is not close to the power and wealth is clean, and the one who is close to it but not stained is especially clean; the one who is not aware of the wisdom and cleverness of the machinery is high, and the one who is aware of it but does not use it is especially high.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the world of snobbishness and splendor, those who are not close are considered clean, and those who are close and untainted are especially clean; those who are clever and mechanical, and those who do not know are considered high, and those who know them but do not use them are especially high.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who avoid the temptations of wealth and splendor are considered pure, but those who remain untainted by them despite being in close proximity are even purer; those who are unaware of craftiness and cunning are regarded as noble, but those who know it and choose not to use it are even nobler.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些拥有权力、名声、财富和奢侈的人--不接近他们，就能保持纯洁。然而，能够接近而不受影响的人是最纯洁的。那些聪明、狡猾、充满诡计的人--一个人不了解他们，就会保持心高气傲。然而，知其然而不知其所以然的人，才是最高明的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 权、名、财、奢者，不近则人清。而能亲近而不受影响的人，才是最纯洁的。聪明狡诈的人，不认识他们，就保持高尚。然而，能够知道但仍然不使用它们的人是最高尚的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些拥有权力、名望、财富和奢华的人——不接近他们可以保持纯洁。然而，能够接近而不受影响的人是最纯洁的。那些聪明、狡猾和满是诡计的人——不认识他们可以保持高尚。然而，能够认识并且不去利用他们的人是最高尚的。

text.ori_cn: 耳中常闻逆耳之言，心中常有拂心之事，才是进德修行的砥石。若言言悦耳，事事快心，便把此生埋在鸩毒中矣。
text.man_en: Our ears forever hear things distasteful to them. Our mind is forever filled with events contrary to our desires. But such situations are exactly the whetstones for advancing our virtue, for putting our discipline into practice. If we always heard words pleasing to our ears, Living this life would be just like being buried alive in poison.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To always hear words that are contrary to the ear and to always have things in one's heart that are pleasing to the ear are the cornerstones of virtue and cultivation. If one's words are pleasing to the ear and one's heart is pleased with everything, then one's life will be buried in hemlock.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Often hearing words that are offensive to one's ears and having things that please one's heart often are the stepping stones for moral cultivation. If you speak pleasantly and do everything cheerfully, your life will be buried in the poison of poison.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Often hearing unpleasant words and frequently encountering irksome matters are the whetstones for improving one's virtue and practice. If every word is pleasing and every matter brings joy, one will bury themselves in poison throughout their life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们的耳朵永远听不到厌恶的东西。我们的脑海中永远充斥着与我们的愿望背道而驰的事情。但这种情况恰恰是提升我们的美德、将我们的纪律付诸实践的磨刀石。如果我们总能听到顺耳的话，那我们的生活就会像被毒药活埋一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我们的耳朵总是听到令他们厌恶的事情。我们的头脑永远充满了与我们的愿望相反的事件。但这种情况正是我们提高德行、践行戒律的磨刀石。如果我们总是听到悦耳的话，那么这一生就如同被活埋在毒药里一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们的耳朵永远听到讨厌的东西。我们的心灵永远充满与我们愿望相违背的事件。但正是这种情况，是提升我们美德的磨刀石，实践我们自律的机会。如果我们总是听到令人愉悦的话语，生活在人世间就如同被活埋在毒药中一样。

text.ori_cn: 怒雨疾风，禽鸟戚戚；光风霁日，草木欣欣。可见天地不可一日无和气，人心不可一日无喜神。
text.man_en: When winds grow bitter and rains angry, Even small birds are frightened and sad. When skies become clear and breezes are bright, The grasses and trees are fresh and full of joy. From this it can be seen that Heaven and Earth are unable to go one day without harmony; The human heart is unable to go one day without joy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Angry rain and wind, birds and birds; light wind and sun, grass and trees are happy. It can be seen that heaven and earth can not be one day without peace, the human heart can not be one day without joy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The angry rain and strong wind make the birds rest; the bright wind and the bright sun make the vegetation happy. It can be seen that heaven and earth cannot be without harmony for a day, and people's hearts cannot be without joy for a day.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the raging storm, the birds mourn; under the clear skies, the plants rejoice. It is evident that the world cannot go a day without harmony, and the human heart cannot go a day without joy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当狂风怒号、暴雨如注时，连小鸟也会感到惊恐和悲伤。天晴风朗，草木清新，满心欢喜。由此可见，天地不可一日不和，人心不可一日不乐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 风大雨大，连小鸟也惊恐悲伤。当天空晴朗，微风徐徐，草木清新，充满欢乐。由此可见，天地不能一日不和；天地不能一日不和。人心一日不能没有喜乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当风凛冽，雨凶猛时，连小鸟也会惊恐悲伤。当天空变晴朗，微风明媚时，草木便会清新喜悦。从中可以看出，天地一日不能无和谐；人心一日不能无欢乐。

text.ori_cn: 醲肥辛甘非真味，真味只是淡；神奇卓异非至人，至人只是常。
text.man_en: Strong wines and fatty meats, sweets and spicy foods— These do not possess true taste. True taste is only found in the light and simple. The mysterious and strange, the preeminent and uncommon— These are not the man who has arrived. The man who has arrived is only the ordinary man.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The concentrated fat, sweet and pungent flavour is not the true taste, the true taste is only light; the magical and extraordinary is not the most human, the most human is only the common.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The pungent and sweet taste of glutinous rice is not the real taste, the real taste is just bland; the magic and excellence are not the best, but the best is just ordinary.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Rich, spicy, and sweet are not the real flavors; the real taste is simply bland. Miraculous and exceptional are not the sages; the true sage is simply ordinary.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 烈酒和肥肉、甜食和辛辣食物--这些都不具备真正的味道。只有在清淡和简单中才能找到真正的味道。神秘而奇特，卓越而不凡--这些都不是人的本性。平凡的人才是真正的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 酒肥肉、甜食辛辣，这些都不是真正的味道。真正的品味只能在清淡和简单中找到。玄奇奇特，卓尔不凡，非此人所至。来的人只是一个普通人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 浓酒肥肉，甜品辛辣——这些不是真正的味道。真正的味道，只在清淡简单中。神秘奇异，非凡少见——这些不是到达人。达到的人，只是普通人。

text.ori_cn: 天地寂然不动，而气机无一息少停；日月昼夜奔驰，而贞明则万古不易。故君子闲时要有吃紧的心思，忙处要有悠闲的趣味。
text.man_en: Heaven and Earth remain peacefully unmoved, Yet their lifebreath is unceasing, and seldom rests. The sun and moon hasten through their courses day and night, Yet their constant light has not changed through the ages. Thus for the gentleman, It is necessary during times of leisure to keep in mind what is proper for emergencies. It is necessary during times of haste to retain an element of composure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Heaven and earth are silent and motionless, but the air is not a breath less stop; the sun and the moon run by day and night, but the chastity is not easy for the ages. Therefore, a gentleman should have a tight mind when he is idle, and have a leisurely fun when he is busy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heaven and the earth are silent and motionless, but the air movement never stops; the sun and the moon are running day and night, but the purity is eternal. Therefore, a gentleman should have a busy mind when he is free and have leisurely fun when he is busy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The heavens and earth remain still and motionless, yet the vital energy never pauses for a moment; the sun and moon race day and night, yet their clear brightness remains unchanged for eternity. Therefore, a gentleman should maintain a sense of urgency during idle times, and find leisure in the midst of busyness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天地安然不动，但它们的生命气息却绵绵不绝，很少停息。日月昼夜匆匆，恒光亘古不变。因此，对于君子来说，在闲暇时，必须牢记应急之策。在匆忙的时候，必须保持冷静。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天地平静不为所动，而生息却绵绵不绝，很少休息。日月日夜行进，恒光千古不改。所以君子，闲暇之时，要谨记应急之事。在匆忙的时候保持冷静是必要的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地岿然不动，然其生气不息，甚少歇息。日月昼夜急驰，然其恒光历久未变。因此，君子在闲暇时须记紧急情况的礼仪。在匆忙时须保持一份镇定。

text.ori_cn: 夜深人静，独坐观心，始觉妄穷而真独露，每于此中得大机趣；既觉真现而妄难逃，又于此中得大惭忸。
text.man_en: Late at night, when others are at rest, Sitting alone, I look deep into my heart: For the first time, distractions cease, and the truth alone becomes manifest, as dew appears at dawn. At such times I experience a free and responsive mind. Now the truth is manifested about the past, and I am once again aware of how difficult it is to escape distractions. At such times I experience mortification and shame.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I sit alone in the quiet of the night and observe my mind, I realise that the delusion is poor and the truth is revealed alone, and I get great pleasure from it; I realise that the truth is present and the delusion is hard to escape, and I get great shame from it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Late at night, when people are still and quiet, I sit alone and observe my mind, and I realize that the illusion is endless and the truth is revealed alone. Every time I get great interest from this;
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the deep silence of the night, sitting alone and observing my mind, I begin to realize the end of illusions and the bare revealing of truth. In these moments, I find great inspiration. However, when the truth manifests and falsehood becomes inescapable, I also feel immense shame in these moments.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 夜深人静时，独坐我心间：第一次，杂念不再，唯有真理显现，如同黎明时的露水。在这样的时刻，我体验到了自由和灵敏的心灵。现在，过去的真相显现出来，我再次意识到摆脱杂念是多么困难。每当此时，我都会感到羞愧和惭愧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 深夜，别人都休息了，我独坐，深深地审视自己的内心：第一次，杂念停止，真理独自显现，如黎明的露水。在这种时候，我会体验到一种自由且反应灵敏的思想。现在，过去的真相已经昭然若揭，我再次意识到摆脱干扰是多么困难。在这种时候，我会感到羞愧和羞愧。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 深夜，当别人都在休息时，独坐时，我深深地观察我的内心：分心之念首次平息，真理独自显现，如黎明的露水。在这些时刻，我感受到心灵的自由和灵感。此时，关于过去的真相显现出来，我再次意识到摆脱干扰是多么困难。在这些时刻，我感到痛苦和羞愧。

text.ori_cn: 恩里由来生害，故快意时，须早回头；败后或反成功，故拂心处，莫便放手。
text.man_en: Injury can appear in the midst of kindness. When happy, keep your wits about you. The aftermath of failure can be turned into success. When things don't go the way you want, Do not be quick to give up the ghost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Enri is a source of harm, so when you are happy, you must turn back early; when you are defeated or successful, so don't let go of your heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Favors can cause harm, so when you are happy, you must look back early; after defeat, you may succeed instead, so don't let go when your heart is touched.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Blessings often arise from misfortunes, so when things go well, one must reflect early; failure can sometimes turn into success, so when faced with setbacks, do not hastily give up.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 伤害可能出现在善意之中。快乐时要保持清醒。失败的后果可以转化为成功。事与愿违时，不要急于放弃。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 善良之中也可能会出现伤害。快乐的时候，保持理智。失败的后果可以转化为成功。当事情没有按照你想要的方式发展时，不要急于放弃。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 伤害可能出现在善意之中。高兴时，要保持冷静。失败后的结果可以转化为成功。当事情不如意时，不要轻易放弃希望。

text.ori_cn: 藜口苋肠者，多冰玉清洁；衮衣玉食者，甘婢膝奴颜。盖志以澹泊明，而节从肥甘丧也。
text.man_en: Of those who make their meals from simple herbs and vegetables, their repasts are as pure as ice, as stainless as gems. Of those who dress in fancy clothes and feast sumptuously, they lower themselves to acting like servants and slaves. Ultimately the will is made clear by simplicity, And integrity lost by opulence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Quinoa mouth amaranth intestines, more ice and jade clean; gun clothes and jade food, Gan maidservant. Covering the will to be tranquil and bright, and the section from the fat and sweet loss also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have a mouth full of quinoa and amaranth intestines will be cleansed by ice and jade; those who are clothed in jade and food will be willing to be slaves and slaves. The goal is to express the light through dullness, while the festival is from fatness and sweetness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who eat wild amaranth often value purity and cleanliness, while those who live in luxury and opulence tend to fawn and flatter. For it is through simplicity and tranquility that one's aspirations become clear, while indulgence in riches and delicacies leads to the loss of integrity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些用简单的草药和蔬菜做饭的人，他们的饭菜像冰一样纯净，像宝石一样不锈。而那些衣着华丽、大吃大喝的人，却把自己贬得像仆人和奴隶。简朴终能明志，奢华终会失节。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对于那些用简单的香草和蔬菜做饭的人来说，他们的食物像冰一样纯净，像宝石一样不锈。那些衣冠楚楚，大吃大喝的人，却把自己降格为仆人、奴隶。最终，意志因简单而明确，而诚信因富裕而丧失。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些以简单的草药和蔬菜为食的人，他们的饭菜像冰一样纯洁，像宝石一样无瑕。那些穿着华丽衣服，盛宴奢华的人，沦落到像仆人和奴隶一样的行为。最终，意志因简朴而显现，正直因奢华而失落。

text.ori_cn: 面前的田地要放得宽，使人无不平之叹；身后的惠泽要流得长，使人有不匮之思。
text.man_en: Your attitude while still in the world Should be open and free, saving others from the grief of discontent. The benefits you leave after you are gone Should flow the length of time, steeping others in feelings of ease.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The field before you should be set wide, so that there is no sigh of inequality; and the bounty behind you should flow long, so that there is no scarcity of thought.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The field in front of you should be wide, so that people will not feel unjust; the benefits behind you should flow long, so that people will have no shortage of things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The fields before us should be vast, leaving no one with feelings of discontent; the benefits behind us should last long, making people think of them as inexhaustible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你在世时的态度应该是开放和自由的，让他人免于不满的悲伤。你离去后留下的好处应该源远流长，让他人沉浸在轻松的感觉中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你还在世时的态度应该是开放和自由的，使他人​​免于不满的悲伤。你离开后留下的好处应该随着时间的推移而流动，让他人沉浸在轻松的感觉中。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你在世上时的态度应该是开放和自由的，救别人于不满的悲伤之中。你离去后留下的益处应该历经时间长流，使他人沉浸于安逸的感觉中。

text.ori_cn: 径路窄处，留一步与人行；滋味浓的，减三分让人嗜。此是涉世一极安乐法。
text.man_en: When walking narrow pathways, Step back a pace, let your companion go ahead. When eating delicious rich foods, Surrender onethird of your portion for others to enjoy. This is the law for making your way most comfortably through the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where the path is narrow, leave one step to walk with others; where the flavour is strong, reduce it by three to let others enjoy it. This is the law of peace and happiness in the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Where the path is narrow, leave one step with others; if the flavor is strong, reduce it by three points to make people addicted. This is the ultimate peace and happiness in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Where the path is narrow, leave a step for others to walk; where the flavor is rich, reduce it by three parts for others to savor. This is an extremely peaceful way to navigate the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 走窄路时，退后一步，让同伴走在前面。吃美味丰富的食物时，把自己三分之一的分量让给别人享用。这就是让自己在世界上走得最舒适的法则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 走窄路时，退一步，让同伴走。吃美味丰盛的食物时，将自己的三分之一交给别人享用。这是让你在这个世界上最舒适地生活的法则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 行走狭窄小路时，退一步，让你的同伴先走。享用美味丰富的食物时，分享三分之一给别人。这是让你在世界上最舒适地过活的法则。

text.ori_cn: 作人无甚高远事业，摆脱得俗情，便入名流；为学无甚增益工夫，减除得物累，便超圣境。
text.man_en: In becoming a person of merit, though you perform no lofty deeds, If you are able to shake off mundane concerns, You will become one of the renowned. In pursuing studies, though you make no claim to ingenuity, If you are able to decrease externals that afflict the heart, You will cross over to the land of the sages.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no lofty cause in being a man, but if you can get rid of common feelings, you will enter the world of fame; there is no gainful work in learning, but if you can get rid of material things, you will transcend the holy realm.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't have a very lofty career as a person, if you get rid of the worldly sentiments, you will become a celebrity; if you don't put much effort in learning, if you get rid of the burden of material things, you will transcend the holy realm.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One does not need grand ambitions to distinguish oneself; simply breaking free from worldly attachments will elevate one's status. Similarly, in the pursuit of knowledge, it is not the additional effort but the elimination of worldly burdens that leads to transcendence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 立身处世，虽无豪言壮语，但若能摒弃俗念，便能跻身名流之列。在求学的道路上，虽然你不自诩聪明才智，但如果你能减少困扰心灵的外在因素，你就能进入圣贤之境。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 成为有功德的人，虽然没有什么伟大的事迹，但如果能够摆脱世俗的忧虑，就会成为名声显赫的人。求学虽不求聪明，若能减少心外之事，则可渡圣圣国。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 要成为一个有功德的人，虽然你没有高尚的行为，但如果你能摆脱世俗的烦恼，你就会成为名人。在追求学问的过程中，虽然你不自称有智慧，但如果你能减少使心灵痛苦的外物，你就会到达人们的领域。

text.ori_cn: 交友须带三分侠气，做人要存一点素心。
text.man_en: Associating with friends, you should show some chivalry. Laying up merit, you need at least a modicum of the artless.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: You must be chivalrous in your friendships and a little bit vegetarian in your behaviour.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When making friends, you need to be chivalrous, and when you are a person, you need to be honest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In making friends, retain three parts of chivalry; in life, uphold a bit of sincerity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与朋友交往，要有侠义心肠。论功行赏，至少要有几分文雅。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与朋友交往，应该表现出一些侠义精神。积累功德，你至少需要一点点朴素。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与朋友交往，应当表现出一些侠义精神。积累功德，则需至少具备一点淳朴。

text.ori_cn: 宠利毋居人前，德业毋落人后；受享毋逾分外，修为毋减分中。
text.man_en: Avoid putting your own blessings and profits before others, But do not fall behind them in moral progress. When receiving, do not go beyond your share, But when conducting yourself in a course of action, do not do less than you should.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Favours and benefits do not precede, virtues and deeds do not lag behind; enjoyment does not exceed, cultivation does not diminish.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Do not put yourself before others in terms of favor and benefit, do not lag behind others in virtue and achievements; do not receive more than your share of benefits, and do not take away from others in your cultivation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not seek personal gain ahead of others, nor let your virtues lag behind; do not enjoy more than your due share, nor diminish your commitment to self-cultivation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不要把自己的福分和利益置于他人之前，但在道德进步方面也不要落后于他人。在接受时，不要超出自己的份额，但在行动过程中，不要做得比自己应该做的少。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 避免将自己的福祉和利益置于他人之上，但在道德进步上也不要落后于他​​们。接受的时候，不要超出自己应得的份量；做事的时候，也不要少做自己应该做的事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 避免将自己的福祉与利益置于他人之前，但不要在道德进步上落后于他们。领取时不要超过你应得的份额，但在行动中表现时不要少于你应该做的。

text.ori_cn: 处世让一步为高，退步即进步的张本；待人宽一分是福，利人实利己的根基。
text.man_en: In passing through this world, one is esteemed if he steps back a pace for others to go ahead. Stepping backward is thus Preliminary to stepping forward. In serving others, it is felicitous to show a bit of magnanimity. Benefiting others is truly The foundation of benefiting yourself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Let a step in the world for high, backward that is the progress of the Zhangben; treating people a point of grace is a blessing, the foundation of the benefit of others actually benefit themselves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In life, one step is a step forward, and a step back is the basis for progress; treating others with kindness is a blessing, and benefiting others is the foundation of self-interest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In dealing with the world, taking a step back is considered wise, as retreat can actually be a form of progress; when interacting with others, being more understanding is a blessing, as benefiting others is essentially the foundation of benefiting oneself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在这个世界上，如果一个人退后一步，让别人走在前面，他就会受到尊敬。因此，后退是前进的初步。在为他人服务时，表现出一点宽宏大量，也是一种善举。利人是利己的基础。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在走过这个世界的过程中，退一步让别人前进，就会受到尊重。因此，向后退一步是向前迈进的先决条件。在为他人服务的过程中，表现出一点大度是很幸福的。利益他人才是真正利益自己的基础。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 行走世间，为他人退一步便能获得尊重。退步因此是前进的前提。服务他人时，展现一些宽宏大量是幸运的。利他才是利己的根本。

text.ori_cn: 盖世功劳，当不得一个矜字；弥天罪过，当不得一个悔字。
text.man_en: Even if you have performed worldshaking meritorious deeds, If pride is involved then the value is lost. Even if you have committed a crime that has reached the heavens, If you have truly repented, regret will find no home.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A world of merit is not worth a word of reserve; a world of sin is not worth a word of repentance.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There should be no word of regret for a world-class achievement; there should be no word of regret for a heinous sin.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All the unparalleled achievements cannot bear a single word of pride; all the immense sins cannot bear a single word of regret.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使你做出了惊天动地的功绩，如果骄傲自满，也会失去价值。即使你犯下了滔天大罪，只要你真心悔过，就不会后悔。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使你做了惊天动地的功事，如果涉及到骄傲，那就失去了价值。即使你犯了天大的罪，如果你真心悔改，悔恨也无处可去。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即便你建立了惊天动地的功勋，如果掺杂了骄傲，价值也会丧失。即便你犯下了滔天大罪，如果你真正悔过，悔恨也无处寄居。

text.ori_cn: 完名美节，不宜独任，分些与人，可以远害全身；辱行污名，不宜全推，引些归己，可以韬光养德。
text.man_en: Fame and honor— These are not things you should assume only for yourself. If you divide these up and confer them on others, You will be able to keep harm at a distance and make yourself replete. Disgraceful conduct and ill repute— These are not things you should thrust onto others. If you will lighten others' burdens and ascribe them to yourself, You will be able to veil your own brilliance and cultivate virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not advisable to be solely responsible for the honour and beauty of one's name, but to share some of it with others, so that the whole body can be far from being harmed; it is not advisable to push all the dishonour and disgrace, but to draw some of it back to oneself, so that one can bide one's time and nourish one's virtue.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: With perfect reputation and integrity, one should not be left alone. If you share some of it with others, it can harm the whole body. If you have insults and stigmatization, it is not appropriate to reject them all. Bring some of them to yourself, so that you can cultivate your talents and cultivate your virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In times of perfect reputation and beautiful accolades, it is unwise to claim all credit; sharing some with others can help avoid harm and preserve oneself. In times of dishonor and tarnished reputation, it is unwise to shift all blame; accepting some responsibility can help conceal one's light and cultivate virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 名声和荣誉--这些都不是你应该独享的东西。如果你把它们分给他人，你就能远离伤害，使自己变得充实。不光彩的行为和坏名声--这些都不是你应该强加给别人的东西。如果你能减轻他人的负担，并将其归于自己，你就能掩盖自己的光辉，培养美德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 名声和荣誉——这些不是你应该只为自己承担的东西。若分而授于人，则能远离伤害，而使自己充实。不光彩的行为和坏名声——这些不是你应该强加给别人的。如果你能减轻别人的负担，而将其归于自己，你就能遮蔽自己的光彩，修养德行。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 声誉和荣耀——这些不是你应该独占的东西。如果你把它们分给别人，你就能远离伤害并充实自己。耻辱和坏名声——这些不是你应该推给别人的东西。如果你能减轻别人的负担并把它们归于自己，你就能隐藏自己的光芒并培养美德。

text.ori_cn: 事事留个有余不尽的意思，便造物不能忌我，鬼神不能损我。若业必求满，功必求盈者，不生内变，必召外忧。
text.man_en: No matter what you do, If you forsake ideas of excess and inexhaustibility. The Creator of Things will be unable to scorn you, And the gods and spirits will be unable to do you harm. If you invariably seek satisfaction in your own undertakings, Or habitually seek for your own efforts to be fulfilled, If some calamity does not occur internally, You will surely invite sorrow from without.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you leave a surplus in everything, then the creatures will not be jealous of me, and the ghosts and gods will not be able to harm me. If you seek fullness in your work, and if you seek surplus in your work, you will not have internal changes, but you will have external worries.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If I keep an eye on everything, then all creatures will not be afraid of me, and ghosts and gods will not be able to harm me. If your karma must be fulfilled and your achievements must be abundant, internal changes will not occur, but external worries will arise.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Leave a bit of leeway in everything you do, so that neither creation can envy you, nor spirits can harm you. If you always strive for perfection and fullness in your work, it won't lead to internal strife, but will inevitably attract external troubles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无论你做什么，只要你放弃过剩和无尽的想法。造物主就不会蔑视你，神灵也不会伤害你。如果你总是在自己的事业中寻求满足，或习惯性地寻求自己的努力得到实现，如果内部不发生一些灾难，你必将招致来自外部的悲伤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无论你做什么，只要你放弃过度和取之不尽的想法。造物主不能蔑视你，神灵也不能伤害你。如果你总是在自己的事业中寻求满足，或者习惯性地追求自己的努力得到实现，如果内不发生某种灾难，那么你一定会招来外在的悲伤。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无论你做什么，如果你抛弃了过度和无穷无尽的想法。万物的造物者将无法轻视你，神灵也将无法伤害你。如果你总是在自己的事业中寻求满足，或习惯性地追求自己的努力得到回报，如果没有内在的灾难发生，你必定会引来外界的悲伤。

text.ori_cn: 家庭有个真佛，日用有种真道。人能诚心和气，愉色婉言，使父母兄弟间，形骸两释，意气交流，胜于调息观心万倍矣。
text.man_en: In every household there is a true Buddha; In everyday life you will find true men of the Way. If a man can be sincere in his heart, harmonious in spirit, Joyful in countenance and pleasant in his words, If he will serve his parents and siblings, Laying aside reserve in body and spirit, Letting his temperament flow with those around him, Such a man will be far superior to those who regulate their breathing or practice meditation.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a true Buddha in the family and a true way of life. People can be sincere and peaceful, pleasant colours and polite words, so that between parents and brothers, the form of the two release, the exchange of ideas, better than adjusting the breathing and observing the heart 10,000 times.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a true Buddha in the family, and the true way is cultivated in daily life. People can be sincere and kind, and speak pleasantly and politely, so that parents and brothers can understand each other's body and mind, and communicate with each other, which is ten thousand times better than regulating the breath and observing the mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In every family, there is a true Buddha, and in everyday actions, there is a genuine path. If one can be sincerely harmonious and gentle, with a pleasant countenance and kind words, attaining a state where parents and siblings understand each other physically and mentally, the mutual exchange of sentiments surpasses the benefits of meditation and mindfulness by ten thousand times.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 家家有真佛，户户见真人。如果一个人内心真诚，精神和谐，面容愉悦，言语和蔼，如果他愿意侍奉父母和兄弟姐妹，放下身体和精神上的矜持，让自己的性情与周围的人融为一体，这样的人将远远胜过那些调节呼吸或修炼冥想的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 家家有真佛，在日常生活中你会发现真正的有道之人。一个人若能心诚，神和，面悦，言和，侍奉父母兄弟，身心克制，性情与周围人流动，这样，一个人将远远优于那些调节呼吸或练习冥想的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 家家有真佛，日日是道场。人能心虚，神和，气怡，言悦，事亲孝，体谦身随，性情流于人者，是其人远胜专科呼吸调息与打坐者。

text.ori_cn: 好动者，云电风灯；嗜寂者，死灰槁木。须定云止水中，有鱼跃鸢飞气象，才是有道的心体。
text.man_en: Those who love activity are like lightning seen through clouds or lanterns flickering in the wind. Those who practice quietism are like dead ashes or withered trees. One should be like the hawk that flies, the fish that leaps in still waters. By this, one enters the mind and the body of the Way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are good at moving, are in the clouds and the wind; those who love silence, are in the dead ashes and the dead wood. It is only when the clouds are fixed in the water and there is the weather of the fish leaping and the kite flying that there is a Taoist body of mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who love to be active are like clouds, electricity and wind lanterns; those who love silence are like dead trees. Only when the clouds are still and the water is still, and there are fishes leaping and kites flying, can you have a Taoist mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For the active ones, it resembles clouds, electricity, wind, and lanterns; for those who crave silence, it resembles dead ashes and withered wood. Only when calmness like settled clouds and still waters contains the lively energy of fishes leaping and kites soaring, can it be considered the true essence of Dao.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 喜欢热闹的人就像云中的闪电或风中闪烁的灯笼。喜欢安静的人就像死灰或枯树。人应如鹰击长空，如鱼得水。如此，方能入心、入道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 热爱活动的人，就像穿过云层的闪电，或者风中摇曳的灯笼。实行清静主义的人，就像死灰、枯树。人应如鹰展翅飞，鱼跃静水。由此，进入道心、身。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些喜欢活动的人，就像云中闪电或风中摇曳的灯笼。那些练习静修的人，就像死灰或枯树。人应当像飞翔的鹰，静水中跃动的鱼。如此，方能入道心与道身。

text.ori_cn: 攻人之恶，毋太严，要思其堪受；教人之善，毋过高，当使其可从。
text.man_en: When attacking someone's faults Do not be too severe. You need to consider how well he will weather what he hears. When teaching someone by showing him what is good, Do not pass certain heights, But hit upon what he should be able to follow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When attacking a man's evil, do not be too severe, but think that he can bear it; when teaching a man's good, do not be too high, but make it possible for him to follow.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When attacking people's evil, don't be too harsh, but make sure they can tolerate it; when teaching people how to be good, don't be too harsh, make sure they can follow you.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When criticizing others' faults, do not be too harsh; consider what they can bear. When teaching others virtues, do not set the bar too high; ensure it is achievable for them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在攻击别人的缺点时，不要过于严厉。你需要考虑他听了之后的承受能力。在教导别人时，向他展示好的东西，不要超越一定的高度，而要击中他应该能够遵循的东西。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 攻击别人的缺点时，不要太严厉。你需要考虑他对所听到的事情的承受能力如何。当教导某人向他展示什么是好的时候，不要超越某些高度，而要抓住他应该能够遵循的东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在指出别人的错误时，不要过于严厉。你需要考虑到他能承受听到这些的程度。在通过展示好的事物来教导别人时，不要超出他的能力，而要找到他能够跟随的高度。

text.ori_cn: 粪虫至秽，变为蝉而饮露于秋风；腐草无光，化为萤而耀采于夏月。固知洁常自污出，明每从晦生也。
text.man_en: The vermin that crawl through the dung are the extremity of filth, But transformed they become cicadas drinking dew in the autumn wind. Rotten grass has no light, But it metamorphoses and becomes the fireflies that shine with iridescence under the summer moon. Know this well: The pure always comes from that which is stained; The bright is forever born from the totally dark.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Dung worm to filth, into a cicada and drink dew in the autumn wind; rotting grass without light, into a firefly and shine in the summer months. I know that cleanliness often comes out of pollution, and brightness is born from obscurity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the dung worms become filthy, they turn into cicadas and drink the dew in the autumn wind; when the rotten grass becomes dull, they turn into fireflies and shine in the summer moon. It is known that purity always emerges from dirt, and brightness emerges from darkness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The dung beetle, though filthy, transforms into a cicada to drink dew in the autumn breeze; the decayed grass, though dark, turns into a firefly that glows in the summer night. Thus, it is evident that purity often arises from the impure, and brightness is born from obscurity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 爬过粪便的害虫是肮脏的极致，但它们蜕变成了秋风中饮露的蝉。腐草没有光，但它会蜕变，变成夏月下闪烁着七彩光芒的萤火虫。你要清楚这一点：纯洁总是从污秽中产生；光明永远从完全黑暗中诞生。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 粪里爬的虫子，是污秽之极，化作秋风饮露的蝉。烂草没有光，却幻化成夏月下闪烁着虹彩的萤火虫。深知这一点：纯洁的事物总是来自于污秽的事物；光明永远诞生于完全的黑暗。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些爬在粪便里的害虫是肮脏至极，但它们蜕变后便成为在秋风中饮露的蝉。腐草没有光，但它蜕变后便成为在夏夜月下闪烁着彩光的萤火虫。请牢记这一点：纯净总是来自被玷污之物；光明永远从至暗中诞生。

text.ori_cn: 矜高倨傲，无非客气，降伏得客气下，而后正气伸；情欲意识，尽属妄心，消杀得妄心尽，而后真心现。
text.man_en: Lofty pride, haughty arrogance— These are nothing more than rashness and false courage. When you have been able to bring this rashness under submission, Then the right mind will grow. Carnal passions and calculations of gain and loss— These are but attachments of the confused mind. When the confused mind has been totally extinguished, Then the true mind will appear.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Arrogance is nothing but politeness; when politeness is subdued, then righteousness is extended; lust and consciousness are all delusions; when delusions are eliminated, then the true heart appears.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Being arrogant and arrogant is nothing more than politeness. It can be subdued until the politeness is reduced, and then the righteousness can be extended. The consciousness of lust is all a delusional mind. disinfect it until the delusional mind is gone, and then the true heart appears.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Arrogance and pride are nothing but courtesy; when subdued, righteousness prevails. Desires and consciousness belong to the delusional mind; once eradicated, the true heart emerges.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 高高在上的骄傲、傲慢无礼的自大--这些不过是轻率和虚假的勇气。当你能够使这种鲁莽屈服时，正确的思想就会成长。肉欲、计较得失--这些不过是迷惑之心的执着。当迷惑的心完全熄灭，真正的心就会显现。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 骄傲自大，狂妄自大，这不过是鲁莽、虚勇而已。当你能够克服这种鲁莽时，正确的心就会成长。情欲、计较得失，不过是迷惑心的执着而已。当迷惑心完全熄灭时，真实的心就会出现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 高傲的自尊，狂妄的傲慢——这些不过是鲁莽和虚假的勇气。当你能将这种鲁莽降服，正确的心态就会成长。肉体的欲望和利益得失的计算——这些不过是混乱心态的牵挂。当混乱的心态彻底熄灭，真正的心态就会出现。

text.ori_cn: 饱后思味，则浓淡之境都消；色后思淫，则男女之见尽绝。故人常以事后之悔悟，破临事之痴迷，则性定而动无不正。
text.man_en: When you think of food after filling your stomach, The boundary between the flavorful and the insipid disappears completely. When you think of sex after a liaison, The [true] attraction between man and woman totally melts away. Thus, if you always think of the remorse that follows the act And thwart the foolish confusion that comes with facing the situation, Your disposition will be composed, your actions not incorrect
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you think about flavour after you are full, then you will be able to eliminate both the thick and the light; if you think about sex after you are lustful, then you will be able to eliminate all the views of men and women. Therefore, people often use the repentance after the incident to break the obsession of the incident, then the sex is fixed and the movement is not correct.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you think about taste after you are full, the light and shade will disappear; if you think about lust after sex, the vision of men and women will be completely eliminated. Therefore, people often use regret after the event to break the obsession before the situation, and then the nature will be fixed and everything will be correct.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: After being full, reflecting on the flavors, all distinctions of richness and mildness vanish; after the act of lust, reflecting on desire, all notions of male and female disappear. Thus, if one frequently uses the regret after the event to break the obsession amidst the event, one's character will stabilize, and all actions will be righteous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你在填饱肚子之后想到食物，美味与平淡之间的界限就会完全消失。当你在性爱之后想到性，男女之间[真正的]吸引力就会完全消融。因此，如果你总是想到行为之后的悔恨，并挫败面对这种情况时的愚蠢困惑，你的性情就会变得沉稳，你的行为就不会不正确
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你填饱肚子再想起食物时，美味与平淡的界限就完全消失了。当你想到交往后的性行为时，男人和女人之间的[真正]吸引力完全消失了。所以，如果你时时想到行为后的悔恨，并阻止面对情况时出现的愚昧困惑，你的性情就会平静，你的行为就不会不正确。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在你填饱肚子后再想到食物，美味与乏味的界限完全消失了。当你在一场幽会后再想到性，男女之间的真正吸引力完全融化了。因此，如果你总是想到事后懊悔并且阻止面对情况时的愚蠢困惑，你的性情将会清晰，你的行为将不会出错。

text.ori_cn: 居轩冕之中，不可无山林的气味；处林泉之下，须要怀廊庙的经纶。
text.man_en: When outfitted in the accoutrements of a high official, You should still relish the mountain recluse. When living among the forests and springs, You should preserve in your heart the administration of the state.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you live in the middle of a palace, you can't live without the smell of the mountains and forests; if you live in the middle of a forest, you have to have the experience of the temple and the corridor.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To live in a palace, one must have the scent of mountains and forests; to live under forests and springs, one must have the experience of a temple.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Even when residing in a position of high status, one must possess the essence of nature and seclusion; and when living in a secluded environment, one must still bear in mind the duties and responsibilities of governance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 身居高位，仍应怡然山林。居山泉林间，心存治国之道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 身着大官之装，仍应尝山隐之趣。居于林泉之中，当存国家之政于心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 身披高官的服饰时，仍应心怀隐士的情怀。生活在山林之间，仍应心系国家的治理。

text.ori_cn: 处世不必邀功，无过便是功；与人不求感德，无怨便是德。
text.man_en: Living in the world is not necessarily a matter of waiting eagerly for every chance to perform a meritorious deed. Making no mistakes is in itself a meritorious deed. Interacting with people is not a matter of seeking others to feel gratitude for your own virtue. Not earning their hostility is in itself a virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no need to take credit in the world; no fault is credit; and there is no need to ask for gratitude; no grudge is a virtue.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no need to ask for credit when doing things in the world, as long as there are no faults, it is merit; when dealing with others, there is no need to seek gratitude, and there is no resentment, which is virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In dealing with life, one need not seek accolades; being without fault is merit in itself. In interacting with others, one should not expect gratitude; being without resentment is virtue in itself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生活在这个世界上，并不一定要急切地等待每一次立功的机会。不犯错误本身就是一种功德。与人交往并不是为了让别人感激自己的美德。不招致他人的敌意本身就是一种美德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 活在世上，并不一定是要急切地等待每一个建功立业的机会。不犯错误本身就是一种功德。与人交往，不是求别人感恩自己的德行。不招致他们的敌意本身就是一种美德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 生活在这个世界上，并不一定要急切地等待每一个机会去立功。没有犯错本身就是一种功劳。与人交往，并不是为了让别人对你的美德心存感激。不招致他们的敌意本身就是一种美德。

text.ori_cn: 忧勤是美德，太苦则无以适性怡情；澹泊是高风，太枯则无以济人利物。
text.man_en: To be overly concerned about your duties is a beautiful virtue, But to bring yourself too much hardship because of them is neither fitting to your constitution nor felicitous to human nature. To revere simplicity and be unattached is indeed an indication of high character, But to maintain too much elegant simplicity is neither helpful to mankind nor useful to the world at large.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Worry and diligence is a virtue, too bitter is not in order to suit the nature of pleasure; tantalising is a high wind, too dry is not to help people and benefit things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Worry and diligence are virtues, but if they are too bitter, they will not be suitable for one's temperament and happiness; indifference is a high wind, and if they are too dry, they will not be able to help others or benefit things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Diligence and hard work are virtues, but excessive toil can impair one's well-being and happiness. Simplicity and restraint are noble qualities, but extreme austerity can hinder the ability to help others and provide benefits to the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 恪尽职守是一种美好的品德，但因此给自己带来过多的苦难，既不符合自己的体质，也不符合人性。崇尚简朴、淡泊名利确实是高尚品格的表现，但过于高雅简朴既无益于人类，也无益于整个世界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 过分关心自己的职责是一种美好的美德，但因此而给自己带来太多的困难，既不符合你的体质，也不符合人性。崇尚朴素、不执着，固然是品格高尚的表现，但过于保持优雅的朴素，对人类无益，对世界无益。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 过于忧虑自己的职责是一种美丽的美德，但因职责而使自己过度辛劳，既不适合你的体质，也不合乎人性。崇尚简朴并不执着确实是一种高尚品格的标志，但过于保持优雅的简朴，既无助于人类，也无益于整个世界。

text.ori_cn: 人至事穷势蹙，宜原其初心；士当行满功成，要观其末路。
text.man_en: When your work has come to a standstill and you can neither advance nor retreat, You should relocate the mentality with which you began. When your efforts have been realized and your actions are fulfilled, You need to look carefully farther down the road.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When a man is poor and in dire straits, it is better to restore his original mind; when a man has achieved success, he should look at the end of his road.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When a person is at a disadvantage, he should return to his original intention; when a scholar has achieved success, he should observe his end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a person is faced with adversity and dwindling resources, it is essential to understand their original intentions; similarly, when a scholar achieves success and fulfillment, it is important to observe their final conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你的工作停滞不前，进也不是，退也不是的时候，你就应该重新调整开始时的心态。当你的努力得到了实现，你的行动得到了满足，你就需要仔细看看更远的路。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的工作陷入停滞，进退不得的时候，你应该重新定位你开始的心态。当你的努力得到实现、你的行动得到实现时，你需要仔细地看更远的路。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你的工作陷入僵局，无法前进也无法后退时，你应该重新找回你开始时的心态。当你的努力取得成效，你的行动得以实现时，你需要小心地看清更远的道路。

text.ori_cn: 居卑而后知登高之为危，处晦而后知向明之太露；守静而后知好动之过劳，养默而后知多言之为躁。
text.man_en: After you have resided in a lowly position, You know the danger of climbing to a high status. After you have been in shadow and darkness, You know the great exposure of facing the bright and clear. After you have abided in inactivity, You know the overexertion of those who love activity. After you have cultivated yourself with silence, You know the confusion of an abundance of words.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are in a low place, you will know the danger of ascending to a high place, when you are in the dark, you will know that it is too exposed to the light; when you are in a quiet place, you will know that it is too much work to be active, and when you are in a silent place, you will know that it is too much talk to be agitated.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Stay humble and then know that climbing high is dangerous; stay in darkness and then know that it is too exposed to the bright; keep quiet and then know that being active is overwork; cultivate silence and then know that talking too much is impetuous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only after living humbly does one realize the peril of reaching for heights; only after residing in obscurity does one understand the conspicuous nature of seeking brightness; only after preserving tranquility does one acknowledge the exhaustion from restlessness; only after cultivating silence does one recognize the rashness of excessive speech.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在你居于卑微的地位之后，你知道攀登高峰的危险。在你经历了阴影和黑暗之后，你知道了面对光明和晴朗时的巨大暴露。在你碌碌无为之后，你知道那些热爱活动的人的过度劳累。在你以沉默修身养性之后，你知道言多必失的困惑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你居于卑微的地位之后，你就知道登高的危险了。当你经历过阴影和黑暗之后，你才知道面对明亮和清晰的伟大曝光。住于不动之后，就知道好动者的劳累过度。当你静心修行之后，你就会知道多言的混乱。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 身处卑位之后，才知道攀上高处的危险。身处阴暗之后，才知道面对光明的曝光。处于无为之境之后，才知道好动之人的过劳。以寂静修身之后，才知道言多之乱。

text.ori_cn: 放得功名富贵之心下，便可脱凡；放得道德仁义之心下，纤可入圣。
text.man_en: Release the mind that desires merit and fame, wealth and distinction, And you will be able to avoid the ordinary. Release the mind that desires the Way and its virtue, humanity and righteousness, And you will, for the first time, be able to join the sages.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you let go of the heart of fame and wealth, you will be able to escape from the ordinary; if you let go of the heart of morality and benevolence, you will be able to enter the Holy Spirit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you let go of fame and wealth, you can transcend the world; if you let go of morality, benevolence and righteousness, you can become a saint.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one puts aside the pursuit of fame and wealth, they can transcend the ordinary; if one lets go of the desire for morality and righteousness, they can achieve sainthood.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 释放渴望功名利禄的心，你就能远离凡俗。释放那颗渴望大道及其美德、人性和正义的心，你就能第一次加入圣贤的行列。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 放下贪求功名富贵的心，就能远离凡夫。解脱欲道德仁义之心，初能入圣。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 放下对功名、财富和地位的欲望，你便能避免世俗。放下对道及其德行、仁义的欲望，你才能首次步入贤者之列。

text.ori_cn: 利欲未尽害心，意见乃害心之蟊贼；声色未必障道，聪明乃障道之藩屏。
text.man_en: Although the desire for gain will not completely damage the mind, Egoistic opinion is a cutworm and will inevitably eat it away Although women and song will not necessarily keep you from the Way, Intellect and cleverness raise a barrier and will shut you out in the end.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Profit is not enough to harm the heart, but opinion is the vermin that harms the heart; sound and colour may not be a barrier to the way, but cleverness is a barrier to the way of the fence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the desire for profit is not exhausted and harms the heart, opinions are the thieves that harm the heart; sound and appearance may not block the way, but intelligence is the barrier that blocks the way.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Unfulfilled desires and opinions are the thieves of the heart; worldly pleasures may not necessarily obstruct the path, but cleverness itself is a barrier to it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然利欲不会完全伤害心灵，但利己主义的观点是一条蛀虫，必然会吞噬心灵。虽然女人和歌声不一定会让你远离大道，但智慧和聪明会设置障碍，最终将你拒之门外。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 利欲虽然不会完全损害心灵，但利己主义是蛀虫，必然会被它吃掉。虽然女人和歌不一定能阻止你远离大道，但理智和聪明会设置障碍，最终将你拒之门外。 。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然求利的欲望不会完全损害心智，但自私的见解却如同地老虎，终将吞噬心智。虽然女人和歌舞未必会让你远离正道，但聪明才智却会筑起高墙，最终将你阻隔在外。

text.ori_cn: 人情反复，世路崎岖。行不去处，须知退一步之法；行得去处，务加让三分之功。
text.man_en: The human heart will reverse itself. The road through this world is steep and uphill. For places that are difficult to pass, You should know the law of stepping back a pace for others. For places that are easily traveled, You should give some breathing space to others, so they may do the same.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world is a rugged place. If you can't go, you should know how to take a step back; if you can go, you should make sure to make three concessions.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Favors come and go, and the world is bumpy. If you can't go where you want to go, you must know how to take a step back; if you can go where you want to go, you must give in three-thirds of the effort.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Human relationships are variable, and life's path is rugged. When faced with impassable situations, one must know the art of retreating; in passable circumstances, one should exert the effort of yielding by three parts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人心是会逆转的。人世间的路是陡峭的上坡路。对于难以通过的地方，你应该懂得退一步海阔天空的道理。对于容易通过的地方，你应该给别人一些喘息的空间，让他们也可以这样做。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人心会自行逆转。穿过这个世界的路是陡峭的、上坡的。难过的地方，要懂得为别人退一步的法则。对于交通便利的地方，你应该给其他人一些喘息的空间，这样他们也可能会这样做。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人心会反复无常。这世界的路是陡峭而上行的。对于难以通过的地方，你应该知道退一步给他人的道理。对于容易通行的地方，你应该给他人留一些喘息的空间，这样他们也能照样对待你。

text.ori_cn: 待小人，不难于严，而难于不恶；待君子，不难于恭，而难于有礼。
text.man_en: When dealing with people of no status, It is easy to be severe, But difficult not to be hateful. When dealing with people of high status, It is easy to be fawning, But difficult to maintain proper decorum.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not difficult to treat a villain with severity, but with non-evil; it is not difficult to treat a gentleman with respect, but with courtesy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To treat a villain is not difficult to be strict, but difficult not to be evil; to treat a gentleman is not difficult to be respectful, but difficult to be polite.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dealing with petty people, it is not difficult to be strict, but difficult not to despise; dealing with righteous people, it is not difficult to be respectful, but difficult to be genuinely courteous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与没有地位的人打交道时，严厉很容易，但不招人恨却很难。与地位高的人打交道时，容易献媚，但很难保持应有的风度。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对待无身份的人，严厉很容易，不憎恨却很难。与地位高的人打交道时，很容易阿谀奉承，但保持应有的礼节却很难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在与没有地位的人打交道时，严厉是容易的，但不带仇恨是困难的。在与有地位的人打交道时，奉承是容易的，但保持应有的礼节是困难的。

text.ori_cn: 宁守浑噩而黜聪明，留些正气还天地；宁谢纷华而甘澹泊，遗个清名在乾坤。
text.man_en: Better to abide in simplicity and repel cleverness, To retain a bit of rightmindedness, To return to Heaven and Earth. Better to decline the overly gorgeous and to content yourself with artlessness, To bequeath one pure name, To remain in Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I'd rather keep the muddle-headed and dismiss the clever, and leave some righteousness back to heaven and earth; I'd rather be thankful for the chaos and sweetness, and leave a clear name in Qiankun.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It would be better to be ignorant and deposed to be clever, leaving some righteousness to return to the world; it is better to be free from all splendor and be content with indifference, leaving a clear name in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I would rather remain in obscurity and renounce brilliance, leaving some righteousness in the world; I would rather withdraw from ostentation and embrace simplicity, leaving a reputation for integrity in the universe.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 宁守朴素摒聪明，留一点正气归天地。宁拒浮华，安于平淡，遗一清名，归于天地。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不如守简拒巧，留一点正心，回归天地。宁可谢绝华丽，安于朴素，留一清名，留于天地。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宁归于质朴，抛弃聪明， 留一片正直， 回归天地。宁放弃繁华，以朴素为乐， 留一个清白的名字， 永存天地。

text.ori_cn: 降魔者，先降自心，心伏，则群邪退听；驭横者，先驭此气，气平，则外横不侵。
text.man_en: If you would quell demons, You must first subjugate your own mind. When the mind has yielded, then the legions of demons will disperse obediently. If you would drive away deceitfulness, You must first bridle your own spirit. When your spirit is at peace, heresies will not bother you.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who subdue the devil should first subdue their own hearts, and if their hearts are subdued, then the evils will retreat and listen; those who harness the cross should first harness this gas, and if the gas is levelled, then the outer cross will not be invaded.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To subjugate demons, first subdue your own mind, and then the evil spirits will recede; to control the evil spirits, first control the energy, and if the energy is calm, then external forces will not invade.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To conquer demons, one must first subdue one's own heart; when the heart is subdued, evil forces will retreat. To control aggression, one must first control one's own temper; when temper is calm, external aggression will not intrude.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你想镇压恶魔，首先必须征服自己的心灵。当心灵屈服之后，恶魔军团就会乖乖散去。若要驱除诡诈，必须先约束自己的心灵。当你的心灵安宁时，异端邪说就不会打扰你。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 欲降魔，必先降伏自心。当心意屈服时，恶魔军团就会乖乖地散去。欲除邪，必先克制己心。当你的心灵平静时，异端就不会打扰你。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若欲降魔，先降自身之心。心若服矣，群魔自将散去无睱。若欲驱除欺诈，先驭自身之灵。灵若安宁，异端自不扰你。

text.ori_cn: 教弟子，如养闺女，最要严出入，谨交游。若一接近匪人，是清净田中，下一不净种子，便终身难植嘉禾矣。
text.man_en: Teaching a disciple is like bringing up a wellprotected maiden: It is absolutely necessary to be strict about coming and going, and to be cautious about friends and associates. If a person becomes intimate with noxious people even once, This is sowing one impure seed in an unsullied field. Then it will be difficult, throughout a lifetime, to have even one unblighted seedling.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Teaching a disciple is like raising a daughter; it is most important to be strict about entering and leaving, and to be careful about socialising. If one is close to a gangster, it is a pure field, but an impure seed is planted, and it is difficult to plant a good harvest for a lifetime.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Teaching disciples is like raising a daughter. The most important thing is to be strict about coming in and going out, and be careful about socializing. If you approach a bandit and drop unclean seeds in a clean field, you will never be able to plant a golden harvest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Teaching disciples is like raising daughters; it is crucial to be strict about their whereabouts and to monitor their associations carefully. Once they come into contact with bad influences, it is like sowing an impure seed in a clean field, making it difficult to cultivate good crops for their entire lives.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 教导弟子就像养育一个被保护得很好的少女：绝对有必要严格控制来往，谨慎对待朋友和伙伴。如果一个人与有害的人亲近，哪怕只有一次，这就等于在未被玷污的田地里播下了一颗不洁的种子。那么，终其一生，也很难再有一棵未受玷污的幼苗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 教弟子如养少女，出入须严格，朋友交往须谨慎。如果一个人与恶人有过一次亲密接触，这就是在不洁的土地上播下一颗不洁的种子。那么，终其一生，想要拥有一棵不枯萎的幼苗都困难重重。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 教导弟子如同抚养一个受到良好保护的少女：必须对出入严格要求，并对朋友和交往保持谨慎。如果一个人哪怕一次与恶劣的人亲近，这就像在一片纯净的田地里撒下了一粒不洁的种子。那么在一生中，要有一株没有受到损害的幼苗将会变得困难重重。

text.ori_cn: 欲路上事，毋乐其便而姑为染指，一染指便深入万仞；理路上事，无惮其难而稍为退步，一退步便远隔千山。
text.man_en: On the road of desire, do not happily dip your fingers into the pot just because it happens to be there. Once you have stuck them in and tasted what is inside, You will try to put them in ten thousand fathoms deep. On the road of principle, do not step back even a little, hesitating over the difficulties. Once you have stepped back in retreat, You will be separated from your goal by a thousand mountains.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you want to do something on the road, don't be happy with the convenience of it, but let your fingers be coloured, for once you have coloured your fingers, you will go to the depth of 10,000 metres; if you want to do something on the road of reason, don't be afraid of the difficulty of it, but let your step back a little, for once you have stepped back, you will be far away from a thousand mountains.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you want to do things on the road, don't be happy with them and just let them get involved. Once you get involved, you will go deep into the mountains.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: On the path of desire, do not indulge in its convenience and tentatively dip your finger, for once you do, you will be plunged into an abyss. On the path of reason, do not fear its difficulty and take even a slight step back, for once you retreat, you will be separated by a thousand mountains.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在欲望的道路上，不要因为锅里有东西就高兴地把手指伸进去。一旦你把手指伸进去，尝到里面的滋味，你就会想方设法把手指伸进万丈深渊。在原则的道路上，不要因为困难而退缩，哪怕是一点点。一旦退缩，你将与目标相隔千山万水。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在欲望的路上，不要因为有锅就高兴地把手指伸进锅里。一旦你把它们放进去并尝到里面的味道，你就会尝试把它们放进万寻深处。在原则的道路上，不要因为困难而退缩，犹豫不决。一旦你退后一步，你就会与目标相隔千山万水。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在欲望的道路上，不要因为锅刚好在那里就高兴地把手指蘸进去。一旦你把它们插进去并尝到里面的东西，你就会想把它们伸到万丈深处。在原则的道路上，不要因为困难而后退一步。一旦你退却，你将被千山万水阻隔在目标之外。

text.ori_cn: 念头浓者，自待厚，待人亦厚，处处皆浓；念头淡者，自待薄，待人亦薄，处处皆淡。故君子居常嗜好，不可太浓艳，亦不宜太枯寂。
text.man_en: One whose disposition is conscientious will be attentive toward himself, attentive toward others. He will be attentive in all things. One whose disposition is indifferent will be unreserved toward himself, unreserved toward others. He will be unreserved in all affairs. Therefore, the gentleman, In all those things for which he habitually has a taste, Should not lean toward the overly gorgeous. Neither should he incline toward the elegantly simple.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you have strong thoughts, you treat yourself and others as thick, and everywhere is thick; if you have light thoughts, you treat yourself and others as thin, and everywhere is light. Therefore, a gentleman's hobbies should not be too colourful, nor should they be too dull.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those with strong thoughts will treat themselves well, treat others well, and be warm everywhere; those with weak thoughts will treat themselves poorly, treat others well, and be weak everywhere. Therefore, a gentleman's usual hobbies should not be too colorful, nor should they be too dull.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those with intense thoughts treat themselves and others generously, with intensity in all matters. Those with mild thoughts treat themselves and others sparingly, with mildness in all affairs. Therefore, a gentleman's preferences in life should not be too flamboyant, nor too dull.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个有良知的人，对自己和他人都会很用心。他在任何事情上都会兢兢业业。一个人如果性情冷漠，就会对自己毫无保留，对他人毫无保留。他在所有事情上都会毫无保留。因此，绅士在他惯常喜欢的所有事物中，不应偏爱过于华丽的东西。他也不应该倾向于优雅简洁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个性格认真的人会关心自己，关心别人。他会对所有事情都很细心。性情淡漠的人，对自己毫无保留，对别人也毫无保留。凡事他都会毫无保留。所以君子，凡是自己习惯所喜欢的事物，都不应偏向华丽。他也不应该倾向于优雅简单的风格。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 凡是性格谨慎的人，对自己会很专注，对别人也会很专注。他会在所有事情上都很专注。凡是性格冷漠的人，对自己会很随便，对别人也会很随便。他会在所有事务上都很随便。因此，君子在他平时所喜好的所有事情上，应该不偏向于过于华丽，也不应该偏向于过于简朴。

text.ori_cn: 彼富我仁，彼爵我义，君子固不为君相所牢笼；人定胜天，志壹动气，君子亦不受造物之陶铸。
text.man_en: If others possess wealth, then I possess humanity; If others possess high status, then I possess justice. Therefore, the gentleman never forces his thoughts on others. If men would be persistent, they could gain mastery of Heaven; If they concentrated their wills, they would have command of their ch'i The gentleman does not accept the shackles of the created world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am rich, I am benevolent, I am righteous, the gentleman is certainly not for the prison of the king's phase; people must win the day, the will of the one to move the gas, the gentleman is not the creation of the pottery casting.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He is rich in my benevolence, he is noble in my righteousness, and a gentleman is not imprisoned by his king and prime minister; man is determined to conquer heaven, and when his ambition is moved, a gentleman is not molded by creation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He is wealthy, I am benevolent; he has rank, I have righteousness. A true gentleman is not ensnared by the favors of a ruler. Man will surely triumph over nature, and with determination, one can inspire the spirit; a true gentleman is not shaped by the forces of creation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 别人拥有财富，我就拥有人性；别人拥有崇高地位，我就拥有正义。所以，君子从不强人所难。天行健，君子以自强不息；地势坤，君子以厚德载物。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 别人有财富，我就有人性；别人地位高，我就有正义。因此，君子从不把自己的想法强加于人。人若能坚持，就能主宰天；人若能坚持，就能主宰天。如果他们的意志集中，他们就会控制他们的气。君子不接受受造世界的束缚。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他人有财，我有仁；他人有位，我有义。所以，君子不强加己意于人。若人能持久不懈，便能掌握天道；若能专注意志，便能主宰其气。君子不受造物的束缚。

text.ori_cn: 风恬浪静中，见人生之真境；味淡声希处，识心体之本然。
text.man_en: In the midst of a tranquil breeze and quiet waves, You see the true form of human life. Where exist the simpletasting and tranquilvoiced, You detect the original nature of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the quietness of the wind and waves, one can see the true state of life; in the lightness of taste and sound, one can recognise the true nature of the mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the calmness of the wind and waves, one can see the true state of life; in the place where the taste is faint and the sound is rare, one can recognize the true nature of the mind and body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the calm of the wind and waves, one sees the true essence of life; in the quietness of taste and sound, one recognizes the intrinsic nature of the heart and soul.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在宁静的微风和静谧的波涛中，你看到了人类生命的本真。在淳朴宁静的声音中，你发现了心灵的本真。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 清风静浪中，见人生真相。哪里有简单的品味和平静的声音，你就能发现心的本性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在宁静的微风和安静的波浪中，你看到了人类生活的真实面貌。在简淡的滋味和宁静的声响中，你察觉到心灵的本质。

text.ori_cn: 立身不高一步立，如尘里振衣，泥中濯足，如何超达；处世不退一步处，如飞蛾投烛，羝羊触藩，如何安乐。
text.man_en: In establishing yourself in life, if you do not raise yourself at least one step higher, It will be like shaking off your clothes in a dust cloud, Like washing your feet in the mud. How will you ever excel? In living with the world, if you do not step back a single pace for others, You will be like the moth that hurls itself into the lamp, Or the ram that catches its horns in the hedge. How will you ever be at peace?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you don't take a step forward in your life, you'll be like reviving your clothes in the dust, or washing your feet in the mud, how can you achieve greatness; if you don't take a step back in the world, you'll be like a moth throwing itself into a candle, or a billy goat touching a feudal lord, how can you be happy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't stand tall and take one step, you are like shaking your clothes in the dust or washing your feet in the mud. How can you achieve excellence? When you are in the world without taking a step back, you are like a moth throwing a candle or a sheep touching the feudal clan. How can you be happy?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one doesn't elevate their standing, it's like shaking off dust from clothes or washing feet in mud; how can one surpass and reach greatness? If one doesn't take a step back in life, it's like a moth flying into fire or a goat getting stuck in a fence; how can one find peace and happiness?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在人生的道路上，如果你不至少把自己提高一步，那就会像在尘埃中脱衣，像在泥泞中洗脚。你怎能出类拔萃？与世无争时，如果不为他人退一步，你就会像飞蛾扑火般扑向灯火，或像公羊在篱笆中抓住自己的角。你怎能安宁？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 立身之事，如果不把自己提升一步，就如尘云中抖衣裳，泥泞中洗脚一样。你将如何表现出色？与世共处，若不为他人退一步，则如飞蛾扑灯，公羊在篱中叼角。你将如何平静？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 立身处世，若不将自己提上一阶，便如在灰尘中抖衣，似在泥潭中洗足，如何能够出类拔萃？与世相处，若不为他人退一步，便如飞蛾扑火，或如羊撞篱笆，如何能够心安理得？

text.ori_cn: 学者要收拾精神，并归一路。如修德而留意于事功名誉，必无实诣；读书而寄兴于吟咏风雅，定不深心。
text.man_en: If you want to study, it is necessary to collect your spirit, And to concentrate in earnest. But if in cultivating virtue there remains any idea of merit or fame, Learning will inevitably amount to nothing. And if in reading books you have a tendency toward recitation and stylishness, Surely there will nothing in the depths of your heart.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholars should gather their spirits and return to the same path. If you cultivate virtue and pay attention to the honour and reputation, you will have no real attainments; and if you read books and indulge in singing and singing, you will not have a deep heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Scholars must gather their energy and get back together. If you cultivate virtue and pay attention to achievements and reputation, you will have no real achievements; if you study and focus on chanting elegance, you will definitely not have a deep heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A scholar must gather his thoughts and follow one path. If he cultivates virtue but is preoccupied with worldly achievements and reputation, he will achieve nothing substantial; if he studies but finds pleasure in reciting poetry and appreciating elegance, he will not have profound insights.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 学而时习之，不亦说乎？但是，如果在修身养性的过程中仍有功名利禄之念，那么学习必然一事无成。倘若在读书时一味背诵和追求文采，那么你的内心深处必然一无所获。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 要想学习，就必须集中精神，专心致志。但修德若尚有功名之念，学问必然无济于事。而读书若有背诵、文雅的倾向，内心深处必定是空无一物的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若要学习，必须集中精神，专心致志。然而，如果在修身养性中存有任何功名之念，学习必然一无所成。而且如果你在读书时倾向于背诵和花哨，心灵深处必然空无一物。

text.ori_cn: 人人有个大慈悲，维摩屠刽无二心也；处处有种真趣味，金屋茅檐非两地也。只是欲蔽情封，当面错过，便咫尺千里矣。
text.man_en: All men have the capacity for great benevolence: The mind of the Bodhisattva Vimalakirti is no different than that of a butcher or executioner. All places have the capacity for true pleasure: A house made of gold is no different than a hut with thatched eaves. Ah, but desire creeps in and passion envelops, And that which is right in front of you is mixed and mistaken, Causing the tiniest fraction of an inch to become a thousand miles.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Everyone has a great compassion, Vimalayan executioner no two hearts; everywhere there is a kind of real fun, the golden house thatched roof is not two places. It is just that the desire to cover the love seal, face to face miss, will be at hand a thousand miles away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Everyone has great compassion, and Vimalakirti had no second thoughts when he executed him; there is true interest everywhere, and the golden roofs and thatched eaves are not in two places. If you just want to hide your love, if you miss it in person, you will be thousands of miles away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Everyone possesses great compassion; for Vimalakirti, there is no difference between a butcher and a non-butchian heart. True pleasure can be found everywhere, whether in a gold house or under a thatched eave, as they are not separate realms. Yet, if one is blinded by desire and delusion, missing what is right in front of them, then even a short distance becomes a thousand miles apart.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人皆有大仁：维摩诘菩萨之心，与屠夫刽子手无异。所有地方都有真正快乐的能力：金屋与茅屋无异。啊，但欲望悄然而至，激情悄然而至，眼前之物混淆不清，误入歧途，导致 "差之毫厘，谬以千里"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一切人皆有大慈悲之能，维摩诘菩萨心与屠夫刽子手无异。所有的地方都有真正的快乐的能力：金子建造的房子与茅草屋没有什么不同。啊，欲欲潜入，情欲笼罩，眼前错乱，寸寸成千里。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所有人都具备伟大仁慈的能力：菩萨维摩诘的心灵与屠夫或刽子手的心灵无异。所有地方都具备真正愉悦的能力：金屋与茅草屋无异。啊，但欲望潜入，激情包裹，眼前之物混杂错乱，使得毫厘之差变成千里之距。

text.ori_cn: 进德修道，要个木石的念头，若一有欣羨，便趋欲境；济世经邦，要段云水的趣味，若一有贪著，便堕危机。
text.man_en: In improving your worth or in practicing the Way, It is necessary to have a mind as unmoving as trees and stones. Having once become envious or elated, You will skip along to the world of desire. In benefiting society or participating in government, It is necessary to have an attitude as free flowing as water and clouds. Once you covet or become attached, You will fall crashing into crisis and extremity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To advance in virtue and cultivation, we need a thought of wood and stone; if we are envious, we will tend to the realm of desire; to help the world and the state, we need the fun of clouds and water; if we are greedy, we will fall into a crisis.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To advance morally and cultivate the Tao, you need to have thoughts of wood and stone. If you are envious, you will fall into the state of desire.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To advance in virtue and cultivate the Way, one must have the mindset of wood and stone; if envy arises, one falls into the realm of desire. To serve the world and govern the nation, one must have the charm of cloud and water; if greed arises, one plunges into peril.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在提升自身价值或修行的过程中，必须要有一颗像树木和石头一样不动的心。一旦心生羡慕或得意，就会跳入欲望的世界。在造福社会或参政议政时，必须要有水云般飘逸的心态。一旦贪恋或执着，就会坠入危机和绝境。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 提高身价，修行道，必须要有木石不动的心。一旦嫉妒或得意，你就会跳入欲望的世界。无论是造福社会还是参与政务，都需要有一种如行云流水的态度。一旦你有了贪心或执着，你就会陷入危机和绝境。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在提高你的价值或修行道时，需要有如树石般不动的心。一旦你变得嫉妒或兴奋，你将跳入欲望的世界。在造福社会或参与政府时，需要有如水云般自由流动的态度。一旦你贪婪或执着，你将坠入危机和极端。

text.ori_cn: 吉人无论作用安详，即梦寐神魂，无非和气；凶人无论行事狠戾，即声音笑貌，浑是杀机。
text.man_en: It is a matter of course that the daily behavior of good men is tranquil and propitious. Thus their sleep and dreams, their spirits and souls Are never without peace. It is a matter of course that the daily actions of bad men are brutish and frightening. Thus the sounds of their words and laughter Are all transfused with malevolence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Whether the role of the auspicious person is peaceful, that is, dreaming soul, nothing but peace; whether the vicious person acts viciously, that is, the voice and laughter, all is killing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Regardless of whether the auspicious person acts peacefully, that is, his dreaming spirit, he is nothing but harmonious; whether the evil person acts ruthlessly, that is, his voice, smile, and appearance are full of murderous intent.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For the righteous, no matter how peaceful their actions, even their dreams and spirits are filled with harmony; for the wicked, no matter how cruel their deeds, even their voices and smiles are full of menace.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 好人的日常行为理所当然是宁静祥和的。因此，他们的睡眠和梦境，他们的精神和灵魂，从来都是安宁的。当然，坏人的日常行为是野蛮和可怕的。因此，他们的言语和笑声都充满了恶意。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 善人的日常行为自然是平静吉祥的。因此，他们的睡眠和梦境、他们的精神和灵魂永远不会不安宁。当然，坏人的日常行为是野蛮而可怕的。因此他们的言语和笑声都充满了恶意。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 好人的日常行为自然是安静和吉祥的。因此，他们的睡眠和梦境，他们的精神和灵魂从不缺乏和平。而坏人的日常行为自然是粗暴和可怕的。因此，他们的言语和笑声中都充满了恶意。

text.ori_cn: 肝受病，则目不能视；肾受病，则耳不能听；病受于人所不见，必发于人所共见。故君子欲无得罪于昭昭，先无得罪于冥冥。
text.man_en: When the liver ails, it will soon follow That the eye is unable to focus. When the kidney is afflicted, it will soon follow That the ear is unable to distinguish sounds. Illness begins in a place unseen by men, But invariably develops to a condition that can be seen by all. Therefore, the gentleman, If he hopes not to be censored in the light of day, Commits no crimes in secret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the liver is affected by disease, the eye cannot see; if the kidney is affected by disease, the ear cannot hear; if the disease is affected by what people do not see, it will be seen by what people do. Therefore, if a gentleman wants to be free from offence, he should first be free from offence in the dark.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the liver is affected, the eyes will not be able to see; if the kidneys are affected, the ears will not be able to hear; if the disease is not seen by others, it will be seen by everyone. Therefore, if a gentleman wishes not to offend Zhao Zhao, he must first not offend Ming Ming.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the liver is afflicted, the eyes cannot see; when the kidneys are afflicted, the ears cannot hear. A hidden ailment will inevitably manifest in a visible way. Therefore, a gentleman, to avoid wrongdoing in the public eye, must first avoid wrongdoing in private.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 肝脏有病，眼睛很快就无法聚焦。肾脏有病，耳朵很快就会分辨不出声音。病从人看不见的地方开始，却总是发展到人人都能看见的地步。因此，君子如果不希望在光天化日之下受到审查，就不要在暗地里犯罪。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当肝脏生病时，很快就会导致眼睛无法聚焦。当肾有病时，很快就会出现耳朵不能辨别声音的现象。病起于人所看不见的地方，而必然发展到人人都能看见的地步。所以，君子如果不想在光天化日之下受到审查，就不要暗中犯罪。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当肝脏不适时，很快就会导致眼睛无法聚焦。当肾脏受损时，很快就会导致耳朵无法分辨声音。疾病始于人们看不见的地方，但不可避免地发展到所有人都能看见的状态。因此，一个君子，如果希望在光天化日之下不被谴责，就不要在暗地里犯罪。

text.ori_cn: 苦心中，常得悦心之趣；得意时，须防失意之悲。
text.man_en: In the midst of painstaking labor, There is always a way to make the heart glad. At the time of one's prosperity, The sorrow of disappointment may quickly be born.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the heart of bitterness, we always get the pleasure of being happy; when we are happy, we must guard against the sadness of losing our mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the heart of suffering, you can always find joy in your heart; when you are satisfied, you must guard against the sadness of disappointment.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In times of hardship, one often finds the joy of contentment; in moments of triumph, one should guard against the sorrow of disappointment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在艰辛的劳动中，总有一种方法能让人心旷神怡。在一个人的繁荣时期，可能很快就会产生失望的悲伤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 辛苦劳作中，总有一种方法可以让心愉悦。一个人一帆风顺的时候，很快就会产生失望的悲伤。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在艰辛的劳动中，总有一种方法让心情愉快。在繁荣昌盛之时，失望的悲伤可能很快滋生。

text.ori_cn: 富贵名誉，自道德来者，如山林中花，自是舒余繁衍；自功业来者，如盆槛中花，便有迁徙废兴；若以权力得者，如瓶钵中花，其根不值，其萎可立而待矣。
text.man_en: Riches and status, fame and honor— Those who come from morality and principle Are like flowers in mountain forests: Of their own they gently spread and grow. Those who come from work and effort Are like the flowers in pots and trays: They can be put in or taken out, planted or thrown away. Those who gained by power and influence, Are like flowers stuck in a vase or jar: As their roots are not planted, They will fade and wilt in no time at all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Wealth and reputation, from the moral, such as flowers in the mountains and forests, since the Shu Yu multiply; from the work, such as flowers in the pot threshold, there will be migration and abolition of the rise; if the power to get the person, such as bottles and bowls in the flower, the root is not worth, its wither can be set up and to be carried forward.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wealth and fame come from morality, like flowers in the mountains and forests, which naturally flourish and multiply; wealth and fame come from merit, like flowers in a pot and sill, and they migrate and fail to flourish; if they are obtained by power, they are like flowers in a vase and bowl, and their roots It's not worth it. It can wither and stand and wait.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wealth and fame that come from virtue are like flowers in the mountains and forests, naturally blooming and thriving. Those that come from achievements are like flowers in pots and baskets, subject to relocation and decline. If obtained through power, they are like flowers in vases and bowls; their roots are worthless, and their withering is inevitable.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 财富和地位，名声和荣誉--那些来自道德和原则的人，就像山林中的花朵：自生自灭。那些来自工作和努力的人，就像花盆和托盘里的花朵：可放可取，可种可弃。那些靠权力和影响力得来的人，就像插在花瓶或罐子里的花朵：由于没有扎根，它们很快就会凋谢、枯萎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 富贵名誉，有道德有原则的人，就像山林里的花，自己慢慢地生长。那些来自劳动和努力的人就像花盆和托盘中的花朵一样：它们可以放入或取出，可以种植或丢弃。靠权势得势的人，就像花插在瓶里、坛子里，根不扎根，很快就会枯萎。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 财富和地位、名声和荣誉——那些源于道德和原则的人，像山林中的花朵，自然地蔓延和生长。那些源于劳动和努力的人，像盆栽和托盘中的花朵，可以放进或拿出，种植或丢弃。那些依靠权力和影响力获得的人，像插在花瓶或罐子中的花朵，由于根基未植，不久便会凋谢枯萎。

text.ori_cn: 春至时和，花尚铺一段好色，鸟且啭几句好音。士君子幸值清时，复遇温饱，不思立好言，行好事，虽是在世百年，恰似未生一日。
text.man_en: When spring comes, the season softens: The flowers spread thickly in colors more beautiful; The birds sing continuously verses lovely of sound. The person of rank happily stands out from the crowd, For all to see, well fed and well dressed. But if he does not aspire to compose beautiful verses, to perform good deeds, Though he lives for one hundred years He will never have truly lived for a single day.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When spring arrives and, flowers still lay a good colour, birds and warble a few good sound. Scholar is fortunate to be worth the time of the Qing Dynasty, meet again, do not want to set up a good speech, good deeds, although it is in the world for a hundred years, just like not born a day.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When spring arrives, the flowers are spread out for a while, and the birds chirp a few pleasant notes. A gentleman is fortunate enough to be in his prime time, and when he has enough food and clothing, he does not think about good words or deeds. Although he has been alive for hundreds of years, it seems as if he has not been born for a day.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With the arrival of spring, flowers display their vibrant colors and birds sing melodious tunes. Scholars and gentlemen fortunate enough to live in peaceful times and enjoy warmth and sustenance, if they do not aspire to speak well and perform good deeds, though they may live a century, it is as if they have not been born for even a day.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 春天来了，季节变得柔和：花儿开得更艳，鸟儿唱得更欢。有地位的人乐于从人群中脱颖而出，衣食无忧，为众人所瞩目。但如果他不立志创作优美的诗篇，不立志行善积德，即使他活了一百年，他也不会真正活过一天。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 春天来了，季节变得柔和了：花开得茂盛，色彩更艳丽；鸟儿不断地歌唱着美妙的歌声。有地位的人快乐地从人群中脱颖而出，吃得好，穿得好，众目睽睽之下。若不立志作优美的诗篇，行善事，虽能活一百岁，也未真正活过一日。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当春天来临时，季节变得柔和：花朵厚厚地铺满，美丽的色彩；鸟儿不停地唱着动听的歌谣。显赫的人开心地从人群中脱颖而出，人人可见，衣食无忧。但是如果他不志在创作优美的诗句，行善事，纵使他活到百岁，也不曾真正活过一天。

text.ori_cn: 学者有段竞业的心思，又要有段潇洒的趣味。若一味敛束清苦，是有秋杀，无春生，何以发育万物。
text.man_en: The student of the Way keeps his thoughts circumspect and discreet, But needs also a penchant for the clean and refined. Yet if he only brings himself under earnest control, making himself pure and impecunious, It will be the killing of autumn, not the birth of spring. How will he give growth to the Ten Thousand Things? 28
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholars have a period of competitive mind, but also to have a period of dashing fun. If a convergence bundle of bitterness, is an autumn kill, no spring, how to develop all things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Scholars should have a competitive spirit, but also have a free and unrestrained taste. If we just keep away all the bitterness, there will be death in autumn and no growth in spring. How can all things develop?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A scholar should possess both competitive spirit and a touch of elegance. If one only adheres to strict austerity, it resembles autumn's killing frost without the rejuvenation of spring, making it impossible to nurture all things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 学道者谨小慎微，但也需要洁身自好。然而，如果他只是认真地控制自己，使自己纯洁无暇，那将是秋天的凋零，而不是春天的诞生。他如何让万物生长？28
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 学道的人，思想要谨严，但又要有清净的心。然而，如果他只认真地控制自己，使自己纯洁而贫穷，那就是秋天的杀戮，而不是春天的诞生。他将如何让万事成长？ 28
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道的学生保持他的思想谨慎和隐秘，但也需要对清晰和优雅有偏爱。然而，如果他只严肃地控制自己，使自己纯洁和贫困，它将是秋天的死亡，不是春天的诞生。他如何能推动万物生长？28

text.ori_cn: 真廉无廉名，图名者正所以为贪；大巧无巧术，用术者乃所以为拙。
text.man_en: True purity contains no fame within; He who establishes a reputation for himself does so strictly out of desire. Great skill contains no art within; He who mindfully uses technique does so only out of clumsiness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no name for honesty, but the one who tries to make a name for himself is greedy; there is no art for skillfulness, but the one who uses art is clumsy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: True integrity has no reputation for incorruptibility, and those who seek fame are greedy; great skill has no skill, and those who use it are clumsy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: True honesty does not seek a reputation for honesty; seeking a reputation is in itself a form of greed. Great skill does not rely on techniques; relying on techniques is in itself a form of clumsiness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 真正的纯洁不包含任何名声；为自己建立名声的人完全是出于欲望。高超的技艺中并不包含艺术；用心运用技巧的人只是出于笨拙。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真正的清净，里面没有名气；为自己建立声誉的人完全是出于欲望。伟大的技艺内含无艺术；那些用心运用技术的人只是出于笨拙才这样做。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真正的纯粹不含有声望；树立名声的人完全出于欲望。极高的技艺不含有艺术；刻意运用技巧的人仅仅是因为笨拙。

text.ori_cn: 欹器以满覆，扑满以空全。故君子宁居无不居有，宁处缺不处完。
text.man_en: When the water bottle is full, it overturns. While the piggy bank remains empty, it is whole. Therefore, the gentleman Resides in vacuity rather than existence, And exists in the lacking rather than the complete.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Interjections are covered by fullness, and puffs are full by emptiness. Therefore, a gentleman prefers to live in nothing rather than in something, and to be in a state of deficiency rather than in a state of completion.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the bucket is full, it will be filled, and when the bucket is full, it will be empty. Therefore, a gentleman would rather live in everything and live in everything; he would rather live in a place where there is a lack than in a place where there is nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A tilted vessel spills when full; a savings jar remains whole when empty. Therefore, a gentleman prefers to dwell in need rather than in abundance, and to live with imperfection rather than with completeness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当水瓶装满时，它就会翻倒。储蓄罐空则全。故君子居虚而不居实，居缺而不居全。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当水瓶装满时，它会翻倒。虽然存钱罐仍然是空的，但它是完整的。故君子于虚而不于有，于于缺而不于全。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 水瓶满则倾，储蓄罐空则全。因此，君子处虚不处实，居缺不居完。

text.ori_cn: 名根未拔者，纵轻千乘甘一瓢，总堕尘情；客气未融者，虽泽四海利万世，终为剩技。
text.man_en: If you have not yet uprooted the desire for fame, Though you belittle the command of a thousand chariots, And content yourself with only a gourd from which to drink — This is still crashing into the dusty passions of the world. If you have not yet tempered your own hotbloodedness, Though you benefit amply from within the four seas And rake in profit from the entire world— This is, in the end, nothing but a show.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the root of the name has not been pulled out, even if the light of a thousand times a scoop of sweet, always fall into the dust; polite not yet melted, although the four seas and the world, but ultimately the leftover skills.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have not uprooted their reputation will always fall into earthly emotions even if they take a thousand rides and a scoop of sweetness; those who have not melted their politeness will benefit the world and benefit the world, but they will eventually be left behind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For those whose inner roots haven't been removed, even if they disdain opulence and cherish simplicity, they ultimately remain ensnared by worldly emotions; for those whose sense of ego hasn't dissolved, no matter how they benefit the world or future generations, their contributions eventually amount to mere technical prowess.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你还没有根除对名利的渴望，尽管你轻视千军万马的统帅，满足于一瓢饮--这仍然是在撞击尘世的激情。倘若你还不曾收敛自己的热血，尽管你从四海之内获益良多，从整个世界攫取利益--这终究只是一场表演。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你还没有根除名利的欲望，虽然贬低了千乘之师，只满足于葫芦里的饮水，却还是撞在了尘世的情欲之中。如果你自己的热血还没有调和，虽然你在四海之中利益颇丰，在全世界范围内捞取利益，但终究不过是作秀罢了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你还未根除名利之欲，虽然你轻视千乘之军的命令，并满足于仅用一个葫芦饮水——这仍是在碰撞尘世的激情。如果你还未平息自己的热血，虽然你在四海之内获益丰厚，尽收天下之利——这归根结底不过是个虚假的表象。

text.ori_cn: 心体光明，暗室中有青天；念头暗昧，白日下生厉鬼。
text.man_en: When the true mind is bright and shiny, You will have fair weather even in a dark room. When your thoughts are dark and gloomy, Evil demons will be born even under a bright sun.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the mind is bright, there is a blue sky in a dark room; when the thoughts are dark, there is a white sun under which a stern ghost is born.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the mind is bright, there is a blue sky in the dark room; when the thoughts are dark, there are evil ghosts under the daylight.
