text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With a clear and bright mind, even a dark room can have a blue sky; with obscure thoughts, even in broad daylight, fierce ghosts can arise.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当本心明亮灿烂时，即使在黑暗的房间里也会风调雨顺。当你的思想阴沉沉的时候，即使在明媚的阳光下也会诞生邪恶的魔鬼。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当真心明亮时，即使在黑暗的房间里也会有晴朗的天气。当你的思想阴暗时，即使在灿烂的阳光下，邪魔也会诞生。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当真心明亮而闪耀时，即使在黑暗的房间里你也会有好天气。当你的思绪黑暗而阴郁时，即使在明亮的阳光下也会有邪恶的恶魔诞生。

text.ori_cn: 人知名位为乐，不知无名无位之乐为最真；人知饥寒为忧，那知不饥不寒之忧为更甚。
text.man_en: Men know the happiness of fame and position. They do not know that obscurity and lack of position Is the happiness of the highest truth. Men know the affliction of hunger and cold. They do not know that being rid of hunger or cold Is an affliction more excessive still.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People know fame and position as happiness, but they don't know that the happiness of no name and no position is the most true; people know hunger and cold as worries, but they know that the worries of no hunger and no cold are even more serious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People know that being famous is a joy, but they don’t know that the joy of being nameless and having no position is the most real. People know that being hungry and cold is a worry, but they know that being neither hungry nor cold is even more worrying.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People find joy in fame and position, but they don't realize that there is greater joy in anonymity and lack of position; people know the worry of hunger and cold, but little do they know that there is a greater worry in not being hungry or cold.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们知道名誉和地位的幸福。他们不知道，默默无闻、没有地位才是最高真理的幸福。人们知道饥寒交迫的痛苦。他们不知道，摆脱饥饿或寒冷是一种更过分的痛苦。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 男人懂得名誉和地位的快乐。他们不知道默默无闻和缺乏地位才是最高真理的幸福。人皆知饥寒之苦。殊不知，除饥除寒，更是一种过分的痛苦。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们知道名利的快乐，却不知道默默无闻和无职无位是最高真理的快乐。人们知道饥寒交迫的痛苦，却不知道摆脱了饥寒才是更大的痛苦。

text.ori_cn: 为恶而畏人知，恶中犹有善路；为善而急人知，善处即是恶根。
text.man_en: Those who do evil and yet fear that men should learn of it Are, in the midst of evil, still on the road to good. Those who do good and yet want that men should soon learn of it Live within the good, but are truly at nothing other than the foot of iniquity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you fear to be known for evil, there is still a way to goodness in evil; if you are anxious to be known for good, goodness is the root of evil.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you are afraid of people knowing for the sake of evil, there is still a way of good in the evil; if you are anxious for people to know for the sake of good, the good place will be the root of evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Doing evil and fearing others knowing it still leaves a path to good; doing good and being anxious for others to know it is the root of evil in good.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 作恶却害怕被人知道的人 在恶中，他们仍在通往善的路上。行善而又怕人知道的人 生活在善之中，但实际上却在罪恶的脚下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些行恶却害怕被人知道的人，虽然身处恶中，却仍然走在行善的路上。那些行善却想让人们很快知道的人，生活在善中，但实际上除了罪恶之外什么也没有。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些做了坏事但害怕被人知道的人，还在邪恶之中，仍在通往善的道路上。那些行善却希望人们很快知道的人，虽然生活在善中，但实际上只是在罪恶的边缘。

text.ori_cn: 天之机缄不测。抑而伸，伸而抑，皆是播弄英雄，颠倒豪杰处。君子只是逆来顺受，居安思危，天亦无所施其技俩矣。
text.man_en: The contrivances of Heaven are unfathomable: They are repressed, and then increase; They increase, and then are repressed. In all, they make sport of heroes, And set great men on their heads. Thus, if reverses come to the gentleman, he receives them as routine. When living at peace, he thinks of the emergency, And Heaven has no place to use its skills.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The machine of heaven is unpredictable. Suppressing and extending, extending and suppressing, are all broadcasting heroes, reversing the place of heroes. Gentlemen just go against the grain, think of danger in peace and quiet, and the sky has nothing to do with its techniques.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The secrets of heaven are unpredictable. Suppression and extension, extension and suppression, are all playing tricks on heroes and inverting their characteristics. A gentleman just accepts the situation and is prepared for danger in times of peace. Heaven has nothing to offer him.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven’s mechanisms are inscrutable. Sometimes it suppresses, sometimes it elevates, all to manipulate heroes and confound the valiant. The gentleman merely adapts to adversity, remains vigilant in times of peace, and thus the heavens have no means to deploy their tricks.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上天的安排深不可测：先抑后扬，先扬后抑。总之，他们以英雄为乐，以伟人为耻。因此，如果君子遭遇挫折，他就把它们当作家常便饭。居安思危，天道无亲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天意深不可测，先压抑，后增强；它们增加，然后受到抑制。总之，他们戏弄英雄，把伟人顶在头上。因此，如果君子遭遇逆境，他会视之如常。居安思危，天无处用。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天道无常：抑之使增，增之使抑。总之，弄弄英雄，倒倒伟人。故，君子临变不惊。居安思危，天无所施其巧。

text.ori_cn: 燥性者火炽，遇物则焚；寡恩者冰清，逢物必杀；凝滞固执者，如死水腐木，生机已绝。俱难建功业而延福祇。
text.man_en: The man with an arid personality surges like fire: Whatever he chances into, he burns. The man with little sense of kindness is as cold as pure ice: Whatever encounters him is killed off for sure. The man who is stagnant and clinging is like dead water or rotten wood: His life force is already cut off. With any of these it will be difficult To establish good works or prolong the good life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are dry are fiery and burn when they encounter things; those who are ungrateful are icy and clear and kill when they encounter things; and those who are stagnant and stubborn are like stagnant water and rotten wood, and their vitality is gone. It is difficult to build a career and extend the blessings.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those with a dry nature are blazing with fire and will burn when they encounter objects; those with a ungrateful nature are ice-clear and will kill everything they encounter; those with stagnation and stubbornness are like stagnant water and rotten wood, with no vitality left. It is difficult to build meritorious deeds and only extend blessings.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are fiery in nature blaze with intensity, igniting whatever they encounter; those who lack compassion are cold and deadly, destroying everything in their path; those who are stagnant and stubborn are like dead water and rotting wood, devoid of vitality. None of them can achieve great accomplishments or extend their blessings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 性格干旱的人像火一样汹涌澎湃：无论他碰上什么，都会燃烧起来。缺乏仁慈之心的人冷若冰霜：无论遇到什么，都会一命呜呼。固步自封的人就像死水和朽木：他的生命力已经被切断。凡此种种，都难以建立善行或延长善命。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 性格冷漠的人就像火一样汹涌澎湃：无论遇到什么，都会被烧毁。没有善意的人，冰冷如冰，遇之必杀。停滞执着的人，就像死水或朽木：他的生命力已经被切断了。有了这些，就很难建立善行或延长美好的生活。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 性格干枯的人就像火一样：无论他遇到什么，他都会燃烧。缺乏善意的人如同纯净的冰一样冷漠：碰到他的一定会被杀死。停滞不前且固守不变的人就像死水或腐木：他的生命力已经断绝。与其中任何一类人相处，都很难建立善行或延长美好生活。

text.ori_cn: 福不可邀，养喜神，以为召福之本而已；祸不可避，去杀机，以为远祸之方而已。
text.man_en: Happiness cannot be sought: nourish your own spirit of joy. This alone is the foundation for beckoning happiness. Disaster cannot be avoided: flee from that which encourages brutality. This alone is the way to avoid disaster's reach.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Fortune is not to be invited, but to raise the God of Joy as the basis for calling for fortune; misfortune is not to be avoided, but to go to the killing machine as a way to keep away from misfortune.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Blessings cannot be invited, raising the spirit of joy is the basis for summoning blessings; disasters cannot be avoided, removing murderous intentions is just a way to keep disasters away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Blessings cannot be solicited; cultivate a cheerful spirit, as it is the foundation of attracting fortune. Disasters cannot be avoided; eliminate killing intent, as it is the way to distance oneself from misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 幸福不可求：滋养自己的快乐精神。只有这样，才是召唤幸福的基础。灾难无法避免：逃离那些助长残暴的东西。唯有如此，才能避开灾难的侵袭。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 幸福是无法寻求的：滋养你自己的快乐精神。仅此一点，就是召唤幸福的基础。灾难是无法避免的：逃离那些助长暴行的事物。只有这样才能避免灾难的发生。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 幸福不可追寻：培养你自己的喜乐精神。只有这样才能招来幸福。灾难无法避免：逃离鼓励残暴的事物。只有这样才能避开灾难的接近。

text.ori_cn: 十语九中，未必称奇，一语不中，则愆尤骈集；十谋九成，未必归功，一谋不成，则訾议丛兴。君子所以宁默毋躁，宁拙毋巧。
text.man_en: Of the things we say, nine out of ten hit the mark; Yet we do not necessarily count this as strange. But let one word miss the mark, and people will line up to complain. Of the things we plan, nine out of ten come to pass; Yet we do not necessarily ascribe this to our due. But let one plan go awry, and people will crowd in to revile. For this reason, the gentleman Remains silent rather than makes noise; Shows ineptitude rather than displays a skill.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine out of ten words, may not be called strange, a word does not hit, then the offence of a collection; nine out of ten plans, may not be attributed to the success of a plan, a plan does not work, then a series of criticisms. The gentleman would rather be silent than impatient, and would rather be clumsy than clever.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If nine out of ten words are correct, it may not be a surprise. If one word is not right, it will be embarrassing, especially for Pianji. Ninety percent of the plans may not be credited. If one plan fails, the discussion will be chaotic. A gentleman would rather be silent than impetuous, clumsy than cunning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine out of ten words may be accurate, yet unremarkable; but if one word is off, blame and fault are heaped together. Nine out of ten strategies may succeed, yet not receive credit; but if one strategy fails, criticism arises in abundance. Thus, a gentleman prefers to remain silent rather than rash, and clumsy rather than cunning.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们说的话，十句有九句是对的；但我们并不一定认为这很奇怪。但只要有一句话说错了，人们就会排队抱怨。在我们计划的事情中，十之八九都能实现；但我们并不一定认为这是我们应得的。但是，只要有一个计划出了差错，人们就会蜂拥而至，肆意谩骂。因此，君子保持沉默，而不喧哗；显示无能，而不展示技能。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我们所说的话，十分之九是切中要害的；然而我们并不一定认为这很奇怪。但如果一言不合，人们就会排队抱怨。我们计划的事情，十分之九都会实现；然而，我们并不一定将此归因于我们应得的。但一旦计划出了差错，就会遭到人们的谩骂。因此，君子沉默而不喧哗；表现出无能而不是表现出技能。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们所说的话，十句话中有九句是对的；然而，我们并不觉得这有什么特别。但如果错了一句，人们会排队来抱怨。我们所计划的事情，十件中有九件成功；然而，我们并不因此自以为是。但如果有一件事出问题，人们会蜂拥而至发怒。正因如此，君子宁可保持沉默，而不喧哗；宁可显得笨拙，而不炫耀技巧。

text.ori_cn: 天地之气，暖则生，寒则杀。故性气清冷者，受享亦凉薄。唯和气热心之人，其福亦厚，其泽亦长。
text.man_en: When the breath of Heaven and Earth is warm, there is birth; When it is cold, there is death. Therefore, he whose nature is indifferent Receives blessings that are less than lukewarm. Only the man of friendly spirit and warm heart Will have fortune that is also kind And blessings that are longlived.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The qi of heaven and earth is warm, but cold kills. Therefore, those who are cold in nature are also cold in enjoyment. Only those who are kind and warm-hearted will be blessed and have a long life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Qi of heaven and earth, when warm, produces life, and when cold, it kills. Therefore, those with cold temperament will feel cool and weak. Only those who are kind and enthusiastic will have great blessings and long-term benefits.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The energy of heaven and earth, warmth brings life, coldness brings death. Therefore, those with a cold and detached nature also experience a sparse and indifferent fate. Only those with a warm and kind disposition enjoy abundant blessings and enduring grace.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天地之气，温则生，寒则死。因此，天性冷漠的人得到的福气也是冷冰冰的。只有心地善良的人，福气才会绵长。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天地之气温，则生；天地之气暖，则生；当寒冷时，就会有死亡。因此，性情淡泊的人，所受的福报不及冷淡。唯有心地友善、心地温暖的人，才会拥有同样的福气和长寿的福报。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地之气温暖时，万物诞生；寒冷时，万物凋零。因此，那性情冷淡之人，所得的福泽也如同温水一般。不咸不淡。唯有那心怀善意、热心肠之人，才会获得同样仁慈的命运，长久的福祉。

text.ori_cn: 天理路上甚宽，稍游心，胸中便觉高明广大；人欲路上甚窄，才寄迹，眼前俱是荆棘泥涂。
text.man_en: The road to the Principle of Heaven is extremely abundant. If you divert your mind there for but a little way, You will feel in your breast both vastness and light. The road of human desire is extremely restricted. If you approach it by only a step, Wherever you look will be brambles and mire.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The road of heavenly reason is very wide, a little travelling heart, the chest will feel high and bright; the road of human desires is very narrow, only to send traces, in front of the eyes of all the thorns and mud.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The road of heavenly principles is very wide, and if you wander your mind for a moment, you will feel the wisdom and vastness in your mind; if the road of human desire is very narrow, you will only find traces of it, and your eyes will be filled with thorns and mud.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The path of righteousness is exceedingly wide; by merely setting your heart on it, you will feel enlightened and expansive within. The path of human desires is exceedingly narrow; by merely stepping onto it, you will find nothing but thorns and mire before you.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通往天道的道路极为宽广。只要你稍稍将心思转移到那里，你就会感受到胸中的浩瀚与光明。人类的欲望之路是极其有限的。如果你只走一步，你所看到的将是荆棘和泥潭。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天道之道极其丰富。如果你把你的注意力转移到那里，只要一点点，你就会在你的胸中感到广阔和光明。人的欲望之路是极其受限的。如果你只靠近一步，放眼望去，都是荆棘和泥沼。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通向天理之路极其丰盈。只要稍微转移心思一下，你就会在心胸中感受到广阔与光明。人欲之路极其狭窄。只要接近一步，无论你看向何处，尽是荆棘与泥沼。

text.ori_cn: 一苦一乐相磨链，链极而成福者，其福始久；一疑一信相参勘，勘极而成知者，其知始真。
text.man_en: When you train yourself with both suffering and joy, Ah, what blessings come when this training is taken to the extreme: They are, for the first time, blessings that last. When you think things through with both doubt and faith, The knowledge that comes when this thinking is taken to the extreme Is, for the first time, a knowledge of truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If one suffering and one happiness rubs the chain together, and the chain becomes a blessing at the end, the blessing will be long-lasting; if one doubt and one faith investigate each other, and the investigation becomes a knowledge at the end, the knowledge will be true.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: One pain and one happiness are intertwined, and those who become blessed at the extreme end of the chain will be blessed for a long time; if doubts and beliefs are intertwined, and they become known, their knowledge will be true.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Through the alternation of hardship and joy, one forges a resilient bond; when the bond reaches its zenith, it transforms into enduring happiness. Through the interplay of doubt and belief, one embarks on a journey of discernment; when discernment reaches its peak, it culminates in genuine knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你用痛苦和快乐训练自己的时候，啊，当这种训练达到极致的时候，你会得到怎样的祝福：它们第一次成为持久的祝福。当你带着怀疑和信心去思考问题时，当这种思考达到极致时，所产生的知识第一次成为真理的知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你以苦与乐来训练自己时，啊，当这种训练达到极致时，会带来什么福报：它们第一次是持久的福报。当你带着怀疑和信念思考事物时，当这种思考达到极端时，你所获得的知识，第一次是关于真理的知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你在痛苦和欢乐中磨炼自己时，啊，当这种训练被推向极致时，什么样的福祉会降临：它们是第一次真正持久的福祉。当你在怀疑和信仰中思考时，当这种思考被推向极致时，所获得的知识第一次成为真理的知识。

text.ori_cn: 心不可不虚，虚则义理来居；心不可不实，实则物欲不入。
text.man_en: The mind should always be void, For once void, Justice and Principle may enter and reside. The mind may not be without Truth, For once Truth is there, desire will not enter in.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart must not be false, if it is false, then righteousness will come to dwell; the heart must not be false, if it is true, then material desires will not enter.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart must not be empty, as if it is empty, the principles and principles will come in; the heart must not be empty, and if it is true, material desires will not enter.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The mind must remain open, for openness welcomes righteousness and truth; the mind must also be firm, for firmness keeps material desires at bay.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心灵应该永远是空虚的，因为一旦空虚，正义和原则就会进入并驻留。心灵不能没有真理，因为真理一旦存在，欲望就不会进入。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心应常空，一旦空了，正义与原则就可以进入并居住。头脑不可能没有真理，因为一旦真理存在，欲望就不会进入。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心应常虚空，因为一旦虚空，公正和原则便可进入并存在。心不能没有真理，因为一旦真理在，欲望便无法进入。

text.ori_cn: 地之秽者多生物，水之清者常无鱼。故君子当存含垢纳污之量，不可持好洁独行之操。
text.man_en: Where the earth has been neglected, many things grow. Where the water is clear, there are never any fish. Therefore, the gentleman Should be acquainted to an extent with embracing impurity and accepting stain. He should not hold onto the total chastity of only loving the pure and going his own way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The dirt of the earth is full of living creatures, and the water is always clear without fish. Therefore, a gentleman should keep the amount of dirt, not to hold the good and clean alone.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the land is dirty, there will be many living things; if the water is clear, there will often be no fish. Therefore, a gentleman should keep a certain amount of filth and accept dirt, and should not adhere to the practice of being pure and alone.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The impure earth is rich in life, whereas the clear water often holds no fish. Therefore, a gentleman should maintain the capacity to tolerate impurities and accept flaws, rather than adhering strictly to a self-imposed standard of purity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大地荒芜之处，万物生长。水至清则无鱼。因此，君子应该在一定程度上接受不洁，接受污浊。而不是一味地坚守贞洁，只爱纯洁的人，只走自己的路。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在地球被忽视的地方，许多东西却在生长。水清则无鱼。因此，君子应当懂得包容不洁、接受污点。他不应该固守着只爱纯洁、一意孤行的完全贞洁。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 土地被忽视的地方，许多东西会生长。水清无鱼。因此，君子应在一定程度上接纳污秽和污点。他不应该只追求纯洁和独善其身。

text.ori_cn: 泛驾之马可就驰驱，跃冶之金终归型范。只一优游不振，便终身无个进步。白沙云：“为人多病未足羞，一生无病是吾忧。”真确论也。
text.man_en: The restive horse that has overturned the carriage Can, at last, be made to run properly. The melting metal that leaps out of the mold Can, at last, be returned to the cast. But the man who lives only in peaceful amusement without arousing himself to action Will, until the end of his life, make no progress at all. Paisha said, "There are many ailments involved in becoming a man, But none are sufficient to make him hide his face in shame. I lament only the man who lives his life without any ailment at all. " This is truly a solid argument.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The horse that is driven by a panhandler can be driven, and the gold that is leapfrogged will eventually be modelled. Only a leisurely not vibrant, will be lifelong no progress. White sand cloud: "for people sick not enough to be ashamed, life without disease is my worry." This is true.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The horse that rides everywhere can gallop, and the gold that leaps and metals finally sets an example. As long as you are sluggish, there will be no progress in your life. Bai Shayun: "It's not shameful to be sick, but it's my worry to be disease-free in my life." This is true theory.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A horse that can be harnessed will surely gallop swiftly, and molten metal will eventually take shape. Just idling away and not striving results in no progress for a lifetime. Bai Sha once said, 'Being often ill is nothing to be ashamed of; my concern is a life without illness.’ This is truly a correct statement.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 翻车的马儿终于可以正常奔跑。熔化的金属从模具中跃出，终于可以回到铸模中。但是，一个人如果只是生活在平静的娱乐中，而不去唤醒自己的行动，那么直到生命的尽头，他也不会取得任何进步。白沙说："成为一个人有许多苦难，但没有一种苦难足以让他羞愧难当。我只感叹那些一生没有任何病痛的人。"这确实是一个坚实的论据。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 躁动的马，掀翻了马车，终于可以正常奔跑了。从模具中跳出的熔化金属最终可以返回到铸件中。但是，如果一个人只生活在平静的娱乐中，而不主动采取行动，那么他直到生命的最后一刻都不会取得任何进展。派沙说：“做人有许多毛病，但没有一个足以使他羞愧难当。我只哀叹一生没有毛病的人。”这真是一个坚实的论据。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那匹颠覆车子的暴躁马儿，最终可以被调教得正当跑步。 那跃出模具的熔化金属，最终可以回归铸件。 但只追求宁静娱乐而不激发自己行动的人，直至生命终结，都无法取得任何进步。 伯牙说：“成为一个人，有许多病痛，但没有哪一种足以让他羞愧难当。 我只叹息那些一生没有任何病痛的人。” 这真是一个牢固的论点。

text.ori_cn: 人只一会贪私，便销刚为柔，塞智为昏，变恩为惨，染洁为污，坏了一生人品。故古人以不贪为宝，所以度越一世。
text.man_en: Man, with simply one thought of greed, Will melt away his strength and transform it into weakness, Will obstruct his wisdom and create ignorance, Will change kindness into cruelty, Will stain the pure and produce the tarnished, And so will completely destroy the character of his entire life. Therefore, the ancients Considered the lack of greed to be a gem, And thus did they transcend the everyday world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a person is greedy for selfishness, he or she will turn hardness into softness, wisdom into fainting, grace into misery, and cleanliness into dirt, which will spoil his or her character for the rest of his or her life. Therefore, the ancients took non-covetousness as a treasure, so they were able to get through the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person is greedy for selfishness for a while, he will turn his strength into softness, his wisdom into ignorance, his kindness into misery, his purity into filth, and his character will be ruined throughout his life. Therefore, the ancients regarded non-greed as a treasure, so they lived a better life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a person briefly succumbs to greed, they turn strength into weakness, clarity into confusion, kindness into cruelty, and purity into corruption, ultimately ruining their character for a lifetime. Thus, the ancients considered a lack of greed as a virtue, enabling them to navigate life wisely.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人，只要一念贪婪，就会消融力量，变成软弱；就会阻碍智慧，造成无知；就会把善良变成残忍；就会玷污纯洁，产生污点，从而彻底毁掉一生的品格。因此，古人将无贪视为瑰宝，从而超越了世俗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人只要一贪一念，就会消融自己的力量，变成软弱，阻碍自己的智慧，造就愚昧，变仁慈为残忍，玷污纯洁，产生污秽，从而彻底毁坏人格。他的一生。故古人以无贪为宝，从而超凡俗。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人，只要心存一念贪婪，就会消融他的力量并将其转化为软弱，会阻碍他的智慧并产生愚昧，会将善良变为残忍，会玷污纯洁并生出污浊，从而彻底摧毁他整个生命的品格。因此，古人认为无贪为宝，因而他们超越了尘世。

text.ori_cn: 耳目闻见为外贼，情欲意识为内贼。只是主人翁惺惺不昧，独坐中堂，贼便化为家人矣。
text.man_en: Ears, eyes, seeing, hearing— these are the thieves of the external. Emotion, desire, consciousness of self— these are the thieves of the internal. Only when the Old Man who is master, Bright of mind and unobscured by desire, Sits alone within the temple, Will the thieves be transformed into servants of the House.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Eyes and ears are external thieves, and lust and consciousness are internal thieves. Only the master sympathetic, sitting alone in the middle of the hall, the thief will be turned into a family member carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Hearing and seeing through eyes and ears are external thief, and sexual consciousness is internal thief. It's just that the protagonist is confused and sitting alone in the middle hall, and the thieves become family members.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The senses are external foes, while desires and consciousness are internal foes. But if the master remains alert and discerning, sitting alone in the main hall, these foes will transform into family members.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 耳朵、眼睛、视觉、听觉--这些都是外在的小偷。情感、欲望、自我意识，这些都是内在的盗贼。只有当作为主人的老人，头脑清醒，不为欲望所惑，独自坐在寺庙里时，盗贼才会转变为寺庙的仆人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 耳朵、眼睛、视觉、听觉——这些都是外在的窃贼。情感、欲望、自我意识——这些都是内在的窃贼。唯有老夫为师，心明无欲，独坐殿中，盗贼才转为家仆。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 耳朵、眼睛、看见、听见——这些是外在的盗贼。情感、欲望、自我意识——这些是内在的盗贼。只有当心明目清、无欲无求的老人独自坐在庙宇中时，盗贼才会变成家中的仆人。

text.ori_cn: 图未就之功，不如保已成之业；悔既往之失，不如防将来之非。
text.man_en: Instead of making plans for works that have not yet been completed, You should preserve the projects that have already been achieved. Instead of regretting the mistakes of the past, You should hold in check your crimes of the future.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It would be better to make sure that you have done something than to make sure that you have done it; it would be better to regret your past mistakes than to prevent your future mistakes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to protect what has been accomplished than to seek for unfulfilled achievements; it is better to regret the mistakes of the past than to guard against future mistakes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is better to safeguard the achievements already made than to pursue unattainable plans; it is better to prevent future faults than to lament past mistakes.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与其为尚未完成的工程制定计划，不如保护已经完成的项目。与其为过去的错误后悔，不如控制住未来的罪行。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要为尚未完成的工作制定计划，而应该保留已经完成的项目。与其为过去的错误后悔，不如抑制未来的罪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与其为尚未完成的工作制定计划，不如保护已经完成的项目。与其后悔过去的错误，不如控制未来的罪行。

text.ori_cn: 气象要高旷，而不可疏狂；心思要缜密，而不可琐屑；趣味要冲澹，而不可偏枯；操守要严明，而不可激烈。
text.man_en: Our disposition should be lofty and broad, But not to the point of being distant and abstracted. Our thoughts should be detailed and conscientious, But not to the point of being tedious and nitpicking. Our tastes should be simple and ascetic, But not to the point of eccentricity and desiccation. Our virtue should be strict and clearcut, But not to the point of vehemence or rage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The atmosphere should be high and open, not sparse; the mind should be thoughtful, not trivial; the taste should be tranquil, not parched; the conduct should be strict, not fierce.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The atmosphere should be broad, but not wild; the mind should be careful, but not trivial; the interest should be indifferent, but not dull; the conduct should be strict, but not intense.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One's disposition should be lofty and open, not frivolous and unrestrained; thoughts should be meticulous, not trivial; tastes should be refined and moderate, not biased and extreme; and conduct should be strict and principled, not excessively harsh.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们的性情应该高尚而宽广，但不应该遥远而抽象。我们的思想应该细致认真，但不能乏味和吹毛求疵。我们的趣味应该简单而禁欲，但不应该古怪而枯燥。我们的美德应该是严格而明确的，但不能到了激烈或愤怒的地步。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我们的胸怀应该是崇高、博大的，但又不能达到疏远、抽象的地步。我们的思想应该细致、认真，但不能达到乏味、挑剔的地步。我们的品味应该是简单而禁欲的，但又不能达到古怪和枯燥的地步。我们的德行应该是严明的，但又不至于激烈或愤怒的地步。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们的气质应该是崇高而宽广的，但不要达到疏离和抽象的程度。我们的想法应该是详细而认真，但不要达到繁琐和吹毛求疵的程度。我们的品味应该是简单而苦行的，但不要达到怪癖和干枯的程度。我们的品德应该是严格而清晰的，但不要达到激烈或愤怒的程度。

text.ori_cn: 风来疏竹，风过而竹不留声；雁度寒潭，雁去而潭不留影。故君子事来而心始现，事去而心随空。
text.man_en: The wind soughs through the bamboo, And when it has passed, the bamboo has no sound. The geese fly over the cold clear pool, And when they have gone, the pool retains no image. Therefore, for the gentleman, A thing is manifest when it appears for the first time in his mind; When the thing has ceased, his mind commits itself to the void.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The wind comes to the bamboo, the wind passes and the bamboo does not leave a sound; the geese go to the cold pool, the geese go and the pool does not leave a shadow. Therefore, a gentleman's heart begins to appear when things come to him, and his heart is empty when things go away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The wind comes and thins the bamboos, but the wind passes by but the bamboos leave no sound; the wild geese cross the cold pond, but the wild geese leave but leave no trace on the pond. Therefore, when things come, a gentleman's mind begins to appear; when things go, his mind becomes empty.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The wind passes through the sparse bamboo, leaving no sound; the geese cross the cold pond, leaving no trace. Thus, when events arise, the nobleman's heart reacts; when the events pass, his heart returns to stillness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 风萧萧兮易水寒，壮士一去兮不复还。雁过寒潭，雁去潭无影。因此，对于君子来说，当事物第一次出现在他的心中时，它就显现出来了；当事物消失时，他的心就归于虚无。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 风吹竹，风过竹无声。雁飞过清寒潭，去后潭无影。因此，对于君子来说，事物第一次出现在他的脑海中，就已经是明显的；当事情停止时，他的心就归于虚空。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 风在竹林中低语，当风过去后，竹林中无声。大雁飞过寒冷清澈的池塘，当它们离去，池塘中无影。 所以，对于君子来说， 事情在初现于他心中时显现； 当事情过去，他的心归于虚无。

text.ori_cn: 清能有容，仁能善断；明不伤察，直不过矫。是谓蜜饯不甜，海味不咸，才是懿德。
text.man_en: Being pure and yet tolerant, Being warmhearted and yet resolved, Having insight but not speculating on the faults of others, Being upright but not beyond reform— All of these can be called honeyed biscuits, not too sweet; Or products of the sea, not too salty. Only this is balanced virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Clear can be tolerant, benevolent can be good judgement; Ming does not hurt to detect, straight is not over-corrected. It is only when the candied fruit is not sweet and the sea flavour is not salty that one is virtuous.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The clear can have tolerance, the benevolent can make good judgments; the clear can not hurt the inspection, and the straight can not correct. This means that the candied fruit is not sweet and the seafood is not salty, which is the virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Purity allows tolerance, benevolence allows good judgment; clarity does not harm discernment, and honesty does not go beyond correction. This is like candied fruits that are not overly sweet and sea flavors that are not overly salty, which are exemplary virtues.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既纯洁又宽容，既热心又果断，既有洞察力又不揣测别人的过失，既正直又不妄自菲薄--这些都可以称为蜜糖饼干，不会太甜；也可以称为海产品，不会太咸。只有这样，才是平衡的美德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 纯洁而又宽容，热心而又坚定，有洞察力而不揣测别人的过失，正气而不改过自新——这一切都可以称为蜜饼，不过分甜；或者是海产品，不太咸。只有这样才是平衡的德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 纯而能容，热而能固，明而不察人之非，正而不不可改——这些都可以被称作蜜饼，不太甜；或者海味，不太咸。唯有这样的才是真正的中庸之德。

text.ori_cn: 贫家净扫地，贫女净梳头，景花虽不艳丽，气度自是风雅。士君子一当穷愁寥落，奈何辄自废弛哉。
text.man_en: Even an impoverished house may have its grounds swept clean; Even a penniless woman may comb her hair neatly. Though what is seen may not be enticingly beautiful, The grace within is refined of its own accord. Even the gentleman of rank may for a time encounter suffering and ruin. But will he let himself suffer neglect each time this occurs?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Poor family net sweeping, poor girl net combing hair, although the scene of flowers is not beautiful, the temperament is elegant. Scholar when the poor worry few, how can they be easily abolished.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A poor family sweeps the floor and a poor girl combs her hair. Although the scenery and flowers are not gorgeous, their demeanor is certainly elegant. When a gentleman is poor and lonely, he often abandons himself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Though in a poor household the floors are swept clean, and in poverty the maiden's hair is neatly combed. The flowers, though not flamboyant, possess an inherent elegance. When a gentleman faces destitution and loneliness, why should he let himself fall into neglect?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使是一贫如洗的房子，也会被打扫得干干净净；即使是身无分文的妇女，也会把头发梳得整整齐齐。虽然眼前的景象可能并不诱人，但内心的优雅却会自行锤炼。即使是有地位的绅士，也会有遭遇苦难和毁灭的时候。但他会让自己每次都遭受忽视吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使是破烂的房子，地面也可能被打扫得干干净净；即使是身无分文的女人，也能把头发梳得整整齐齐。外表虽不美丽，但内在的优雅却是自成一体。即使是有品位的君子，也可能有一段时间遭受痛苦和毁灭。但他每次都会让自己受到忽视吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 贫家可扫地洁净；贫妇可理发整齐。虽所见未必迷人——然内在优雅自成。即使显贵的君子也可能暂遭苦难，但他每遇此事会任自己颓废么？

text.ori_cn: 闲中不放过，忙处有受用；静中不落空，动处有受用；暗中不欺隐，明处有受用。
text.man_en: If you do not pass time thoughtlessly when at leisure, It will stand you in good stead when you are busy. If you do not sit there blankly when at peace, It will stand you in good stead when you are active. If you do not deceive others when you are unobserved, It will stand you in good stead when you are clearly seen.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In idleness one does not let go, and in busyness one is useful; in quietness one does not fall short, and in motion one is useful; in darkness one does not deceive and conceal, and in brightness one is useful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't let go when you are idle, you will benefit from being busy; if you don't let go when you are still, you will benefit from being active; if you don't deceive in secret, you will benefit from the light.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not waste time when idle, you'll benefit when busy; do not let go in stillness, you'll benefit in movement; do not deceive in darkness, you'll benefit in light.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你在闲暇时不漫不经心地消磨时间，那么当你忙碌时，它就会帮你打理得井井有条。如果你在平静时不茫然地坐着，它就会在你活跃时让你站稳脚跟。如果你在无人注意时不欺骗他人，那么当你被人清楚地看到时，它将使你处于有利地位。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你在闲暇时不漫不经心地打发时间，那么在你忙碌的时候它会对你大有裨益。如果你不在平静的时候呆呆地坐在那里，那么当你活跃的时候它会对你有好处。如果你在不被察觉的时候不欺骗别人，那么当你被清楚地看到时，它就会对你有利。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你在闲暇时不虚度光阴，在忙碌时就能派上用场。如果你在安静时不呆坐发呆，在活跃时就能派上用场。如果你在无人注意时不欺骗他人，在众目睽睽下就能派上用场。

text.ori_cn: 念头起处，才觉向欲路上去，便挽从理路上来。一起便觉，一觉便转，此是转祸为福，起死回生的关头，切莫轻易放过。
text.man_en: When the mind is aroused, As soon as you become aware that it has taken the road of desire, Force it aside and lead it back to the road of principle. When the mind is aroused, you become aware. When you become aware, you can make changes. This is precisely the time To change disaster into fortune, To raise the dead and bring them back to life. Never let such times pass lightly by.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When one's thoughts arise, one realises that one is on the path of desire, and then one is saved from the path of reason. When you realise, you will be turned around, and this is the moment when you can turn misfortune into blessing and bring back the dead, so don't let it go so easily.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When thoughts arise, they realize that they are heading towards the path of desire, and then they turn towards the path of reason. You will fall asleep as soon as you wake up, and you will change as soon as you wake up. This is the moment when misfortune is turned into blessing, and death is brought back to life. Don't let it go easily.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a thought arises, if you realize it is leading you towards desire, you should pull yourself back to the path of reason. As soon as you become aware of it, you must change course immediately. This is the critical moment where you can turn misfortune into blessing and recover from a dire situation; under no circumstances should you let it slip by.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当心灵被唤醒时，一旦你意识到它走上了欲望之路，就应立即把它逼到一边，引导它回到原则之路。当心灵被唤醒时，你就会觉知。当你意识到时，你就能做出改变。这正是转祸为福、起死回生的时刻。千万不要让这样的时机轻易流逝。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当心被唤醒时，当你意识到它走上了欲望之路时，就将它推开，引导它回到原则之路。当心被唤醒时，你就会变得有觉知。当你意识到时，你就可以做出改变。正是转祸为福，起死回生的时候。千万不要让这样的时光轻易过去。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当心念被激起时，一旦你意识到它已经走上了欲望之路，便要赶快将其排除并引导回到正道上来。当心念被激起时，你会变得清醒。当你清醒时，你就能作出改变。这正是化灾为福、起死回生的时刻，决不能轻易错失这样的时机。

text.ori_cn: 静中念虑澄澈，见心之真体；闲中气象从容，识心之真机；淡中意趣冲夷，得心之真味。观心证道，无如此三者。
text.man_en: When your thoughts are at peace and have become transparent, You see the true form of the mind. When your feelings are at rest and have become tranquil, You understand the true movements of the mind. When your disposition is disinterested and totally calm, You obtain the true flavor of the mind. There is nothing that can rival these three.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In quietness, the thoughts are clear, see the true body of the heart; in leisure, the weather is calm, know the true opportunity of the heart; in lightness, the interest is flushed, get the true taste of the heart. There is no such thing as a mindfulness of the Tao.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In silence, thoughts and considerations are clear, and you can see the true nature of the heart; in leisure, you can be calm and calm, and you can recognize the true intention of the heart; in lightness, your interests and interests are neutralized, and you can get the true taste of the heart. When you observe the mind and realize the Tao, there are no such three things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In stillness, thoughts become clear, revealing the true nature of the mind; in leisure, the demeanor is composed, recognizing the true mechanism of the mind; in simplicity, the taste is serene, experiencing the true flavor of the mind. Observing the mind and attaining the Way, there is nothing like these three aspects.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你的思想平和而透明时，你就能看到心灵的真实形态。当你的情感得到安抚，变得宁静时，你就了解了心灵的真正动向。当你的性情变得无私和完全平静时，你就获得了心灵的真味。没有什么能与这三者匹敌。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的思想平静且变得透明时，你就会看到心的真实形态。当你的感受静止并变得平静时，你就了解心的真实运作。当你的性情无私、完全平静时，你就获得了心的真实味道。没有什么可以与这三者相比。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你的思绪平静且变得透明时，你会看到心灵的真实面貌。当你的情感平复且变得安宁时，你会理解心灵的真实动态。当你的性情淡泊且完全镇定时，你会品味到心灵的真实滋味。没有什么可以与这三者相提并论。

text.ori_cn: 静中静非真静，动处静得来，才是性天之真境；乐才乐非真乐，苦民乐得来，才见心体之真机。
text.man_en: The peace that comes from peaceful surroundings is not true peace. Only in the peace obtained in the midst of activity Is found the true sphere of one's original nature. The pleasure that comes from pleasurable surroundings is not true pleasure. Only with the pleasure obtained in the midst of suffering Can one see the true movements of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not true silence in silence, but silence in motion that is the true state of nature and heaven; it is not true happiness to be happy, and it is not true happiness to see the true opportunity of the mind until the suffering people are happy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Stillness within stillness is not true stillness. Only when one achieves stillness in the midst of movement is the true state of human nature. Only when one enjoys happiness can one see the true nature of the mind and body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Stillness in stillness is not true stillness; attaining stillness in movement is the true realm of the innate nature. Pleasure in pleasure is not true pleasure; finding joy in hardship reveals the true mechanism of the heart.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 安宁的环境带来的安宁不是真正的安宁。只有在活动中获得的平静，才是一个人原始本性的真正领域。从愉悦的环境中获得的快乐不是真正的快乐。只有在痛苦中获得的快乐，才能让人看到心灵的真正运动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从平静的环境中获得的平安并不是真正的平安。只有在活动中获得的平静中，才能找到一个人本性的真正领域。从令人愉快的环境中获得的快乐并不是真正的快乐。只有在痛苦中获得快乐，才能看到内心真实的活动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从宁静的环境中获得的和平不是真正的和平。只有在活动中获得的和平，才是发现人本性真正领域的和平。从令人愉悦的环境中获得的快乐不是真正的快乐。只有在痛苦中获得的快乐，才能看到心灵真正的运动。

text.ori_cn: 舍己毋处其疑，处其疑，即所舍之志多愧矣；施人无责其报，责其报，并所施之心俱非矣。
text.man_en: In sacrificing yourself for others, let there be no doubt in your actions. If doubt resides there, in the very will to make the sacrifice There will be much shame. In rendering services to others, do not seek compensation. If compensation is sought, It will equal the mentality of your sacrifice: Both are at fault.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you give up your own life, you will not be in doubt; if you are in doubt, you will be ashamed of what you have given up; if you give to others, you will not be blamed for their rewards; if you blame them for their rewards, you will be blamed for their rewards; if you give to others, you will be blamed for their rewards; if you give to others, you will be blamed for their rewards.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't worry about self-sacrifice, don't worry about it, that is, you will be ashamed of your ambition; don't blame others for the retribution, blame them for the retribution, and the intention of giving is wrong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When sacrificing oneself, avoid dwelling on doubts; to dwell on doubts would only bring shame to the intent of the sacrifice. When giving to others, expect no return; to expect a return would render the intent of the giving insincere.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在为他人牺牲时，不要对自己的行为有任何怀疑。如果心存怀疑，做出牺牲的意愿本身就会蒙羞。在为他人提供服务时，不要寻求补偿。如果寻求补偿，那就等于你的牺牲精神：两者都有过错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在为他人牺牲自己的过程中，不要对自己的行为产生怀疑。如果怀疑存在于此，那么在做出牺牲的意愿中就会有很多耻辱。为他人提供服务时，不得索取报酬。如果要求赔偿，就等于你牺牲的心态：双方都有错。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为了他人牺牲自己时，你的行动中不应存在任何疑虑。如果心中有疑虑，在你决定作出牺牲的意志中，就会有很多羞愧。在为他人服务时，不要寻求回报。如果寻求回报，那将与牺牲的心态相等：二者都有错。

text.ori_cn: 天薄我以福，吾厚吾德以迓之；天劳我以形，吾逸吾心以补之；天厄我以遇，吾亨吾道以通之。天且奈我何哉。
text.man_en: If Fate is stingy with me and thus affects my fortune, I make my virtue ample, and greet my fortune in this way. If Fate sends toil and thus affects my body, I put my mind at peace and assist myself in this way. If Fate brings obstructions and thus affects my circumstances, I make my Way and pass along with ease. More than this, what can Fate do with me?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sky is thin with my blessings, I am thick with my virtue to receive; the sky is labouring with my form, I am escaping with my heart to make up for it; the sky is in trouble with me, I am prospering with my way to get through it. What can Heaven do to me?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the weather is poor, I use blessings, and when we are generous, I use virtues to improve it; when heaven helps me, I use shape, and when I am free, my heart makes up for it; when heaven is bad, I use encounters, and I promote my way to connect it. What can God do to me?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven limits my fortune, so I fortify my virtue to meet it; Heaven exhausts my body, so I indulge my mind to compensate; Heaven constrains my encounters, so I follow my path to overcome them. What can Heaven do to me?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果命运对我吝啬，从而影响了我的运势，我就使我的德行充实，并以这种方式迎接我的运势。如果命运给我带来劳累，从而影响我的身体，我就使我的心平静下来，用这种方式帮助自己。如果命运带来阻碍，从而影响了我的境遇，我也会让我的道路畅通无阻。除此之外，命运还能把我怎么样呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果命运对我吝啬，从而影响了我的命运，我就充实自己的德行，这样迎接我的命运。如果命运使劳累影响了我的身体，我就安下心来帮助自己。如果命运给我带来障碍，从而影响我的处境，我就会走自己的路，轻松地度过。不仅如此，命运还能对我做什么呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果命运对我吝啬，从而影响我的福分，我就扩大美德，以此迎接福分。如果命运使我劳累，从而影响我的身体，我就使心灵平静，以此帮助自己。如果命运带来阻碍，从而影响我的境遇，我就追随道，以此轻松度过。除此之外，命运还能把我怎么样？

text.ori_cn: 贞士无心徼福，天即就无心处牖其衷；憸人着意避祸，天即就着意中夺其魄。可见天之机权最神，人之智巧何益。
text.man_en: In his heart, a man of principle does not wait in anticipation of good fortune. Heaven attaches itself to this mind of no anticipation, and guides his sincerity. The crafty man maintains his determination to avoid disaster. Heaven abides in the midst of this attachment to determination, and harasses his soul. Thus we can see that The workings of Heaven are the greatest mystery, But the wisdom and art of man are of questionable gain.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chastity of the blessed without intention, the sky is on the heart of the heart of the place lashes his heart; the video man intent on avoiding disaster, the sky is on the intention of the spirit of the capture. It can be seen that heaven's most divine, human wisdom and cleverness is not beneficial.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a virtuous person has no intention of seeking happiness, God will take advantage of him without any intention; if a man is determined to avoid misfortune, God will take advantage of him. It can be seen that the power of heaven is the most powerful, but human wisdom and skill are of no use.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The virtuous man does not seek blessings, yet heaven, aligning with his unintentional actions, enlightens his heart; the wicked man meticulously avoids disasters, yet heaven, seizing upon his intentional efforts, strips him of his spirit. This shows that the machinations of heaven are the most mysterious, rendering human cunning of no avail.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个有原则的人，内心不会等待好运的降临。上天依附于这种不期待的心态，引导着他的真诚。狡猾的人坚持自己的决心，以避免灾难。上天就在这种执着的决心之中，骚扰着他的灵魂。由此我们可以看出，上天的运作是最神秘的，而人的智慧和艺术则是值得怀疑的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在他的心里，有原则的人不会等待好运。天依此无期之心，引导其诚心。狡猾的人保持着避免灾难的决心。天就住在这种执着之中，骚扰他的灵魂。由此可见，天行者是最大的奥秘，而人的智慧和艺术的收获却是值得怀疑的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在他心中，一个有原则的人不会期待幸运的降临。天依附于这种无所期待的心，指引他的诚意。狡猾的人则坚持避免灾祸。天则居于这种决心的中间，骚扰他的灵魂。因此我们可以看出，天的运作是最大的奥秘，但人的智慧和技巧却是有待商榷的收获。

text.ori_cn: 声妓晚岁从良，一世之烟花无碍；贞妇白头失守，半生之消苦俱非。语云：“看人只看后半截。”真名言也。
text.man_en: If the songanddance girl latches onto a good man in her later years, The rouge and flowers of her former life will be no obstacle at all. If the chaste wife lets down her guard after her gray hairs have begun to show, The purity and work of half a life together come to naught. The proverb says, "In scanning the life of a man, look only at the latter half of his years. " This is truly a wise saying.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sound of prostitutes in their late years from the good, a world of fireworks without hindrance; chaste woman white head lost, half a life of pain and suffering are not. Language cloud: "look at people only look at the second half." True words of wisdom.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a prostitute turns good in her later years, the fireworks of her life will be fine; if a chaste woman loses her virginity in her old age, she will suffer no pain in half her life. As the saying goes: "Only look at the second half of a person." This is a true saying.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A courtesan who reforms late in life will not be hindered by her past; a chaste wife who falters in her old age feels that her half-life of suffering was in vain. As the saying goes, 'Judge a person by their latter years.' Truly wise words.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果歌舞女郎在晚年遇到一个好男人，她前世的胭脂水粉和花容月貌将不再是障碍。如果贞洁的妻子在白发苍苍之后放松了警惕，那么半生的纯洁和付出都将化为乌有。谚语说："看一个人的一生，只看他的后半生。"这真是一句至理名言。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 歌舞姑娘晚年若能遇上良人，前世的胭脂花都不是障碍。如果贞洁的妻子在白发开始显现后放松警惕，半生的纯洁和努力就化为泡影。俗话说：“看人的一生，只看后半生。”这真是至理名言。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若年老时歌舞女遇良人，往昔的红尘花事，皆不是阻碍。若贞妻晚年放松警惕，半生的清廉辛苦，尽皆成空。俗语说：“看人一生，只看后半辈。” 此言着实有理。

text.ori_cn: 平民肯种德施惠，便是无位的公相；士夫徒贪权市宠，竟成有爵的乞人。
text.man_en: If a common person ventures to cultivate virtue or perform a good deed, It is just like being a high official, but without rank. If a man of high rank uselessly indulges in his power or markets his position, He becomes, in the end, only a titled beggar.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A commoner who is willing to be kind and generous is a minister without a position; a scholar who is greedy for power and favour is a beggar with a title.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the common people are willing to cultivate virtue and give favors, they will become princes and ministers without a position; if the scholars are greedy for power and market favor, they will become noble beggars.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If commoners cultivate virtue and bestow kindness, they are essentially high-ranking officials without a title; whereas if scholars merely seek power and favor, they ultimately become titled beggars.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个普通人冒险去修德或行善，那就好比做了高官，但没有官阶。如果一个身居高位的人无用地沉溺于他的权力或推销他的地位，那么他最终只会成为一个有头衔的乞丐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 凡人若敢修德，行善，就如大官无爵位。一个地位高的人，如果无益地沉迷于自己的权力、推销自己的地位，那么他最终只是一个有头衔的乞丐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个普通人冒险修养美德或行善，就像是没有职衔的高官。如果一个高官无用地沉溺于自己的权力或兜售他的位置，他最终只会成为一个有头衔的乞丐。

text.ori_cn: 问祖宗之德泽，吾身所享者是，当念其积累之难；问子孙之福祉，吾身所贻者是，要思其倾覆之易。
text.man_en: If you would ask about the blessing left by your ancestors, It is the very life you have received. You should think of the accumulation of troubles they had. If you would ask about the benefits you will leave to your descendants, It is what your life will leave behind. You must think of how easy that is to turn upside down.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I ask about the virtues of my ancestors, which I enjoy, I should remember the difficulty of their accumulation; when I ask about the welfare of my descendants, which I inherited, I should think about the ease of their overthrow.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When I ask about the virtues of my ancestors, what I have enjoyed, I should think about how difficult it is to accumulate them; when I ask about the well-being of my descendants, what I have suffered, I should think about how easy it is to overthrow.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Inquire into the virtues and benevolence of our ancestors, for which I am the beneficiary, and we must remember the difficulty of their accumulation; consider the welfare and prosperity of the descendants, for which I am the bequeather, and we must contemplate the ease with which it can be ruined.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你想问祖先留下的祝福是什么，那就是你所得到的生命。你应该想到他们所积累的烦恼。若问子孙福，当思来世祸。你要想一想，这是多么容易颠倒的事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你问祖先留下的福分，那就是你所得到的生命。你应该想到他们所经历的烦恼的积累。如果问你给子孙后代留下什么好处，那就是你的一生给后人留下什么。你必须想一想，这是多么容易颠倒过来的事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你问到你的祖先留下的福祉，那就是你现在拥有的生命。你应该想到他们积累的烦恼。如果你问到你将留给后代的好处，那就是你生命中留下的东西。你必须想到这有多容易被颠覆。

text.ori_cn: 君子而诈善，无异小人之肆恶；君子而改节，不及小人之自新。
text.man_en: The gentleman who pretends to be good Is no different from the scoundrel who commits evil at will. The gentleman who falls from honor Does not measure up to the villain who improves his intent.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A gentleman who defrauds the good is no different from a villain who wreaks evil; a gentleman who changes his ways is not as good as a villain who renews himself.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman's deception of good deeds is no different from the wickedness of a villain; a gentleman's change of conduct is inferior to the villain's reformation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman feigning goodness is no different from a petty man indulging in evil; a gentleman changing his principles is not as commendable as a petty man mending his ways.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 假装善良的君子与随意作恶的恶棍并无不同。失节的君子比不上变本加厉的小人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子假装善良，无异于无赖作恶。君子失德，不如小人提高志向。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 伪善的君子，与肆意作恶的无赖并无不同。失去荣誉的君子，比不上改过自新的小人。

text.ori_cn: 家人有过，不宜暴怒，不宜轻弃。此事难言，借他事隐讽之；今日不悟，俟来日再警之。如春风解冻，如和气消冰，才是家庭的型范。
text.man_en: When a friend or relative makes a mistake, It is best not to become violently angry, But nor should you neglect it. If the affair is difficult to discuss, Give the subject a different tact; Hide the one, suggest the other. If today he does not understand, Patiently await another time, and admonish him again. Be like the spring winds that thaw the frozen ground; Be like the soft ch'i that melts away the ice. Only with this will you be a model to your family.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a family member has done something, it is not advisable to be angry or to abandon him lightly. This is difficult to say, through other things hidden irony; today do not understand, the next day to warn again. Like the spring breeze thawing, like the harmony of the ice, is the model of the family.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a family member has had a problem, it is not appropriate to get angry or give up lightly. This matter is difficult to explain, so I will use other things to hide it and ridicule it; if I don’t realize it today, I will warn you again in the future. Like the spring breeze thawing the ice, like the harmonious atmosphere melting away the ice, this is the model of a family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When family members make mistakes, it is unsuitable to respond with rage or hastily abandon them. If the matter is difficult to address, use other occasions to discreetly admonish. If they don't realize it today, wait for another opportunity to warn them again. Like the spring breeze melting the frost, like the warmth that dissipates the ice, this is the model of a harmonious family.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当亲友犯错时，最好不要暴怒，但也不能忽视。如果这件事难以启齿，那就换个话题；隐藏一个，暗示另一个。如果今天他不理解，耐心等待下一次，再次告诫他。要像春风融化冰冻的大地，要像柔气融化坚冰。只有这样，你才能成为家人的楷模。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当朋友或亲人犯错时，最好不要勃然大怒，但也不应忽视。如果事情很难讨论，就换一种方式；隐藏一个，建议另一个。今日若不明白，则再忍耐，再劝诫他。如同春风融化冰冻的大地；就像融化冰的软气一样。只有这样，你才能成为家人的榜样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当朋友或亲戚犯错时，最好不要暴怒，但也不应该忽略。如果事情难以讨论，可以换个角度；掩盖一方，暗示另一方。如果今天他不理解，就耐心等待另一个时候，再次劝告他。要像春风一样融化冰冻的土地；要像柔和的气息一样消融冰块。只有这样，你才能成为家庭的榜样。

text.ori_cn: 此心常看得圆满，天下自无缺憾之世界；此心常放得宽平，天下自无险侧之人情。
text.man_en: If your mind always assumes a peaceful state, The world will not seem lacking, If your mind forever frees itself by practicing tolerance and impartiality, The world will show no distortion in human nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If this heart always sees perfection, there will be no world without defects; if this heart always puts in a wide and flat, there will be no dangerous side of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If this mind always sees perfection, there will be no imperfect world in the world; if this mind is always relaxed and peaceful, there will be no dangerous human feelings in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the heart always sees everything as perfect, the world naturally becomes a place without regrets; if the heart always remains broad and even, human relationships in the world naturally become free of danger and deceit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你的心灵永远处于平和的状态，世界就不会显得匮乏；如果你的心灵永远以宽容和公正的态度释放自己，世界就不会显示出人性的扭曲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你的心始终处于一种平静的状态，那么世界就不会缺乏；如果你的心永远以宽容和公正的方式自由自在，那么世界就不会出现人性的扭曲。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你的心灵总是保持平静的状态，世界就不会显得欠缺；如果你的心灵永远通过练习宽容和公正而得到解脱，世界将不会在人性上表现出扭曲。

text.ori_cn: 澹泊之士，必为浓艳者所疑；检饰之人，多为放肆者所忌。君子处此，固不可少变其操履，亦不可露其锋芒。
text.man_en: The man who takes things lightly Will necessarily be doubted by those of a more obstinate disposition. A man both strict and severe Will many times be loathed by those more selfindulgent. The gentleman places himself in these situations And should neither change from his former integrity Nor be too revealing of his own skills.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A man who is tranquil will be suspected by those who are colourful; a man who is decorative will be feared by those who are wanton. A gentleman in this situation should not change his behaviour or show his sharpness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are indifferent will be suspected by those who are showy; those who are scrupulous will be jealous of those who are unbridled. When a gentleman is here, he must not change his behavior or reveal his sharp edge.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are unassuming are often doubted by the flamboyant; those who are modest are frequently envied by the reckless. A gentleman in such situations should neither easily change his conduct nor openly display his sharpness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 对事情掉以轻心的人，必然会受到性格更顽固的人的怀疑。一个既严格又严厉的人，很多时候会被那些更放纵自己的人所厌恶。君子置身其中，既不能一改往日的正直，也不能过于暴露自己的能力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对待事情轻率的人，必然会受到性格比较固执的人的怀疑。一个既严厉又严厉的人，很多时候会被那些更加自我放纵的人所厌恶。君子置身于这样的境地，既不应该改变以前的诚信，也不应该过于暴露自己的技巧。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个做人轻浮的人，必定会被那些顽固之人所怀疑。一个严厉苛刻的人，往往会被那些放纵自我的人所厌恶。君子置身于这些情境中，应当既不改变他原有的正直，也不过于暴露自己的才能。

text.ori_cn: 居逆境中，周身皆针砭药石，砥节励行而不觉；处顺境内，满前尽兵刃戈矛，销膏糜骨而不知。
text.man_en: In the midst of reverses, All around you are acupuncture needles and medicine To polish your integrity or burnish your behavior. Yet, you remain unaware of these. Circumscribed by favorable events, Arrayed in front of you are battle swords, halberds, and spears To melt away the fat and whittle away your bones. Yet, of these, too, you remain unaware.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Living in adversity, all around the body are acupuncture and medicinal stones, and do not realise it; in the smooth territory, full of blades and spears, and do not know it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When living in an adverse situation, the whole body is covered with needles and stones, and the drill is carried out without realizing it; when in a favorable situation, the whole body is full of weapons and spears, and the bones are burned with paste without realizing it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In adversity, one is surrounded by needling medications and corrective measures, yet remains unaware while strengthening integrity and conduct; in prosperity, one is faced with an array of swords and spears, yet wastes away fat and bone without realizing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在逆境中，你的周围都是针灸和药物，来打磨你的正直或锤炼你的行为。然而，你却浑然不觉。在顺境中，摆在你面前的是战刀、方天画戟和长矛，用来消脂蚀骨。然而，你对这些也一无所知。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 逆境中，你的身边都是针药，磨砺你的气节，磨砺你的行为。然而，你仍然不知道这些。顺势而为，剑戟枪列于前，融脂削骨。然而，对于这些，你仍然没有意识到。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在困境中，周围都是用来磨砺品德或改善行为的针灸针和药物。而你却对此毫无察觉。在顺境中，眼前是一片用于消除脂肪、削减骨头的战剑、戟和长矛。对此，你也毫无察觉。

text.ori_cn: 生长富贵丛中的，嗜欲如猛火，权势如烈焰。若不带些清冷气味，其火焰若不焚人，必将自烁矣。
text.man_en: A person brought up closely surrounded by wealth and rank Will have appetites like raging fires And wield power like violent flames. If he cannot become cool and clear, If his flames do not actually burn someone else, They will surely scorch the man himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Growing rich in the bush, lust like fire, power like a flame. If you do not bring some cold odour, its flame if not burning people, will be flickering.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who grow among riches and honors have lusts like fierce fire and power like blazing flames. If it does not bring some cool smell, its flame will surely flicker if it does not burn people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Raised amidst wealth and luxury, desires burn like fierce flames, and power burns like a raging inferno. Without a touch of cool austerity, such flames, if they do not consume others, will surely consume oneself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个被财富和地位紧紧包围的人，欲望会像熊熊烈火，权力会像猛烈的火焰。如果他不能变得冷静和清醒，如果他的火焰不能真正烧到别人，那就一定会烧焦他自己。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个人在财富和地位的包围下长大，他的胃口如烈火，权力如烈焰。如果他不能变得冷静和清醒，如果他的火焰没有真正烧伤别人，也一定会烧伤他自己。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个在财富和地位的包围中长大的人，会有像烈火般的欲望，并像暴烈的火焰一样行使权力。如果他不能冷静清明，如果他的火焰不真正烧到别人，它们必定会灼伤他自己。

text.ori_cn: 人心一真，便霜可飞，城可摧，金石可贯。若伪妄之人，行骸徒具，真己已亡，对人则面目可憎，独居则形影自愧。
text.man_en: When the human heart has sincerity, It can drive away the frost, Can cause battlements to fall, And penetrate metal and stone. But if a man lives with deception, Though his body may be replete in its vanity, The true master, his soul, will have perished. When in the company of men, his countenance will be reviled; When by himself, his own form and shadow will be Embarrassments to themselves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When a person's heart is true, frost can fly, cities can be destroyed, and gold and stone can be penetrated. If a person is false and delusional, he has nothing to do with the skeleton, but his true self is gone, and his face is hateful to others, and he is ashamed of himself when he lives alone.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person's heart is true, frost can fly, a city can be destroyed, and metal and stone can penetrate it. If a hypocritical person walks like a skeleton, his true self is dead, his face will be hateful to others, and he will be ashamed of himself if he lives alone.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When one's heart is true, frost can be defied, cities can be conquered, and even metal and stone can be penetrated. However, a person who is false and deceitful is merely an empty shell; their true self has already perished. Such a person is repulsive in the eyes of others and feels ashamed of their own shadow when alone.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人心诚则灵，它能驱走冰霜，能使城墙倒塌，能穿透金石。但是，如果一个人生活在欺骗之中，尽管他的肉体可以满足其虚荣，但真正的主人，他的灵魂，却将消亡。当他与人为伍时，他的容貌会遭到谩骂；当他独自一人时，他的形体和影子会成为自己的耻辱。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人心有诚，可以驱寒霜，可以使城垛倒，可以穿透金石。但如果一个人生活在欺骗之中，尽管他的身体可能充满虚荣，但真正的主人，他的灵魂，就会灭亡。与人交往时，他的面容会受到辱骂；当自己一个人的时候，自己的形影都会让自己难堪。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当人心怀有真诚时，它能驱散寒霜，能让城墙倒塌，能穿透金石。若人心怀欺骗，尽管其肉体充满虚荣，真正的主人——他的灵魂将已消亡。在人群之中，他的面容将被憎恶；独处时，他的影子与自身都会感到羞愧。

text.ori_cn: 文章做到极处，无有他奇，只是恰好；人品做到极处，无有他异，只是本然。
text.man_en: When literature is taken to its highest level, There is nothing particularly extraordinary about it: It is simply appropriate. When human character is developed to its fullest, There is nothing particularly wonderful about it: It is simply natural.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Article to the extreme, there is no other strange, just just right; character to the extreme, there is no other different, just natural.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the article is done to the best, there is nothing special about it, it is just right; when the character is done to the best, there is nothing out of the ordinary, it is just the way it is.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Writing at its best has nothing extraordinarily peculiar—it is simply apt; character at its best has nothing remarkably different—it is simply natural.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当文学达到最高境界时，它并没有什么特别之处：它只是恰到好处。当人类的品格得到最充分的发展时，它并没有什么特别奇妙的地方：这只是自然而然的事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当文学达到最高水平时，它并没有什么特别非凡的地方：它只是合适的。当人的性格得到充分发展时，没有什么特别奇妙的：它就是自然而然的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当文学达到最高境界时，并没有什么特别非凡的地方：它只是恰到好处而已。当人生品格发展到极致时，并没有什么特别神奇的地方：它只是自然而然。

text.ori_cn: 以幻迹言，无论功名富贵，即肢体亦属委形；以真境言，无论父母兄弟，即万物皆吾一体。人能看得破，认得真，才可以任天下之负担，亦可脱世间之缰锁。
text.man_en: If we speak of the world of illusion, Then merit, fame, riches, and status, Not to mention our very limbs and bodies, are all attached to the form entrusted to us. If we speak of the world of truth, Then father, mother, brothers, and sisters, Not to mention the rest of creation, are all of one body with us. If a man is able to see through these things And recognize the truth, Only then will he be capable of taking responsibility for the world's encumbrances, Only then will he be capable of stripping off society's chains.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In terms of illusion, no matter how rich or famous one is, one's limbs are also in the form of commissions; in terms of the realm of truth, no matter what one's parents or brothers are, everything is one with me. Only when a person can see through and recognise the truth can he be free from the burdens of the world, and free from the reins of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In terms of fantasy, no matter fame, wealth or honor, even the limbs are still in shape; in terms of reality, no matter parents or brothers, all things are one with me. Only when people can see through and recognize the truth can they bear the burden of the world and escape the shackles of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From the perspective of illusions, regardless of fame and wealth, even the body is just a shell; from the perspective of true reality, regardless of parents and siblings, everything in the world is part of oneself. If one can see through and recognize this truth, only then can one shoulder the burdens of the world and also free oneself from the fetters of earthly existence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果我们谈论的是虚幻的世界，那么功名利禄、地位高低，更不用说我们的肢体和身体，都依附于托付给我们的形式。如果我们说的是真实的世界，那么父亲、母亲、兄弟姐妹，更不用说造物的其他部分，都与我们同体。如果一个人能够看透这一切，认清真相，那么他才有能力为这个世界的累赘承担责任，才有能力挣脱社会的枷锁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若说如幻世界，则功德、名利、地位，乃至我们的肢体、身体，皆依附于所托之相。如果我们说到真理的世界，那么父亲、母亲、兄弟姐妹，更不用说其余的受造物，都与我们同为一体。一个人如果能够看清这些，认清真相，才有能力承担起世间的负担，才有能力挣脱社会的枷锁。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果我们谈论虚幻的世界，那么功德、名声、财富和地位， 更不用说我们的四肢和身体，都是依附于委托给我们的形式。如果我们谈论真实的世界，那么父亲、母亲、兄弟和姐妹， 更不用说其余的创造，都是与我们同体的。如果一个人能够看透这些事物并认清真理，只有这样他才能够承担世界的负担，只有这样他才能够摆脱社会的枷锁。

text.ori_cn: 爽口之味，皆烂肠腐骨之药，五分便无殃；快心之事，悉败身丧德之媒，五分便无悔。
text.man_en: Those things pleasant to the taste Are all poisons; 54they inflame the intestines and rot the bones. If you will halve your portions, you should find no divine reproach. Those things pleasurable to the mind Are all gobetweens; they break down abilities and eradicate virtue. If you will halve your portions, you should be without regret
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The flavours that are pleasurable to the palate are all medicines that rot the intestines and bones, and there will be no harm if they are five points; the things that are pleasurable to the heart are all mediums that destroy the body and the morals, and there will be no remorse if they are five points.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The refreshing taste is a medicine that rots the intestines and bones. If you take five points, you will have no trouble; if you take pleasure in things, they will be the matchmaker who ruins your body and morality. If you take five points, you will have no regrets.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The delicacies we savor are all but poisons that can harm our insides and bones; enjoying them in moderation will spare you the repercussions. The pleasures we indulge in are all conduits of ruin and moral decay; savoring them moderately will leave you without regret.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些美味的东西都是毒药；54它们使肠道发炎，使骨头腐烂。如果你能把食物减半，就不会受到神的责备。那些愉悦心灵的东西都是绊脚石，它们破坏能力，铲除美德。如果你愿意减半，你就不会后悔
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些美味的东西，都是毒药； 54、他们使肠子发炎，使骨头腐烂。如果你将自己的份量减半，你就不会受到神圣的责备。那些令人心愉悦的事物，都是媒介；他们破坏能力，消灭美德。如果你将份量减半，你应该不会后悔
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些味美之物，皆是毒药；它们灼烧肠胃，腐蚀骨头。若你将你的食量减半，你便不会遭受神的责难。那些心灵之乐，皆是中介；它们削弱能力，消灭美德。若你将你的享乐减半，你便不会遗憾。

text.ori_cn: 不责人小过，不发人阴私，不念人旧恶。三者可以养德，亦可以远害。
text.man_en: Do not attack men's smaller mistakes. Do not expose men's private affairs. Do not think of men's former crimes. With these three, You can nourish your virtue and keep harm at a distance.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Do not blame people for small faults, do not send people to the dark side, do not remember people's old evils. The three can foster virtue, but they can also keep harm away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't blame others for their minor transgressions, don't reveal their secrets, and don't remember their past evil deeds. The three of them can cultivate virtue, and they can also prevent harm.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not blame others for minor faults, do not divulge others' secrets, do not dwell on others' past misdeeds. These three principles can cultivate virtue and also keep harm at bay.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不要攻击男人的小错误。不要揭发他人的私事。勿念人之旧恶。有了这三点，你就能滋养美德，远离伤害。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要攻击男人的小错误。不要暴露男人的私事。不要想起男人以前的罪行。有了这三者，就能养德，远离伤害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不要攻击别人的小错。不要揭露别人的隐私。不要记住别人的过去恶行。具备这三点，你可以培养你的德行，远离伤害。

text.ori_cn: 士君子持身不可轻，轻则物能挠我，而无悠闲镇定之趣；用意不可重，重则我为物泥，而无潇洒活泼之机。
text.man_en: The gentleman of rank should not take his conduct lightly. Taking it lightly, he will be easily bent by the world around him, And will never have the likelihood of leisure or peace. He should not take his mind's workings so solemnly. For taking them seriously, the world will stick to him like mud, And his actions will be neither lively nor refined.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A gentleman should not be light, if he is light, then things can tickle me, and there is no interest in leisure and calmness; he should not be heavy, if he is heavy, then I am the mud, and there is no opportunity to be lively and elegant.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman should not take his body lightly. If it is light, things will scratch me, and there will be no leisure and calmness;
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman should not take himself lightly, for if he does, external matters can perturb him, depriving him of calmness and composure; his intentions should not be excessively heavy, for if they are, he will become bogged down by them, lacking the grace and vivacity of free-spiritedness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有地位的绅士不应轻视自己的行为。如果掉以轻心，他就很容易被周围的世界所左右，永远不可能有闲暇或安宁。他不应该如此严肃地对待自己的思想工作。因为认真对待，世界就会像泥巴一样粘在他身上，他的行为就会既不活泼也不高雅。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子不应该轻视自己的行为。如果掉以轻心，他就会很容易被周围的世界所弯曲，永远不会有闲暇和安宁的可能。他不应该如此严肃地对待自己的思想运作。如果认真对待，世界就会像泥土一样粘在他身上，他的行为就会不活泼也不精致。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有身份的君子不应该轻视他的行为。轻视了，他就会很容易被周围的世界所改变，永远不会有悠闲或和平的可能。他不应该如此严肃地对待自己的思想运作。因为认真对待它们，世界会像泥巴一样粘在他身上，他的行为将既不活跃也不精致。

text.ori_cn: 天地有万古，此身不再得；人生只百年，此日最易过。幸生其间者，不可不知有生之乐，亦不可不怀虚生之忧。
text.man_en: Heaven and Earth exist for ten thousand ages, But this body you will not receive again. Man's life spans no more than a hundred years, But the days pass with the greatest of ease. You who have had the good fortune to be born Should not be unknowing of the joy of existence, Nor yet free in your breast of the sorrow of life's vanity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Heaven and earth are ancient, but this body is no longer available; life is only a hundred years long, and this day is the easiest to pass. Those who are fortunate enough to be born in this world should not be unaware of the joy of life, nor should they be free from the sorrow of a false life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heaven and earth last for eternity, and this body will never be found again; life only lasts for a hundred years, and this day is the easiest to pass. Those who are fortunate enough to be born in this period must not know the joy of life, nor should they not cherish the worries of living in vain.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The heavens and the earth last for eternity, but this body will not last forever; a human life spans only a hundred years, and this day is the easiest to let slip. Those fortunate enough to live in this world should not ignore the joys of life, nor should they fail to contemplate the worries of a fleeting existence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天地存万世，此身不复生。人的一生不过百年，但日子却过得轻松惬意。有幸生而为人，不应不知生存之乐，也不应无人生虚无之悲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天地存在万世，而此身不复得。人的寿命不过百岁，但日子过得却是最安逸的。你有幸出生，不应该不知道存在的快乐，也不应该在你的胸中摆脱生命虚荣的悲伤。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地长久存在，但此身你将不会再次得到。人的寿命不超过百年，但日子却轻巧地流逝。你有幸来到这世上，不应对生之喜悦无知，也不应胸中没有人生虚无的忧伤。

text.ori_cn: 怨因德彰，故使人德我，不若德怨之两忘；仇因恩立，故使人知恩，不若恩仇之俱泯。
text.man_en: When favors exist, hostility completes the pattern. Thus, rather than make others feel that you have bestowed favors, You should forget both favor and hostility. When mercy exists, enmity is aroused. Thus, rather than make others feel that you have been merciful, You should annihilate both mercy and enmity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The grudge is manifested by virtue, so that people will be virtuous, not like the two forgetfulness of virtue and grudge; the hatred is established by grace, so that people will be aware of grace, not like the obliteration of both grace and hatred.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Resentment is caused by virtue, so it makes people appreciate me, which is not as good as forgetting both virtue and resentment; hatred is caused by kindness, so it makes people realize kindness, which is not as good as forgetting both kindness and hatred.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Resentment is emphasized by virtue; thus, asking people to remember our virtue is not as good as forgetting both virtue and resentment. Enmity arises from gratitude; thus, asking people to acknowledge gratitude is not as good as letting both gratitude and enmity vanish.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当恩惠存在时，敌意也就形成了。因此，与其让别人觉得你施以恩惠，不如忘掉恩惠和敌意。当仁慈存在时，敌意就会被激发。因此，与其让别人觉得你很仁慈，不如同时消灭仁慈和敌意。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当存在恩惠时，敌意就会使整个模式变得完整。所以，与其让别人觉得你施恩，不如忘恩负义。当慈悲存在时，敌意就会产生。所以，与其让别人觉得你有慈悲，不如把慈悲和仇恨都消灭掉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有了恩惠，才有了仇恨。因此，与其让别人觉得你施恩于他们，你应该忘记恩惠与仇恨。有了慈悲，便激起敌意。因此，与其让别人觉得你慈悲于他们，你应该消除慈悲与敌意。

text.ori_cn: 老来疾病，都是壮时招的；衰后罪孽，都是盛时作的。故持盈履满，君子尤兢兢焉。
text.man_en: The diseases of old age Are all incurred at the time of our youth. The adversities that overtake us as we start to decline Were all created at the time of our prosperity. Therefore, the gentleman is apprehensive When handling an overflow of wealth Or treading the road of the replete.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Diseases in old age are invoked in the prime of life, and sins in old age are committed in the prime of life. Therefore, a gentleman should be especially cautious when holding a surplus and walking on a full shoelace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Diseases that come with old age are all caused when one was strong; sins that come with aging are all caused when one is strong. Therefore, a gentleman is particularly cautious when his shoes are full.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Old age ailments are all invited by youthful vigor; sins in decline are all committed in times of strength. Therefore, the wise remain ever cautious when at their peak.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老年疾病都是在我们年轻时产生的。我们开始衰落时所遭遇的逆境，都是在我们富裕的时候造成的。因此，君子在处理泛滥的财富或踏上富足之路时会惴惴不安。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 晚年的疾病都是在我们年轻时发生的。当我们开始衰落时所遇到的逆境都是在我们繁荣时期造成的。因此，君子在富贵之时，或在富足之道上，是忧心忡忡的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老年的疾病皆是在年轻时引起的。人生衰退时所遇到的困境皆是繁荣时造成的。因此，君子对处理过多的财富或走在富足道路上时，都会心存警惕。

text.ori_cn: 市私恩，不如扶公议；结新知，不如敦旧好；立荣名，不如种隐德；尚奇节，不如谨庸行。
text.man_en: Rather than marketing personal favors, contribute to public opinion. Rather than making bonds with new acquaintances, be cordial with old friends. Rather than establishing a shining reputation, sow secret acts of virtue. Rather than admiring the extraordinarily virtuous, respect ordinary behavior.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to support public opinion than to pay for private favours; it is better to make new acquaintances than to honour old ones; it is better to establish a glorious name than to cultivate hidden virtues; it is better to honour the most extraordinary than to behave in a modest manner.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to express private favors than to support public affairs; to gain new knowledge is not as good as to honor the old; to establish an honorable reputation is not as good as cultivating hidden virtues; to respect the eccentric and moral integrity is not as good as to be prudent and mediocre.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Assisting private interests is not as good as supporting public affairs; forming new friendships is not as good as maintaining old ones; establishing a notable reputation is not as good as cultivating hidden virtues; pursuing extraordinary deeds is not as good as adhering to ordinary yet proper conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与其推销个人恩惠，不如促进公众舆论。与其结交新朋友，不如亲切对待老朋友。与其建立光辉的名声，不如播撒秘密的美德。与其仰慕超凡的美德，不如尊重平凡的行为。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与其推销个人利益，不如为公众舆论做出贡献。与其与新认识的人建立联系，不如与老朋友保持友好。与其建立光辉的声誉，不如播种秘密的美德行为。与其钦佩非凡的美德，不如尊重普通的行为。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与其推销个人恩惠，不如为公众意见做贡献。与其结交新朋友，不如对老朋友和气。与其树立光辉的声誉，不如播种无名的善行。与其仰慕非凡的美德，不如尊重普通的行为。

text.ori_cn: 公道正论，不可犯手，一犯，则贻羞万世；权门私窦，不可着脚，一著，则点汗终身。
text.man_en: Correct and impartial views— you should not set your hand to violate these. Once violated, your shame will remain ten thousand generations. Places of authority, gatherings for profit— you should not set a foot inside. With a single step inside, your whole life will be blemished.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Justice and righteousness are not to be committed, and if one does, one will be disgraced for the rest of one's life; power and private sinuses are not to be footed, and if one does, one will be sweating for the rest of one's life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When it comes to fairness and justice, don't make mistakes. If you make a mistake, you will be embarrassed forever; if you are a powerful person, you can't make mistakes. If you make a mistake, you will be sweating for the rest of your life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Fair and just remarks should not be tampered with; any tampering will bring shame for generations. Private channels of powerful families should not be entered; any entry will bring enduring regret.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正确和公正的观点--你不应该去触犯它们。一旦违背，你的耻辱将留存万代。权力的场所、利益的集会--你都不应该涉足。只要踏入一步，你的一生都将蒙上污点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 正确、公正的观点——你不应该动手去违背这些观点。一旦触犯，将留下万代耻辱。权力场所、营利集会——你不应该踏入其中。只要踏入其中一步，你的一生就会受到玷污。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正确和公正的观点——你不应该去违反。一旦违反，你的耻辱将会存在于万世之中。拥有权力的地方，追逐利益的集会——你不应该踏足其中。一步踏入，你的一生都会沾上污点。

text.ori_cn: 曲意而使人喜，不若直躬而使人忌；无善而致人誉，不若无恶而致人毁。
text.man_en: Rather than distorting your own beliefs to make others happy, Make yourself correct and make others mad. Rather than rendering no good and receiving others' praise, Commit no evil and obtain their slander.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to make people happy by curving one's mind than to make them jealous by straightening one's bow; it is better to make people honour one's goodness than to make them destroy one's evilness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to bend the meaning and make people happy than to make people jealous when it is straight; to make people praise it if it is not good, than to ruin it if it is not evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Catering to please others is not as good as being straightforward, even if it arouses resentment; earning praise without merit is not as good as avoiding condemnation without fault.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与其扭曲自己的信念让别人高兴，不如让自己正确让别人疯狂。与其不做善事而得到别人的赞美，不如不做恶事而得到别人的诽谤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与其扭曲自己的信念来让别人快乐，不如让自己正确，让别人生气。与其不行善而受人称赞，不如不作恶而受人诽谤。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与其歪曲自己的信仰让别人高兴，不如让自己正确，让别人生气。与其毫无益处而获得别人的称赞，不如不作恶而接受他们的诽谤。

text.ori_cn: 处父兄骨肉之变，宜从容，不宜激烈；遇朋友交游之失，宜剀切，不宜优游。
text.man_en: When disaster has come to a father, brother, or other blood relative, Compose yourself properly, and do not become rattled. When you encounter the faults of a friend or associate, Act appropriately and do not hesitate or delay.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When dealing with changes in one's father, brother, or flesh and blood, it is better to be calm than to be intense; when encountering the failures of one's friends and friends, it is better to be careful than to be leisurely.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When it comes to changes in the relationship between father and brother, it is better to take it easy and not to be violent; when it comes to the loss of friends, it is better to cut it off and not to travel leisurely.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the face of family and kinship conflicts, one should remain composed rather than react violently; when dealing with misunderstandings among friends, one should be sincere and straightforward, rather than evasive.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当父亲、兄弟或其他血亲遭遇灾难时，要保持冷静，不要惊慌失措。当你遇到朋友或同事的过失时，要采取适当的行动，不要犹豫或拖延。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当父亲、兄弟或其他血亲遭遇灾难时，要保持镇定，不要惊慌失措。当你遇到朋友或同事的过失时，要采取适当的行动，不要犹豫或拖延。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当灾难降临到父亲、兄弟或其他血亲身上时，要稳重镇定，不要慌乱。当遇到朋友或同事的错误时，要适当处理，不要犹豫或拖延。

text.ori_cn: 小处不渗漏，暗处不欺隐，末路不怠荒，才是个真正英雄。
text.man_en: Do not be careless with small leaks, Do not deceive in the dark, Do not become lazy and neglectful at the end of the road. Only with these three will you become exalted.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A true hero is one who does not ooze in small places, who does not deceive and hide in dark places, and who does not slacken and desert at the end of the road.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A true hero is one who does not leak in small places, does not deceive others in the dark, and does not neglect the end of the road.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A true hero is one who does not overlook small details, does not deceive in the dark, and does not falter at the end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 勿以善小而不为，勿以恶小而为之，勿以善小而不为。只有做到这三点，你才能变得高尚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 勿因小漏而大意，勿在黑暗中欺骗，勿在路尽头变得懒惰和疏忽。只有具备这三者，你才能变得崇高。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不要轻视小漏，不要在暗中欺骗，不要在路终点变得懒惰怠慢。唯有做到这三点，你才能被推崇。

text.ori_cn: 千金难结一时之欢，一饭竟致终身之感。盖爱重反为仇，薄极反成喜也。
text.man_en: Even with a thousand in cash it is difficult to tie down more than a moment of happiness. Surprisingly, even a single meal will render a person grateful for the rest of his life. For ultimately, when love is too ponderous, it creates its opposite, aversion. But when light, love reverses again, and engenders joy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It's hard to make love for a moment with a thousand pieces of gold, but a meal can lead to a lifelong feeling. Love is a great enemy, and love is a joy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It costs a lot of money to create a temporary happiness, but one meal can lead to a lifelong feeling. A heavy love can turn into hatred, a thin love can turn into happiness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A great sum cannot buy a moment's joy, but a single meal can invoke lifelong gratitude. For profound love can turn into enmity, while extreme indifference may lead to delight.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使有一千元现金，也难以拴住片刻的幸福。令人惊讶的是，即使是一顿饭，也会让一个人感激终生。因为归根结底，当爱过于深沉时，就会产生它的反面--厌恶。但当爱轻盈时，它又会反转，产生快乐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使有一千块现金，也很难只留下片刻的幸福。令人惊讶的是，即使是一顿饭也会让一个人终生感激。因为最终，当爱过于沉重时，就会产生相反的厌恶。但当光亮时，爱又会逆转，并产生欢乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即使有一千现金也很难固定片刻的幸福。令人惊讶的是，即使一顿饭也能让人感激一生。因为最终，当爱过于沉重时，它会产生它的对立面，厌恶。但当爱变得轻盈时，它又反过来，产生了喜悦。

text.ori_cn: 藏巧于拙，用晦而明，寓清之浊，以屈为伸，真涉世之一壶，藏身之三窟也。
text.man_en: Hide your skill under a show of inability:62 Display dimwittedness, but continue to be bright; 63 Let your purity reside within the muddy; By means of bending, let yourself extend. These are the tubs in which you may truly float through the world; 65 These are the three caves in which you may take cover.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Hiding cleverness in clumsiness, using obscurity and clarity, the turbidity of the clear, in order to bend for stretching, really involved in the world of a pot, hiding the body of the three grottoes also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It hides skill in clumsiness, uses darkness to make it clear, combines the clear and turbid, uses bending to stretch. It is a pot that truly touches the world, and it is also a three-hole hiding place.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Conceal skill beneath clumsiness, use obscurity to reveal clarity, embed purity within murkiness, and adopt humility to achieve greatness. This is truly a gourd for navigating the world and a sanctuary for self-preservation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 63 让你的纯洁寓于泥泞之中；通过弯曲，让你的身躯得以伸展。这是你真正可以漂浮于世间的浴盆；65 这是你可以藏身的三个洞穴。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 将你的技能隐藏在无能之下：62 表现出愚笨，但仍保持聪明； 63、让你的纯洁驻留在泥泞中；通过弯曲，让自己伸展。在这些浴缸中，您可以真正漂浮在世界上； 65 这是您可以躲藏的三个洞穴。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 示弱以藏才：示愚以明；让纯净在浑浊之中存在；通过屈服，得以伸展。这是你可以真正漂浮世界的盆子；这是你可以隐藏的三个洞穴。

text.ori_cn: 衰飒的景象，就在盛满中；发生的机缄，即在零落内。故君子居安，宜操一心以虑患；处变，当坚百忍以图成。
text.man_en: An omen of the winds of decline exists in the center of plentitude. The mechanisms of germination exist in the midst of ruin. Therefore, the gentleman knows, When living at ease, he must secure his right mind And contemplate affliction; In times of calamity, he must harden his fortitude one hundredfold And chart the route to success.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the gentleman living in peace, it is appropriate to manipulate a heart to worry about the problem; in change, when the firm hundred patience to try to become.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The rustling scene is in the fullness; the silence of the occurrence is in the falling. Therefore, when a gentleman lives in peace, he should concentrate on worrying about danger; when facing changes, he should be patient and patient in order to succeed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The scene of decline is found within prosperity; the mechanisms of change are seen in dissolution. Therefore, a gentleman, when at peace, should single-mindedly consider the possibility of trouble; in times of upheaval, he should steadfastly exercise great patience to achieve success.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 丰饶的中心蕴藏着衰落之风的预兆。萌芽的机制存在于毁灭之中。故君子知，居安思危，危难之时，百倍坚韧，方能成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 衰落之风的预兆存在于丰饶的中心。萌芽机制存在于废墟之中。因此，君子知道，安逸的时候，必须保持正念，思惟烦恼；安逸的时候，必须保持正念，思惟烦恼；危难之际，必须百倍坚韧，绘制成功之路。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在富足的中心存在着衰败的预兆，在废墟之中存在着萌芽的机制。因此，君子知道，在安逸时，他必须保持清醒，思考患难；在灾难时，他必须百倍坚定，规划成功的道路。

text.ori_cn: 惊奇喜异者，无远大之识；苦节独行者，非恒久之操。
text.man_en: Those who admire the unusual or take delight in the uncommon Do not have farreaching discrimination. Those who hold to a rigid integrity or stiff selfreliance Do not have longlasting honor.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are surprised and happy have no far-reaching knowledge; those who are bitter and solitary are not constant in their endeavours.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are surprised and happy do not have far-reaching knowledge; those who walk alone in hardships do not have long-term practice.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are easily surprised and delighted lack foresight; those who practice asceticism and isolation do not possess lasting integrity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 崇尚不寻常或以不寻常为乐的人没有深远的辨别力。坚守正直或僵硬自立的人没有长久的荣誉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些欣赏不寻常或喜欢不寻常的人，没有深远的分别心。固守正直或固执自立的人，不会获得长久的荣誉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些喜欢奇特或以稀罕之物为乐的人，并没有深远的辨别力。那些坚持严格正直或固执自力更生的人，并不拥有长久的荣耀。

text.ori_cn: 当怒火欲水正腾沸处，明明知得，又明明犯著。知的是谁，犯的又是谁，此处能猛然转念，邪魔便为真君矣。
text.man_en: When the flames of anger or the floods of desire are about to boil over, Consider these things with clarity, And with clarity strike them down. Who is it that knows? Who is it that strikes? If you are able to take this point and turn it resolutely in your mind, The twisted demon will become the gentleman of truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the water of anger and desire is boiling, it is clear that you know it, and it is also clear that you are committing a crime. Who is the one who knows, and who is the one who commits the offence? If you can change your mind violently here, the evil demon will become a true ruler.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the anger is boiling, you clearly know that you have gained it, but you have also committed it. Who knows and who is guilty? If you can suddenly change your mind here, the evil devil is the true king.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the rage surges like boiling water, we knowingly understand, yet knowingly commit the mistake. Who is the one that knows, and who is the one that errs? If at this moment we can abruptly change our mindset, the evil demon will turn into a true sage.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当愤怒的火焰或欲望的洪流即将沸腾时，请清醒地考虑这些事情，并清醒地将它们击倒。是谁知道？是谁在打击？如果你能抓住这一点，并在心中坚定地将其转化，扭曲的恶魔就会变成真理的君子。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当愤怒的火焰或欲望的洪流即将沸腾时，清晰地考虑这些事情，并清晰地将它们击倒。谁知道呢？到底是谁来袭呢？如果你能抓住这一点，坚决地转入你的内心，扭曲的恶魔就会成为真理的君子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当愤怒的火焰或欲望的洪流即将沸腾时，要清晰地思考这些事情，并清晰地将它们击溃。是谁在知晓？是谁在打击？如果你能坚定地将这一点铭记于心，扭曲的恶魔将会变成正直的绅士。
