text.ori_cn: 毋偏信而为奸所欺，毋自任而为气所使。毋以己之长而形人之短，毋因己之拙而忌人之能。
text.man_en: Do not believe in the onesided nor be cheated by deceivers. Do not be too selfreliant nor make a show of your courage. Do not, with your own strong points, expose the shortcomings of others. Do not, because of your own ineptitude, despise abilities not your own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Do not be deceived by treachery through partiality; do not be deceived by anger through self-indulgence. Don't use your own strengths to make up for others' weaknesses, and don't be jealous of others' abilities because of your own clumsiness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't be partial to trust and be deceived by traitors, don't be self-reliant and be led by anger. Don't use your own strengths to show off others' shortcomings, and don't be afraid of others' abilities because of your own clumsiness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not blindly trust and be deceived by evil, do not overestimate yourself and be led by impulse. Do not flaunt your strengths to highlight others' weaknesses, do not be envious of others' talents because of your own shortcomings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不要相信一面之词，也不要被骗子欺骗。不要过于自强，也不要逞强。不要以己之长，揭人之短。不要因为自己的无能，而轻视不属于自己的能力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要轻信片面之言，也不要被骗子所欺骗。不要太自立，也不要表现出你的勇气。不要以自己的长处去揭露别人的短处。不要因为自己的无能而轻视不属于自己的能力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不要只听片面之词，也不要被欺骗人所骗。不要过于自信，也不要炫耀你的勇气。不要因为自己的长处，而揭露他人的短处。不要因自己的无能，而轻视他人的才能。

text.ori_cn: 人之短处，要曲为弥缝，如暴而扬之，是以短攻短；人有顽的，要善为化诲，如忿而疾之，是以顽济顽。
text.man_en: People's shortcomings— you need to patch them up with grace. If you drag them into the light of day and hoist them up to view, You will be attacking another's shortcomings with your own. People's intransigence— you need to enlighten them with skill. If you become angry and detest this chore, You will be polishing another's intransigence with your own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People's shortcomings, to be curved for the seam, such as violence and Yang, is to short attack short; people have stubborn, to be good for the teaching, such as wrath and disease, is to stubborn to help stubborn.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A person's shortcomings should be bent to close a gap, such as violence and violence, so use shortcomings to attack the shortcomings; if people are stubborn, they should be good at teaching them, such as anger and illness, so use stubbornness to cure stubbornness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One should tactfully cover the shortcomings of others; to expose and criticize them is to oppose shortcoming with shortcoming. When encountering stubbornness, one should skillfully transform and educate; to respond with anger and impatience is to augment stubbornness with stubbornness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们的缺点--你需要用优雅的态度去弥补。如果你把他们拉到阳光下，将他们高高举起，你就是在用自己的缺点攻击别人的缺点。人们的顽固不化--你需要巧妙地开导他们。如果你怒火中烧，厌恶这项苦差事，那你就是在用自己的顽固打磨别人的顽固。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人的缺点——你需要用优雅来弥补它们。如果你把它们拖到光天化日之下，高高举起，你就是用自己的缺点来攻击别人的缺点。人们的顽固——你需要用技巧来启发他们。如果你变得愤怒并厌恶这项苦差事，你就会用自己的顽固来磨砺别人的顽固。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人的缺点——你需要用优雅去弥补。如果你把它们暴露在光天化日之下并高高举起观看， 你就会用自己的缺点去攻击别人的缺点。人的固执——你需要用技巧去启发他们。如果你因此而生气并厌恶这项任务， 你就会用自己的固执去磨练别人的固执。

text.ori_cn: 遇沈沈不语之士，且莫输心；见悻悻自好之人，尤须防口。
text.man_en: When encountering a gentleman of deep reticence, Do not for a moment communicate your true mind. When meeting a man of highstrung selfsatisfaction, Do your best to keep him from opening his mouth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you meet a man who is silent, don't lose your heart; if you meet a man who is unhappy with himself, be especially careful with your mouth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you meet someone who is silent and silent, don't lose your heart; when you see someone who is resentful and self-indulgent, you must especially guard your mouth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When encountering a taciturn individual, do not readily open your heart; when meeting a self-satisfied and arrogant person, be especially cautious with your words.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 遇到深藏不露的绅士，一刻也不要表露你的真实想法。遇到自我满足感极强的人，要尽力不让他开口。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 遇到深沉默寡言的君子，不要片刻说出自己的真心。遇到一个高度自我满足的人时，尽量不让他开口。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 遇到深沉寡言之人，切勿片刻透露真实心意。碰到情绪高涨、自满之人，尽力阻止其开口。

text.ori_cn: 念头昏散处，要知提醒；念头吃紧时，要知放下。不然恐去昏昏之病，又来憧憧之扰矣。
text.man_en: When your thoughts are dismal and scattered, You should remember both awareness and caution. When your thoughts are pressing and tense, You should remember looseness and composure. Lacking this, though you may be able to get over the disease of depression, Won't the confusion of indecision inflict itself again?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where the thoughts are scattered, we must know to remind; when the thoughts are strained, we must know to put them down. Otherwise, I am afraid to go to the disease of faintness, and then come to the disturbance of longing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When your thoughts are faint and scattered, you must know how to remind them; when your thoughts are tense, you must know how to let them go. Otherwise, I am afraid that the disease of dizziness will be gone, and the disturbance of longing will come again.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When your thoughts are scattered, you need to remind yourself to stay focused; when your thoughts are too intense, you need to know how to let go. Otherwise, you may rid yourself of a state of confusion only to be troubled by restlessness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你的思想灰暗而散乱时，你应该记住警觉和谨慎。当你的思绪紧迫而紧张时，你应该记住放松和沉着。如果缺乏这一点，虽然你可以摆脱抑郁症的困扰，但优柔寡断的困惑难道不会再次袭来吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的思想黯淡、散乱时，你应该记住清醒和谨慎。当你的思绪紧迫、紧张时，你应该记住放松和冷静。缺少了这一点，虽然你或许能克服抑郁症，但犹豫不决的困惑岂不是又会降临吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你的思绪阴郁且散乱时，你应当记得保持觉察和谨慎。当你的思绪紧迫且紧张时，你应当记得放松和沉稳。若缺乏这些，虽然你也许能够克服抑郁的疾病，但犹豫不决的困惑是否会再次袭来？

text.ori_cn: 霁日青天，倏变为迅雷震电；疾风怒雨，倏转为朗月晴空。气机何尝有一毫凝滞，太虚何尝有一毫障塞，人之心体，亦当如是。
text.man_en: Even cloudless days and clear weather May quickly change to sudden thunderclaps and shuddering streaks of lightning. Even violent squalls and angry rains May quickly change to a bright moon and a cloudless sky. What consistency has nature's movements? A stagnation as slender as an autumn hair. What consistency has the Cosmic Beginning? A hindrance as slender as a hair in the fall. The carriage of man's mind should also be like this.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The clear sky, swiftly into a swift thunder and lightning; wind and rain, swiftly into a clear moon and sky. Qi Qi has not the slightest stagnation, the emptiness has not the slightest obstruction, the human heart body, also when the same.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The bright sun and blue sky suddenly turned into thunder and lightning; the strong wind and rain suddenly turned into a bright moon and clear sky. There is no stagnation in the Qi movement, no obstruction in the Taixu. The same is true for the human mind and body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A clear sky after the rain, suddenly transforms into a thunderstorm with lightning; a fierce gale with angry rain, swiftly turns into a moonlit, cloudless night. The movement of air and energy never has the slightest stagnation, and the vast emptiness is never obstructed in the slightest way. The human mind should also be like this.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使是万里无云的晴朗天气，也可能很快变成突如其来的霹雳和令人战栗的闪电。即使是狂风暴雨，也可能很快变成明月当空、万里无云。大自然的运动有什么一致性？如秋毫般纤细的停滞。宇宙之初何尝不是如此？阻碍如秋毫般纤细。人的心境也应如此。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使万里无云、天气晴朗，也可能很快变成突然的雷声和令人颤抖的闪电。即使狂风怒雨，也可能很快变成明月万里。大自然的运动有什么一致性？凝滞如秋发纤细。宇宙开端有什么一致性？秋天的障碍物像头发一样纤细。人的心性也应该如此。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即使无云的日子和晴朗的天气，也可能很快变成突然的雷鸣和颤抖的闪电。即使狂风暴雨，也可能很快变成明月和万里无云的天空。自然的变化有何规律？秋天的一根细发般的停滞。宇宙初始的变化有何规律？秋天的一根细发般的阻碍。人的心态也应该如此。

text.ori_cn: 胜私制欲之功，有曰识不早，力不易者，有曰识得破，忍不过者。盖识是一颗照魔的明珠，力是一把斩魔的慧剑，两不可少也。
text.man_en: Of the means for defeating the ego and suppressing desire, It is said that if your understanding is slow, your strength will not be easily applied. And even if your understanding can penetrate the matter, you may be unable to follow it through to the end. Perhaps knowledge is the grain of the bright gem that shines down on demons, And strength is one flourish of the keen sword that cuts them down. We cannot lessen either.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Winning private desire to control the work, said that knowledge is not early, force is not easy, said that knowledge of the broken, endure, but the person. Cover knowledge is a pearl to illuminate the devil, force is a sword to cut the devil, two can not be less.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The power of overcoming selfishness and controlling desires is sometimes said to be those who are not aware of it early and have difficulty in gaining strength, and sometimes it is said that those who are aware of it are not able to endure it. Consciousness is a pearl that illuminates demons, and power is a sword of wisdom that slays demons. They are both indispensable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There are those who conquer personal desires who lament not recognizing them early, and finding it difficult to change. Others recognize them clearly but cannot endure. For recognition is like a clear pearl that illuminates demons, and strength is a wise sword that cuts them down; both are indispensable.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 关于战胜自我、抑制欲望的方法，有人说，如果你的理解力迟钝，你的力量就不容易发挥出来。即使你的理解能够深入事物，你也可能无法将其贯彻到底。也许，知识是照耀恶魔的璀璨宝石的一粒，力量是斩杀恶魔的锋利宝剑的一抹。二者缺一不可。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在战胜自我和抑制欲望的方法中，据说如果你的理解缓慢，你的力量就不会轻易运用。而且即使你的理解能看透这件事，你也可能无法跟进到底。也许知识是照耀恶魔的璀璨宝石的颗粒，而力量则是斩杀恶魔的利剑的一抹华丽。我们也不能减少。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于战胜自我和压抑欲望的手段，据说如果你的理解慢，你的力量就不容易发挥。即使你的理解能够透彻领会这件事，你也可能无法坚持到底。或许知识是照耀在恶魔身上的那颗明亮宝石的纹理，而力量是一挥而就的利剑，斩除它们。我们不能减少其中任何一个。

text.ori_cn: 觉人之诈，不形于言；受人之侮，不动于色。此中有无穷意味，亦有无穷受用。
text.man_en: Though you are aware of the deceit of others, Do not let this appear in words. Though you receive the contempt of others, Do not let this move your temper. Between the two of these there is an infinity of meaning. Between the two of these there is an infinity of use.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be aware of a man's deception is not to be seen in words; to be insulted by a man is not to be seen in colour. There are infinite meanings in this, and also infinite benefits.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you feel someone's deceit, you can't express it in words; when you receive someone's insult, you can't express it in words. It has infinite meaning and infinite benefits.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Perceive others' deceit without expressing it in words; endure others' insults without showing it in your demeanor. Therein lies boundless meaning, as well as boundless benefit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然你知道别人的欺骗，但不要让这种欺骗出现在言语中。虽然你受到他人的蔑视，但不要因此而动怒。二者之间，意义无穷。这两者之间有无穷的用途。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 虽然你知道别人的欺骗，但不要让这种行为表现在言语上。尽管你受到别人的蔑视，但不要因此而动怒。两者之间蕴藏着无穷的意义。这两者之间有无限的用途。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然你知道他人的欺骗，但不要在言语中表现出来。虽然你受到他人的轻视，但不要因此动怒。这两者之间有无限的意义。这两者之间有无限的用途。

text.ori_cn: 横逆困穷是煅炼豪杰的一副鑪锤，能受其煅炼，则身心交益，不受其煅炼，则身心交损。
text.man_en: Misfortune and distress— This is a set of forges for tempering the great man. If one is able to bear this tempering, both body and mind benefit. If one is unable to bear it, both body and mind suffer loss.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Poverty and adversity are the plutonium of the great and the good. If you can suffer from them, you will benefit physically and mentally; if you don't suffer from them, you will lose physically and mentally.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Poverty and adversity are a hammer that forges heroes. If you can be tempered by it, your body and mind will be benefited. If you are not tempered by it, your body and mind will be harmed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Adversity is the forge and hammer that molds heroes; those who withstand its tempering emerge stronger in body and mind, while those who do not, suffer harm in both.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不幸与苦难--这是一套锤炼伟人的锻造工具。经得起锤炼，身心受益。若不能承受，则身心俱损。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不幸与困苦——这是锤炼伟人的一套锻炉。如果能经受住这种磨炼，身心都会受益。如果无法承受，身心都会受到损害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不幸与困苦——这是锻炼伟人的锻炉。如果一个人能够承受这样的锤炼，身心都会受益。如果一个人不能承受，身心都会受到损失。

text.ori_cn: 吾身一小天地也，使喜怒不愆，好恶有则，便是燮理的工夫；天地一大父母也，使民无怨咨，物无氛疹，亦是敦睦的气象。
text.man_en: My body is a tiny Heaven and Earth. If joy and anger are not misguided, If likes and aversions are regulated, it will all be a harmonious scheme. Heaven and Earth are our great parents. If people do not become hateful or succumb to grief, If all things in creation are neither hindered nor harmed, all phenomena will be at peace.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: My body is a small heaven and earth, so that happiness and anger do not offend, good and bad rules, is the work of Xie Li; heaven and earth, a large parent, so that the people have no complaints, things have no atmosphere of rash, but also the harmony of the weather.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: My body is like a small heaven and earth, which makes me happy and angry without being upset, and my likes and dislikes are well-regulated, which is the work of regulating. Heaven and earth are one big parent, so that people have no complaints and things are free from anger, which is also a harmonious atmosphere.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: My body is a small universe; if I can regulate my joy and anger and have proper standards for my likes and dislikes, it is the art of harmonizing. Heaven and Earth are the great parents; if they can ensure people harbor no grievances and things run smoothly, it is the atmosphere of concord.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我身是小小天地。喜怒不形于色，喜恶有节于心，则万物皆和。天地是我们伟大的父母。若人不憎不悲，若万物无碍无伤，万象皆安。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我的身体就是一个小小的天地。喜怒若不失，好恶能调，则皆和。天地是我们伟大的父母。人若不嗔恨，不悲哀，万物不碍不伤，则一切诸法皆安。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我的身体就是一个小小的天地。如果喜怒不被误导，如果喜欢与反感得到调节，一切都会是一个和谐的局面。天地是我们伟大的父母。如果人们不变得憎恨或屈从于悲伤，如果所有造物都不被阻碍或伤害，一切现象都会平和。

text.ori_cn: 害人之心不可有，防人之心不可无，此戒疏于虑也；宁受人之欺，毋逆人之诈，此儆伤于察也；二语并存，精明而浑厚矣。
text.man_en: We should not seek to harm others Nor should we not protect ourselves. This is a warning about being careless with our thoughts. "It is better to be deceived by men Than to be always looking for their lies. " This is a reprimand against betraying our insights. When the two exist side by side, There will be both clarity and concord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Harming people's hearts must not have, preventing people's hearts must not be absent, this warning is also sparse in the consideration; would rather be deceived by people, not against people's deception, this warning is also injured in the inspection; two words and coexist, shrewd and thick.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: You must not have the intention of harming others, and you must have the intention of guarding against others. This precept is neglected. You would rather be deceived by others than betray others' deceit. This warning requires observation. The two words coexist, and they are shrewd and honest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One must not harbor the intention to harm others, but must always be vigilant against being harmed by others; this is a warning against being too careless. It is better to suffer being deceived than to anticipate someone else's deceit; this is a caution against being overly suspicious. When these two precepts coexist, one becomes both wise and magnanimous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们不应该伤害他人，也不应该保护自己。这是在警告我们不要胡思乱想。"宁可被人欺骗，也不要总去寻找他们的谎言。"这是训诫我们不要背叛自己的洞察力。当两者并存时，就会既清晰又和谐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我们不应该试图伤害他人，也不应该保护自己。这是对我们的思想不小心的警告。 “宁可被人欺骗，也不要总是寻找他们的谎言。”这是对背叛我们洞察力的斥责。当两者并存时，就会既清晰又和谐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们不应该寻求伤害他人 也不应该不保护自己。 这是关于对自己的想法不小心的警告。 “被人欺骗总比总是在找他们的谎言要好。” 这是对背叛我们见解的谴责。 当二者并存时， 将会有清晰和和谐。

text.ori_cn: 毋因群疑而阻独见，毋任己意而废人言，毋私小惠而伤大体，毋借公论以快私情。
text.man_en: Do not inhibit your own beliefs because of public doubt. Do not entrust yourself to your own ideas, and discard the words of others. Do not add small benefits to yourself while utterly wearing yourself down. Do not appropriate public opinion to accommodate your own emotions.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Don't let the group's suspicions prevent you from having a unique view, don't let your own opinion be invalidated, don't take small favours to the detriment of the general body, and don't use the public opinion for the pleasure of your personal feelings.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't block your own opinions because of the doubts of the crowd, don't let your own opinions invalidate others' opinions, don't hurt the general public by doing personal favors, don't use public opinion to satisfy your personal feelings.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not let collective doubts hinder your unique insight, do not dismiss others' words due to your own convictions, do not harm the greater good for the sake of personal favors, and do not use public opinion to fulfill personal desires.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不要因为公众的质疑而抑制自己的信仰。不要只相信自己的想法，而摒弃他人的言论。不要为自己增加蝇头小利，却让自己身心俱疲。不要为了迎合自己的情绪而挪用公众舆论。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要因为公众的怀疑而抑制自己的信仰。不要相信自己的想法，而抛弃别人的言论。不要给自己带来一点小好处，却把自己搞得精疲力竭。不要利用舆论来迁就自己的情绪。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不要因为公众的质疑而抑制自己的信仰。不要把自己托付给自己的想法，而抛弃他人的话语。不要在耗尽自己的同时给自己增加小的利益。不要为了迎合自己的情绪而占用公众舆论。

text.ori_cn: 善人未能急亲，不宜预扬，恐来谗谮之奸；恶人未能轻去，不宜先发，恐遭媒孽之祸。
text.man_en: While not yet on intimate terms with a good man, It is best not to praise him in advance or you may call down on yourself the slander of scoundrels. While not yet able to get away from a bad man, It is best not to condemn him too quickly or you may invite a disaster that will ferment like yeast.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a good man cannot kiss in a hurry, he should not raise it in advance, for fear of slander; if an evil man cannot go lightly, he should not send it out first, for fear of being caught in the scourge of the matchmaker.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a good person is not in a hurry to get married, it is not advisable to announce it in advance, for fear of being slandered; if an evil person is not able to get away easily, it is not advisable to make the first move, for fear of suffering the disaster of a matchmaker.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If a virtuous person has not yet endeared themselves to you, do not prematurely praise them, for fear of attracting slanderous individuals; if a malevolent person has not yet been dismissed, do not hastily expose them, for fear of inviting calamity through malicious gossip.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在与好人还没有亲密接触的时候，最好不要提前赞美他，否则会招来无赖的诽谤。在还不能摆脱坏人的时候，最好不要过早地谴责他，否则你可能会招致像酵母一样发酵的灾难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 未与善人亲近时，最好不要预先夸奖他，否则会招致流氓的谗言。虽然还无法摆脱坏人，但最好不要太快地谴责他，否则你可能会招致像酵母一样发酵的灾难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在还没有和一个好人建立亲密关系时，最好不要提前赞美他，否则你可能会招来无赖的诽谤。在还没有摆脱一个坏人之前，最好不要过早地谴责他，否则你可能会招来像酵母一样发酵的灾祸。

text.ori_cn: 青天白日的节义，自暗室屋漏中培来；旋乾转坤的经纶，自临深履薄处缫出。
text.man_en: Honor as clear as the day or as bright as the sun Is cultivated in dark rooms and deep recesses. Statecraft that could turn the universe on its course Is conducted as you might approach deep pools or tread on thin ice.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The righteousness of the green sky and the white sun is cultivated from the dark room and the leakage of the house; the scripture of the revolution of the universe is reeled out from the deep and thin place.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The integrity of the blue sky and the bright sun are cultivated from the leaks in the dark room; the economics that spins the heaven and earth are reeled out from the deep and thin places.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The moral integrity that remains unsullied in broad daylight is cultivated through acts done in the privacy of one's own conscience; the grand strategies that shape the world are spun from the careful, measured actions taken in precarious situations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如白昼般清澈或如阳光般灿烂的荣誉是在黑暗的房间和幽深的角落里培养出来的。国事如临深渊、如履薄冰，可以扭转乾坤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 像白天一样清晰或像太阳一样明亮的荣誉是在黑暗的房间和深处培养的。可以扭转宇宙轨迹的治国之道，就像你接近深潭或踏在薄冰上一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 像白天一样清澈或像太阳一样光明的荣誉，是在黑暗的房间和深处养成的。能够改变宇宙运行轨迹的治国之术，是如同你接近深水池或踏在薄冰上一样进行的。

text.ori_cn: 父慈子孝，兄友弟恭，纵做到极处，俱是合当如此，著不得一毫感激的念头。如施者任德，受者怀恩，便是路人，便成市道矣。
text.man_en: A father acts with affection, a child with filial piety. An elder brother acts with friendship, a younger brother with respect. Even if such behavior is carried to the utmost, Altogether, it is only as it should be, And should not impress us by even a hairbreadth. When a person who acts assumes virtue And the person who receives feels obligation, It is the same as meeting a stranger on the road, Or bartering for goods in the market.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Father's kindness, son's filial piety, brother's friendship and brother's respect, even to the extreme, are all appropriate, not the slightest thought of gratitude. If the giver is virtuous and the recipient is kind, he is a passer-by, and he becomes a marketer.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A father is kind and a son is filial, and brothers and sisters are respectful to each other. Even if they do it to the extreme, they should all be like this, without even the slightest thought of gratitude. If the giver is virtuous and the receiver is kind, then he is a passer-by and has become the way of the market.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When parents are kind and children are filial, when elder brothers are friendly and younger brothers are respectful, even if achieved to the utmost, it is simply the way things ought to be, without the slightest thought of gratitude. If the giver assumes virtue and the receiver harbors gratitude, then they are mere acquaintances and the relationship turns into a transaction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 父慈子孝。兄以友，弟以恭。即使这种行为被发挥到了极致，但总的来说，这也是应该的，不应该给我们留下一丝一毫的印象。行者有德，受者有义，就像在路上遇到陌生人，或在市场上以物易物一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 父以慈爱行，子以孝行。兄长以友爱，弟以敬重。即使这种行为进行到了极致，总而言之，也只是应有的样子，不应该给我们留下丝毫的印象。施行者有德，受受者有义务，就像路上遇见陌生人，或者市场上以物易物一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 父亲以慈爱行事，孩子以孝道行事。兄长以友爱行事，弟弟以尊敬行事。即使这种行为做到极致，总而言之，也只是理所当然的，不应使我们有丝毫的印象。当行事的人假设美德，接受的人感到义务，这就如同在路上遇见陌生人，或在市场上交换货物。

text.ori_cn: 有妍必有丑为之对，我不夸妍，谁能丑我；有洁必有污为之仇，我不好洁，谁能污我。
text.man_en: If radiant beauty exists, the ugly will necessarily exist to oppose it. But if I do not take pride in beauty, Who will be able to consider me ugly? If immaculate purity exists, the filthy will necessarily exist to counter it. But if I am not fond of purity, Who will be able to contaminate me?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There must be Yan ugly for the right, I do not boast Yan, who can ugly me; there must be clean dirt for the hatred, I am not good clean, who can dirty me.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is beauty, there must be ugliness for it. If I don’t praise beauty, who can embarrass me; if there is purity, there must be filth for it. If I am not clean, who can taint me.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Where there is beauty, there must be ugliness to contrast it. I do not boast of beauty, who can call me ugly? Where there is cleanliness, there must be filth to oppose it. I do not pride myself on cleanliness, who can stain me?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果存在光彩夺目的美，就必然存在与之对立的丑。但如果我不以美为荣，谁又能说我丑呢？如果纯洁无暇的东西存在，那么肮脏的东西必然会与之对抗。但如果我不喜欢纯洁，谁又能污染我呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果光芒四射的美存在，丑陋就必然存在来反对它。但我若不以美貌为荣，谁能说我丑呢？如果纯洁存在，那么肮脏就必然存在来对抗它。但我若不爱好清净，谁能玷污我呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果存在光辉的美丽，那么丑陋必定会存在以与之对立。但如果我不以美丽为傲，谁能认为我丑陋？如果存在纯洁的无暇，那么污秽必定会存在以抵消它。但如果我不钟爱纯洁，谁能玷污我？

text.ori_cn: 炎凉之态，富贵更甚于贫贱；妒忌之心，骨肉尤狠于外人。此处若不当以冷肠，御以平气，鲜不日坐烦恼障中矣。
text.man_en: Emotions arising like flames or chill winds— These are much more intense among the wealthy and ranked than among the poor and humble. Minds full of jealousy and spite— These are much more pronounced among relatives than among strangers. If you do not consider these points coolly Or manage yourself with tranquillity Your ability to restrain deluding passions and desires Will day by day decrease.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The state of inflammation, rich and noble more than poor and low; jealousy, flesh and blood especially ruthless than outsiders. If you do not take the cold bowels, the Royal to calm the air, rarely sit in the troubles of the barriers to carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In a state of heat and cold, wealth is more severe than poverty; in a jealous heart, flesh and blood are especially cruel to outsiders. If you don't use cold intestines and calm the Qi here, you will rarely sit in the obstacle of troubles every day.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The fluctuations in people's attitudes are more pronounced in times of wealth than in poverty, and the jealousy within family members is often harsher than that from outsiders. If one does not respond with a calm mind and maintain an even temperament, it is rare to avoid being constantly entangled in worries.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 情绪如火焰或寒风--富裕和有地位的人比贫穷和卑微的人更容易产生这种情绪。充满嫉妒和怨恨的心理-- 亲戚之间比陌生人之间更明显。如果你不冷静地考虑这些问题，或者不冷静地管理自己，你克制妄想和欲望的能力就会与日俱增。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 情绪如火焰或寒风般升起——这些情绪在富人和有地位的人中比在穷人和卑微的人中更为强烈。心中充满嫉妒和怨恨——这些在亲戚中比在陌生人中更为明显。如果你不冷静地考虑这些要点，或者平静地管理自己，你抑制迷惑的激情和欲望的能力就会日益下降。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 情绪如火焰或冷风般升起――在富人和有地位的人中比在贫穷和卑微的人中要强烈得多。 心中充满嫉妒和恶意――在亲戚之间比在人际之间要明显得多。 如果你不能冷静地考虑这些问题 或者以平静的心态管理自己 你的控制欲望和情感的能力将日渐减少。

text.ori_cn: 功过不容少混，混则人怀惰堕之心；恩仇不可太明，明则人起携贰之志。
text.man_en: Merit and misjudgment should not be confused; If confusion exists, people's hearts will be invested with negligence and sloth. Gratitude and thanklessness should not be made too clear; If clarity exists, people's thoughts will be sown with division and doubt.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If we do not mix the merits and demerits, then people will have the heart of idleness and depravity; and if we do not make the enmity and hatred too clear, then people will have the will to carry the two.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The merits and demerits should not be confused, otherwise people will have a lazy and degenerate heart; grudges should not be too clear, and if they are clear, people will have the ambition to support each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Merits and faults should not be mixed; if mixed, people will harbor thoughts of laziness. Graces and enmities should not be too clear; if too clear, people will develop intentions of division.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 功与过不可混淆，混淆则人心怠惰。感恩与不感恩不应过于明确；如果明确，人们的思想中就会埋下分裂与怀疑的种子。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 功德与误判不可混为一谈；如果存在混乱，人们的心灵就会充满疏忽和懒惰。感恩与报恩不宜说得太清楚；如果存在清晰性，人们的思想就会播下分裂和怀疑的种子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 功与过不能混淆；如果混淆存在，人们的心中会充满疏忽和懒惰。感谢与忘恩不能分得太清；如果清晰存在，人们的思想中会充满分裂和疑虑。

text.ori_cn: 爵位不宜太盛，太盛则危；能事不宜尽毕，尽毕则衰；行谊不宜过高，过高则谤兴而毁来。
text.man_en: Title and rank should not be elevated too high. Once a high elevation is reached, there is danger. Ability should not be used to exhaustion. Once exhaustion is reached, there is decline. Moral behavior should not be raised excessively. Once excess is reached, there will only come slander and blame.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The title should not be too prosperous, if it is too prosperous, it will be dangerous; the ability should not be completed, if it is completed, it will decline; the line of friendship should not be too high, if it is too high, it will be slandered and destroyed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The title should not be too high, because too high will be dangerous; it should not be done to the fullest, otherwise it will decline; the friendship should not be too high, because if it is too high, it will be discredited and ruined.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Noble titles should not be overly abundant, as excessive abundance leads to danger; tasks should not be fully exhausted, as complete exhaustion leads to decline; one's conduct should not be overly lofty, as excessive loftiness invites slander and brings about destruction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 头衔和级别不能抬得太高。一旦高高在上，就会有危险。能力不能用尽。一旦穷尽，就会衰退。德行不可过高。一旦过高，就会招致诽谤和指责。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 头衔和级别不宜提升得太高。一旦到达高海拔，就会有危险。能力不宜用尽。一旦达到疲惫状态，就会出现衰退。道德行为不宜过度提升。一旦达到了极限，只会招来诽谤和指责。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 地位和头衔不应抬得过高。一旦达到高位，就有危险。能力不应使用到耗尽。一旦耗尽，就会有衰退。道德行为不应提得过分。一旦过分，就只会引来诽谤和指责。

text.ori_cn: 恶忌阴，善忌阳，故恶之显者祸浅，而隐者祸深；善之显者功小，而隐者功大。
text.man_en: Evil abhors the dark; Good shies away from the light. Therefore: When evil is manifest, its harm is superficial; Hidden, its harm is profound. When good is manifest, its merit is insignificant; Hidden, its merit is great.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Evil is jealous of the yin and good is jealous of the yang; therefore, the evil of the obvious is shallow, while the hidden is deep; the good of the obvious is small, while the hidden is large.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Evil is jealous of yin, and good is jealous of yang. Therefore, if evil is manifest, the disaster will be shallow, but if it is hidden, the disaster will be profound; if good is manifest, the result will be small, while if it is hidden, the result will be great.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Evils abhor exposure, while virtues fear obscurity. Thus, the consequences of overt evils are shallow, while hidden evils bring deeper calamities; the benefits of apparent virtues are minor, while concealed virtues yield greater rewards.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 邪恶厌恶黑暗，善良躲避光明。因此：显恶，其害浅也；隐恶，其害深也。善显，其功微小；善隐，其功大。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 邪恶憎恶黑暗；善回避光。是故：恶显时，其害处是表面的；恶显时，其害处是表面的；其隐蔽性，其危害是深远的。善行显现时，其功德就微不足道；隐蔽，其功德大。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 邪恶憎恨黑暗；善良畏惧光明。所以：当邪恶显现时，其危害是表面的；隐藏时，其危害是深远的。当善良显现时，其功德是微不足道的；隐藏时，其功德是巨大的。

text.ori_cn: 德者才之主，才者德之奴。有才无德，如家无主而奴用事矣，几何不魍魉猖狂。
text.man_en: Character is the master of talent, talent the servant of character. To have talent but no character Is like a house with the master absent and the servant in control. How many times will the little demons appear? How many times run amok?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Virtue is the master of talent, talent is the slave of virtue. There is talent without virtue, such as home without a master and slave with things carry on, geometry not sprites and demons rampant.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Virtue is the master of talent, talent is the slave of virtue. Talented but not virtuous, it is like being a servant in a house without a master, and there is no way for evil spirits to flourish.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Virtue is the master of talent, and talent is the servant of virtue. Having talent without virtue is like a house without a master, controlled by servants; how can it not descend into chaos and disorder?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 品格是才能的主人，才能是品格的仆人。有才无品，就像一栋房子，主人不在，仆人当家。小恶魔会出现多少次？多少次肆意妄为？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 品格是才华的主人，才华是品格的仆人。有才华而无品格，犹如房屋主人不在，仆人当家。小恶魔会出现几次？狂奔几次？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 品格是才能的主人，才能是品格的仆人。有才能但没有品格，就像主人不在而仆人掌权的房子。小恶魔会出现多少次呢？会有多少次胡作非为呢？

text.ori_cn: 锄奸杜幸，要放他一条去路。若使之一无所容，譬如塞鼠穴者，一切去路都塞尽，则一切好物俱咬破矣。
text.man_en: In weeding out scoundrels or cutting off flatterers, It is necessary to leave them a means of escape. If you deal with them but leave no way out, It is stopping up the hole of a mouse: When all means of escape have been totally blocked, It will chew its way through everything you love best.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To weed out the wicked and to make them happy, we must give them a way out. If you make one of them intolerant, like the one who stuffs a rat's hole, all the ways are stuffed, and then all the good things are bitten through.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To rape Du Xing, let him have a way out. If there is no room for it, it is like blocking a rat's hole. All the ways out will be blocked, and all good things will be chewed through.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Expose traitors and eliminate sycophants, but leave them a way out. If you offer them no refuge at all, it would be like blocking a mouse hole completely, causing them to chew through everything good.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在铲除无赖或斩断谄媚者时，必须给他们留一条后路。如果你对付他们，却不给他们留后路，那就等于堵住了老鼠的洞：当所有的出路都被堵死时，它就会咬断你最爱的一切。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 铲除恶棍、斩断阿谀奉承者，必须给他们留一条退路。如果你对付它们却不留退路，它就像堵住老鼠的洞：当所有的逃生途径都被完全堵塞时，它就会咬碎你最爱的一切。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在清除恶棍或断绝谄媚者时，有必要给他们留一条退路。如果处理他们时不给任何出路，那就像堵住了老鼠洞：当所有退路完全被封死时，它将咬坏你最心爱的东西。

text.ori_cn: 当与人同过，不当与人同功，同功则相忌；可与人共患难，不可与人共安乐，安乐则相仇。
text.man_en: Accept blame along with others, But do not accept praise. When praise is shared, there will be mutual dislike. Take a share in the suffering of others, But do not take a share in their ease. When ease is shared, there will be mutual dislike.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you share your faults with others, you should not share your achievements with them; if you share your achievements, you will be jealous of each other; if you can share your sufferings with others, you should not share your comfort with them; if you share your comfort, you will be hostile to each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: You should share the same faults with others, and you should not share the same achievements with others. If you share the same merits with others, you will be jealous of each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When working with others, one should not seek equal credit, as equal credit breeds jealousy; one can share hardships with others, but not pleasures, as pleasures incite resentment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与他人一起接受指责，但不要接受赞美。当赞美被分享时，就会有相互的厌恶。与他人同甘共苦，但不要与他人同享安逸。与人同甘共苦，就会相互厌恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与人一起接受责备，但不接受赞扬。当互相赞扬时，就会出现互相厌恶。分享别人的痛苦，但不要分享他们的轻松。当分享安逸时，就会有相互厌恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与他人一同承担责备，但不要接受赞扬。当赞扬被分享时，会引起相互不满。分担他人的痛苦，但不要分担他们的安逸。当安逸被分享时，会引起相互不满。

text.ori_cn: 士君子，贫不能济物者，遇人痴迷处，出一言提醒之；遇人急难处，出一言解救之，亦是无量功德。
text.man_en: If a gentleman of rank is impoverished and unable to help others, When meeting those deluded by their own foolishness He will proffer words to awaken them. When meeting others who are in imminent danger, He will proffer words to save them. This, too, is measureless charity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a gentleman is poor and unable to help others, it is an infinite merit for him to give a word of reminder when he encounters someone who is obsessed; and to give a word of relief when he encounters someone who is in urgent need.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Scholars and gentlemen, if you are poor and unable to give anything, if you encounter someone who is obsessed with something, you can use a word to remind him; if you encounter someone who is in urgent need, you can say a word to save him, which is also a boundless merit.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman, even if unable to materially aid others in poverty, can still perform boundless good deeds by offering a word of advice to someone in confusion or a word of relief to someone in distress.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个有地位的君子穷困潦倒，无力帮助他人，当他遇到那些被自己的愚昧所迷惑的人时，他会用言语唤醒他们。遇人危难，则出言相救。这也是无量的慈悲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子如果贫穷而不能帮助别人，遇到自愚迷惑的人时，就会以言语来唤醒他们。当别人遇到危险时，他会说出拯救他们的话。这也是无量的慈善。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若一位有身份的绅士陷入贫困而无法帮助他人，当遇到那些被自己愚昧所蒙蔽的人时，他会以言语唤醒他们。当遇到那些处于紧急危险中的人时，他会以言语拯救他们。这也是无量的慈悲。

text.ori_cn: 饥则附，饱则飏；燠则趋，寒则弃，人情通患也。君子宜净拭冷眼，慎毋轻动刚肠。
text.man_en: When hungry, they cling to you like vines; When full, they fly away like the wind. If there is warmth, they trot right over; Where there is cold, they abandon ship. These are the common evils of human nature. The gentleman should cleanse and purify his composed vision. But, with respect, not stand thoughtlessly obstinate in his views.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are hungry, you attach, when you are full, you soar; when you are cold, you abandon. A gentleman should cleanse his eyes of the cold, and be careful not to move his intestines lightly.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Hungry will lead to attachment, fullness will lead to intoxication; burning will lead to indigestion, cold will lead to abandonment, and human emotions are common causes of trouble. A gentleman should wipe his cold eyes and be careful not to lightly touch his guts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When hungry, they cling; when full, they drift away. When warm, they approach; when cold, they abandon. Such is the common flaw in human nature. A gentleman should keep a clear and cold eye, and be cautious not to act impulsively or stubbornly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 饥饿时，它们会像藤蔓一样紧紧缠住你；吃饱后，它们会像风一样飞走。如果有温暖，它们会马上跑过来；如果有寒冷，它们会弃你而去。这些都是人性的通病。君子应该净化和纯化自己沉着的眼光。但是，请恕我直言，不要不假思索地固执己见。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 饥饿时，它们像藤蔓一样攀附在你身上；吃饱后，它们就会像风一样飞走。如果有温暖，它们就小跑过来；如果有温暖，它们就会小跑过来。哪里寒冷，他们就弃船。这些都是人性的共性之恶。君子应净化其冷静的目光。但是，带着尊重，不要轻率地固执他的观点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 饥来如藤附，饱去似风飞。暖则赴人，寒则弃舟。此人道之恶也。君子当洗涤净化其心，但应以敬重而非执拗对待其见解。

text.ori_cn: 德随量进，量由识长。故欲厚其德，不可不弘其量；欲弘其量，不可不大其识。
text.man_en: One's character improves according to his magnanimity; His magnanimity increases according to his consciousness. Therefore, he who wishes to enrich his character Cannot do so without broadening his magnanimity. He who wishes to broaden his magnanimity Cannot do so without increasing his consciousness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Virtue advances with quantity, and quantity grows with knowledge. Therefore, if you want to enrich your virtue, you must not fail to increase your quantity; if you want to increase your quantity, you must not fail to increase your knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Virtue advances with quantity, and quantity grows with knowledge. Therefore, if you want to enhance your virtue, you must expand its capacity; if you want to expand your capacity, you must expand your knowledge.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Virtue progresses with one's capacity, and capacity grows with wisdom. Therefore, to enhance one's virtue, one must broaden one's capacity; to broaden one's capacity, one must expand one's wisdom.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个人的品格会随着他的胸襟而提高；他的胸襟会随着他的意识而增强。因此，想要丰富自己的品格，就必须扩大自己的胸襟。一个人要想扩大自己的胸襟，就必须提高自己的觉悟。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个人的品格因他的宽宏大量而提高；他的宽宏量随着他的意识而增加。所以，欲充实自己的人格，就不能不扩大自己的胸怀。欲扩大胸怀的人，不提高觉性就不能做到这一点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个人的品格会随着他的豁达而提升；他的豁达会随着他的觉悟而增加。因此，想要提高品格的人，必须先扩大自己的豁达。想要扩大豁达的人，必须先提升自己的觉悟。

text.ori_cn: 一镫荧然，万籁无声，此吾人初入宴寂时也；晓梦初醒，群动未起，此吾人初出混沌处也。乘此而一念回光，炯然返照，始知耳目口鼻皆桎梏，而情欲嗜好悉机械矣。
text.man_en: When the single lamp in my room flickers like a firefly, And the music of all creation is suspended, I enter a peaceful solitude. When first waking from the dreams of dawn, And the bustling of the crowds has not yet begun, I leave the chaos of precreation. Riding these moments, if I concentrate and reflect, Letting wisdom shine and glow, I know first that My eyes, ears, mouth, and nose are all shackles; My emotions, desires, tastes, and predilections are but tricks and schemes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A stirrup fluorescent, all the music is silent, this is the first time we enter the feast of silence; dawn dreaming, the group movement has not yet risen, this is the first time we come out of the chaos of the place. Taking this and a thought back to the light, shining back to the light, we know that the ears, eyes, mouth and nose are shackled, and all the lust and hobbies are mechanical.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A stirrup shines brightly, and everything is silent. This is when we first enter the silence of the banquet; when we first wake up from a dream, but the crowd has not stirred up, this is when we first emerge from the chaos. Taking advantage of this, a thought returns to the light, shining brightly, and I realize that my ears, eyes, mouth, and nose are all shackles, and my desires and hobbies are all mechanical.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With a single faint gleam of light, everything falls silent; this is the moment we first enter the tranquility of the banquet. When we awaken from a light dream and all beings have yet to stir, this is the moment we first step out from chaos. In this state, if one thought turns inward and reflects back brightly, one will realize that the senses—ears, eyes, mouth, nose—are all shackles, and emotions, desires, and preferences are all mechanisms.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当房间里的一盏灯像萤火虫一样闪烁，万物的音乐暂停，我进入了宁静的独处。当我从黎明的梦中初醒，熙熙攘攘的人群还未开始，我离开了创造前的混沌。在这些时刻，如果我凝神反思，让智慧发光发热，我就会首先知道，我的眼睛、耳朵、嘴巴和鼻子都是枷锁；我的情感、欲望、口味和偏好不过是诡计和阴谋。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当我房间里的一盏灯像萤火虫一样闪烁，当所有造物的音乐都暂停时，我进入了宁静的孤独。当黎明的梦初醒时，人群的喧嚣尚未开始，我就离开了前世的混乱。乘着这些时刻，如果我集中思想，让智慧闪耀发光，我首先知道我的眼睛、耳朵、嘴巴、鼻子都是枷锁；我的情感、欲望、品味和喜好都不过是诡计和阴谋。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当我房间里的那盏孤灯像萤火虫一样闪烁，万物的音乐暂停时，我进入了宁静的孤独。当我第一次从黎明的梦中醒来，喧闹的人群尚未开始时，我离开了混沌的前生。在这些时刻，如果我专心反思，让智慧闪耀发光，我就会首先知道：我的眼睛、耳朵、嘴巴和鼻子都是桎梏；我的情感、欲望、口味和偏好不过是诡计和阴谋。

text.ori_cn: 反己者，触事皆成药石；尤人者，动念即是戈矛。一以辟众善之路，一以导诸恶之源，相去霄壤矣。
text.man_en: For the person open to selfexamination, Everything he touches turns to curing and medicinal goods. For the person who blames others, There are spears and halberds when his heart is stirred. The one opens up the road to all that is good; The other opens the springboard for all that is evil. They are as different as Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are against themselves, all things become medicine and stone; those who are against others, the thought is a spear. One is to open up the road to goodness, and the other is to guide the source of all evils, which is a far cry from each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are against oneself will turn everything into medicine; those who are against others, their thoughts will be like spears. One is to open up the path for all good, and the other is to lead to the source of all evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who reflect on themselves find remedies in everything they encounter; those who blame others see every thought as a weapon. One opens the path to all goodness, the other leads to the source of all evil. The difference between the two is vast like the distance between heaven and earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 对于勇于自省的人，他所接触的一切都会变成治疗和药用物品。对于怨天尤人的人，当他的心被激起时，就会有矛和戟。一个开辟了通往一切善的道路，另一个则打开了一切恶的跳板。它们就像天和地一样不同。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对于一个愿意自省的人来说，他所接触到的一切都变成了治疗和药用物品。怨人者，心动则有枪戟。一个人开辟通向一切美好的道路；另一个为一切邪恶打开了跳板。他们就像天与地一样不同。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于愿意自我反省的人，他所触及的一切都会变成治愈和药品。对于责备他人的人，当他内心被触动时，会有长矛和戟。前者开启通向一切美好的道路；后者为所有邪恶铺设了跳板。他们如天地之别。

text.ori_cn: 事业文章随身销毁，而精神万古如新；功名富贵逐世转移，而气节千载一日。君子信不当以彼易此也。
text.man_en: Although your deeds and writings follow the body and crumble into nothingness, The spirit is made anew for ten thousand ages. Although merit and name, wealth and rank follow the world in its mutability, For honor and highmindedness, one thousand years is the same as one day. The gentleman truly should not change one for the other.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Career articles are destroyed with the body, but the spirit is as new as ever; fame and wealth are transferred from one generation to the next, but the spirit of the day is a thousand years old. A gentleman's faith should not be replaced by his own.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Career articles are destroyed with you, but your spirit remains new forever; fame, wealth and honor are transferred from generation to generation, but your integrity lasts for thousands of years. A gentleman should not trade one thing for another.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Career achievements and articles may be destroyed with time, but the spirit remains as fresh as ever; fame and wealth can be transient, but integrity endures unchanged for millennia. A gentleman surely should not trade the latter for the former.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 功名富贵，虽随世事变迁，但精神万古常新。功名富贵，虽随世事变迁；荣华富贵，千年如一日。天行健，君子以自强不息。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 虽然你的事迹和著作随躯体化为虚无，但精神万世重生。功名富贵虽随世间变化无常，但尊荣高尚，一千年等于一日。君子确实不应该以一换一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然你的行为和文字随形体而化为乌有，精神却为万古更新。虽然功名富贵随世事而变迁，名节高尚，一千年如一日。君子确实不应为了另一个而改变自己。

text.ori_cn: 鱼网之设，鸿则罹其中；螳螂之贪，雀又乘其后。机里藏机，变外生变，智巧何足恃哉。
text.man_en: The net is set for the fish, But catches the swan in its mesh. The praying mantis covets its prey, While the sparrow approaches from the rear. Within one contrivance hides another; Beyond one change, another is born. Are wisdom and skill enough to put your hopes on?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the fishnet is set, the Hong suffers in it; when the mantis is greedy, the sparrow rides behind it. The machine hides the opportunity, the change outside the change, the wisdom and cleverness is not enough to be relied upon.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the fishing net is set up, the swan will be caught in it; if the mantis is greedy, the sparrow will catch it. There are hidden opportunities within the machine, changes arise from the outside, so there is no need to rely on cleverness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When nets are cast for fish, swans may get ensnared; the greed of the mantis invites the ambush of the sparrow. Within scheming lies more scheming, and change begets further change. How can mere cleverness be relied upon?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 网中有鱼，网住天鹅。螳螂捕蝉，黄雀在后。一计不成，又生一计。智慧和技巧足以让你寄予希望吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 网已为鱼设下，却将天鹅捕获在网中。螳螂觊觎，麻雀从后而来。一项发明中隐藏着另一项发明；除了一个变化之外，另一个变化也随之诞生。智慧和技巧足以让你寄予希望吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 网为鱼设，却网到天鹅。螳螂捕蝉，黄雀在后。计中有计，变上加变。智慧与技巧，足能寄望乎？

text.ori_cn: 作人无点真恳念头，便成个花子，事事皆虚；涉世无段圆活机趣，便是个木人，处处有碍。
text.man_en: Being human, if you possess not even a sliver of sincerity in your heart, You will become nothing more than a beggar, And all your affairs will be shams; Passing through this world, If you possess neither a grain of gentleness nor an affable disposition, You will be nothing more than a wooden dummy: Everywhere you go you will find obstructions.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you do not have any sincere thoughts, you will become a flower child, and everything will be false; if you do not have a rounded and interesting way of being in the world, you will be a wooden man, and you will be hindered in every way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person does not have any sincere thoughts, he will become a flower child, and everything will be empty; if he does not have a sense of humor and wit in the world, he will become a wooden person, and he will be hindered in every way.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without a genuine honest thought, a person becomes a façade, everything is false; without a bit of adaptability and cleverness, interacting with the world, one becomes a wooden puppet, encountering obstacles everywhere.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 做人，如果心中没有一丝真诚，就只能沦为乞丐，所有的事情都是假的；在这个世界上，如果没有一丁点温柔，没有和蔼可亲的性格，就只能成为一个木头人：无论你走到哪里，都会遇到阻碍。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 作为人，如果你心里没有一丝真诚，你就不过是一个乞丐，你的一切都是假的；走过这个世界，如果你没有一点温柔，没有一点和蔼可亲的性情，你就只是一个木头人，所到之处都会有障碍。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为人，如果你心中丝毫没有真诚，你将变得只不过是一个乞丐，你的所有事务都将是虚假的；在这个世界上行走，如果你既没有一丝温柔也没有和蔼可亲的性情，你将变得只不过是一个木偶：无论你走到哪里，你都会遇到阻碍。

text.ori_cn: 水不波则自定，鉴不翳则自明，故心无可清，去其混之者，而清自现；乐不必寻，去其苦之者，而乐自存。
text.man_en: If no waves arise, water will settle of itself; If no shadows cross it, the mirror will naturally be bright. Thus, the heart cannot be made pure, but if you avoid muddying elements Purity will appear on its own. Thus, pleasure should not be sought after, but if you avoid things that cause suffering, Pleasure will exist on its own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the water is not wave, then it will be fixed; if the light is not cataracted, then it will be clear; therefore, the heart is not clear; if it is mixed, then it will be clear; if it is happy, it is not necessary to seek; if it is bitter, then it will be happy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the water is not rippled, it will be stable by itself, and if the judgment is not obscured, it will be self-evident. Therefore, the mind cannot be pure. If you remove the confusion, the purity will appear by itself. There is no need to look for happiness. If you remove the suffering, happiness will exist by itself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Water remains calm by itself if undisturbed; a mirror reflects clearly by itself if unclouded. Therefore, the mind does not need purification; remove what confuses it, and clarity appears on its own. Happiness does not have to be sought; remove what causes suffering, and happiness naturally exists.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无波则水自静，无影则镜自明。因此，心灵无法变得纯净，但如果避免玷污，纯净就会自行出现。因此，快乐不应该被追求，但如果你避开那些会导致痛苦的东西，快乐就会自己存在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若无波起，水自沉；如果没有阴影穿过，镜子自然就明亮了。因此，心无法变得纯净，但如果你避免浑浊的元素，纯净就会自行显现。因此，不应追求快乐，但如果你避免导致痛苦的事物，快乐就会自行存在。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若无波涛水自静，若无阴影镜自明。故心不使之净，避浊自现清。故乐不必求，避苦自现乐。

text.ori_cn: 有一念犯鬼神之禁，一言而伤天地之和，一事而酿子孙之祸者，最宜切戒。
text.man_en: With just one thought, You can offend the commandments of the divine spirits. With just one word, You can injure the harmony of Heaven and Earth. With just one action, You can bring disaster on your descendants. You should take extreme caution.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who have a thought that violates the prohibitions of ghosts and gods, a word that injures the harmony of heaven and earth, or a matter that brings disaster to their children and grandchildren, should be most careful to avoid.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who violate the prohibitions of ghosts and gods with one thought, damage the harmony of heaven and earth with one word, or bring disaster to future generations with one thought, should be strictly abstained from.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One must be most vigilant against a single thought that violates the divine order, a single word that disrupts the harmony between heaven and earth, and a single action that brings calamity upon future generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只需一个念头，你就能触犯神灵的戒律。只需一句话，你就能破坏天地的和谐。只需一个动作，你就能给你的子孙带来灾难。你们应该格外谨慎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只要一念，你就能触犯神灵的戒律。只要一言，就能伤及天地之和。你只要一举一动，就能祸及子孙。您应该格外小心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只需一念，便可触犯神灵的戒律。只需一言，便可伤害天地的和谐。只需一举，便可给后代带来灾难。你应极其小心。

text.ori_cn: 事有急之不白者，宽之或自明，毋躁急以速其忿；人有操之不从者，纵之或自化，毋操切以益其顽。
text.man_en: Among things, there are those not well understood when hurried, But when approached leisurely, become clear of their own accord: Do not be impatient, and thus hasten others' wrath. In putting men to use, there are those who will not follow, But when left on their own, change by themselves: Be lenient in controlling others, so as not to increase their obstinacy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If something is urgent and not white, it will be wide or self-explanatory, and will not be anxious to speed up its wrath; if someone is manipulative and not obedient, it will be indulgent or self-developing, and will not be manipulative to benefit its stubbornness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If something is urgent and it is not clear, be lenient or it will be self-explanatory. Don't be impatient to speed up his anger; if someone is in a hurry and refuse to follow it, let it go or it will change on its own. Don't be impatient to benefit from its stubbornness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When affairs are urgent and unclear, be patient—they may resolve themselves without irritable haste. When people do not comply, be lenient—they may change of their own accord without strict enforcement.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有些事情，匆忙时不甚了解，但从容面对，就会豁然开朗：不要急躁，以免引起别人的愤怒。用人，有不从者；任之，则自变：管人要宽，以免增加他人的固执。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 事物之中，有匆忙时不明白的，但慢慢地接近时，自己就清楚了：不要急躁，从而激起别人的愤怒。用人者，有不从者；独处者，自变；宽以待人，免得徒增其刚愎。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在世间事物中，有些事在匆忙时难以理解，但从容不迫地去观察，便会自然而然地明了：不要心急，避免因此引起他人的愤怒。在用人方面，有些人一开始不愿意听从，但放手让他们自己处理，反而会自行改变：对他人要宽容控制，避免增加他们的固执。

text.ori_cn: 节义傲青云，文章高白雪，若不以性情陶镕之，终为血气之私，技能之末。
text.man_en: Having pride in your own integrity, looking down on high rank and office; Creating compositions more refined than famous works: If you do not knead your moral character like fine porcelain clay, In the end it is just like egotistical false courage: Clever but of poor workmanship.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The righteousness of the section is proud of the green clouds, the article is high white snow, if not to temperament pottery, the end of the blood of the private, the end of the skills.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Honesty and justice are proud of Qingyun, and articles are of high quality and snow. If they are not cultivated by temperament, they will end up being selfish and at the end of their skills.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Honor and integrity stand proudly like the clouds, and one's writings are as lofty as pristine snow. If one does not cultivate these qualities through genuine temperament, they will ultimately remain mere physical desires and superficial skills.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 自恃清高，看不起高官厚禄；创作比名著更高雅的作品：如果不把自己的品德像细瓷泥一样揉捏，到头来就会像自负的假勇气一样：聪明却拙劣。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 以自己的正直为荣，轻视高位和官职；创作出比名曲更精致的作品：如果不把自己的品德揉捏得像细瓷泥一样，到头来就像自负的假勇：聪明而拙劣。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以自洁自持为荣，蔑视高官厚禄；创作比名作更精致的作品：如果你不把自己的品德像细瓷土一样捏制，最终只会像虚荣的假勇气：聪明但做工粗糙。

text.ori_cn: 谢事当谢于正盛之时，居身宜居于独后之地。谨德须谨于至微之事，施恩务施于不报之人。
text.man_en: When resigning from an office, You should resign at the height of your strength. When finding a place for yourself, You should look for a place where you can be alone. When being purposeful about your conduct, You should be so in the smallest detail. When conferring favors, You should confer them on those unable to pay you back.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Thankfulness should be given at a time when it is in full bloom, and it is appropriate to live in a place where one is alone. Virtue must be honoured in the smallest things, and kindness must be bestowed on those who do not repay it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: You should give thanks when you are in your prime, and live in a place where you are the only queen. Virtue requires carefulness in the smallest things, and kindness to those who do not repay it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Gratitude should be expressed at times of great prosperity, and one should position oneself humbly in a place of modesty. Virtue must be practiced in the minutest of matters, and kindness should be extended to those who cannot return it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从办公室辞职时，你应该在自己最有能力的时候辞职。在为自己寻找安身之所的时候，你应该寻找一个可以独处的地方。在为自己的行为制定目标时，应在最小的细节上做到这一点。在给予别人恩惠时，应该给予那些无力偿还的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你辞去职务时，你应该在你最有能力的时候辞职。当你为自己寻找一个地方时，你应该寻找一个可以独处的地方。当你的行为有目的时，你应该在最小的细节上做到这一点。施予恩惠时，应当给予那些无力报答的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 辞职时，你应该在最巅峰的时候辞职。寻求自身位置时，你应该找一个可以独处的地方。注重行为时，你应该关注每一个细节。施恩惠时，你应该给予那些无法回报你的人。

text.ori_cn: 交市人，不如友山翁；谒朱门，不如亲白屋；听街谈巷语，不如闻牧唱樵歌；谈今人失德过差，不如述古人嘉言懿行。
text.man_en: Rather than associating with city people, Make friends with the old folks who live in the mountains. Rather than having audiences in crimson palaces, Become intimate with those who live in thatched huts. Rather than listening in on the talks of streets and ports, Let your ears be filled with the songs of woodcutters and cowherds. Rather than talking about your contemporaries' vices and blunders, Relate the fine sayings and actions of the men of old.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to make friends with the city people than with the mountain men; it is better to visit the vermilion gate than to kiss the white house; it is better to listen to the street talk than to hear the pastoral singing and woodcutter's song; it is better to talk about today's people's faults than to describe the ancient people's good words and good deeds.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to be a friend of a mountain man than to meet people in the city; it is better to be acquainted with a white house than to visit a noble family; it is better to listen to the talk in the streets than to hear the woodcutter singing; it is better to talk about the faults of modern people than to recount the good words and deeds of the ancients.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Interacting with city folks is not as good as befriending Old Man Shan; visiting affluent gates is not as rewarding as being intimate with humble homes; listening to street gossip is not as delightful as hearing pastoral songs of shepherds and woodcutters; discussing the faults and mistakes of contemporary people is not as meaningful as recounting the commendable words and deeds of ancient sages.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与其与城里人交往，不如与山里的老人交朋友。与其在深红色的宫殿里聆听，不如与住在茅草屋里的人亲近。与其聆听街头和港口的谈话，不如倾听樵夫和牧童的歌声。与其谈论同时代人的恶习和过失，不如讲述古人的佳言妙行。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与其和城里人交往，不如和住在山里的老人交朋友。与其在深红色的宫殿里接见，不如与住在茅草屋里的人变得亲密。与其聆听街头港口的谈话，不如让你的耳朵充满樵夫和牛郎的歌声。与其谈论同时代人的恶习和错误，不如讲述古人的好言好行。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与其与城市里的人来往，不如与住在山里的老人交朋友。与其在朱红色的宫殿里有观众，不如和住在茅草屋的人亲近。与其倾听街头巷尾的闲话，不如让你的耳朵充满樵夫和牧牛人的歌声。与其谈论当代人的恶行和过失，不如讲述古人的名言和善行。

text.ori_cn: 德者事业之基，未有基不固而栋宇坚久者。心者后嗣之本，未有本不立而枝叶茂荣者。
text.man_en: Character is the foundation of achievement. Where the foundation is not secure, There is yet to be a structure firm and longlasting. The heart is the root of one's descendants. Where the root is not well planted, There are yet to be flourishing branches and leaves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Virtue is the foundation of a career, and there is no building that is not solid and long-lasting. The heart is the foundation of the heir, and there is no branch or leaf that does not flourish.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The foundation of a virtuous person's career is that there is no foundation that is not solid but a building that remains strong for a long time. The heart is the foundation of future generations. Without the foundation, the branches and leaves will flourish.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Virtue is the foundation of enterprise; there has never been a case where the edifice stands firm without a solid foundation. The mind is the root of posterity; there has never been a case where the branches and leaves flourish without the root being established.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 品格是成就的基础。基础不牢，地动山摇。心是子孙的根。根基不牢，枝叶难茂。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 品格是成就的基础。基础不牢，就没有坚固持久的结构。心为子孙之根本。根未扎好，枝叶必不茂盛。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 品格是成就的基础。基础不牢固，就不会有坚固和持久的结构。心是后代的根基。根基不深厚，就不会有繁茂的枝叶。

text.ori_cn: 前人云：“抛却自家无尽藏，沿门持钵效贫儿。”又云：“暴富贫儿休说梦，谁家灶里火无烟？”一箴自昧所有，一箴自夸所有，可为学人切戒。
text.man_en: A man of former times spoke against, "Throwing away your own inexhaustible storehouse, And imitating the indigents who hold their bowls and line the gates. " Another has said, "Nouveau riche with indigent souls! Take a break from preaching dreams! Will fire from the stove of any house not make the smoke rise? " One verse warns against being blind to your own possessions. The other remonstrates against pride in what you own. Both can be important precepts for the student.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The former said, "Throw away your own endless stash, and hold a bowl along the door to serve the poor." He also said, "Don't talk about dreams of the rich and the poor; who has no smoke in the stove?" One proverb is to ignore everything and the other is to boast about everything, which can be a warning for the learners.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: An ancient saying goes: "Forsake your endless treasures at home and hold an alms bowl by the door to serve the poor." Another saying: "Poor children suddenly become rich and don't talk about their dreams. Whose family has no smoke in the fire?" One proverb is ignorant of what you have, and the other is boasting of what you have. , can be a warning for students.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The ancients said: 'Forsaking one's own boundless treasures, one goes around the doors with a begging bowl like a poor child.' They also said: 'A suddenly wealthy poor child should not speak of dreams; in whose kitchen is there fire without smoke?' One should neither be ignorant of what one possesses nor boast about it, which serves as a stern warning for scholars.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 前人有言："丢掉自己取之不尽用之不竭的宝库，去模仿那些拿着碗在门口排队的穷人。"还有人说："灵魂贫乏的新贵！别再宣扬梦想了！家家灶火不升烟？"一节诗警告人们不要对自己的财产视而不见。另一句则告诫人们不要以自己的财产为荣。这两点对学生来说都是重要的训诫。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 古人反对：“丢掉自己取之不尽用之不竭的仓库，效仿穷人捧着碗，排在门前。”另一个人则说：“灵魂贫乏的暴发户！休传梦想吧！会火的。”任何房屋的炉子都不会冒烟吗？”有一节经文警告不要对自己的财产视而不见。另一个则反对对自己所拥有的东西感到骄傲。两者对于学生来说都是重要的戒律。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 古人曾说：“抛弃你自己取之不尽的仓库而去效仿那些拿着碗排在人家门前的穷人。” 另一个人说：“暴发户的灵魂却依旧贫困！休息一下，别再鼓吹梦想了吧！任何房子的炉灶燃起的火，难道不会让烟上升吗？” 一则警告不要对自己的财产视而不见，另一则劝诫不要为拥有的东西而自傲。这两者对于学生来说都是重要的格言。

text.ori_cn: 道是一重公众物事，当随人而接引。学是一个寻常家饭，当随事而讲求。
text.man_en: The Way is in the public domain, And all should be encouraged to seek it. Learning is a like a daily meal, And its nourishment should be strongly recommended to all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Way is a public thing, when it is received as it is. Learning is a common household meal, and should be pursued in accordance with events.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Tao is a public matter and should be followed and guided by others. Learning is an ordinary job, and it should be paid attention to according to the situation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Way is a public matter, to be adapted to people for guidance. Learning is an everyday necessity, to be pursued according to circumstances.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大道之行也，天下为公。学习犹如一日三餐，应向所有人大力推荐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 道是公共领域的，应该鼓励所有人去寻求它。学习就像一日三餐，其营养值得大力推荐给大家。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道在公共领域，大家应鼓励追寻它。学习如每日之餐，其营养应强烈推荐给所有人。

text.ori_cn: 信人者，人未必尽诚，己则独诚矣；疑人者，人未必皆诈，己则先诈矣。
text.man_en: About the man who believes in others While others may not be entirely sincere: Sincerity will reside in him alone. About the man who doubts others While others may not be wholly fraudulent: Fraud will reside in him from the first.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you believe in people, they may not be sincere, but you are only sincere; if you doubt people, they may not be fraudulent, but you are fraudulent first.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you trust others, they may not be completely sincere, but you will be the only one who is sincere; if you doubt others, everyone may not be deceitful, but you will be the first to deceive.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who trust others may find that not everyone is entirely sincere, yet they themselves remain sincere; those who doubt others may find that not everyone is deceitful, yet they themselves become deceitful first.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 关于相信他人的人 虽然他人可能并不完全真诚：真诚只属于他自己。怀疑别人的人，别人未必完全是骗子：欺诈从一开始就存在于他心中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 关于相信别人的人 虽然别人可能并不完全真诚：但真诚只会存在于他自己。关于怀疑他人的人 虽然其他人可能并非完全欺诈，但欺诈从一开始就存在于他的内心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 关于那个信任他人的人，尽管其他人可能并不完全真诚：真诚只能存在于他自己身上。关于那个怀疑他人的人，尽管其他人可能并非完全欺骗：欺骗从一开始就在他身上存在。

text.ori_cn: 念头宽厚的，如春风煦育，万物遭之而生；念头忌刻的，如朔雪阴凝，万物遭之而死。
text.man_en: When your heart is allembracing and kind, It is like the spring breeze that warms and nurtures: All that meet you will grow. When your heart is cold and severe, It is like the northern snow that pales and stiffens all things: All that meet you will wither.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who is generous in his thoughts is like a warm spring breeze, by which all things come to life; and he who is scornful in his thoughts is like a snowy gloom, by which all things die.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Thoughts that are generous are like the warm spring breeze, and all things are born by them; thoughts that are harsh are like the condensation of snow, and all things die by them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thoughts that are generous are like the nurturing spring breeze, giving life to all things that encounter them; thoughts that are critical are like the harsh winter snow, bringing death to all things that come across them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你的心包容、善良，就像春风一样温暖、滋润：所有与你相遇的人都会成长。当你的心冰冷严酷，就像北方的雪，使万物苍白僵硬：所有与你相遇的人都会枯萎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的心包容一切、善良的时候，就像春风一样温暖滋养：凡是遇见你的都会成长。当你的心冷酷时，就像北方的雪一样，使万物变得苍白僵硬，与你相遇的一切都会枯萎。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你的心胸宽广而善良时，它就像春天的微风，温暖并滋养万物：所有遇到你的人都会成长。当你的心冷漠而严厉时，它就像北方的飞雪，令万物凋零：所有遇到你的人都会枯萎。

text.ori_cn: 为善不见其益，如草里东瓜，自应暗长；为恶不见其损，如庭前春雪，势必潜消。
text.man_en: Doing good without seeking profit Is like the melon growing among weeds: It develops unseen of its own accord. Committing evil without aiming to harm Is like the spring snow lying in the garden: It should melt naturally away, without note.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you don't see the benefit of doing good, like a melon in the grass, you should grow in the dark; if you don't see the damage of doing evil, like the snow in front of the garden, you will surely be eliminated.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Doing good without seeing its benefits is like a winter melon growing in the grass; doing evil without seeing its harm is like spring snow in front of the court, which is bound to fade away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Doing good without seeing its benefits is like a melon in the grass, naturally growing in the dark; committing evil without seeing its harm is like spring snow in the courtyard, inevitably melting away unnoticed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 行善而不求利，就像长在杂草中的瓜：它在不知不觉中自行生长。作恶而不害人，犹如春雪满园：自然消融，不留痕迹。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 行善而不求利，犹如瓜长在杂草中，不知不觉中就长出来了。作恶无害，如园中春雪，自然消融，不留痕迹。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 行善而不求利，就像瓜在草丛中生长：它在不为人见的情况下自行生长。作恶而不意图伤害，就像春雪在花园里躺着：它应该自然而然地融化，毫无踪迹。

text.ori_cn: 遇故旧之交，意气要愈新；处隐微之地，心迹宜愈显；待衰朽的辈，恩礼当愈隆。
text.man_en: When meeting old acquaintances, Your feelings should be animated all the more. When doing something hidden from view, Your frame of mind should be all the more on display. When waiting on others well past their prime, Your cordiality should be ever amplified.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you meet an old friend, your spirit should be new; when you are in a hidden place, your heart should be more visible; when you treat a decaying generation, your gift should be more prosperous.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you meet an old acquaintance, your spirit should become newer; when you are in a hidden place, your thoughts should become more obvious; when you are a declining generation, your kindness and courtesy should become more prosperous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When encountering old friends, your enthusiasm should be even fresher; when in obscure positions, your heart and intentions should be even clearer; when dealing with the elderly and frail, your kindness and respect should be even greater.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与老熟人见面时，你的感情应该更加活跃。在做隐蔽的事情时，你的心境应该更加显露。伺候已过不惑之年的人时，你的亲切感应该更加强烈。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 遇到老熟人，感情更要热烈。当做一些看不见的事情时，你的心态应该更加显露出来。待人已过盛时，你的热心应当不断放大。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 遇见老朋友时，你的情感应该更加生动。当做一些隐秘之事时，你的心态应该更加表现出来。当照顾那些已过巅峰的人时，你的热情应该更加倍增。

text.ori_cn: 勤者敏于德义，而世人借勤以济其贫；俭者淡于货利，而世人假俭以饰其吝。君子持身之符，反为小人营私之具矣。惜哉。
text.man_en: The word exertion originally counseled people to a moral sense, But the public has borrowed the term To deliver them from poverty. The word thrift originally lightened the people's sense of wealth, But the public has temporarily usurped the term To embellish stinginess. What the gentleman uses as a charm for his preservation, The smallminded employ to build their selfishness. Regrettable, indeed!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Diligent people are sensitive to virtue and righteousness, and the world borrowed diligence to help its poor; thrifty people fade in goods and profits, and the world fake thrift to decorate its stingy. The gentleman to hold the body of the talisman, but for the small man of the tool for personal gain. Pity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Diligent people are sensitive to virtue and justice, and the world uses diligence to help their poverty; frugal people are indifferent to material profits, and people in the world are frugal to cover up their stinginess. The talisman held by a gentleman is used by villains for personal gain. What a pity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The diligent are quick in virtue and righteousness, yet the common people use diligence to alleviate their poverty; the frugal are indifferent to wealth and profit, yet the common people use frugality to mask their stinginess. Thus, the principles by which a gentleman conducts himself are instead employed by petty people for their own selfish gains. How regrettable.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 勤奋一词原本是劝导人们要有道德感，但公众却借用它来使人们摆脱贫困。节俭一词原本是为了减轻人们对财富的感知，但公众却暂时篡夺了这个词来美化吝啬。君子以节俭为魅力，小人则以节俭为自私。确实令人遗憾！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “努力”这个词原本是劝人道德感的，但公众借用这个词是为了让他们摆脱贫困。节俭这个词本来是淡化人们的富贵感的，但大众却暂时篡用了这个词来修饰吝啬。君子以之为保身之符，小人以之为私。确实令人遗憾！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “努力”这个词最初劝人向善，但大众借用了这个词来摆脱贫困。“节俭”这个词最初减轻了人们对财富的感觉，但大众暂时篡夺了这个词来美化吝啬。君子用作保身的符咒，小人用来建立自私。确实令人遗憾！

text.ori_cn: 凭意兴作为者，随作则随止，岂是不退之车轮；从情识解悟者，有悟则有迷，终非常明之灯烛。
text.man_en: Practicing certain conduct only when the interest arises, You will sometimes practice, but sometimes cease to do so. How can you consider this progress without backsliding? 81 Being enlightened only as your emotions dictate, You will sometimes be enlightened, but sometimes be in doubt. In the end, this will not be the lamp of eternal light.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For those who act on the basis of intention, if they do as they please, they will stop as they please, and they will not be the wheel of non-return; and for those who understand from their feelings, if they are enlightened, they will be lost, and they will not be the candles of the lamps and lanterns of the light of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who act according to their will will stop as they act, how can they be a wheel that never retreats; those who understand based on emotion and consciousness will be confused when they have enlightenment, and will end up being a very bright candle.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who act on impulse will start and stop as they please; their progress is not like an undeviating wheel. Those who comprehend through emotions and understanding, where there is enlightenment, there will also be delusion; their insight is not like an ever-burning lamp.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有在有兴趣的时候，你们才会实践某些行为，你们有时会实践，但有时又会停止。你怎么能认为这是不退步的进步呢？81 只根据自己的情绪来开悟，你们有时会开悟，有时却会怀疑。最终，这将不是永恒之光。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有当兴趣出现时才实行某些行为，你有时会实行，但有时会停止这样做。如何看待这一进步而不倒退？ 81、随情而开悟，有时会开悟，有时又会疑惑。最终，这不会是永恒之光的灯。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只在有兴趣时才练习某种行为，你有时会练习，但有时会停止。你怎么能认为这不是进退维谷呢？只按情绪作祟才会觉悟，你有时会觉悟，但有时会怀疑。最终，这不会成为永恒的光明之灯。

text.ori_cn: 人之过误宜恕，而在己则不可恕；己之困辱宜忍，而在人则不可忍。
text.man_en: Tolerate the mistakes and faults of others, But not your own. Endure your own difficulties and disgrace, But not those of others.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to forgive a person's faults than to forgive one's own; it is better to endure one's own humiliation than to endure one's own.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The mistakes of others should be forgiven, but not to oneself; the hardships and humiliations of oneself should be tolerated, but not to others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One should forgive the mistakes of others, but not one's own; one should endure one's own hardships, but not those of others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 容忍别人的错误和过失，但不要容忍自己的错误和过失。忍受自己的困难和耻辱，但不能忍受别人的困难和耻辱。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 容忍别人的错误和过失，但不能容忍自己的错误和过失。忍受自己的困难和耻辱，而不是别人的困难和耻辱。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 容忍别人的错误和过失，但不要容忍自己的。忍受自己的困难和耻辱，但不要忍受别人的。

text.ori_cn: 能脱俗便是奇，作意尚奇者，不为奇而为异；不合污便是清，矫情求清者，不为清而为激。
text.man_en: To rid yourself of worldliness is extraordinary. Yet to deliberately respect the ordinary Will not make you so: it will only make you look strange. To remain aloof from the world's contamination is purity. Yet to sever ties with the world and seek the pure Will not make you so: it will only make you look extreme.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be able to escape from vulgarity is strange, and those who make a wish to be strange are not strange but different; to be untainted is to be clear, and those who seek to be clear in their pretensions are not clear but radical.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who can transcend vulgarity are strange, and those who intend to be strange are not strange but different; those who do not conform to the dirty are pure, and those who are pretentious and seek purity are not pure but exciting.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One who can transcend the common is truly extraordinary; those who deliberately seek extraordinariness often end up being merely different for the sake of being different. One who can remain untainted is genuinely pure; those who forcefully pursue purity often end up being merely pretentious for the sake of being pure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 摆脱世俗是非凡的。然而，刻意尊重平凡并不会让你变得平凡：它只会让你看起来很奇怪。远离世俗的污染是纯洁。然而，断绝与世俗的联系，追求纯粹，并不会让你变得纯粹：它只会让你显得极端。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 摆脱世俗是非凡的。然而刻意尊重平凡不会让你如此：它只会让你看起来很奇怪。远离尘世的污染，就是清净。然而，断绝与世俗的联系，追求纯粹，并不会让你如此，只会让你显得极端。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 要摆脱世俗是非凡的。然而，刻意尊重平凡不会使你变得如此：它只会使你显得奇怪。保持远离世俗的污染是纯洁的。然而，切断与世界的联系并寻求纯净不会使你变得如此：它只会让你显得极端。

text.ori_cn: 恩宜自淡而浓，先浓后淡者，人忘其惠；威宜自严而宽，先宽后严者，人怨其酷。
text.man_en: Favors conferred should at first be slight, and then more generous. If they are generous at first and later slight, People will forget their benefit. Authority imposed should at first be strict, and then more lenient. If it is lenient at first and later strict, People will resent its severity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Grace should be light and strong; if it is strong and then light, people will forget its favour; authority should be strict and wide; if it is wide and then strict, people will complain about its cruelty.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Favor should be light and then thick, if it is thick first and then light, people will forget its benefits; authority should be strict but broad, if it is broad first and then severe, people will complain about its harshness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Favors should start small and grow; if they start big and then lessen, people will forget the kindness. Authority should start strict and then loosen; if it starts loose and then tightens, people will resent the severity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 给予的恩惠应该先小后大。如果起初慷慨，后来轻微，人们就会忘记他们的好处。所施之权，先严后宽。如果先宽后严，人们就会反感其严厉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 给予的恩惠应该先是微薄的，然后是更大的。如果先宽厚，后来小薄，人们就会忘记自己的利益。权力的施加应该先从严，然后再从宽。如果先宽后严，人民就会怨恨它的严厉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 给予恩惠应先少后多，如果先多后少，人们会忘记恩惠。施加权威应先严后宽，如果先宽后严，人们会怨恨其苛刻。

text.ori_cn: 心虚则性现，不息心而求见性，如拨波觅月；意净则心清，不了意而求明心，如索镜增尘。
text.man_en: If the mind is empty, your true nature becomes manifest. If you do not shut off the mind, It will be like stirring up the waves, Then looking for the reflection of the moon. If the heart is unstained, the mind will be pure. If you do not make your mind clear, It will be like seeking out a mirror, Your very action covering it in dust.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the mind is empty, the nature will appear; if one does not rest the mind but seeks to see the nature, it is like plucking the waves to look for the moon; if the mind is pure, the mind will be clear; if one does not have the will but seeks to make the mind clear, it is like asking for a mirror to increase the dust.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the mind is empty, the nature will appear. If the mind is not still, seeking to see the nature is like looking for the moon by stirring the waves; if the mind is pure, the mind will be clear. If the mind is not clear, seeking to understand the mind is like looking for dust in a mirror.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the mind is uneasy, the true nature reveals itself; seeking to see one's true nature without calming the mind is like searching for the moon by stirring the waters. When the intentions are pure, the mind becomes clear; trying to clear the mind without understanding one's intentions is like cleaning a mirror by adding more dust.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心若空明，真性自现。心若不静，便如惊涛拍岸，明月当空。心不染，则心净。心不净，如明镜，举动蒙尘。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果心是空的，你的真实本性就会显现出来。若心不闭，则如激起波涛，而后寻月影。心若无染，则心清净。如果你的心不清晰，就像寻找一面镜子，你的行动却将它蒙上了灰尘。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若心空虚，真性显现。若不止心，如波涛泛起，再寻月影。若心无染，心亦清净。若不澄清心境，如探寻明镜，反使其蒙尘。

text.ori_cn: 我贵而人奉之，奉此峨冠大带也；我贱而人侮之，侮此布衣草履也。然则原非奉我，我胡为喜？原非侮我，我胡为怒？
text.man_en: When I have rank and people respect it, They are respecting my tall cap and great sash. When I am destitute and people despise me, They are despising my cotton garb and straw sandals. If this is so, they do not respect me from the first, So why should I be happy? They do not despise me from the first, So why become upset?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I am noble, people flatter me, and I flatter this crown and sash; when I am lowly, people insult me, and I insult this cloth and grass. If I am not flattered, why should I be happy? If I am not insulted, why should I be angry?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When I am noble, people respect me, and I wear this crown and belt; when I am humble, people insult me, and I humiliate my common clothes and grass shoes. But if you don't serve me, why should I be happy? You are not insulting me, why am I so angry?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When I am esteemed, people respect me, honoring the high hat and broad sash I wear; when I am despised, people insult me, scorning the coarse clothing and straw sandals I don. Therefore, it is not truly me they respect, so why should I be pleased? Nor is it me they insult, so why should I be angry?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当我有地位，人们尊重我时，他们尊重的是我的高帽子和大腰带。当我穷困潦倒时，人们鄙视我，鄙视我的棉衣和草鞋。既然如此，他们从一开始就不尊重我，我又何必高兴呢？他们又不是从一开始就瞧不起我，我又何必生气呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当我有地位并且人们尊重它时，他们也会尊重我的高帽和宽腰带。当我穷困潦倒时，人们鄙视我，他们也鄙视我的棉衣草鞋。既然如此，他们从一开始就不尊重我，那我又何必高兴呢？他们从一开始就没有鄙视我，那为什么要生气呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当我有地位，人们尊敬我时，他们尊敬的是我的高帽子和华美的腰带。当我贫困潦倒，人们鄙视我时，他们鄙视的是我的棉衣和草鞋。如果情况是这样的，他们从一开始就没有尊敬我，那我为何感到高兴？他们从一开始就没有鄙视我，那我为何感到难过？

text.ori_cn: “为鼠常留饭，怜蛾不点灯”，古人此等念头，今人学之，便是一点生生之机。无此，便所谓土木形骸而已。
text.man_en: For the sake of the mice, they always left out rice; In pity for the moths, they did not light the lamps. 84 Thoughts like these of the people of old Are the agencies that help us to flourish as human beings. Without them we are merely bodies Of earth and wood.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The ancient idea of "always leaving food for the rats and not lighting the lamps for the moths", which is learnt by the present generation, is a little chance of life. Without this, it is just a so-called earth and wood form.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Always leave food for rats, but don't light lamps in pity for moths." These ancient people's thoughts, if today's people learn from them, it will be a chance for survival. Without this, it is just the so-called earth and wood skeletons.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "Leave food for the mouse, show compassion to the moth by not lighting the lamp." If modern people learn from the ancients' sentiments, it could spark a bit of life's continuity. Without this, humans are merely bodies of earth and wood.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为鼠常遗饭，为蛾不点灯。84 古人的这种思想是我们人类繁衍生息的动力。没有它们，我们只是土木之躯。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为了老鼠，他们总是不吃米饭；为了怜悯飞蛾，他们没有点灯。 84 古人的这些思想是帮助我们作为人类蓬勃发展的动力。没有它们，我们只是泥土和木头的躯体。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为老鼠着想，他们总是留下米； 可怜飞蛾，他们不点灯。84 古人的这些想法 是帮助我们作为人类得以繁荣的动力。没有这些，我们就仅仅是 土木之躯。

text.ori_cn: 心体便是天体，一念之喜，景星庆云；一念之怒，震雷暴雨；一念之慈，和风甘露；一念之严，烈日秋霜；何者所感，只要随起随灭，廓然无碍，便与太虚同体。
text.man_en: The substance of the mind is nothing other than the substance of the universe. Thoughts of joy: auspicious stars and promising clouds. Thoughts of anger: rattling thunder and violent gales. Thoughts of benevolence: soft winds and sweet dew. Thoughts of severity: hot summer days and autumn frosts. Which of these natural phenomena could you diminish? It is necessary only to follow their rise and their decrease, To be fully open and to put up no barriers. In this way you become one fabric with the origin of the stars.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The body of the mind is the body of heaven, a thought of joy, the stars and clouds; a thought of anger, thunderstorms; a thought of mercy, the wind and manna; a thought of severity, the sun and autumn frost; what is felt, as long as with the rise and disappearance of the contours of the unobstructed, will be the same body with the emptiness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The mind is like the celestial body. A thought of joy brings the stars and clouds; a thought of anger brings thunder and rain; a thought of kindness brings gentle wind and dew; a thought of severity brings the scorching sun and autumn frost; whatever you feel, as long as it rises and goes away, there is nothing wrong with it. , then they are of the same body as Taixu.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The nature of the heart is akin to the nature of the cosmos. A single thought of joy brings auspicious stars and propitious clouds; a single thought of anger brings thunder and torrential rain; a single thought of compassion brings gentle breezes and sweet dew; a single thought of sternness brings scorching sun and autumn frost. Whatever the emotion, as long as it arises and dissipates freely, the heart and the cosmos remain as one.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心灵的实质就是宇宙的实质。喜悦之念：吉星高照，云开雾散。怒之念：雷霆万钧，狂风大作。仁慈之念：和风与甘露。严酷之念：炎炎夏日和秋霜。你能减少这些自然现象中的哪一种呢？只需跟随它们的涨落，完全敞开心扉，不设任何障碍。这样，你就与星辰之源融为一体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心的本质无非是宇宙的本质。喜念：吉祥星、有希望云。嗔恨的念头：雷霆轰鸣，狂风大作。仁慈的思想：和风甘露。严重的思想：夏季炎热，秋季霜冻。您可以减少哪些自然现象？只须随其兴衰，全然开放，不加任何壁垒。这样你就成为了与星星起源的一种织物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心灵的本质无非就是宇宙的本质。喜悦的思绪：吉祥的星辰和祥和的云彩。愤怒的思绪：轰鸣的雷声和猛烈的狂风。仁爱的思绪：柔和的微风和甘甜的露水。严厉的思绪：炎热的夏天和秋天的霜冻。你能减少哪一种自然现象呢？只需要顺应它们的兴起和衰退，完全敞开而不设障碍。这样你就会与星辰的起源融为一体。

text.ori_cn: 无事时，心易昏昧，宜寂寂而照以惺惺；有事时，心易奔逸，宜惺惺以而主以寂寂。
text.man_en: In uneventful times, The mind is easily distracted. Then you should make yourself still and let your true nature shine. When things are happening all around you, The mind is easily scattered, Then you should make your true nature shine and allow your center to become still.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When there is nothing going on, the mind is prone to obscurity, and it is appropriate to be silent and illuminate with sympathy; when there is something going on, the mind is prone to run away, and it is appropriate to be sympathetic and dominate with silence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When there is nothing, the mind is easy to be confused, so it is better to be still and illuminate with tranquility; when there is something, the mind is easy to run away, so it is better to be peaceful and still.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When there is nothing to do, the mind tends to be dim, so it is advisable to remain calm and illuminate it with clarity; when there is something to do, the mind tends to be restless, so it is advisable to maintain clarity and govern it with calmness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在平淡无奇的日子里，心绪很容易分散。那么你就应该让自己静下来，让你的真性情发光发热。当周围的事情发生时，心很容易散乱，这时你应该让自己的本性闪耀，让自己的中心变得静止。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 平淡无奇的时候，心很容易分心。然后你应该让自己安静下来，让你的真实本性闪耀。当周围发生事情的时候，心很容易散乱，那么你应该让你的本性闪耀，让你的中心安静下来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在平静的时刻，心容易分散。这时你应该让自己静下来，让你的本性展现。当周围发生许多事情时，心容易混乱，这时你应该让你的本性展现，并使你的内心保持平静。

text.ori_cn: 议事者，身在事外，宜悉利害之情；任事者，身居事中，当绝利害之虑。
text.man_en: When you want to discuss a subject, Put yourself outside the matter And fathom the situation's advantages and disadvantages. When you want to take up a matter, Put yourself in the middle of the thing And forget all reflections on profit and loss.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who discuss matters should be aware of the advantages and disadvantages when they are outside the matter; those who are in charge of matters should stop thinking about the advantages and disadvantages when they are in the middle of the matter.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who discuss matters should be aware of interests when they are outside the affairs; those who are in charge of affairs should be in the midst of affairs and should avoid concerns about interests.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: An advisor, positioned outside the matter, should understand the advantages and disadvantages comprehensively; whereas an executor, involved in the matter, should put aside concerns about personal gain and loss.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你想讨论一个问题时，把自己置身于事情之外，思考事情的利弊得失。当你想处理一件事时，把自己置身事外，忘却一切利弊得失。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你想讨论一个话题时，把自己置于事情之外，了解情况的优点和缺点。当你想要处理一件事时，把自己置于事情的中间，忘记所有对利润和损失的思考。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你想要讨论一个主题时，把自己置于事外，揣摩局势的利弊。当你想要着手处理一件事时，把自己置于其中，忘记一切对得失的反思。

text.ori_cn: 士君子处权门要路，操履要严明，心气要和易，毋诡随而陷腥膻之党，亦毋矫激而忘蜂虿之危。
