text.man_en: When the true gentleman finds himself in a place of authority or importance, He must conduct himself strictly in the light of day, Keeping his mind both gentle and easy. He must not let down his guard And fall in with those who smell of selfinterest or greed. Nor must he follow extremes And end up stung with the poison of his own scorpions and wasps.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholarly gentlemen in the power of the door to the road, the conduct to be strict, the heart to be easy, no tricky with and trapped in the fishy party, and no excitement and forget the danger of an insect.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman is on the right path to a powerful family. He should be strict in his behavior and be at ease in his attitude. He should not be cunning and fall into the party of fishy people, nor should he be so exaggerated that he forgets the danger of bees and flies.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman in a position of power must maintain strict and clear ethical conduct, while keeping a calm and amiable demeanor. He should neither deceitfully follow impure cliques nor blindly resist, forgetting the dangers of hidden threats.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当真正的绅士发现自己身居要职或重要地位时，他必须在阳光下严格要求自己，保持温和从容的心态。他绝不能放松警惕，与那些充满私利或贪婪气息的人同流合污。他也不能走极端，最终被自己的蝎子和黄蜂毒死。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真正的君子，当处于权贵地位的时候，一定要严格按照白天的规矩行事，保持内心的温和和从容。他决不能放松警惕，与那些带有自私或贪婪气味的人为伍。他也不能走极端，最终被自己的蝎子和黄蜂的毒液蜇伤。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当真正的绅士身处权力或重要地位时，他必须严格以光明正大的方式行事，保持他的心既温和又安详。他不得放松警惕，与那些充满私利或贪婪的人同流合污。他也不应走向极端，最终被自己身上的蝎子和黄蜂的毒刺所伤。

text.ori_cn: 标节义者，必以节义受谤；榜道学者，常因道学招尤；故君子不近恶事，亦不立善名，只要和气浑然，才是居身之宝。
text.man_en: The man who makes honor his main attraction Is bound to receive ridicule. The man who makes philosophy his signboard Forever invites faultfinding. Therefore, the gentleman Neither approaches evil Nor seeks a reputation for being good. Only in the gem of harmonious concord does he reside.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The person who labelled righteousness will be slandered for righteousness; the list of Taoist scholars is often attracted by Taoism; therefore, a gentleman does not approach evil things, nor does he establish a good name, as long as he is peaceful and harmonious, he is the treasure of his life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who stand for integrity will be slandered for their integrity; scholars who promote Taoism are often recruited because of their Taoism. Therefore, a gentleman does not do evil things, nor does he have a good reputation. As long as he is harmonious and harmonious, he is the treasure of his life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who uphold integrity often face slander because of it; those who promote moral teachings frequently attract criticism due to their teachings. Therefore, a noble person neither draws close to evil deeds nor seeks a reputation for doing good. Maintaining a harmonious demeanor is the true treasure for one's conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以荣誉为荣的人，必然会受到嘲笑。以哲学为招牌的人，永远会招来非议。因此，君子既不趋炎附势，也不沽名钓誉。只有在和谐的宝石中，他才能安身立命。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 以荣誉为主要吸引力的人注定会受到嘲笑。以哲学为永远招牌的人招致挑剔。所以君子不近恶，不求善。他只居住在和谐和谐的宝石中。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以荣誉为主要吸引力的人，必然会招致嘲笑。以哲学为标榜的人，永久地邀请挑剔。因此，君子既不接近邪恶，也不追求美名。惟在和谐一致的宝石中，君子才安身。

text.ori_cn: 遇欺诈的人，以诚心感动之；遇暴戾的人，以和气薰蒸之；遇倾邪私曲的人，以名义气节激砺之；天下之人，无不入我陶冶中矣。
text.man_en: If you meet a deceiver, Move him with sincerity; Of you meet a bully, Imbue him with harmony. If you meet a perverse or selfseeking person, Encourage him with moral duty and integrity. There is nothing under Heaven I cannot knead or mold.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Encounter fraudulent people, moved by sincerity; encountered violent people, and gas fumigation; encountered dumping evil private song of people, to the name of the temperament to sharpen; the world of people, no not into my pottery carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you meet those who are deceitful, move them with your sincerity; when you meet those who are violent, diffuse them with your gentleness; when you meet those who are evil and selfish, stimulate them with your honor and integrity; everyone in the world will be edified by me.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When encountering fraudulent people, move them with sincerity; when encountering violent people, calm them with gentleness; when encountering deceitful and selfish people, inspire them with integrity and honor. In this way, everyone in the world will be influenced by my example.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你遇到一个骗子，请用真诚打动他；如果你遇到一个恶霸，请用和谐感染他。若遇倒行逆施者或自私自利者，则以道义和正直鼓励他。普天之下，莫非王土；率土之滨，莫非王臣。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 遇到骗子，以诚心感动他；若遇恶霸，与他和睦。如果你遇到一个乖僻或自私的人，以道德责任和正直来鼓励他。天底下没有我不能揉捏、不能塑造的东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若遇欺骗之人，以诚待之；若遇凶横之人，以和谐感化之。若遇偏执或自私之人，以道义和正直劝导之。天下无不可捏作之物。

text.ori_cn: 一念慈祥，可以酝酿两间和气；寸心洁白，可以昭垂百代清芬。
text.man_en: With even a touch of charity, You can brew harmony to fill Heaven and Earth. With one small pinch of purity, You can bequeath a clarity and fragrance to last a hundred generations.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A thought of kindness, can brew two peace; inch of heart white, can show down a hundred generations of Qingfen.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A kind thought can brew harmony between two people; a pure heart can shine through generations.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A single thought of kindness can foster harmony in two households; a pure heart can leave a lasting legacy of virtue for generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 哪怕是一丁点的慈善，你也能酿造出充盈天地的和谐。只要一小撮纯净，您就能留下清澈和芬芳，流芳百世。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 哪怕一点点的布施，也能酿出和谐充盈天地。只要一小撮纯度，您就可以将清澈和芬芳留给一百代人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只要怀有一丝慈善之心，你就能酿造出充满天地的和谐。只要怀有一丝纯净，你就可以为百代留下清晰和芬芳。

text.ori_cn: 阴谋怪习，异行奇能，俱是涉世的祸胎。杀身的利器，只一个庸德庸行，便可以完混沌而召和平。
text.man_en: Obscure plots and strange conventions, Eccentric behavior and mysterious abilities— Together, these are the roots of disaster that spread throughout the world. Only with ordinary virtues and ordinary behavior Can you make your original nature replete And beckon harmony in.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conspiracy and strange habits, strange behaviour and strange abilities are all the scourges of the world. The sharp weapon that kills the body, only a mediocre virtue and mediocre behaviour, can complete the chaos and call for peace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Conspiracies, strange habits, strange behaviors and miraculous abilities are all the troubles in the world. The weapon of death, with just a mediocre act, can end chaos and summon peace.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Plots of strange customs, bizarre actions and extraordinary abilities are all sources of misfortune in dealing with the world. A single unremarkable virtue and mediocre conduct can bring harmony to chaos and call forth peace.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 晦涩的情节和奇怪的惯例，古怪的行为和神秘的能力--这些都是遍布世界的灾难根源。只有以平凡的品德、平凡的行为，才能使自己的本性变得丰满，并召唤和谐的到来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 晦涩的情节和奇怪的惯例，古怪的行为和神秘的能力——这些都是席卷世界的灾难的根源。只有用平常的德行，平常的行为，才能让你的本性充实起来，招来和谐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 晦涩的情节和奇怪的常规，古怪的行为和神秘的能力——一起，这些是传播在全世界的灾难根源。只有用平凡的美德和平凡的行为，才能让你的本性充实，并招来和谐。

text.ori_cn: 语云：“登山耐侧路，踏雪耐危桥。”一耐字极有意味。如倾险之人情，坎坷之世道，若不得一耐字撑持过去，几何不堕入榛莽坑堑哉。
text.man_en: An old saying goes, "When climbing a mountain, you endure the steep roads; When walking through snow, you endure the narrow bridges. " The one word endure Has considerable significance. Human nature is steep, and the road through this world vexing If people do not acquire endurance for support, Won't many fall into a thicket or ditch?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As the saying goes, "Climbing mountains is resistant to side roads, treading snow is resistant to dangerous bridges." The word "patience" is very meaningful. Such as the danger of the human condition, the world of the bumpy road, if you do not have a word of patience to support the past, geometry does not fall into the hazelnut pit moat.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As the saying goes: "You can endure side roads when climbing mountains, and you can endure dangerous bridges when walking on snow." The word "resistant" is very meaningful. Such as dangerous human relationships and rough world, if you don't have the patience to hold on to the past, you will easily fall into a rough pit.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As the saying goes, 'Enduring the side paths of mountain climbing and the perilous bridges in the snow.' The word 'endurance' here carries profound meaning. Much like the treacherous nature of human emotions and the tumultuous world, without the support of endurance, how many would not fall into the pitfalls and brambles?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 古语有云："登山，忍路陡；踏雪，忍桥窄。一个 "忍 "字，意味深长。人性陡峭，世路艰辛，如果没有忍耐力做支撑，岂不是会有很多人跌入草丛或沟渠？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 古人云：“登山者忍路险，行雪者忍桥窄。”“忍”字具有相当的意义。人性是险峻的，人世间的路是坎坷的，如果没有忍耐力作为支撑，很多人不都会掉进灌木丛、沟渠里吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 俗话说：“上山要忍受陡峭的道路；过雪地要忍受狭窄的桥梁。” 这个“忍”字有相当重要的意义。人性是陡峭的，而人生之路是坎坷的。如果人们不学会以忍耐作为支持，岂不是很多人都会掉进荆棘或沟壑吗？

text.ori_cn: 夸逞功业，炫耀文章，皆是靠外物做人。不知心体莹然，本来不失，即无寸功只字，亦自有堂堂正正做人处。
text.man_en: Those who are proud of their accomplishments, or put up their knowledge like lamps for all to see Are relying on externals to make themselves men. They should know that When the mind shines like a jewel and one's original nature is not lost, Though they have performed no great deeds, nor have knowledge of writing, They will be naturally dignified and correct. They become men of their own accord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To boast of one's achievements and to show off one's writings is to rely on external things to be a man. I do not know that the heart is clear, the original is not lost, even if there is not an inch of work only words, but also has its own place of uprightness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Boasting achievements and showing off articles are all based on external things. I don't know that the clarity of mind and body is not lost originally. Even if I don't have an inch of merit, I still have an upright and upright life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Boasting about achievements and flaunting literary prowess are all reliant on external things to define oneself. Unaware that the essence of the heart is inherently pure and never lost, even without notable accomplishments or noteworthy writings, one can still uphold integrity and dignity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些居功自傲的人，那些把自己的知识像灯一样摆在众人面前的人，都是靠外在的东西使自己成为人。他们应该知道，当心如明珠般闪耀，本性不失时，虽然没有丰功伟绩，也不懂文墨，也会自然而然地端庄端正。他们会主动成为人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些为自己的成就感到自豪的人，或者把自己的知识像灯一样展示给所有人看的人，都是依靠外在来使自己成为男人。当知心明如珠，本性不失，虽无大事，无文识，自然端正端正。他们自愿成为男人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些以成就自豪，或炫耀知识如灯给众人看的人，是依赖外在的东西来成就自己。他们应该知道，当心灵如宝石般闪耀，而本性不丧失时，虽未立下大功，亦无写作知识，他们自然会庄重而端正，顺其自然地成为真正的人。

text.ori_cn: 忙里要偷闲，须先向闲时讨个把柄；闹中要取静，须先从静里立个根基；不然，未有不因境而迁，随时而靡者。
text.man_en: When you are busy but want to steal leisure time, Before enjoying it Search out the right place for your mind. When the situation is chaotic and you want to find peace, First, you must establish the mind's autonomy earlier, When you are at peace. If this is not done, You will be tossed about by your surroundings, Or flutter like a flag in the wind of events.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Busy to steal leisure, must first to idle time to ask for a handle; to take the quiet in the noise, must first from the quiet to set up a foundation; otherwise, there is not not due to the situation and move, at any time and the people.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you want to take some time off while you are busy, you must first ask for an excuse when you are free; if you want to find tranquility in the midst of chaos, you must first establish a foundation in tranquility; otherwise, there is no one who will not change according to the circumstances and become extinct at any time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To find leisure amidst busyness, one must seek a handle in times of idleness; to find tranquility amidst turmoil, one must establish a foundation of calmness. Otherwise, it is inevitable to be swayed by circumstances and drift with the times.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你忙碌而又想偷闲时，在享受闲暇之前，先为自己的心灵寻找一个合适的位置。当局势混乱而你想寻求平静时，首先，你必须在平静时提前建立心灵的自主性。如果做不到这一点，你就会被周围的环境所折腾，或像一面旗帜在事件的风中飘扬。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你忙碌却想偷闲的时候，在享受它之前，先找一个适合你心灵的地方。当局势混乱而你想寻求平静时，首先你必须早点建立心灵的自主性，当你平静时。如果不这样做，你就会被周围的环境抛来抛去，或者像一面旗帜在事件的风中飘扬。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你忙碌但想偷得浮生半日闲时，享受之前，先为你的心找个合适的地方。当局势混乱你想找到平静时，首先，你必须在心境安宁时就早些建立心的自主。如果这一点没有做到，你会被周围的环境所左右，或者像旗帜在事件的风中飘扬。

text.ori_cn: 不昧己心，不尽人情，不竭物力；三者可以为天地立心，为生民立命，为子孙造福。
text.man_en: Do not let your mind become clouded, Do not deplete the good will of others, Do not exhaust the vigor of things. With these three, You will be able to establish your mind in accord with Heaven and Earth, Bring your fate into balance with that of the people, And build a good estate for the sake of your descendants.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Do not obscure your own heart, do not exhaust human feelings, and do not exhaust material resources; the three can establish the heart for heaven and earth, the life of the people, and the well-being of future generations.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Do not neglect one's own heart, do not fulfill the feelings of others, and do not exhaust material resources; these three can establish a heart for the world, establish a destiny for the people, and benefit future generations.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Not going against one's conscience, not solely catering to human emotions, and not exhausting natural resources; these three principles can establish a heart for heaven and earth, determine the destiny for the people, and bring blessings for future generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 勿以善小而不为，勿以恶小而为之，勿以善小而不为。有了这三点，你就能与天地合其心，与万物合其命，为子孙后代建立一个美好的家园。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 莫让自己的心变得昏暗，莫让别人的善意被耗尽，莫让事物的元气耗尽。有了这三者，就能立心合天地，调平民运，为子孙建良业。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不要让你的心变得迷茫，不要消耗别人的善意，不要耗尽事物的活力。有了这三条，你就能使你的心与天地相协，与你的命运和人民的命运平衡，并为你的后代建立一个良好的基业。

text.ori_cn: 居官有二语，曰：“惟公则生明，惟廉则生威。”居家有二语，曰：“惟恕则情平，惟俭则用足。”
text.man_en: When working in an official capacity, Follow two modes of advice. As they say, If there is impartiality, clarity will grow. If there is honesty, authority will grow. When at home, There are two kinds of advice. As they say, If there is sympathy, emotions will be at peace. If there is thrift, what is used will be sufficient.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Officials have two words, said: "but the public is born bright, but clean is born Wei." At home there are two words, said: "but forgiveness is the love of peace, but thrift is used enough."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There are two sayings for being an official, saying: "Being honest will bring wisdom, being honest will bring authority." There are two sayings for being at home, saying: "Only being forgiving will bring peace of mind, but being frugal will be enough."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There are two principles for being an official: 'Only fairness brings clarity, only integrity brings authority.' There are two principles for household management: 'Only forgiveness brings harmony, only frugality brings sufficiency.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在以官方身份开展工作时，遵循两种建议模式。俗话说：公正则明。廉则威。在家时，有两种建议。所谓 "恻隐之心，人皆有之。俭，则用足。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 以官方身份工作时，请遵循两种方式的建议。正如他们所说，如果有公正性，清晰度就会提高。如果有诚实，权威就会增长。在家时，有两种建议。正如他们所说，如果有同情心，情绪就会平静。如果有节俭，用什么就够了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在公务中，有两种建议需要遵循。正如他们所说，如果有公正，清晰度会增长。如果有诚实，权威性会增长。在家中，有两种建议需要遵循。正如他们所说，如果有同情，情感会平和。如果有节俭，所需的将会足够。

text.ori_cn: 处富贵之地，要知贫贱的痛痒；当少壮之时，须念衰老的辛酸。
text.man_en: When in a place of wealth and rank, Pay attention to the suffering of the poor and humble. During the time of your youth and vigor, Guide your thoughts to the hardships of the old and feeble.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are in a rich place, you should know the pain and itch of poverty; when you are young and strong, you should remember the sorrows of aging.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you are in a place of wealth, you must know the pain of poverty; when you are young and strong, you must remember the pain of aging.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In times of wealth, one should understand the afflictions of poverty; in moments of youth, one must remember the hardships of old age.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你身处富贵之地时，请关注穷人和卑微者的苦难。在你年轻气盛的时候，引导你的思想关注老弱者的艰辛。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 身处富贵之位，关注贫贱之苦。在你青春年华、精力充沛的时候，引导你思念老弱的艰辛。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 身处富贵之地时，留意贫穷与卑微者的苦难。在你青春活力之际，将思绪引向老弱者的艰辛。

text.ori_cn: 持身不可太皎洁，一切污辱垢秽，要茹纳些；与人不可太分明，一切善恶贤愚，要包容得。
text.man_en: In carrying yourself through the world, Do not try to be overly pure. One needs to ingest A morsel of disgrace and defacement, too. In associating with others, Do not be too scrupulous. One needs to embrace Both the good and the evil, both the clever and the dull.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The body should not be too bright, all insults and dirt, to Ru Na some; with people should not be too clear, all the good and evil virtuous and foolish, to be tolerated.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The body should not be too pure, and all insults and filth should be tolerated; it should not be too clear-cut with others, and all good and evil, wise and foolish, should be tolerated.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One should not be too spotless in conduct; one must tolerate some insults and filth. One should not be too clear-cut when interacting with others; one must be able to embrace both good and bad, the virtuous and the foolish.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在这个世界上，不要让自己过于纯洁。人也需要吃一点耻辱和污点。在与他人交往时，不要过于肆无忌惮。善与恶，聪明与愚钝，都需要包容。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 带着自己走过这个世界，不要试图变得过于纯洁。一个人也需要吸收一点耻辱和污损。与人交往时，不要太拘谨。一个人需要拥抱善与恶、聪明与愚钝。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在行事做人方面，不要追求过于纯洁。人需要接受一点耻辱和玷污。在与人交往时，不要过于谨慎。人需要包容善与恶，聪明与愚钝。

text.ori_cn: 休与小人仇仇，小人自有对头；休向君子谄媚，君子原无私惠。
text.man_en: Give up confronting little men; Little men will, of themselves, confront each other. Give up fawning upon men of high quality; Men of high quality are, from the beginning, without selfinterest.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Don't hate the little man, the little man has his own enemy; don't flatter the gentleman, the gentleman has no personal favour.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't be enmity with villains, villains have their own enemies; don't flatter gentlemen, for gentlemen have no selfish favors.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not seek revenge against petty people; they have their own foes. Do not fawn over righteous people; they show benevolence without favoritism.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 放弃与小人物对抗；小人物本身就会相互对抗。放弃向高尚的人献媚；高尚的人从一开始就没有私利。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 放弃与小人物对抗；小人物会自行对抗。放弃对高品质男人的奉承；高素质的人，从一开始就没有私利。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 放弃与小人对抗；小人们自然会彼此对抗。放弃讨好高质量的人；高质量的人从一开始就没有私心。

text.ori_cn: 纵欲之病可医，而执理之病难医；事物之障可除，而义理之障难除。
text.man_en: The disease of blatant desire can be cured, But the disease of excusemaking is difficult to alleviate. The obstacles of external affairs and things can be displaced, But the obstacles of Reason are difficult to remove.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The disease of indulgence can be cured, but the disease of reasoning is difficult to cure; the barrier of things can be removed, but the barrier of righteousness is difficult to remove.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Diseases caused by indulgence in lust can be cured, but diseases caused by grasping principles are difficult to cure. Obstacles caused by things can be removed, but obstacles caused by principles and principles are difficult to remove.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sickness from indulgence can be cured, but the illness from rigid reasoning is hard to heal; obstacles from things can be removed, but barriers from principles are difficult to eliminate.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 明目张胆的欲望之病可以治愈，但找借口的疾病却难以缓解。外物之障可除，理性之障难除。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 欲望之病可以治愈，借口之病却难以缓解。外事事物的障碍可以移走，但理理的障碍却难以消除。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 露骨欲望之病可医，推脱借口之病难解。外物之障可移，理障之难除。

text.ori_cn: 磨砺当如百炼之金，急就者，必非邃养；施为宜似千钧之弩，轻发者，决无宏功。
text.man_en: Polishing and burnishing yourself Is comparable to forging metal a hundred times: The man who prepares himself too quickly will have no deep breeding at all. Undertaking a task with competence Is comparable to pulling a stone bow of a thousand pounds: The man who shoots lightly will have no effect at all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sharpening should be like the gold of a hundred refinements, and those who are in a hurry will not be profoundly nurtured; it is appropriate to apply it like the crossbow of a thousand pounds, and those who send it out lightly will never achieve any great success.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Grinding should be like gold that has been refined a hundred times, and those who are hasty will not be able to cultivate it carefully; giving it appropriately is like a powerful crossbow, and those who use it lightly will never achieve great results.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sharpening should be like the forging of gold undergoing a hundred practices; those who rush will surely not achieve deep cultivation. Actions should resemble a crossbow that withstands a thousand pounds; those who act lightly will certainly not attain great accomplishments.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 打磨自己，锤炼自己，无异于百炼成钢：揠苗助长者，其养必不深。工欲善其事，必先利其器：轻射者无功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 磨砺自己，犹如锻金百遍：准备太快的人，根本没有深厚的教养。能干事，如拉千斤石弓，轻射者无功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 磨炼和抛光自己犹如锻造金属百次：准备得太快的人根本不会有深厚的修养。胜任地承担任务犹如拉动千斤石弓：轻率射箭的人根本不会有任何效果。

text.ori_cn: 宁为小人所忌毁，毋为小人所媚悦；宁为君子所责备，毋为君子所包容。
text.man_en: It is better to incur the displeasure of small men Than to receive their flattery. It is better to receive the criticism of men of high quality Than to obtain their toleration.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to be scorned and destroyed by a villain than to be flattered by a villain; it is better to be chastised by a gentleman than to be tolerated by a gentleman.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to be jealous and destroyed by the villain than to be flattered by the villain; it is better to be blamed by the gentleman than tolerated by the gentleman.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Better to be slandered by petty people than to be flattered by them; better to be criticized by noble people than to be tolerated by them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 与其接受小人的奉承，不如招致小人的不快。与其得到高人的宽容，不如接受他们的批评。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宁可招致小人物的不悦，也不要接受他们的阿谀奉承。与其获得他们的宽容，不如接受高素质人士的批评。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宁受小人怨，不受小人谄。宁受君子谏，不受君子容。

text.ori_cn: 好利者，轶出于道义之外，其害显而浅；好名者，窜入于道义之中，其害隐而深。
text.man_en: Those who love profit run along the outside of the Way: Their mischief is apparent and shallow. Those who love fame hide like mice in the burrow of the Way: Their mischief is hidden and deep.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are interested in profit are outside of morality and righteousness, and their harm is obvious and shallow; those who are interested in fame are in morality and righteousness, and their harm is hidden and deep.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are fond of profit are outside of morality, and their harm is obvious and superficial; those who are fond of fame are hidden and deep in harm.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who seek profit often stray beyond the realm of morality, causing obvious yet shallow harm; whereas those who seek fame embed themselves within moral boundaries, causing hidden and profound harm.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 利欲熏心的人在 "道 "的外侧奔走：他们的恶行浅显易懂。爱名者如鼠，藏于道之穴：他们的恶行隐蔽而深刻。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 贪利者走道外，其恶行明显而浅薄。贪爱名声的人，就像老鼠藏在道穴里，其祸害是深藏不露的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 爱好利益的人在道之边缘奔跑：他们的恶行是显而易见且浅显的。爱好名声的人像老鼠一样隐藏在道的洞穴里：他们的恶行是隐藏且深远的。

text.ori_cn: 受人之恩，虽深不报，怨则浅亦报之；闻人之恶，虽隐不疑，善则显亦疑之。此刻之极，薄之尤也，宜切戒之。
text.man_en: Receiving a favor, and though it is considerable, Not repaying it; Drawing enmity, and though it is light, Returning it in style; Hearing of ill deeds, and though they are unclear, Having no doubt about them; Then, when good is apparent, doubting it altogether— Such ways are the far end of cruelty; This is brutality in the extreme. You should be careful about this.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Receiving people's favour, although deep not to report, the grudge is shallow also reported; heard people's evil, although hidden not to suspect, the good is also suspected of the obvious. This carving of the extreme, thin especially also, should be cut to prevent.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you receive kindness from others, you will not repay it even if it is deep; if you receive resentment, you will repay it if it is shallow; if you hear the evil of others, you will not doubt it even if it is hidden; if you hear the kindness of others, you will still doubt it. At this moment, it is extremely extreme, especially thin, so it is advisable to avoid it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To receive kindness from others and not repay it even if it is profound, but to repay even the smallest grievance; to hear of others' wrongdoings without doubt even if they are hidden, but to suspect the obvious good deeds — this is the extreme of injustice and the height of inconsistency. It must be strictly avoided.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 受人之恩，虽重而不报；招人之怨，虽轻而不还；闻人之恶，虽不明而不疑；见人之善，虽明而不疑--这就是残忍的极端；这就是野蛮的极端。你们应该对此小心谨慎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 受恩虽大而不报答；结仇虽轻，还礼有礼；闻恶业，虽不明，不疑；然后，当善事显而易见时，却完全怀疑它——这样的方式就是残忍的尽头；这是极端的残酷。你应该小心这一点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 受人恩惠，虽大亦不报；得罪于人，虽轻必报；闻他人之恶，虽不明亦不疑；察他人之善，虽显著亦生疑——此皆残酷之极。此为极度残忍之行。对此应当谨慎。

text.ori_cn: 谗夫毁士，如寸云蔽日，不久自明；媚子阿人，似隙风侵肌，无疾亦损。
text.man_en: Slanderers and gossips Are like thin clouds covering the sun: It will not be long before they clear up of themselves. Flatterers and toadies Resemble the gusts of wind that brush our flesh: One is not conscious of any damage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Slanderers destroy soldiers, like an inch of cloud covering the sun, soon to be clear; charming son of a person, like a gap wind invasion of muscle, no disease is also damage.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A slanderous husband destroys a scholar, like an inch of cloud covering the sun, which will soon become clear; a charming person is like a crack of wind invading the flesh, even if there is no disease, it will be damaged.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A slanderer who destroys a gentleman is like a small cloud covering the sun; it won't be long before the truth is revealed. A sycophant who flatters others is like a draught that invades the body; even without illness, it still causes harm.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诽谤者和流言蜚语者就像遮住太阳的薄云：过不了多久，它们就会自行消散。奉承者和谄媚者就像拂过我们肉体的阵风：人们不会意识到任何伤害。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 诽谤和流言蜚语，就像薄云遮住了太阳，不久就会消散。阿谀奉承者与阿谀奉承者，如一阵风拂过肉身，不知所受的伤害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 诽谤者和长舌妇就像遮住太阳的薄云：不过多久它们自己就会散开。拍马屁者和阿谀奉承者像刮过我们皮肤的阵风：人们意识不到任何伤害。

text.ori_cn: 山之高峻处无木，而谿谷回环则草木丛生；水之湍急处无鱼，而渊潭停蓄则鱼鳖聚集。此高绝之行，褊急之衷，君子重有戒焉。
text.man_en: On high mountain peaks, there are no trees, but in river valleys and meandering places Grasses and trees grow dense. Where water swirls or moves rapidly, there are no fish, but in deep pools and quiet places Fishes and turtles congregate. Thus is the gentleman extremely cautious Of lofty actions Or quick emotions.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no wood in the mountains, but grass grows in the squabbles and valleys; there is no fish in the rapid waters, but fish and turtles gather in the abyssal pools. This high and extreme behaviour, small-mindedness, the gentleman has a serious warning.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There are no trees in the high mountains, but there are thick vegetation in the winding valleys; there are no fish in the rapid water, but there are fish and turtles gathering in the deep pools. This is a noble act, a desperate act, and a gentleman should take precautions.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Where the mountains are lofty and steep, no trees grow; but in the winding valleys, vegetation flourishes. Where the water is swift, no fish can live; but in the deep pools where the water is still, fish and turtles gather. This reflects the extreme paths and urgent thoughts, of which the wise always remain cautious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 高山上没有树木，但在河谷和蜿蜒的地方，草木茂盛。水流湍急的地方没有鱼，但在深潭和幽静的地方却有鱼和乌龟聚集。因此，君子对高尚的行为或急躁的情绪要格外谨慎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 高高的山峰上，没有树木，但在河谷和蜿蜒的地方，草木茂密。水流湍急的地方，没有鱼，但深潭幽静的地方，鱼和鳖聚集。因此，君子对崇高的行为或急躁的情绪极其谨慎。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在高山之巅，没有树木，但在河谷和曲折的地方，草木繁茂。在水流湍急或水流急速的地方，没有鱼，但在深潭和静水处，鱼龟聚集。因此，君子极其谨慎，对于高尚的行为或迅速的情感。

text.ori_cn: 建功立业者，多圆融之士；偾事失机者，必执拗之人。
text.man_en: Of those who have accomplished great deeds or established important enterprises, Many were unprejudiced and harmonious fellows. But those who have muddled affairs or lost their chances, Were invariably men of attachment and obstinacy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Whoever builds up a successful career is a man of many rounded minds; whoever ruins things and loses the chance must be an obstinate man.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have made great achievements are mostly harmonious people; those who miss opportunities in things will be stubborn people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who achieve great deeds are often adaptable individuals; those who fail and miss opportunities are invariably stubborn people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在那些成就伟业或建立重要企业的人中，许多人都是没有偏见、和睦相处的人。但那些把事情弄得一团糟或失去机会的人，无一例外都是执着而固执的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些成就伟大事迹或创办重要企业的人，很多都是不带偏见、和睦相处的人。但凡是搞乱了事情、失去了机会的人，都是执着执着的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些成就伟业或建立重要事业的人，许多是无偏见且和谐的人。而那些搞砸事情或错失机会的人，无一例外是固执己见和执着的人。

text.ori_cn: 处世不必与俗同，亦不宜与俗异；作事不必令人喜，亦不可令人憎。
text.man_en: Living in the world, You should not imitate what is common, But should not deviate from it either. Conducting events, You should not make people angry, nor should you make them glad.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not necessary to be the same as the common people in the world, nor is it advisable to be different from the common people; it is not necessary to be pleasing to the eye, nor to be detestable in one's work.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no need to behave in the same way as the world, nor should it be different from the world; do things need not be pleasing to others, nor should they be hated.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In life, one need not conform to the common ways, nor should one deliberately be different; in actions, one need not seek to please everyone, but should also avoid being detested.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为人处世，不可人云亦云，但也不可离经叛道。做人做事，既不能让人生气，也不能让人高兴。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人活在世上，不应该效仿世俗，但也不应该偏离世俗。举办活动，不应该让人生气，也不应该让人高兴。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 生活在世上，你不应该模仿常见的行为，但也不应偏离它。处理事情时，你不应该让人生气，也不应该让人高兴。

text.ori_cn: 日既暮而犹烟霞绚烂，岁将晚而更橙橘芳馨。故末路晚年，君子更宜精神百倍。
text.man_en: When the sun is setting, Patterns of haze and mist become all the more brilliant. When the year comes to its end, The oranges and tangerines are all the more fragrant. Thus, on the road to his later years, The gentleman should quicken his spirit one hundredfold.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sun is at its twilight, but it is still a brilliant haze, and the year will be late, but it is even more fragrant with oranges and tangerines. Therefore, at the end of his life, a gentleman should be more energetic.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As the sun sets, the smoke is still gorgeous, and as the year approaches, the sky becomes more orange and fragrant. Therefore, in old age, a gentleman should be more energetic.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Though the day draws to a close, the sky remains resplendent with hues of clouds, and as the year approaches its end, the fragrance of oranges and tangerines becomes even more pronounced. Therefore, in the twilight of one's journey and later years, a gentleman should exhibit even greater vigor and spirit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 夕阳西下，雾霭更灿烂。岁暮，橘桔更香。故君子于晚年，当百倍地振奋精神。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 夕阳西下，薄雾缭绕的图案显得更加绚丽。到了年末，橘子橘子更香了。所以，君子在晚年的路上，应该精神百倍。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 夕阳西下时，烟雾图案更加璀璨。岁末之时，橙子和橘子更加芳香。因此，在通往晚年之路上，君子应振奋百倍精神。

text.ori_cn: 鹰立如睡，虎行似病，正是他攫鸟噬人法术。故君子要聪明不露，才华不逞，才有任重道远的力量。
text.man_en: When the hawk soars, it looks asleep. When the tiger walks, it seems to be ailing. But in truth, this is their means of seizing their prey. Thus the gentleman Should not let his wisdom show, Nor give his ability free play. Only then will he have the capacity To shoulder the vast and carry the weighty.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The eagle stands like a sleeper, and the tiger walks like a sick man, and it is he who seizes the bird and devours the man. Therefore, a gentleman should not reveal his intelligence and talent, and only then will he have the strength to carry on his work.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The eagle stands as if sleeping, and the tiger moves as if it is sick. This is his magic of grabbing birds and biting people. Therefore, a gentleman must be smart and not show off his talents, so that he can have the strength to carry out long and hard work.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: An eagle stands as if asleep, a tiger moves as if sick, yet this is precisely their technique for seizing birds and devouring people. Therefore, a gentleman should be wise without showing it, talented without flaunting it, to have the strength to bear heavy responsibilities and achieve great distances.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 鹰翱翔时，它看起来睡着了。当老虎行走时，它似乎在生病。其实，这是它们捕捉猎物的手段。因此，君子不应该让自己的智慧显露出来，也不应该让自己的能力自由发挥。只有这样，他才有能力肩负起巨大的责任，扛起沉重的担子。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当鹰翱翔时，它看起来像是睡着了。当老虎行走时，它似乎生病了。但事实上，这是他们夺取猎物的手段。所以君子不应该让自己的智慧显露出来，也不应该让自己的能力自由发挥。唯有如此，他才有能力担大任重。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 鹰飞时，看似在睡觉；虎行时，似乎在病中。但实际上，这是它们捕捉猎物的方式。因此，君子不应显露他的智慧，也不应尽显他的才华。唯有如此，他才能有能力承担庞大与重任。

text.ori_cn: 俭，美德也，过俭则为悭吝，为鄙啬，反伤雅道；让，懿行也，过让则为足恭，为曲谨，多出机心。
text.man_en: Thrift is a beautiful virtue. But if it goes too far, it becomes stinginess Or a vulgar miserliness, And damages the True Way. Deference to others is excellent behavior. But if it goes too far, it becomes excessive politeness Or a twisted reverence, And may give birth to twisted designs.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Thrift, virtue, too thrifty for stingy, for mean, hurt the elegant way; let, Yi line, too let is enough to be polite, for curtness, more out of the machine.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Frugality is a virtue. Excessive frugality is stinginess, stinginess, and harms elegance. Yielding is also a virtue. Excessive moderation is respectful, prudent, and clever.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Frugality is a virtue, but excessive frugality turns into stinginess, into miserliness, and harms the noble path; humility is a commendable conduct, but excessive humility turns into obsequiousness, into servility, and often arises from cunning intentions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 节俭是一种美好的美德。但如果节俭过头，就会变成吝啬或庸俗的吝啬，损害正道。尊重他人是极好的行为。但如果做得太过分，就会变成过分的礼貌或扭曲的敬畏，还可能产生扭曲的图谋。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 节俭是一种美丽的美德。如果太过了，那就是吝啬，或者是庸俗的吝啬，而损害了正道。尊重他人是优秀的行为。但如果太过分了，就会变成过度的礼貌或者扭曲的崇敬，并且可能会产生扭曲的设计。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 节俭是一种美德。但如果过度了，就变成了小气或者一种粗俗的吝啬，并会损害真正的道。对他人的尊重是优秀的行为。但如果过度了，就变成了过分的礼貌或者一种扭曲的敬意，并可能会产生扭曲的意图。

text.ori_cn: 毋忧拂意，毋喜快心，毋恃久安，毋惮初难。
text.man_en: Do not be distressed when events turn counter to your wishes; Do not be overjoyed when things go your way. Do not count on lengthy contentment; Do not shy away from first difficulties.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Don't worry about what you want to do, don't be happy about what you want to do, don't rely on long term security, and don't be afraid of the first difficulties.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't be worried about your mind, don't be happy and happy, don't rely on long-term peace, don't be afraid of initial difficulties.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not worry over discontent, do not rejoice over delight, do not rely on long-standing peace, do not dread initial difficulties.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 事与愿违，不要苦恼；事与愿违，不要欣喜若狂。不要指望长久的满足，不要回避最初的困难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当事态与你的意愿背道而驰时，不要感到沮丧；当事情进展如你所愿时，不要高兴得不得了。不要指望长久的满足；不要回避最初的困难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 事情不如愿时不要沮丧；顺利时不要过于喜悦。不指望长久的满足；不逃避初始的困难。

text.ori_cn: 宴饮之乐多，不是个好人家；声华之习胜，不是个好士子；名位之念重，不是个好臣工。
text.man_en: Those who take pleasure in banquets and drinking bouts Do not have good households. Those who struggle for reputation and showiness Are not true gentlemen. Those who think too much about name and position Are not good administrators.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A man who feasts and drinks too much is not a good man; a man who is used to sound and splendour is not a good scholar; a man who thinks too much of fame and position is not a good courtier.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A man who enjoys a lot of banquets and feasts is not a good family; a man who is accustomed to fame and glory is not a good scholar; a man who cares about fame and position is not a good minister.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A family that indulges excessively in banquets and drinking is not a good family; a scholar who places too much emphasis on fame and reputation is not a true scholar; an official who is overly concerned with rank and status is not a loyal servant.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以宴会和酒局为乐的人没有好家庭。沽名钓誉的人不是真正的君子。过多考虑名声和地位的人不是好的管理者。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 喜欢宴饮饮酒的人，家庭并不好。那些争名夺利的人，不是真正的君子。过分注重名誉和地位的人不是好的管理者。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 喜好宴饮之人，家室不兴。争名夺利之徒，非正人君子。贪念名利之辈，难成良吏。

text.ori_cn: 世人以心惬处为乐，却被乐心引入苦处；达士以心拂处为乐，终由苦心换得乐来。
text.man_en: People think pleasure satisfies the mind, But in seeking pleasure They are drawn into suffering. The accomplished think pleasure runs against their hearts' desire; And in the end, it is through suffering That pleasure is gained.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man of the world takes pleasure where his heart is comfortable, but he is led into bitterness by a happy heart; the great man takes pleasure where his heart is whisked away, but he is exchanged for pleasure by a bitter heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People in the world take pleasure in the places where their hearts are comfortable, but are led into suffering by their joy. Dashi take pleasure in places where their hearts are caressing, but they finally get happiness through painstaking efforts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ordinary people find pleasure in what is pleasing to the heart, but this pursuit often leads to suffering; the wise find happiness in what is challenging to the heart, ultimately turning hardship into joy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们以为快乐能满足心灵，但在追求快乐的过程中却陷入了痛苦。有成就的人认为快乐违背了他们内心的渴望；而最终，快乐是在痛苦中获得的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人们认为快乐可以满足心灵，但在寻求快乐的过程中却陷入痛苦。所达到的思想快乐与他们内心的愿望背道而驰；最终，只有通过痛苦才能获得快乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们认为快乐能满足内心，但在追求快乐的过程中，他们却陷入了痛苦。有成就的人认为快乐违背了他们内心的愿望；最终，正是通过痛苦才获得了快乐。

text.ori_cn: 居盈满者，如水之将溢未溢，切忌再加一滴；处危急者，如木之将折未折，切忌再加一搦。
text.man_en: A life of total satisfaction is like water Rising to the lip of the jug, But not overflowing: Even one more drop would be too much. A life in a state of crisis is like a tree Sawn nearly through But not quite toppling: Even one slight push would bring it down.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For those who live in fullness, like water that is about to overflow, do not add another drop; for those who are in danger, like wood that is about to break, do not take another hold.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When it is full, it is like water that is about to overflow but is not overflowing. Do not add another drop. When it is in danger, it is like a tree that is about to break but is not yet broken. Do not add another drop.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are full to the brim are like water on the verge of overflowing; not a single drop more should be added. Those who are in extreme danger are like wood on the verge of breaking; not the slightest pressure should be applied.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 完全满足的生活就像水涨到壶口，但不会溢出来：哪怕再多一滴也嫌多。危机四伏的生活就像一棵树，几乎被锯断，但还没有完全倒塌：即使轻轻一推，也会倒下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 完全满足的生活就像水上升到罐子的边缘，但不溢出：即使多一滴也太多了。处于危机状态的生命就像一棵树，几乎被锯断，但还没有完全倒塌：即使轻轻一推，它也会倒塌。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一种完全满足的生活就像水涨到壶口，但不过溢：哪怕再多一滴也会太多。一种处于危机状态的生活就像一棵几乎被锯断的树，但还未完全倒下：哪怕轻轻一推也会倒下。

text.ori_cn: 冷眼观人，冷耳听语，冷情当感，冷心思理。
text.man_en: A cool eye discerns men's character. A cool ear hears the intent of their speech. Cool emotions plumb others' feelings. A cool mind thinks through Principle.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Cold eyes to see people, cold ears to hear words, cold feelings when feeling, cold heart to think.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Look at people with cold eyes, listen with cold ears, feel coldly, and think coldly.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Observe people with a cold eye, listen to words with a cold ear, feel emotions with a cold heart, and think things through with a cold mind.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一双冷静的眼睛能洞察人的性格。冷静的耳朵能听到他们说话的意图。冷静的情感能洞悉他人的感受。冷静的头脑思考原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 冷静的眼光可以看出男人的性格。冷静的耳朵能听出他们讲话的意图。冷静的情绪会影响他人的感受。冷静的头脑会思考原则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 冷静的眼睛辨别人的性格。冷静的耳朵听出他们言语中的意图。冷静的情感测知他人的感受。冷静的头脑通晓事理。

text.ori_cn: 仁人心地宽舒，便福厚而庆长，事事成个宽舒气象；鄙夫念头迫促，便福薄而泽短，事事得个迫促规模。
text.man_en: The mind of a man of humanity is loose and at ease; 93 With his fortune ample and his happiness extended, His spirit is carefree in every situation. The thoughts of a meanhearted man are cramped and constrained; With his happiness shallow and his prosperity short, He looks restless at every turn.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a benevolent person has a generous heart, he will be blessed with a thick and long celebration, and everything will become a generous weather; if a despicable person has a hasty thought, he will be blessed with a thin and short zephyr, and everything will be a hasty scale.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a benevolent person has a relaxed mind, his blessings will be abundant and his blessings will be long, and everything will be a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere; if a mean man's thoughts are urgent, his blessings will be thin and his benefits will be short, and everything will be in a hurry.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A benevolent person has a charitable heart, leading to lasting blessings and a relaxed demeanor in all matters; whereas a narrow-minded person is always anxious and short-sighted, resulting in fleeting fortunes and a hasty approach in everything.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个有人性的人的思想是宽松自在的；93 他的财富充足，幸福绵长，他的精神在任何情况下都是无忧无虑的。吝啬之人的思想狭窄而拘束；他的幸福肤浅，富足短暂，动不动就显得焦躁不安。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 仁人之心是松散自在的； 93、财物丰足，福乐绵长，精神随遇皆自在。心地狭隘的人的思想是狭隘的、受限制的；他的幸福浅薄，繁荣短暂，他看上去处处焦躁不安。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 仁者心宽而安；93 行运广，福寿多，神怡气静处处安。小人心窄拘束；福薄寿浅，处处不安。

text.ori_cn: 闻恶不可就恶，恐为谗夫泄怒；闻善不可急亲，恐引奸人进身。
text.man_en: Hearing of evil, do not be quick to rile: It may be a slanderer giving vent to his ire. Hearing of good works, do not hastily advance friendship: It may be the wicked enticing you.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you hear of evil, you must not be evil, for fear that you may be a slanderer; if you hear of good, you must not be hasty to kiss, for fear that you may lead a traitor into your body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you hear something bad, don't act evil, for fear of venting your anger on the slanderer; if you hear something good, don't rush into intimacy, for fear of attracting traitors.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Upon hearing about evil, do not approach it, fearing the wrath of slanderers; upon hearing about good, do not hastily embrace it, fearing the advancement of deceitful people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 听到恶言，不要急于发怒：可能是诽谤者在泄愤。闻善行，勿遽交：可能是恶人在引诱你。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 听到恶事，不要急于发怒：这可能是诽谤者的泄愤。听到善行，不要急于增进友谊：可能是恶人引诱你。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 听到恶事，不要急着恼怒：可能是恶意中伤者在发泄愤怒。听到善行，不要急着结交朋友：可能是恶人引诱你。

text.ori_cn: 性躁心粗者，一事无成；心和气平者，百福自集。
text.man_en: The man whose mind is quicktempered and rude Accomplishes not one thing. For the man whose mind is harmonious and calm, One hundred blessings gather of themselves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are impatient and rough-minded will achieve nothing; those who are calm and peaceful will be blessed with a hundred blessings.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are impatient and have a rough mind will achieve nothing; those who have a peaceful mind and a calm mind will gather a hundred blessings.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are impatient and hasty achieve nothing; those who are calm and composed gather blessings naturally.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 脾气急躁粗鲁的人一事无成。心平气和者，百福自聚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心性急躁、粗鲁的人，一事无成。心调和平静的人，百福自聚。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心性急躁粗鲁的人，什么事也完成不了。而心性和谐平静的人，百福自会来临。

text.ori_cn: 用人不宜刻，刻则思效者去；交友不宜滥，滥则贡谀者来。
text.man_en: In employing others, Do not be too strict. Otherwise, those who exert themselves will leave. In making friends, Do not go to extremes. Otherwise, flatterers will soon be at your side.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not advisable to employ people in a deliberate manner, for if you do, those who want to be effective will go away; it is not advisable to make friends indiscriminately, for if you do, those who flatter will come.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not advisable to hire people with care, because those who want to be effective will go; it is not advisable to make friends indiscriminately, and those who are indiscriminate will come with tribute and flattery.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One should not be overly harsh when employing people; being harsh will drive away those who think about being effective. One should not be indiscriminate in making friends; being indiscriminate will attract sycophants.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在用人方面，不要过于严格。否则，用力过猛的人就会离开。在交友方面，不要走极端。否则，谄媚者很快就会出现在你身边。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 用人方面，不要太严格。否则，那些努力的人就会离开。交朋友时，不要走极端。否则，阿谀奉承者很快就会站在你这边。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 用人不要太苛严。否则，努力的人会离开。交友不要太极端。否则，阿谀奉承的人会很快出现在你身边。

text.ori_cn: 风斜雨急处，要立得脚定；花浓柳艳处，要著得眼高；路危径险处，要回得头早。
text.man_en: When the wind is blustery and the rain falls Suddenly, you should stand and plant your feet. When the flowers are in full bloom and the willows most charming, You should fix your sights a little higher. When the road is dangerous and the narrow paths steep, You should do an aboutface without delay.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where the wind and the rain are fast, you must be sure of your feet; where the flowers are thick and the willows are colourful, you must have high eyes; where the road is dangerous, you must turn back to your head early.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Where the wind is slanting and the rain is severe, one must stand firm; where the flowers and willows are thick, one must keep one's eyes high; where the road is dangerous and the path is dangerous, one must turn back early.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the face of slanting wind and driving rain, stand firm; amidst the lush blossoms and beautiful willows, maintain a high standard; on perilous roads and dangerous paths, be quick to turn back.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 风萧萧兮易水寒，壮士一去兮不复还。当鲜花盛开，杨柳依依的时候，你应该把目光放得更高一些。路险路陡时，应立即转身。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 风大雨骤时，应站稳脚跟。花开柳暗花明时，你的眼光应该放得高一点。当道路险峻、窄路陡峭时，应立即掉头。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当风吹得猛烈，雨突然降临时，你应该站稳脚跟。当花儿盛开，柳树最迷人的时候，你应该把视线升高一点。当道路危险，狭窄的小径陡峭时，你应该立即掉头。

text.ori_cn: 节义之人济以和衷，才不启忿争之路；功名之士承以谦德，方不开嫉妒之门。
text.man_en: The man of high integrity Redeems himself with a sense of harmony, And only then keeps the road to quarrel unopened. The man of distinguished service Complies with a sense of humility, And from the first keeps the gates of jealousy closed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man of integrity and righteousness is in harmony, so as not to open the path of wrath; the man of honour and fame is in humility, so as not to open the door of envy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Only those who are honest and righteous will not open the door to anger and strife; only those who have merit and honor will be modest and will not open the door to jealousy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who embody virtue and righteousness unite with harmonious intentions, thus avoiding the path of strife and anger; those aspiring for honor and fame uphold humility, thereby not opening the door to jealousy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正直的人以和为贵，只有这样，才能避免争吵。功勋卓著的人以谦卑之心行事，从一开始就紧闭嫉妒之门。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子以和气赎己，方能止争口之道。有功之人，怀有谦卑之心，自始关闭嫉妒之门。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 高尚品格的人以和谐自救，唯有如此才不会打开争吵之门。功勋卓著的人以谦逊为本，一开始便关闭嫉妒之门。

text.ori_cn: 士大夫居官，不可竿牍无节，要使人难见，以杜幸端；居乡不可崖岸太高，要使人易见，以敦旧好。
text.man_en: The high official— In office, he should exercise moderation in his writings and letters So as to make it difficult for others to see through him, Thus obstructing opportunistic schemes. When retired to the country, he should not appear so elevated as cliffs and peaks but make it easy for others to see him, Thus making old friendships more cordial.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholars in the officialdom, not pole and paper without section, to make it difficult to see, in order to eliminate the fortunate end; living in the countryside can not be too high cliffs, to make it easy to see, in order to Dun the old good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When a scholar-bureaucrat is in an official position, he should not have unruly poles and tablets. He should make it difficult for people to see him and use Du Xingtuan. When he lives in the countryside, he should not have the cliffs too high.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For an official, it is essential not to be excessively burdened with documents and appointments, so as to make it difficult for people to gain unwarranted favors; when residing in the community, it is important not to be too aloof, so as to make it easy for people to interact, thus maintaining old friendships.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 达官贵人--在任时，文笔和书信要有节制，让别人难以看透，从而阻挠投机取巧。退居乡野时，不要像悬崖峭壁一样高高在上，要让别人容易看清自己，这样才能让老朋友更加亲切。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大官——在位时，要克制自己的文章和书信，以免别人看穿他，从而阻碍机会主义的图谋。退居乡下时，不应显得高高在上，如悬崖峭壁，而要容易让人看见，从而使旧交更加亲切。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 高官——在任时，他应在写作和书信中保持适度，以便让他人难以看透他，从而阻止投机取巧的计划。退隐乡野时，他不应显得像悬崖峭壁般高不可攀，而应让他人容易见到他，从而使旧友谊更加亲切。

text.ori_cn: 大人不可不畏，畏大人则无放逸之心；小民亦不可不畏，畏小民则无豪横之习。
text.man_en: You should stand in awe of great men. Doing so, Your mind will contain no selfindulgence. You should stand in awe of the humble. Doing so, You will have no reputation as highhanded.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are afraid of adults, then you will not have a heart of indolence; if you are afraid of the little people, then you will not have a habit of being arrogant.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't be afraid of adults, because if you are afraid of adults, you won't be arrogant; if you are afraid of small people, you won't be arrogant.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The elders should be respected, for respecting the elders prevents carelessness; the common people should also be respected, for respecting the common people prevents arrogance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你应该敬畏伟人。这样，你的心中就不会有自我放纵。你应该敬畏谦卑的人。这样，你就不会有高高在上的名声。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你应该对伟人感到敬畏。这样做，你的心就不会包含自我放纵。你应该对谦卑的人感到敬畏。这样做，你就不会有霸道的名声了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你应该敬畏伟人。这样做，你的内心就不会有自我放纵。你应该敬畏谦卑的人。这样做，你就不会有高傲的名声。

text.ori_cn: 事稍拂逆，便思不如我的人，则尤怨自消；心稍怠荒，便思胜似我的人，则精神自奋。
text.man_en: When events run a little against your desires, Direct your thoughts to those who are not as well off. Then resentment and blame will of themselves disappear. When your mind becomes a bit slovenly, Direct your thoughts to those who have excelled beyond your own lot. Then your spirits will of themselves be restored.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If I think of those who are not as good as I am when things are a bit rough, then my grudges will go away; if I think of those who are better than I am when things are a bit dull, then I will be invigorated.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When things are a little unfavorable, I will think about people who are not as good as me, and my resentment will disappear; when my heart is a little lazy, I will think about people who are worse than me, and my spirit will be invigorated.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When things go against your wishes, think of those who are worse off than you, and your grievances will naturally disappear. When your spirit becomes lazy, think of those who are better than you, and your motivation will naturally rise.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当事情的发展与你的愿望有些背道而驰时，把你的思绪引向那些生活不如意的人。这样，怨恨和责备就会自行消失。当你的思想变得有点邋遢时，把你的思想引向那些超越你自己命运的人。这样，你的精神就会得到恢复。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当事情与你的愿望有些背道而驰时，请将你的想法转向那些境况不佳的人。然后怨恨和责备就会自行消失。当你的思想变得有点邋遢时，请将你的思想转向那些比你自己更优秀的人。然后你的精神就会自行恢复。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果事情稍微不如你所愿，把你的想法转向那些不如你幸运的人。这样，一切怨愤和责难就会自行消失。当你的心情有点懒散时，把你的想法转向那些比你更优秀的人。这样，你的精神自然会恢复。

text.ori_cn: 不可乘喜而轻诺，不可因醉而生嗔，不可乘快而多事，不可因倦而鲜终。
text.man_en: Do not be carried away with happiness and lightly give your consent. Do not be carried away by drunkenness and give rise to your anger. Do not be carried away with lighthearted compliance and make your affairs many. Do not be carried away by disinterest and lessen your final efforts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: You must not multiply joy and make light promises, you must not become angry because of drunkenness, you must not multiply pleasure and do many things, and you must not become weary and have little end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't take advantage of joy and make light promises, don't take advantage of being drunk and become angry, don't take advantage of speed and become troubled, and don't end up dying because of tiredness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Do not make promises lightly in moments of joy, do not give in to anger when drunk, do not be overly busy in times of happiness, and do not lack perseverance when weary.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不要被幸福冲昏头脑，轻率地同意。勿因醉酒而忘乎所以，导致怒火中烧。莫因轻顺而多事。莫因无趣而忘乎所以，减少最后的努力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要高兴得冲昏头脑，轻率地表示同意。不要因醉酒而产生愤怒。不要被轻松的顺从冲昏了头脑，把你的事情搞得很多。不要被冷漠冲昏了头脑，从而减少了你最后的努力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不可因喜悦而轻率同意。不可以因醉酒而引起愤怒。不可以因轻易顺从而让事务繁多。不可以因冷漠而减少最后的努力。

text.ori_cn: 善读书者，要读到手舞足蹈处，方不落筌蹄；善观物者，要观到心融神洽时，方不泥迹象。
text.man_en: The person who reads books carefully Should read until "his hands dance and his feet stamp";96 Then, from the first, he will not fall into "net and snares. "97 The person who perceives things well Should look until his mind merges and his spirit softens; Then, from the first, the outward traces will not be muddied.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are good at reading should read to the place where their hands and feet dance, so as not to fall into the trap; those who are good at observing things should observe to the time when their hearts are in harmony with God, so as not to mud signs.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A person who is good at reading should read to the point where the hands and feet are dancing, so that he will not fall off his feet; a person who is good at observing things should observe that when the heart is in harmony with the spirit, there will be no trace of mud.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are adept at reading should reach a state of jubilation, only then will they not be ensnared by superficialities; those who are skilled at observing should reach a state of soul and spirit integration, only then will they not be bogged down by appearances.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 认真读书的人，应该读到 "手舞足蹈"；96 这样，从一开始，他就不会陷入 "网罗和陷阱"。"97 善于观察事物的人，应该一直看下去，直到他的思想融合，他的精神变得柔软；这样，从一开始，他就不会被外在的痕迹所迷惑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 细心读书的人，应该读到“手舞足蹈”；96那么，从此，他就不会陷入“网罗”。 97、善于洞察事物的人，应该看到心融为一体。他的精神软化了；那么，从一开始，外在的痕迹就不会被弄脏。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 用功读书的人要读到 “手舞足蹈”； 然后，从一开始，他就不会落入 “网和陷阱。” 感知事物敏锐的人应该看直到心灵相融，精神柔和；然后，从一开始，外部的痕迹就不会被弄脏。

text.ori_cn: 天贤一人，以诲众人之愚，而世反逞其所长，以形人之短；天富一人，以济众人之困，而世反挟其所有，以凌人之贫。真天之戮民哉。
text.man_en: Heaven makes a man wise to enlighten the ignorance of the people. But in the world, he acts contrarily and strengthens his own talents, Thus exposing the shortcomings of others. Heaven makes a man wealthy to relieve the difficulties of the people. But in the world, he acts contrarily, and bearhugs his own possessions, Thus ignoring the poverty of others. Truly men to be cut down by Heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Heaven is a wise man to teach the stupidity of the people, but the world shows its strengths to shape the shortcomings of the people; Heaven is a rich man to help the poor of the people, but the world holds its own to bully the poor of the people. This is really the killing of the people by Heaven.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A wise person in heaven tries to teach people how to be stupid, but in the world they use their strengths to exploit people's shortcomings. A person in heaven is rich in order to help people in poverty, but in the world they take advantage of their possessions and humiliate people's poverty. It’s true that heaven kills people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven endows one person with wisdom to enlighten the ignorance of many, yet the world flaunts his talents to highlight the shortcomings of others; Heaven bestows wealth upon one person to alleviate the hardships of many, yet the world uses his riches to oppress the poverty of others. Indeed, it seems like Heaven punishes the people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上天使人明智，以启迪人们的无知。但在世间，他却反其道而行之，自强不息，从而暴露了他人的缺点。上天让一个人富裕，是为了减轻人们的困难。但在世间，他却反其道而行之，恃才傲物，无视他人的贫穷。真是天将降大任于斯人也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天使人有智慧，以启迪百姓的愚昧。但在世上却反其道而行之，强化自己的才能，从而暴露别人的缺点。天赐人富，解民困。但在世上，他却反其道而行之，只顾自己的财产，从而忽视了别人的贫穷。真是人被天砍了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上天使人变得睿智，以启迪民众的无知。但在世间，他却反其道而行之，增强自己的才能， 从而暴露他人的缺点。上天使人变得富有，以减轻民众的困苦。但在世间，他却反其道而行之，紧抱自己的财产， 从而忽视他人的贫困。实乃上天要铲除的人。

text.ori_cn: 至人何思何虑，愚人不识不知，可与论学亦可与建功。唯中材的人，多一番思虑知识，便多一番臆度猜疑，事事难与下手。
text.man_en: The man who has arrived has neither anxiety nor apprehension; The ignorant man has no discrimination, no knowledge. Together they can talk about Learning; Together they can work through their projects. The man who is halfwise is full Of anxieties, apprehensions, judgments, and the usual bits of knowledge; His aspirations are many and ordinary. If you work with him, nothing will come easy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A man of the highest calibre thinks and thinks, but a fool knows not what he knows and knows not, and he can learn and build with them. Only the middle-aged man, who has more thoughts and knowledge, will have more suspicions, and it is difficult to get down to business.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As for what people think and worry about, fools don’t know and don’t know. They can discuss learning with them and make contributions to them. Only people with Chinese talents will have more speculations and suspicions if they think more about knowledge, making it difficult to take action in everything.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The transcendent person neither worries nor thinks, while the ignorant know nothing and understand nothing, yet can still discuss scholarly matters and achieve great deeds. It is the mediocre person, burdened with extra thoughts and knowledge, who ends up with more speculation and doubt, making it difficult to take action in anything.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 达者无忧，知者无识。他们可以一起谈论学习，一起完成他们的计划。半智之人充满了焦虑、忧虑、判断和常见的知识；他的愿望很多，也很普通。如果你和他一起工作，一切都不会容易。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 到达的人既不焦虑也不忧虑；无知的人没有分别心，没有知识。他们可以一起谈论学习；他们可以一起完成他们的项目。半知半解的人充满了焦虑、忧虑、判断和平常的知识；他的愿望很多，也很平凡。如果你和他一起工作，没有什么是容易的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 到来的人没有焦虑也没有忧虑；愚人无辨别力，无知识。他们可以一起谈论学问；他们可以一起完成他们的项目。半懂的人充满了焦虑、忧虑、判断和常规的知识；他的抱负多而平凡。如果你和他合作，事情不会容易。

text.ori_cn: 口乃心之门，守口不密，泄尽真机；意乃心之足，防意不严，走尽邪蹊。
text.man_en: The mouth is surely the mind's gate. When the mouth is not guarded closely, All of your secrets will spill over and out. Thoughts are surely the mind's feet. When thoughts are not strictly protected, Heresies and shortcuts will rush right in.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The mouth is the door of the heart; if you don't keep the mouth secret, you will leak all the real opportunities; the mind is the foot of the heart; if you don't keep the mind strict, you will walk all the way to the evil groove.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The mouth is the door to the heart. If the mouth is not kept secret, all the true secrets will be revealed; the mind is the foot of the heart. If the mind is not guarded carefully, all evil will be taken away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The mouth is the door to the heart; if you do not guard it well, true intentions will be revealed. The mind is the foot of the heart; if you do not control it strictly, it will lead you astray.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 嘴巴无疑是心灵的大门。当嘴巴没有得到严密的保护时，你所有的秘密都会溢出来。思想无疑是心灵的脚。当思想没有得到严格保护时，异端邪说和捷径就会蜂拥而至。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 口无疑是心灵之门。嘴巴不严防的话，所有的秘密都会泄露出去。思想肯定是头脑的脚。当思想不受到严格保护时，异端和捷径就会涌入。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 口是心扉。口不严守，秘密泄露无余。思是心足。思不严防，邪念邪途蜂拥而入。

text.ori_cn: 责人者，原无过于有过之中，则情平；责己者，求有过于无过之内，则德进。
text.man_en: If the person who criticizes others Will root out successes in the midst of faults, No one will be chagrined. If the person who examines himself Will look for faults in the midst of his successes, His character will gain ground.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who blame others, if they have nothing too much to do, then their feelings will be peaceful; those who blame themselves, if they seek to have too much to do, then their virtues will be improved.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who blame others should not go beyond their faults, and their feelings will be peaceful; those who blame themselves should seek to go beyond their faults, and their virtue will advance.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When criticizing others, if you perceive someone with faults as faultless, it shows a fair and balanced mind. When criticizing yourself, if you recognize faults even in your seemingly faultless actions, it leads to moral improvement.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果批评别人的人能从别人的缺点中找出成功之处，那么没有人会感到懊恼。如果检讨自己的人能在成功中寻找缺点，他的品格就会得到提升。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果批评别人的人，能在过失中铲除成功，那么，没有人会感到懊恼。如果一个人省察自己，在成功中寻找缺点，那么他的品格就会得到巩固。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果批评他人的人能在过失中找出成功点，就没有人会感到懊恼。如果反省自己的人能在成功中找出过失，他的品格就会得到提升。

text.ori_cn: 赤子者，大人之胚胎；秀才者，宰相之基础。此时若火力不到，陶铸不纯，他日涉世立朝，终难成个令器。
text.man_en: The young man is the embryo of the adult; The clever student, of the high official. At this stage, If the strength of the fire is insufficient, The casting will not be pure. On a later day, When he goes through the world, or stands at court, It will be difficult to be of good use.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The red child is the embryo of a great man; the scholar is the foundation of a prime minister. If the firepower is not enough at this time, and the pottery is not pure, it will be difficult for him to become an instrument in the world and establish a dynasty in the future.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: An innocent person is the embryo of an adult; a talented person is the foundation of a prime minister. If the firepower is not available at this time and the pottery is not pure, it will be difficult to become an imperial weapon in the future.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: An innocent child is the embryo of a great person; a scholar is the foundation of a prime minister. If at this time, the intensity of the effort is insufficient and the molding is not pure, in the future, when they have to face the world and stand in the court, they will ultimately find it difficult to become a fine instrument.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 少年，是成人的雏形；聪慧的学生，是高官的雏形。在这个阶段，如果火候不够，铸就就不纯。日后闯荡江湖，或立于朝堂，难有大用。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 年轻人是成年人的胚胎；聪明的学生，高官。在这个阶段，如果火的强度不够，铸造就不会纯净。日后，他走遍天下，或站在朝堂上，就难有什么用武之地了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 年轻人是成人的雏形；聪明的学生是高官的雏形。在这个阶段，如果火力不足，铸造出来的东西就不会纯净。到了以后，无论是走遍世界，还是立身朝廷，都难以发挥好作用。

text.ori_cn: 君子处患难而不忧，当宴游而益加惕虑；遇权豪而不惧，对惸独而反若惊心。
text.man_en: When the gentleman suffers difficulties, he is not distressed; But finding himself at the banquet table, He shrinks back in fear and unease. When meeting a man of influence and power, he does not miss a beat; But encountering the distressed and lonely, His mind is unsettled and tense.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A gentleman does not worry when he is in trouble, but is more vigilant when he is travelling; he is not afraid when he encounters a powerful man, but is alarmed when he learns to be alone.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman is not worried when he is in trouble; he is more wary when he is having a banquet; he is not afraid when he meets powerful people, but he is frightened when he is alone.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman faces adversity without worry, becomes even more cautious when enjoying leisure, remains unafraid in the presence of the powerful, and instead becomes deeply concerned when encountering the lonely and helpless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 君子遇难而不忧，遇宴而不惧。逢权贵，从容不迫；遇孤苦，心绪不宁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子有困难时，不忧愁；但当他发现自己站在宴会桌上时，他因恐惧和不安而退缩了。遇到有权有势的人，他不会错过任何一个机会；但遇到苦恼和孤独，他的心就不安和紧张。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子遇难而不忧，宴席上却退缩畏惧。遇权势之人，他毫不迟疑；但见困苦孤独之人，心中却不安紧张。

text.ori_cn: 桃李虽艳，何如松苍柏翠之坚贞；梨杏虽甘，何如橘绿橙黄之馨冽。信乎，浓夭不及淡久，早秀不如晚成也。
text.man_en: Though plum and damson are charming, How can they compare with the steadfast green of pine and oak? Though pear and apricot are sweet, How can they measure up to the sharp fragrance of bitter orange and green tangerine? In truth, the colorful and shortlived Are not equal to the lighthued and longstanding; And easy beauty Does not measure up to slow but steady growth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Peaches and plums are beautiful, how as the pine and cypress green chastity; pear and apricot although sweet, how as the orange green and orange yellow warm and cold. I am sure that it is not as good as a long period of time, and it is not as good as a late bloomer.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although the peaches and plums are beautiful, they are as firm as the green pines and cypresses; although the pears and apricots are sweet, they are not as refreshing as the oranges and oranges. Believe it or not, it is better to show off early than to mature late.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Though peaches and plums are brilliant, how can they compare to the steadfastness of the evergreen pine and cypress? Though pears and apricots are sweet, how can they surpass the fragrant freshness of green tangerines and golden oranges? Truly, the fleeting vibrance is no match for lasting subtlety, early bloom is less favorable than late fruition.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 李子和橘子虽迷人，怎能比得上松树和橡树的翠绿？梨和杏虽甜，怎能比得上苦橙和青橘的清香？事实上，艳丽短暂的花朵比不上光彩照人、历久弥新的花朵；轻松美丽的花朵比不上缓慢而稳健的花朵。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 梅、李虽娇，岂能与松、栎之翠绿相比？梨、杏虽然甘甜，岂能比得上苦橙、青橘的浓香？其实，绚丽而短暂的，并不等于淡雅而长久的；而简单的美丽并不符合缓慢但稳定的增长。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 梅李虽可爱，怎比松柏常青？梨杏虽甘美，怎敌橙橘馨香？实则，艳丽而短暂，不如淡雅而长久；轻易得来的美丽，怎敌缓慢而稳健的成长。

text.ori_cn: 谭山林之楽者、未必真得山林之趣。厌名利之谈者、未必尽忘名利之情。
text.man_en: The man who talks about the pleasures of mountain and forest May not divine the true content of such places. He who shudders at conversations about fame and profit May not yet have forgotten such themes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are interested in the music of the mountains and the forests may not be able to enjoy the fun of the mountains and the forests. Those who are tired of the talk of fame and fortune may not be able to forget the feelings of fame and fortune.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who enjoy the mountains and forests may not really enjoy the beauty of the mountains and forests. Those who are tired of talking about fame and fortune may not necessarily forget the feelings of fame and fortune.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who take pleasure in the tranquility of the mountains and forests may not truly appreciate their charm. Those who speak of renouncing fame and fortune may not have completely forgotten their desire for them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谈论山林之乐的人，可能还不知道这些地方的真正内涵。谈及名利便心惊胆战的人，也许尚未忘记这些主题。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 谈论山林之趣的人，未必能占卜其中的真实内容。那些在谈论名誉和利润时感到不寒而栗的人可能还没有忘记这些主题。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谈笑山林之乐者，未必洞晓山林真意；闻名利之论而色变者，未必已忘名利之事。

text.ori_cn: 钓水逸事也、尚持生杀之柄。奕棋清戯也、且动戦争之心。
text.man_en: A fishing line in the water is an aesthetic thing, But now you hold the rod of life or death. The game of go is a tasteful sport, But it also incites the mind to conflict. Clearly: Taking pleasure in something is not equal To the suitability of lessening one's affairs; Having many abilities does not measure up To the fulfillment of having none at all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Fishing in the water is also a fun activity, but it still holds the power of life and death. The game of chess is also clear, and the heart of the battle is moved.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It's an anecdote about fishing, but it still holds the power of life and death. Yiqi is also a clear play, and it arouses the spirit of war.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Fishing is a leisurely activity, yet it holds the power over life and death. Playing chess is a refined game, yet it stirs the heart towards warfare.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 钓线在水中是一种美感，但现在你握着的是生死攸关的鱼竿。围棋是一项有品位的运动，但它也会激起心灵的冲突。很显然乐在其中并不等于适合减少自己的事务；拥有许多能力并不等于完全没有能力的满足。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 水中的钓鱼线是一件美事，但现在你握着生死攸关的鱼竿。围棋是一项有品味的运动，但它也煽动心灵的冲突。可见：乐于某事，并不等于宜于少事；拥有许多能力并不足以达到完全没有能力的成就感。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 水中的鱼线是美丽的东西，但现在你握的是生死之竿。围棋是一项高雅的运动，但它也激发了内心的冲突。显然：从某事中获得乐趣不等同于减少事务的适宜性；拥有许多能力并不如无所求的满足。

text.ori_cn: 鴬花茂而山浓谷艶、総是乾坤之幻境。水木落而石痩崖枯、才见天地之真吾。
text.man_en: The profusion of songbirds and blossoms, The depth of the mountains, The charm of the valley— These are surely the illusory conditions of Heaven and Earth. The driedup streams, falling trees, The wearing away of stones, The crumbling of cliffs— Here alone can you see the true Self of the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This man is a man of flowers and mountains, and a man of valleys, and he is a man of illusions. Only when water and trees fall, and stone and aura wither, do we see the true nature of heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The flowers are luxuriant, the mountains are thick, the valleys are dense, and the mountains are the illusion of the universe. When the water and trees fall and the rocks and cliffs dry up, you can see the true nature of heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The lush flowers of the nightingales and the rich valleys in the mountains are all illusions of the universe. Only when the water and trees wither, and the stones and cliffs become emaciated, do we see the true self of heaven and earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 莺歌燕舞、百花齐放，山的深邃、谷的幽美--这些肯定都是天地间虚幻的景象。只有在这里，你才能看到世界的真我。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 鸟语花香，山深谷幽，此乃天地虚境。干涸的溪流，倒下的树木，岩石的磨损，悬崖的崩塌，只有在这里你才能看到世界的真实自我。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 繁茂的鸣禽和花朵，山的深处，山谷的魅力——这些无疑是天地间的虚幻景象。干涸的溪流，倒下的树，石头的磨损，悬崖的崩塌——唯有在这里你才能看见世界真正的自我。

text.ori_cn: 歳月本长。而忙者自促。天地本寛、而鄙者自隘。风花雪月本闲、而労攘者自冗。
text.man_en: Time is, by its nature, long; But the preoccupied man hurries restlessly along. Heaven and Earth are, by their nature, expansive; But the mean of heart are naturally narrow. The seasons' breezes, flowers, snow, and moon are, by their nature, tranquil; But the man who toils and fusses is afflicted of his own free will.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The age is long. But the busy man is short of time. Heaven and earth are broad, but the mean are narrow. The world is free, but the busy man is superfluous.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The month of birth is long. But busy people make their own progress. Heaven and earth are originally boundless, but those who are contemptuous are narrow-minded. The wind, flowers, snow and moon are leisurely, but those who are busy are redundant.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Time is inherently long, but it feels short for those who are busy. The world is naturally vast, but it seems narrow to those who are petty. The wind, flowers, snow, and moon are leisurely by nature, but they appear cumbersome to those who are restless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 时间本是漫长的，但心事重重的人却步履匆匆。天地本广阔，人心自然狭隘。四季的风、花、雪、月本是宁静的，但劳碌奔波的人却自作自受。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 时间，就其本质而言，是漫长的；但心事重重的男人却焦躁不安地匆匆走着。天地本来就广阔；但心胸狭窄，自然就狭隘了。四季的风花雪月，本性宁静；但辛勤劳作的人却会受到自己自由意志的折磨。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 时间，本性是漫长的；但是心烦意乱的人匆匆忙忙。天地，本性是广阔的；但是内心狭窄的人天生狭隘。四季的风花雪月，本性是宁静的；但是劳神费心的人是自愿被困扰的。

text.ori_cn: 得趣不在多。盆池拳石间、烟霞具足。会景不在远。蓬窗竹屋下、风月自賖。
text.man_en: Obtaining the tasteful does not come from owning many things; Between a traysized pond and a fistsized stone You have sufficient implements for mists and hazy scenes. Landscapes that will meet your desires are not far away: Through a mugwortlined window or beneath a bamboo hut, Wind and moon are of themselves calm.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It's not about the fun. Between the basin and the fist and the stones, the smoke and the haze are all there. The scenery is not far away. Under the window and the bamboo house, the wind and the moon are all there for you to enjoy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not much fun. There is plenty of haze among the rocks in the basin. The meeting is not far away. Under the bamboo house with canopy windows, the wind and moon are blowing by.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The pleasure does not lie in abundance. In the space between the basin and the fist-sized rocks, all the beauty of nature is present. Appreciation of the scenery does not require distance. Under the humble windows and bamboo houses, the wind and the moon extend their grace.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 获得品味并不在于拥有很多东西；在一个托盘大小的池塘和一块拳头大小的石头之间，您就拥有了足够的工具来营造薄雾和朦胧的场景。满足你愿望的风景并不遥远：艾窗竹下，风月自平。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 获得品味并不是因为拥有很多东西，而是因为拥有很多东西。在托盘大小的池塘和拳头大小的石头之间，您有足够的工具来拍摄薄雾和朦胧的场景。合你心意的风景就在不远处：艾窗外，竹屋下，风月自静。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 获得品味并非源于拥有多物；在一个托盘大的池塘和一个拳头大的石头之间，你已经有足够的工具营造雾气和朦胧的场景。你所渴望的风景并不遥远：透过青蒿围成的窗户或者在竹屋下，风和月本身就是宁静的。

text.ori_cn: 聴静夜之钟声、唤醒梦中之梦、観澄潭之月影、窥见身外之身。
text.man_en: Listening to the sound of a bell during a peaceful night, I am called into sobriety from my dream within a dream. Watching the reflection of the moon in the clear deep pool, I catch a glimpse of the body beyond this earthly shell.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Listen to the sound of the bell in the quiet night, wake up the dream of the dream, 観澄潭之月影, see the body outside the body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sound of bells in a quiet night awakens dreams within dreams, looking at the moonlight in a clear pool, and catching a glimpse of the body outside of the body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Listening to the sound of the evening bell awakens dreams within dreams; observing the moon's reflection in the clear pond reveals an existence beyond oneself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在宁静的夜晚聆听钟声，我从梦中的梦中清醒过来。看着月亮在清澈深潭中的倒影，我瞥见了超越尘世躯壳的身体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 静谧的夜晚，听着钟声，我从梦中的梦中清醒过来。看着清澈的深潭中的月亮倒影，我瞥见了尘世外壳之外的身体。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在宁静的夜晚听到钟声，我从重重梦境中被唤醒。观看清澈深潭中的月影，我瞥见了超越尘世的灵体。

text.ori_cn: 鸟语虫声、総是伝心之诀。花英草色、无非见道之文。学者、要天机清彻、胸次玲珑、触物皆有会心处。
text.man_en: The chirping of birds, the cries of insects— All are secret communications of the mind. The brilliance of flowers, the colors of grasses— These are nothing other than literary patterns of the manifest Way. The man who studies such things Must purify his natural capabilities, Give his heart the timbre of the sound of jewels, And come to grasp this truth in everything he touches.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sound of birds and insects is the secret of Denshin. The colours of flowers and grass are all texts of the Way. Scholars must have a clear mind and a delicate heart, so that everything they touch can be understood.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The chirping of birds and the sound of insects are the secret of your heart. The flowers and flowers are as beautiful as the grass, and they are nothing more than the writings of seeing the Tao. Scholars should have a clear mind, an exquisite mind, and an understanding of everything they touch.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The chirping of birds and the buzz of insects always convey a heartfelt understanding. The blossoms and the green of the grass are nothing but the writings of the way. For scholars, clear insight and a lucid mind are essential, allowing them to find resonance in everything they encounter.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 鸟鸣虫叫--都是心灵的秘密交流。花的光彩，草的颜色--这些都是显道的文学模式。研究这些事物的人必须净化自己的天赋能力，让自己的心灵拥有宝石之声的音色，并在接触的一切事物中领悟这一真理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 鸟鸣虫鸣，皆是心灵的秘密交流。花之绚丽，草之绚丽，无非是显道文格。学此之人，必清净其根性，令其心有宝音之音，凡所触之，皆得此法。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 鸟鸣虫叫——皆是心灵的秘密交流。花之灿烂，草之色彩——这些无非是显现之道的文学图案。研究这些事物的人，必须净化天赋，使其心获得如宝石音色，并在一切接触中领悟此真理。

text.ori_cn: 人解読有字书、不解読无字书。知弾有弦琴、不知弾无弦琴。以迹用、不以神用、何以得琴书之趣。
text.man_en: Men understand how to read books that have words, But do not understand how to read those that lack them. They know how to pluck the lute that has strings, But do not know how to play the one that has none. Caught by the form, but untouched by the spirit: How will they get at the heart of either music or literature?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People read books with words, but not books without words. One knows how to play the stringed zither, but not the unstringed zither. How can one get the pleasure of the zither and the book if one uses it for its purpose, but not for the sake of the spirit?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People understand and read books with characters, but those who do not understand and read books without characters. I know that there is a harp with strings, but I don’t know that there is a harp without strings. If it is used for traces and not for gods, how can we get the interest of Qin Shu?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People can read books with characters, but cannot understand books without them. They know how to play a lute with strings, but don't know how to play one without. If one only uses visible traces instead of tapping into the essence, how can they grasp the real enjoyment of reading and playing music?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们懂得如何阅读有字的书，却不懂得如何阅读无字的书。他们知道如何拨动有弦的琵琶，却不知道如何弹奏无弦的琵琶。被形式所吸引，却未被精神所触动：他们怎么能理解音乐或文学的核心呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人们懂得如何读有文字的书，却不懂得如何读无文字的书。他们知道如何弹奏有弦的琵琶，但不知道如何演奏无弦的琵琶。被形式所吸引，但未被精神所触动：他们将如何触及音乐或文学的核心？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们懂得怎样阅读有字的书，却不懂得怎样阅读无字的书。他们会弹有弦的琴，却不会演奏无弦的琴。被形式所困，却不触及精神：他们怎么能理解音乐或文学的精髓呢？

text.ori_cn: 心无物欲、即是秋空霁海。坐有琴书、便成石室丹丘。
text.man_en: If the heart contains no worldly desires, You will have autumnal skies and cloudless seas. If you can sit with just a lute and a book, Wherever you are becomes the realm of the sages.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart is free of material desires, that is, the autumn sky and sea. Sitting with a zither and a book, it will become a stone room Danqiu.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A heart without material desires is like the autumn sky and the sea. Sitting with a qin and a book, it becomes a stone chamber and Danqiu.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With a heart free from worldly desires, it is like the autumn sky cleared over the sea. Sitting with a qin and books, it becomes a stone chamber in a fairyland.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果心中没有世俗的欲望，你就会拥有秋高气爽、万里无云的大海。若能一琴一书，无论身在何处，都会成为圣贤的境界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心若无世欲，则天秋海无云。若能坐一琴一书，所到之处皆是圣人境界。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心中若无世俗欲望，便会拥有秋天的天空和晴朗的大海。若能安坐仅伴一琴一书，所在之地即成圣贤境界。

text.ori_cn: 宾朋云集、剧饮淋漓楽矣。俄而漏尽烛残、香销茗冷、不覚反成呕咽、令人索然无味。天下事率类此、人奈何不早回头也。
text.man_en: When guests and friends have gathered like clouds, There is pleasure in furious and profuse cups of wine. But suddenly the water clock leaks out its last, the lanterns gutter, the incense fades away, the tea is cold; Involuntarily there is weeping instead of joy, And friends are left with a desolate, insipid taste. This is generally the way things are in this world. Why, then, don't we quickly change our minds?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The guests were gathered, and they drank a lot of music. But then the leakage of the candle is gone, the fragrance of the tea cold, not 覚反成呕咽, people tasteless. The rate of things in the world is similar to this, why people do not turn back early.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Guests and friends gathered together, and there was a lot of entertainment and drinking. The candles are all gone, the fragrance is gone, and the tea is cold. If you don't drink it, it will cause vomiting, which is boring. Things in the world are like this, so why don't people look back sooner?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Guests gathered in great numbers, drinking in abundance and joy. Shortly after, the night ended with the water clock expired, the candles burnt out, the incense dissipated, and the tea grew cold. Unconsciously, the revelry turned into a sense of emptiness, leaving one with a lack of taste. Most matters in the world are like this; why don't people turn back early?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 宾朋云集，觥筹交错，其乐融融。蓦然间，水钟漏尽，灯火阑珊，香消玉殒，茶水冰凉；不自觉地，哭泣代替了喜悦，朋友们只剩下凄凉、平淡的滋味。世间百态，大抵如此。那么，我们为什么不赶紧改变自己的想法呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宾朋云集，酒肆豪饮其乐。忽水钟漏尽，灯灭，香尽，茶凉；不由自主地哭而不是喜，而朋友却只剩下凄凉的味道。这就是这个世界上事物的普遍规律。那么，我们为什么不尽快改变主意呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宾客如云，杯中美酒狂饮尽欢。然而，忽然间，漏壶滴尽，灯火摇曳，香气散尽，茶水冷却；不由自主地喜极而泣，友人们留下了满口寂寞无味。这大抵就是世间的常态。既如此，何不马上转念？

text.ori_cn: 会得个中趣、五湖之烟月、尽入寸里。破得眼前机、千古之英雄、尽帰掌握。
text.man_en: When you have grasped the core of a single thing, The mists and moon of the Five Lakes Will be within your heart. When you have broken through the secrets lying right before your eyes, One thousand heroes of old Will be delivered to your grasp.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The interest in the meeting, the smoke and moon of the five lakes, all into the inch. The opportunity in front of me, the heroes of the ages, are all in hand.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: You will get the most interesting feeling, the mist and moon of the five lakes can be seen within an inch. The opportunity before your eyes, the hero of the ages, is in full control.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One can revel in the pleasures within, the mists and moons of the five lakes all within a tiny space. Understanding the opportunity before one's eyes, the heroes of all ages fall into one's grasp.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你抓住一件事的核心，五湖四海的迷雾和明月都将在你心中。当你突破眼前的秘密，千古英雄将在你的掌握之中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你掌握一件事的核心时，五湖烟月就在你的心中。当你破解了眼前的秘密时，一千名古老的英雄将被交付给你。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一旦你掌握了事物的核心，五湖的云雾与月光将融入你的心中。一旦你突破了眼前的秘密，千古英雄将为你掌握。

text.ori_cn: 山河大地、已属微尘。而况尘中之尘。血肉身躯、且帰泡影。而况影外之影。非上上智、无了了心。
text.man_en: Mountains and rivers and the great Earth Are already nothing but dust, While man, to be sure, is but dust within dust. Bodies composed of muscle and blood Will surely return to bubble and shadow While human affairs, to be sure, are but shadows within shades. If the highest wisdom is not obtained, There will be no heart of understanding.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mountains, rivers, and earth are already dust. Not to mention the dust of dust. Flesh and blood and body are shadows. Let alone the shadow outside the shadow. There is no enlightened mind without superior wisdom.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The mountains, rivers and earth are already like dust. But the dust within the dust. The flesh and blood body is nothing. And the shadow outside the shadow. There is no superior wisdom and no clear mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mountains and rivers, the vast lands, have all become mere specks of dust. How much more so the dust within the dust. Flesh and blood bodies will eventually return to illusionary shadows. How much more so the shadows beyond the shadows. Without supreme wisdom, there is no mind of complete understanding.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 山河大地早已化为尘土，而人，不过是尘中之尘。由肌肉和血液组成的躯体必将归于泡沫和阴影，而人类的事务，无疑只是阴影中的阴影。如果没有最高的智慧，就不会有理解之心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 山川大地，已然不过是尘埃，而人，也不过是尘中之尘。由肌肉和血液组成的身体，一定会回归泡沫和阴影，而人的事情，确实只是阴影中的阴影。若未得无上智慧，则无明心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 山河大地已成尘， 人乃尘中尘。 肌血之躯终归泡沫影， 人间事乃影中影。 若不获至高智慧， 心中将无理解。

text.ori_cn: 石火光中、争长竞短。几何光阴。蜗牛角上、较雌论雄。许大世界。
text.man_en: Within the light of the flint's spark, They fight over "long" and compete over "short, " Yet how much time can there be? Above the horns of the tiny snail, They compare their losses and argue about gains, Yet how big can the world be?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the light of stone and fire, competing for length. Geometrical time. On the snail's horn, we compete with each other. The world is a big place.
