text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The stone is in the light of fire, competing for strengths and weaknesses. Geometric time. On the horns of snails, males are compared with females. Many big worlds.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the fleeting moments, they vie for supremacy. How much time has passed. On the horns of a snail, they debate victory and defeat. Such a vast world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在火石的火光中，它们争 "长 "斗 "短"，然而时间能有多少？在蜗牛的角上，它们比较损失，争论得失，然而世界能有多大？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 打火石的火花里，争“长”，争“短”，又能有多少时间呢？小蜗牛角之上，比损争得，世界能有多大？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在火石的火花光芒中，他们为“长”争斗，为“短”竞争，而这些又能有多少时间呢？在小蜗牛的角上，他们对比损失，争论收益，而这个世界能有多大呢？

text.ori_cn: 寒灯无焔、敝裘无温、総是播弄光景。身如槁木、心似死灰、不免堕落顽空。
text.man_en: The cold lamp offers no flame, The wornout fur no warmth— Such things are only fooling with appearance. A body resembling withered branches, A heart like dead ashes — This is only the degeneration of the obstinate ascetic.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The cold lamps are not watchable, the furs are not warmed, and it is all a matter of time. My body is like a haystack, my heart is like ashes, and I can't help falling into the void.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The cold lamp has no heat, the fur has no warmth, and the scorpion is just playing with the scene. The body is like a gaunt wood, the mind is like ashes, and it is inevitable to become degenerate and empty.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The cold lamp without flame, the tattered coat without warmth, all merely toying with the fleeting time. The body is like withered wood, the heart like dead ashes, inevitably falling into a state of stubborn emptiness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 冰冷的灯盏没有火焰，破旧的皮毛没有温暖--这不过是表象的愚弄。身似枯枝，心如死灰--这只是顽固的苦行者的堕落。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 寒灯无火，破皮无暖，此等不过是表面上的愚弄。身如枯枝，心如死灰，这只是苦行僧的败坏。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 冷灯无火，破皮无暖——这些东西只是欺弄外表。形似枯枝，心如死灰——这仅是顽固苦行者的堕落。

text.ori_cn: 人肯当下休、便当下了。若要寻个歇处、则婚嫁未完、事亦不少。僧道虽好、心亦不了。前人云、如今休去便休去、若觅了时无了时。见之卓矣。
text.man_en: If you have the conviction to cease an action right now, You will right now bring the matter to a close. But if you need to look around for the moment to stop, Though the bride and groom may be all prepared, The petty details will go on and on. Though you may happily be ready to follow the Buddha or the Tao, Your heart will still lack understanding. The ancients said, If you quit right now, you will quit. If you look for the perfect time, it will not appear. This is truly clearsighted.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a man is willing to take a break, then he should do so. If you want to find a place to rest, you will have a lot of things to do before you get married. Although monasticism is good, the heart is not. The old man said, "If you want to find a place to rest now, then you should rest now, and if you want to find a place to rest, then you should rest now. It is a good thing to see.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person is willing to rest immediately, he will do so immediately. If you want to find a place to rest, the wedding is not over yet and there are many things to do. Even though the monk's teachings are good, his mind is still weak. The predecessors said, if you stop now, you will leave. If you find time, there will be no time. See how outstanding it is.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one can find peace in the present moment, then one has already attained it. If one seeks a resting place, there will always be unfinished business like marriage and many other matters. Even monks and Taoists, although they are good, cannot fully resolve their hearts. The ancients said, 'If you can rest now, then rest now; if you seek an end, there will never be an end.' This realization is truly profound.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你有立即停止行动的信念，你就会立即结束这件事。但是，如果你需要四处寻找停止的时机，虽然新郎新娘已经准备就绪，但琐碎的细节仍将继续下去。你虽乐于从佛从道，但你的心还是不明白。古人云：欲罢不能。若觅天时，天时不现。这才是真正的高瞻远瞩。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你有决心立即停止某项行动，那么你现在就会结束这件事。但如果你需要暂时停下来环顾四周，虽然新娘和新郎可能已经做好了一切准备，但琐碎的细节会一直持续下去。尽管你可能很高兴准备追随佛或道，但你的心仍然缺乏了解。古人云：当下戒则戒。如果你寻找完美的时间，它不会出现。这实在是有目共睹。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你现在有决心停止一个行动，你现在就会把事情结束。但是如果你需要寻找一个停止的时刻，虽然新娘和新郎可能都已准备好，琐碎的细节还会持续不断。虽然你可能愿意追随佛陀或道，但你的心仍缺乏理解。古人说：如果你现在就停止，你就会停止。如果你寻找一个完美的时刻，它不会出现。这才是真正的明智。

text.ori_cn: 従冷视热、然后知热处之奔驰无益。従冗入闲、然后覚闲中之滋味最长。
text.man_en: When your passion is observed from a position of serenity, You know the zero profit of all that running around. When entering a state of tranquility from an abundance of cares, You are aware that the savoring of peace outdistances the rest.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The cold is seen as hot, and then know that the hot place of Mercedes Benz is not beneficial. The redundancy into the idle, then 覚闲中之滋味最长。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Look at the heat with coldness, and then realize that it is useless to run in the hot place. The longest taste is to indulge in idleness and then enjoy idleness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From observing the cold and the hot, one realizes that ceaseless running in hot places is futile. From busy to idle, one discovers that the taste of leisure is the longest enduring.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你从宁静的位置观察你的激情时，你知道所有奔波的零利润。当你从烦恼中进入宁静状态时，你会意识到，对宁静的品味胜过其他一切。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你从平静的角度观察你的激情时，你就会知道所有的奔波都是零利润。当你从繁杂的忧虑中进入宁静的状态时，你会意识到，和平的品味胜过其他。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你从宁静的角度观察你的激情时，你知道所有的奔波都是徒劳。当你从繁多的忧虑中进入平静的状态时，你意识到品味和平远胜于其他一切。

text.ori_cn: 有浮云富贵之风。而不必岩栖穴处。无膏肓泉石之癖。而常自酔酒耽诗。竞逐聴人、而不谦尽酔。括淡适己、而不夸独醒。此释氏所谓、不为法缠、不为空缠、身心两自在者
text.man_en: You may have the inclination to consider wealth and position as insubstantial as floating clouds. And yet not have to seclude yourself among crags and caves. You may not be afflicted with an addiction for nature's springs and rocks, But still get tipsy on your own, and absorb yourself in poems. Leave the fighting over name and wealth to others, But do not despise their intoxication with such things. Your own disinterestedness is appropriate for you, But do not take pride in thinking that you alone are enlightened. This is what Shakamuni spoke of: Do not be wrapped up in doctrine; Do not be wrapped up in the Void. Body and mind are two, but totally free.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is the style of floating clouds and wealth. And there is no need for a rocky cave. I am not addicted to the world of the heart and the mind, but I have always been a wine-lover. I'm not sure if I'll be able to make it quicker, but I'm sure I'll be able to make it faster. The first thing I would like to do is to make it quicker for the audience. The first thing you need to do is to make sure that you have the right kind of information about the person you are talking to. This is what the Sakyamuni called, not to be entangled in the law, not to be entangled in emptiness, and to be free in both body and mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a wind of floating clouds of wealth and honor. No need to stay in a rock cave. There is no habit of plastering spring stone. And often drink wine and indulge in poems. Competing for appointments, but not being humble. Be gentle and considerate to oneself, but not boastful and sober. This is what Shi Shi calls: one who is not entangled in Dharma or emptiness, and who is at ease with both body and mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is an air of wealth and nobility, without the necessity of dwelling in caves or holes. One may lack the obsession with rocks and springs but is often intoxicated with wine and engrossed in poetry. Competing and listening to others, yet not humbly and completely drunk. Living a simple life satisfying oneself, without boasting about staying awake alone. This is what the Buddhist teachings refer to as not being entangled by conventional or worldly matters, achieving freedom in both body and mind.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你可能会倾向于认为财富和地位如浮云般虚无缥缈。却不必隐居峭壁和洞穴。你可以不沉迷于大自然的泉水和岩石，但也可以独自醉卧，沉醉于诗词之中。让别人去争名夺利吧，但不要鄙视他们对这些东西的沉醉。你自己的无私是适合你的，但不要自以为是，认为只有你才是悟道者。这就是释迦牟尼所说的：不要被教条所迷惑，不要被虚空所迷惑。身心虽二，全然自在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你可能倾向于认为财富和地位就像浮云一样微不足道。但不必将自己封闭在峭壁和洞穴之中。你也许不会沉迷于大自然的泉水和岩石，但仍然可以自己喝醉，沉浸在诗中。名利之争留给别人，但不要轻视他们对这些事物的沉醉。你自己的无私是适合你的，但不要以为只有你是开悟的而自豪。这就是释迦牟尼所说的：不要被教义所束缚；不要被教义所束缚。不要被虚空包裹。身体和心灵是两个，但完全自由。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你或许倾向于认为财富和地位像浮云一样渺小。然而，仍不必隐居在峭壁和洞穴之中。你或许没有对大自然的泉水和岩石产生嗜好，但依然可以独自微醺，沉浸在诗篇中。把对名利的争夺留给别人，但不要蔑视他们对这些东西的迷恋。你自己的淡泊与你相符，但不要自豪于认为只有你一个人是开明的。释迦牟尼说过：不要被教义缠绕；不要被虚空缠绕。身心有二，但完全自由。

text.ori_cn: 延促由于一念、寛窄系之寸心。故机闲者、一日遥于千古、意広者、斗室寛若两闲。
text.man_en: The extended and contracted depend on the thought; The broad and the narrow are affected by your mind. Therefore, the composed man Considers one day longer than a thousand years. The spacious of mind Sees a tiny room as expansive as Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The delay is due to a single thought, but the width is determined by the heart. Therefore, if one's mind is free, one day is more distant than a thousand years, and if one's heart is wide, one's room is as wide as two rooms.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Delay is caused by a thought and a narrow mind. Therefore, those who have leisure time will be far away from the eternity in one day, and those who have the will to live in a small room will be as if they have two leisure days.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Extending and prolonging are due to a single thought, and the degree of spaciousness depends on the mind. Therefore, for those who are unhurried, one day feels like a distant millennium, and for those with a broad mind, a small room feels as spacious as two chambers.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 延伸与收缩取决于思想，宽广与狭隘受你的思想影响。因此，沉着的人认为一日胜过千年。心胸宽广者，视小室如天地。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 伸展和收缩取决于思想；广义和狭义都受你的心所影响。因此，冷静的人认为一日比一千年还要长。心胸广阔，见小室如天地。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 伸缩在心; 宽狭随意。故得定者，视一日为千年。心地宽者，视小室犹天地。

text.ori_cn: 损之又损、栽花种竹、尽交还乌有先生。忘无可忘、焚香煮茗、総不问白衣童子。
text.man_en: Decrease this and decrease it again, Plant flowers and set bamboo, And you will return all to the Void. Forget that there is nothing to forget, Burn incense and heat up some tea, And you'll not be troubled though no one comes bearing gifts of wine.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I planted flowers and bamboos and gave them back to Mr Wu-Yu. Forgetting nothing, burning incense and cooking tea, not asking the boy in white.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Damage after damage, plant flowers and bamboos, and return them all to Mr. Wuyou. Forget nothing, burn incense and cook tea, and don't ask about the boy in white.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Loss upon loss, planting flowers and bamboo, all returned to Mr. Nothingness. Forgetting what cannot be forgotten, burning incense and brewing tea, never asking the white-clad boy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 减一减，再减减，种花栽竹，尽归虚空。忘了无所忘，焚香煮茶，无人送酒也无忧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 减此再减，种花设竹，皆归虚空。忘却无事可忘，烧香热茶，无人送酒不愁。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 减少这个，再次减少它，栽花种竹，返归空寂。忘却无可忘之事，焚香煮茶，无需葡萄美酒亦无烦忧。

text.ori_cn: 都来眼前事、知足者仙境、不知足者凡境。総出世上因、善用者生机、不善用者杀机。
text.man_en: All the things right before your eyes— For the man who knows they are sufficient, this is the world of the sages. For the man who thinks them not enough, this is a world profane. All the causes from which things issue into the world— For the man who puts them to use, they give life to all things. For the man who uses them poorly, they are the functions of death.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world is a world of things, and those who are content with it are in the realm of immortality, while those who are not are in the realm of mortality. The world is full of causes, and those who make good use of it have a chance to live, while those who don't have a chance to kill.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Everything comes before the eyes, those who are satisfied are in fairyland, and those who are dissatisfied are in mortal realm. The cause of the birth of the 総 is in the world. If you use it well, it will bring you life; if you don't use it well, it will kill you.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things come before your eyes; for those who are content, it is a paradise, for those who are not, it is a mundane world. All causes in the world, those who use them wisely find opportunities for life, while those who do not find themselves in peril.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你眼前的一切--对于知道它们足够的人来说，这是圣贤的世界。对于认为它们不够的人来说，这是一个亵渎的世界。万物产生于世间的所有原因--对于善用它们的人，它们赋予万物生命。用之不善者，万物皆死。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一切尽在眼前，知足者，此是圣人世界。对于那些认为这些还不够的人来说，这是一个亵渎的世界。事物产生于世界的所有原因——对于使用它们的人来说，它们赋予万物生命。对于那些使用不当的人来说，它们就是死亡的功能。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所有在你眼前的事物——对那些知道它们已足够的人来说，这是圣贤的世界。对那些认为它们还不够的人来说，这是一个平凡的世界。一切事物产生的根由——对那些善加利用的人来说，它们赋予万物生命。对那些使用不当的人来说，它们是死亡的功能。

text.ori_cn: 趋炎附势之祸、甚惨亦甚速。栖恬守逸之味、最淡亦最长。
text.man_en: The disasters that accompany Those who blaze like fire, And those attached to the influential, Are extraordinarily harsh and astonishingly swift. The experience of those Who find harbor in composure, And who protect their own leisure, Is astoundingly light and extremely longlived.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The scourge of being in favour of others is both tragic and quick. The flavour of tranquillity and contentment is the lightest and the longest.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The disaster of following the trend is both tragic and rapid. The flavor of Qi Tian Shou Yi is the lightest and longest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The calamity of currying favor with the powerful is both severe and swift. The taste of living in tranquility and seclusion is the blandest, yet it lasts the longest.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 炽热如火的人和附庸风雅的人所遭遇的灾难异常残酷，也异常迅速。那些在沉着中找到港湾、保护自己闲暇的人，他们的经历却轻得惊人，而且极其长寿。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些如火般炽热的人，以及那些有影响力的人，所伴随的灾难，是非常严重的，而且是惊人的迅速。那些在平静中找到港湾、保护自己闲暇的人的经历，是令人惊讶的轻松和极其长寿的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 与那些如火般炽热的人同行的灾难，以及那些依附于有影响力的人，同样是异常严酷且令人惊讶地迅速。那些在镇静中找到避风港的人，并保护自己悠闲的经历，令人惊讶地轻松且极其长久。

text.ori_cn: 松涧辺、携杖独行、立处云生破衲。竹窗下、枕书高卧、覚时月侵寒毡。
text.man_en: In a river valley of pines, I walk alone with staff in hand; Standing still for a moment, Clouds rise around my tattered robes. Beneath a window looking out on bamboo, I stretch out with a book for my pillow. When I awake, The moon shines in on the cold, cracked floor.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Pine streams and streams, carrying a staff to walk alone, standing where the clouds born of broken cassock. Under the bamboo window, pillow book high lying, 覚时月侵寒毡.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Walking alone in a pine stream with a stick, standing in the clouds. Under the bamboo window, I lie down with a book on my pillow, and the moon invades the cold felt when I sit down.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By the mountain stream, I walk alone with a staff, and at the place I stand, clouds rise around my tattered robe. Under the bamboo window, I rest my head on a book and lie down, waking only when the moonlight seeps through the cold felt mat.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在松树林立的河谷中，我拄杖踽踽独行；静立片刻，云雾缭绕着我破旧的衣袍。窗外竹影婆娑，枕书而卧。梦醒时，明月照在冰冷的裂缝地板上。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 松树河谷，我手执杖独行；静静地站了一会儿，云朵在我破烂的袍子周围升起。我在窗下眺望竹子，伸了个懒腰，枕头上放着一本书。当我醒来时，月亮照在冰冷、开裂的地板上。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在松树的河谷中, 我独自一人手持拐杖漫步; 稍作停留, 云雾缭绕升起在我破旧的长袍四周。 在竹林窗外, 我手枕书本躺下。 当我醒来时, 月光洒在冰冷且龟裂的地板上。

text.ori_cn: 色欲火炽、而一念及病时、便兴似寒灰。名利饴甘、而一想到死地、便味如嚼蝋。故人常忧死虑病、亦可消幻业而长道心。
text.man_en: Physical desire may rage like fire, But if you think of what happens when you get ill, Your fervor will turn cold as ashes. Fame and fortune may be as sweet as candy, But if you consider the place of your death, They will seem like chewing wax. Therefore, If a man will always take time to think of death, and ruminate on illness The works of illusion will disappear, and the Wayseeking mind will endure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The fire of lust burns, but when I think of sickness, I am as cold as ashes. Fame and wealth are sweet, but when one thinks of death, one tastes as if one is chewing on a stick. Therefore, if a person is always worried about death and illness, he can also eliminate his illusory karma and grow his mind on the Way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sexual desire is burning, and when you think about illness, your body becomes as cold as ashes. Fame and fortune are sweet, but the thought of death tastes like chewing squid. Therefore, people who often worry about death and illness can also eliminate illusory karma and develop a Taoist mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the flames of desire burn fiercely, a single thought of illness can cool them like cold ashes. The sweetness of fame and wealth turns tasteless like chewed wax when one thinks of death. Therefore, by constantly worrying about death and illness, one can dissipate illusions and cultivate a lasting spiritual intention.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 身体的欲望可能像火一样汹涌，但如果你想到生病时会发生什么，你的狂热就会变得像灰烬一样冰冷。名利可能像糖果一样甜美，但如果你想到自己的死期，它们就会像嚼蜡一样。因此，如果一个人总是花时间思考死亡，反刍疾病，那么幻觉就会消失，求道之心就会永存。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 肉欲可能如火般猛烈，但如果你想到生病时的情况，你的热情就会冷如灰烬。名誉和财富可能像糖果一样甜蜜，但如果你考虑你的死亡地点，它们就像嚼蜡一样。是故，人若常思死，思惟病，妄业就会消失，求道心就会长存。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 情欲狂焰如火，病中细思则热情如灰。名利甜美如糖，临死之地细想则如嚼蜡。因此，若人常常思虑死亡，反复反思疾病，幻象将消失，求道之心将持久。

text.ori_cn: 争先的径路窄、退后一歩自寛平一歩。浓艶的滋味短、清淡一分自悠长一分。
text.man_en: The alleys and bypaths of fighting to get ahead are narrow. But step back a pace, and that pace will be broad and wide. The taste of the voluptuous and rich is short. But make yourself just one percent plain and pure, and that one percent will become calm and composed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The path of the first is narrow, but a step backward is a step wider. The taste of the rich and the special is short, but the taste of the light is long.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The path to be ahead is narrow, take one step back and you will be level with one step. The rich taste is short, while the light taste is long.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The path to rush forward is narrow, but taking a step back brings ease and peace. The allure of rich flavors is fleeting, while simplicity in taste leads to enduring enjoyment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 争先恐后的小巷和小路是狭窄的。但退一步，那步伐将是宽广的。妖娆富贵的滋味是短暂的。但让自己只剩下百分之一的平淡和纯粹，那百分之一就会变得从容和淡定。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为取得成功而奋斗的小巷和小路都很狭窄。但退后一步，这个步伐将会变得越来越宽阔。肉欲富贵的滋味是短暂的。但只要让自己有百分之一的朴素和纯粹，那百分之一就会变得平静和从容。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 争强好胜的巷道小径是狭窄的，但退后一步，这一步便是宽广的。奢华丰盛的滋味是短暂的，但让自己纯净平凡一分，这一分便会变得沉着从容。

text.ori_cn: 忙处不乱性、须闲处心神养得清。死时不动心、须生时事物看得破。
text.man_en: If you wish to avoid falling into confusion when busily occupied, Cultivate your mind and make it pure during your leisure hours. If you wish to avoid extreme agitation at the moment of death, Observe the world and see through it while still alive.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are busy, you must be able to maintain a clear mind in your spare time. When you are dead, you must not be moved, but you must be able to see through things in life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To stay calm when you are busy, you must maintain a clear mind when you are free. When you are dead, you will not be distracted, but when you are alive, you will be able to see through things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In times of busyness, one must maintain inner peace; in times of leisure, one must nurture a clear mind. To remain undisturbed at the moment of death, one must see through worldly matters while living.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你想避免在忙碌时陷入困惑，那就在闲暇时修炼自己的心灵，让它变得纯净。如果你想避免临终时的极度焦虑，那就在活着的时候观察世界，看透世界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你想在繁忙的时候不陷入混乱，就在闲暇的时候修养你的心，让它变得清净。如果你想避免临终时的极度躁动，就趁活着的时候观察这个世界，看透它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你希望在忙碌时避免陷入困惑，就在闲暇时修心养性，使其纯净。 如果你希望在临终时避免极度的烦躁，就在生前观察世界，看透它。

text.ori_cn: 隠逸林中无栄辱、道义路上无炎凉。
text.man_en: In the forest of seclusion, there is no honor or disgrace; On the road of right conduct, no flaming up or cooling down.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no honour or disgrace in the forest of Kakushi, and there is no ill will on the path of righteousness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no humiliation in the forest, and there is no heat or cold on the road of morality.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the secluded forest, there is neither glory nor disgrace; on the path of righteousness, there is neither warmth nor chill.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 隐居之林，无荣无辱；正行之路，无焰无火。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 隐居之林，无荣辱；正行路上，不炽不冷。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在隐居的森林里，没有荣誉或耻辱；在正义之路上，没有激烈的情感或冷淡的态度。

text.ori_cn: 热不必除、而除此热悩、身常在清凉台上。穷不可遣、而遣此穷愁、心常居安楽窝中。
text.man_en: You need not seek protection from the heat of the day; But if you seek protection from the distress of thinking of the heat, Your body will always sit on a platform both refreshing and cool. You may not be able to drive away a devastating poverty; But if you drive away the unhappiness of being in such a state, Your mind will always reside in a house of pleasure and peace
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no need to get rid of the heat, but the heat is gone, and the body is always in the coolness. If you can't get rid of poverty, but you can get rid of it, your mind will always be in a nest of peace and music.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not necessary to remove the heat, but to remove the heat, the body is always on the cool platform. Poverty cannot be sent away, but the sorrow of poverty is sent away, and the heart always lives in a safe nest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heat need not be removed, but by dispelling the trouble caused by heat, one can always reside in a state of coolness. Poverty need not be eradicated, but by mitigating the sorrow of poverty, the heart can always dwell in a place of comfort.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你不需要躲避炎热的天气，但如果你能躲避酷暑带来的苦恼，你的身体就会永远坐在清凉的平台上。你也许无法驱走灾难性的贫穷；但如果你驱走了处于这种状态的不快，你的心灵就会永远居住在快乐与和平的殿堂里
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 您无需寻求保护来抵御白天的炎热；但如果你寻求保护，免受炎热的困扰，你的身体将永远坐在一个既清爽又凉爽的平台上。你可能无法摆脱毁灭性的贫困；但如果你赶走这种状态下的不快乐，你的心将永远居住在快乐与平静的房子里
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你不需要逃避一天的炎热；但如果你寻求对炎热思考的困扰的保护，你的身体将永远坐在一个既凉爽又清爽的平台上。你可能无法驱散毁灭性的贫困；但如果你驱散处于这种状态的不快乐，你的心灵将永远居住在一个充满愉悦与和平的家中。

text.ori_cn: 进歩处、便思退歩、庶免触藩之涡。着手时、先図放手、才脱骑虎之危。
text.man_en: When about to advance a step, Quickly think about retreating one step, too: Thus you can avoid the disaster of getting stuck in the hedge When about to grasp at something, Consider first letting it go: Thus you can escape the danger of riding the tiger's back.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are advancing, think of retreating, so as to avoid the danger of touching the fence. When starting out, let go first, so as to avoid the danger of riding the tiger.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you enter the steps, you should think about taking steps back to avoid touching the feudal vortex. When you start, let go first, then you can escape the danger of riding a tiger.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: While making progress, consider stepping back to avoid pitfalls. At the beginning of an endeavor, plan for disengagement to escape a perilous situation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你要前进一步时，也要迅速考虑后退一步：这样就可以避免陷入樊笼的灾难：这样就能避免骑虎难下的危险。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 欲进一步，亦速思退一步，可免遭陷于篱笆之祸；欲抓一物，先思放手，可免险骑。老虎的背。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 欲进一步，先思退步，则得免被困之患；欲有所取，先思舍弃，则得免骑虎之危。

text.ori_cn: 贪得者、分金恨不得玉、封公怨不受侯、権豪自甘乞丐。知足者、藜羮旨于膏梁、布袍暖于狐貉、编民不譲王公。
text.man_en: About the man who is greedy: Though money is parceled out, he will resent not receiving jewels. Though commissioned with public office, he will grumble about not acquiring a fief. Though influential and powerful, he will still happily behave in a beggarly way. About the man who knows sufficiency: He considers his plain herb soup tastier than fatty meats or highclass rice. He considers his padded coat warmer than a robe of fox or badger skins. Though one of the commoners, he is not less satisfied than a nobleman.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For those who are greedy, they hate to part with gold but not with jade, they complain about not receiving a marquis, and they are willing to be beggars. Those who are contented with their own needs are those who drink tequila dumplings and warm their cloth robes to foxes and raccoons, and those who make up their own people do not make any substitutions for the princes and eunuchs.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are greedy will hate jade even if they share gold; those who are resentful for being granted a public title will not be rewarded as a marquis; and those who are wealthy and wealthy will be willing to be beggars. For those who are content, the quinoa and fern will be used to anoint the beams, the cloth robes will be warm to the foxes and raccoon dogs, and the people will not be embarrassed by the princes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The greedy, when dividing gold, wish for jade, those granted noble titles resent not receiving higher ones, and the powerful willingly become beggars. The contented, find flavor in simple fare over rich food, warmth in cloth robes over fur garments, and common folk do not envy nobles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 关于贪婪的人：虽然分到了钱财，但他会怨恨没有得到珠宝。虽有公职在身，却因得不到封地而耿耿于怀。虽有权势，仍乐于行乞。关于知足者：他认为普通的草药汤比肥肉或高级米饭更美味。他认为自己的软垫大衣比狐狸皮或獾皮袍更暖和。虽然他是平民，但他的满足感并不亚于贵族。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 关于贪婪的人：虽然分出了金钱，但他会怨恨没有得到珠宝。尽管担任公职，他仍会抱怨没有获得封地。尽管有影响力和权力，他仍然会快乐地表现出乞讨的样子。关于知足者：他认为他的普通药草汤比肥肉或高级米饭更美味。他认为他的衬垫外套比狐狸皮或獾皮长袍更温暖。虽然是平民，但他的满足感并不亚于贵族。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 关于贪心的人：尽管施舍给他钱财，他会因为没有得到珠宝而怨恨。尽管给予他官职，他会因为没有得到封地而抱怨。尽管他有权有势，仍会乐于乞讨般行事。关于知足的人：他认为清淡的草药汤比肥腻的肉或高档的米饭更美味。他认为填充的棉衣比狐皮或獾皮的袍子更温暖。即使是普通人，他也不会比贵族更不满足。

text.ori_cn: 矜名、不若逃名趣。练事、何如省事闲。
text.man_en: Being proud of your name Does not compare with fleeing fame altogether. Becoming skillful at something Is not like avoiding externals and having time on your own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to be famous than to run away from fame. It is better to practise than to be idle.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to be cautious about fame than to escape from fame. Practice, how to save time and leisure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Pursuing fame cannot compare to avoiding it. Engaging in tasks is not as pleasant as simplifying them and remaining at ease.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为自己的名字感到骄傲，并不等同于完全逃避名声。精于一技之长，不等于避开外物，独享时光。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为自己的名字感到自豪并不能与完全逃离名声相比。在某件事上变得熟练并不像避免外部事物并拥有自己的时间。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为自己的名声感到骄傲，比不上完全逃避名声。变得擅长某事，不如避免外物，拥有自己的时间。

text.ori_cn: 嗜寂者、観白云幽石而通玄、趋栄者、见清歌妙舞而忘倦。唯自得之士、无喧寂、无栄枯、无往非自适之天。
text.man_en: The man who has a taste for quietism Looks into the white clouds and hazy crags, and becomes intimate with the mysterious. The man who runs after the magnificent Watches sublime dances and beautiful chants, and forgets all fatigue. Only for the man who is satisfied with himself Is there neither tumult or quiet, Neither the magnificent nor the withered. There is no place he can go that is not appropriate for him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are fond of silence will enjoy the white clouds and the mysterious rocks, and those who are fond of Japan will forget their tiredness when they see the beautiful songs and dances. Only those who have attained self-realisation are free from noise and silence, free from ebony, and free from all kinds of heaven.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are addicted to silence will be enlightened by looking at the white clouds and secluded rocks; those who are attracted to it will forget their tiredness when they see the clear songs and wonderful dances. Only those who are self-satisfied will have no noise or silence, no dryness, and no choice but to go where they want.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who love solitude comprehend the metaphysical by observing white clouds and secluded rocks, whereas those who pursue glory forget fatigue upon witnessing graceful songs and dances. Only those who are truly content have neither noise nor silence, neither glory nor decline, as all circumstances align with their natural disposition.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 喜欢宁静的人，眺望白云和朦胧的峭壁，与神秘的事物亲密接触。追逐华丽的人 欣赏崇高的舞蹈和美妙的吟唱，忘却一切疲惫。只有满足于自己的人，才不会有喧嚣或宁静，也不会有华丽或枯萎。没有任何地方不适合他。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 爱好静谧的人，眺望白云雾凇，亲近神秘。追逐壮丽的人观看崇高的舞蹈和优美的歌声，忘记所有的疲劳。只有自我满足的人，才不会喧嚣，不会安静，不会壮丽，也不会枯萎。他可以去的地方没有不适合他的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于崇尚静谧的人来说，白云飘渺、山岩虚无之间，他能体味神秘；对于追求壮丽的人来说，神妙的舞蹈和美妙的音律之间，他会忘却疲惫。只有那个自我满足的人才没有喧嚣或宁静，没有壮丽或枯萎。没有任何一个地方是不适合他的。

text.ori_cn: 孤云出岫、去留一无所系。朗镜悬空、静躁两不相干。
text.man_en: A single cloud leaves the peaks:22 Going or staying, with neither is it entangled. A bright mirror like moon hangs in the sky: Peace or noise, with neither is it concerned.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Lonely clouds are out of the mountain, nothing to do with going or staying. The mirror hangs in the air, and there is nothing to worry about.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the lonely cloud comes out of Xiu, it has nothing to do with whether it goes or stays. The bright mirror hanging in the air and the tranquility have nothing to do with each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The lone cloud leaves the peak, bound by nothing in its departure or remaining. The clear mirror hangs in the sky, unaffected by tranquility or disturbance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一朵云彩离开山峰：22 去或留，都不与它纠缠。一轮明月挂天边：宁静或喧闹，都与它无关。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一朵云离开山峰：22 去或留，不纠缠。一轮明镜如月悬空，静或喧嚣，皆无关。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孤云出岫：去留无意，明月如镜悬于天：静噪俱忘。

text.ori_cn: 悠长之趣、不得于醲酽、而得于啜菽饮水。惆怅之懐、不生于枯寂、而生于品竹调丝。固知浓所味常短、淡中趣独真也。
text.man_en: A tendency for deliberation and composure Is not obtained while drinking strong wines, But rather while sipping simple bean soup and drinking plain water. A sense of pathos and compassion Is not developed from the dry and solitary, But rather from blowing the bamboo flute and plucking the lute. This is known to be true: The taste of the thick and rich is always short, While the meaning of the simple and plain alone is truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The pleasure of a long life is not to be found in strong flavours, but in sipping water and beans. Melancholy is not born in silence, but in the taste of bamboo and silk. I know that the flavour of the strong is always short, but the pleasure of the light is unique.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Long-term pleasure cannot come from drinking rice, but from sipping water. The melancholy is not born from dryness and silence, but is born from the quality of bamboo and silk. It is known that the strong taste is often short, and the light taste is only true.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The charm of longevity is not found in richness but in the simplicity of tea and water. Melancholy does not arise from silence but from the harmony of bamboo and silk. Therefore, it is known that the taste of richness is often fleeting, while the pleasure in simplicity is truly genuine.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 深思熟虑和沉着冷静不是在喝烈酒时获得的，而是在喝简单的豆汤和白开水时获得的。凄怆悲悯之情，不在枯燥孤寂，而在吹箫弹琴。此之谓也：厚味恒短，朴意独真。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 深思熟虑、从容不迫，不是喝浓酒时获得的，而是喝简单的豆汤、喝白开水时获得的。悲怆之情，不是从枯燥孤独中产生的，而是从吹笛弹琴中产生的。众所周知，厚重的滋味总是短暂的，而简单朴素的意义却是真理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 深思熟虑和沉着冷静的倾向，不是在喝烈酒时获得的，而是在喝简单的豆汤和白水时获得的。悲怜之情不是从枯燥孤独中产生的，而是从吹竹笛和弹琴中产生的。这是众所周知的真理：厚重丰富的味道总是短暂的，而简单朴素的意义才是真理。

text.ori_cn: 禅宗曰、饥来吃饭倦来眠。诗旨曰、眼前景致口头语。盖极高寓于极平、至难出于至易、有意者反远、无心者自近也。
text.man_en: In Zen it is said: When hungry, eat your rice; When fatigued, sleep. In the deep meaning of poetry it is said, The scenery is right before your eyes; The words are always on your tongue. Ultimately, the highest principle resides in the plainest notion; The most difficult emerges from the very easy. That which is "full of meaning" is, on the contrary, far away; While "NoMind" is, in truth, nearby.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Zen says, "Hunger comes to eat and tiredness comes to sleep. Poetry said, the scene in front of the spoken word. Cover the very high in the very flat, the most difficult out of the most easy, the intention of the anti-distant, the mindless from the near.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zen Buddhism says, Eat when you are hungry and sleep when you are tired. The purpose of the poem is: "The spoken word is spoken before the eyes." The extremely high is contained in the extremely flat, and the most difficult comes from the most easy. Those who are intentional will be far away, and those who are unintentional will be close.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zen says, 'When hungry, eat; when tired, sleep.' The essence of poetry says, 'The scene before the eyes, the words that come out.' Indeed, the highest is found in the most mundane, the most difficult arises from the easiest. Those with intentions are far, but those without them are naturally close.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 禅宗有云饿了就吃饭，累了就睡觉。诗的深意是：风景就在眼前，文字总在舌尖。最终，最高的原则寓于最朴素的观念之中；最困难的事情产生于最容易的事情之中。充满意义 "的东西反而离我们很远，而 "无心 "其实就在我们身边。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 禅宗有云：饿了吃饭，饿了吃饭。累了就睡觉。诗的深刻含义是：风景就在眼前；这些话总是挂在嘴边。归根结底，最高的原则在于最朴素的观念；最困难的事情往往是从最容易的事情中出现的。相反，“充满意义”的东西是遥远的。事实上，“NoMind”就在附近。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 禅宗中说：饿了就吃饭，累了就睡觉。诗意深远地说，风景就在眼前，话语总在舌尖。最终，最高的原则存在于最朴素的概念中；最困难的源自最简单的。所谓“充满意义”的东西，反而很遥远；而“无心”，其实就在身边。

text.ori_cn: 水流而境无声、得处喧见寂之趣。山高而云不碍、悟出有入无之机。
text.man_en: The water flows, but no sound is there: From this we grasp the meaning of seeing peace in the midst of tumult. The mountains are high, but the clouds are unobstructed: From this we awake to the chance of passing from existence to nonexistence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The water flows without sound, and one can see silence in the midst of noise. The mountain is high, but the clouds are unhindered, and one realises the opportunity of entering into nothing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The water flows but the environment is silent, and you can find the joy of silence wherever there is noise. The mountain is high and the clouds are not in the way. I realize that there is an opportunity to enter and exit the non-being.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The water flows silently through the landscape, embodying the charm of finding calm in noise. The mountains stand tall undisturbed by the clouds, revealing the opportunity to comprehend the interplay of presence and absence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 水在流动，却没有声音：由此，我们领悟了在喧闹中看到宁静的含义。山虽高，云无碍：我们从中领悟到从有到无的契机。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 水流而无声，由此可知乱中见和的意义。山虽高，云无碍，我们由此醒悟到从有到无的机会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 水流无声：由此可见，在喧闹中见到和平的意义。高山耸立，云雾无碍：由此可悟，从存在到非存在的契机。

text.ori_cn: 山林是胜地、一営恋便成市朝。书画是雅事、一贪痴便成商贾。盖心无染着、欲界是仙都。心有系恋、楽境成苦海矣。
text.man_en: Mountains and forests— excellent places. But once you place designs on them, They become no better than the marketplace. Books and paintings— elegant things. But once they are coveted unreasonably, They are no better than pawned goods. Generally, if the mind is untainted, Even the vulgar world is the realm of the sages. But if the mind is infatuated, Even places of pleasure become seas of regret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The mountains and forests are a resort, but when one is obsessed with them, one becomes a marketplace. Calligraphy and painting are elegant things, but when one is greedy, one becomes a merchant. When the mind is free from attachment, the realm of desire is a fairyland. When the heart is attached, the realm of musicianship becomes a sea of suffering.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Mountains and forests are resorts, and once you fall in love, you become a city. Calligraphy and painting are elegant things, and if you are greedy and foolish, you will become a businessman. The mind is untainted, and the realm of desire is the capital of immortality. If the heart is in love, the situation becomes a sea of ​​suffering.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The mountains and forests are a paradise; once you yearn for them, they become a marketplace. Calligraphy and painting are elegant pursuits; once you covet them, they become commerce. Indeed, if the heart is untainted, the world of desires becomes a celestial realm. If the heart is attached, a land of joy becomes a sea of suffering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 山脉和森林--绝佳之地。但一旦你在它们身上进行设计，它们就会变得不比市场好多少。书籍和绘画--高雅之物。但一旦被人无理觊觎，就会变得和当铺货一样。一般来说，如果心无杂念，即使俗世也是圣贤的境界。但如果心存迷恋，即使是欢乐之地，也会变成遗憾之海。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 山脉和森林——绝佳的地方。但一旦你对它们进行设计，它们就变得并不比市场更好。书籍和绘画——优雅的东西。但一旦被无理觊觎，那它们就跟当货没什么两样了。一般来说，心若清净，即使是俗世，也是圣人境界。但若心痴迷，即使是快乐的地方，也会变成悔恨的海洋。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 山林——极好的地方。但一旦你对它们产生了设计，它们就不比市场好。书画——优雅之物。但一旦被不合理地觊觎，它们就不比当铺里的货物好。总的来说，如果心灵纯洁，即使是庸俗的世界也是圣人的境界。但如果心灵迷恋，即使是欢愉之地也会变成悔恨之海。

text.ori_cn: 时当喧雑、则平日所记忆者、皆漫然忘去。境在清宁、则夙昔所遗忘者、又恍尔现前。可见静躁稍分、昏明顿异也。
text.man_en: The moment there is noise and confusion, Even the things we remember from day to day Are all forgotten, one after another. In a moment of clarity and peace, Even the things we have forgotten long ago Appear before our very eyes. Thus we perceive: If peace and boisterousness are separated but a little, Darkness and light will be suddenly distinct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the time is noisy and prosperous, all that one remembers from the past is forgotten. When the situation is peaceful, then what has been forgotten in the past will appear again. This shows that there is a slight difference between quietness and restlessness, and a sudden difference between lightness and darkness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When there is a lot of noise, all the things I remember in my daily life will be forgotten. When the environment is in Qingning, things that have been forgotten in the past suddenly appear before you. It can be seen that there is a slight difference in calmness and agitation, and there is also a sudden change in drowsiness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When in the midst of noise and clamor, all that one usually remembers is easily forgotten. However, in moments of calm and tranquility, what was once forgotten suddenly reappears. This shows that the states of quiet and agitation bring about stark differences in clarity and perception.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在嘈杂和混乱的时刻，就连我们日复一日所记得的事情也会被一一遗忘。在清澈宁静的时刻，即使是我们早已遗忘的事情，也会出现在我们眼前。我们由此感悟：如果平静与喧闹稍稍分开，黑暗与光明就会突然分明。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当喧嚣混乱的时候，连我们日复一日记得的事情，也都被遗忘了，一件又一件。在清明与平静的时刻，即使是我们早已忘记的事情也出现在我们眼前。故知：平静与喧闹稍稍分开，黑暗与光明就会突然分明。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一旦出现噪音和混乱，即使我们日复一日记得的事情，也会一个接一个地被遗忘。在清明和平静的时刻，即使是我们早已遗忘的事情，也会出现在我们的眼前。因此我们感知到：如果宁静和喧闹稍微分离，黑暗和光明将会瞬间分明。

text.ori_cn: 芦花被下、卧雪眠云、保全得一窝夜气。竹叶杯中、吟风弄月、躲离了万丈红尘。
text.man_en: Under a comforter of reeds, I lie down in the snow, sleeping above the clouds. And, in a single room, I am able to preserve The refreshing force of the night's serenity. Well into my cups, I chant into the wind, playing under the moon. Thus can I take this body and hide it away, Ten thousand leagues from the world's crimson dust.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Under the blanket of reeds, lying in the snow and sleeping in the clouds, a nest of night air is preserved. In a cup of bamboo leaves, chanting the wind and playing with the moon, I have escaped from the ten thousand feet of red dust.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Under the reed quilt, I lie in the snow and sleep in the clouds, preserving the night air. In the bamboo leaf cup, I sing the wind and make the moon play, hiding away from the world of mortals.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Under the reed flowers, sleeping amidst snow and clouds, preserving a nest of peaceful night air. In a bamboo leaf cup, singing to the wind and playing with the moon, escaping the boundless earthly troubles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在芦苇被下，我躺在雪地里，睡在云端之上。在单间里，我能够保留夜晚宁静的清新力量。我对风吟唱，在月下嬉戏。如此，我便可将此身隐匿，远离世间红尘万里。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我盖着芦苇被，躺在雪地里，睡在云端之上。而且，在一个单间里，我能够保留夜晚宁静的清爽力量。我入杯，在风中吟唱，在月下嬉戏。如此我才能将这身躯藏起来，远离红尘万里。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在芦苇的温柔怀抱下，我躺在雪地上，睡在云以上。独居一室，我能保存夜的宁静之力。酒意正浓时，我对风而歌，在月下嬉戏。我就这样将自己的身心隐藏在万里之外，远离尘世的喧嚣。

text.ori_cn: 衮冕行中、着一藜杖的山人、便増一段高风。渔樵路上、著一衮衣的朝士、転添许多俗气。固知浓不胜淡、俗不如雅也。
text.man_en: If, in the procession of a high official, There is one mountain recluse with a goosefoot staff, It increases the train's lofty character by at least a degree. If, on the road of fishermen and woodcutters, There is one court official in ceremonial robes, It adds vulgarity to the place by no small measure. Know this well: The rich is not superior to the plain; The worldly does not stand up to the unsullied.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The mountain man with a staff of quinoa in his robe is a man of high style. The man with the robe of a gun on the road of the fisherman and the woodcutter has added a lot of vulgarity. I know that the richness is not as good as the lightness, and the vulgarity is not as good as the elegance.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When Gong Mian was walking, the mountain man with a quinoa staff was hit by a high wind. On the fishing and woodcutting road, the court officials wearing uniforms added a lot of tackiness. I know that thick is worse than light, and vulgarity is not as good as elegance.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a hermit, clad in ceremonial robes and carrying a reed staff, walks among others, it adds an element of high elegance. Conversely, when a court official dons the same robes along the path of the fishermen and woodcutters, it only adds to the mundane atmosphere. Indeed, we understand that richness does not surpass simplicity, and the vulgar cannot compare to the refined.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果在高官的队伍中，有一位山中隐士手持鹅足杖，那至少会使队伍的崇高气质增加一分。如果在渔夫和樵夫的队伍中，有一位身着礼服的朝廷官员，那就会使这个地方的庸俗程度大大增加。要知道富贵不能淫，贫贱不能移。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果在大官的行列中，有一个拿着黎杖的山隐，那火车的威严至少会增加一个档次。渔樵路上，若有一位身着礼服的朝廷官员，更是增添了不小的俗气。深知这一点：富贵并不比平民高明；世俗的人抵挡不住清白的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果，在高官的队伍中，有一个拿着鹅掌杖的隐士，这会给整个队伍增添至少一分高雅的气息。如果，在渔夫和樵夫的路上，有一个穿着礼服的官员，这会给这个地方增添不少俗气。务必明白：富贵不比平凡高贵，世俗无法胜过清白。

text.ori_cn: 出世之道、即在渉世中、不必绝人以逃世。了心之功、即在尽心内、不必绝欲以灰心。
text.man_en: The way of transcending the world Exists in passing the world right through. It is not necessary to cut people off, and thus avoid the world. The means of understanding your mind Exists in using it completely. It is not necessary to cut off your desires, and thus turn the mind to ashes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way to go out of the world is to go through the world without having to flee from it. The work of the mind is to be done within the heart, and not to be discouraged by desires.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The way to escape from the world is to live in the world, and there is no need to kill people in order to escape from the world. The power of knowing one's mind lies within one's heart. There is no need to give up desires to lose heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of transcending the world is actually found in engaging with it; there is no need to isolate oneself to escape from it. The cultivation of understanding lies within applying one's heart fully; there is no need to sever desires to become disheartened.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 超越世界的方式存在于对世界的穿越之中。不必与人隔绝，从而避开世界。理解心灵的方法在于完全利用它。不必断绝欲望，从而将心灵化为灰烬。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 超越世界之道，存在于穿越世界之中。没有必要断绝人与人之间的距离，从而避开世俗。理解你的心的方法存在于完全使用它。没有必要切断你的欲望，从而将心变成灰烬。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 超越世界的方法是在穿越世界时实现的。不需要与人隔绝来避开这个世界。了解心灵的办法在于完全使用它。不需要断绝欲望来使心灵化为灰烬。

text.ori_cn: 此身常放在闲处、栄辱得失、谁能差遗我。此心常安在静中、是非利害、谁能瞒昧我。
text.man_en: If this body could be forever released to a place of true leisure, Who would be able to drive me away With honor or shame, gain or loss? If this mind could forever exist in the midst of inactivity, Who would be able to deceive or cheat me With right or wrong, profit or harm?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This body is always at ease, who can miss me in honour, disgrace, gain or loss. This mind is always at peace; who can conceal from me what is right and wrong?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This body is always placed in a idle place, suffering from gain and loss. Who can send me away? This mind is always at peace. Who can hide right and wrong from me?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This body is often placed in leisure; honor and disgrace, gain and loss, who could change me? This mind is always at peace in stillness; right and wrong, benefits and harms, who could deceive me?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果这个身体可以永远释放，回到真正的闲暇之地，谁又能用荣誉或耻辱、利益或损失来驱赶我？如果这颗心能永远存在于无为之中，谁又能用对或错、利或害来欺骗或欺骗我？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 此身若能永远解脱至真闲处，荣辱得失，谁能赶走我？若此心常住于无为之中，谁能欺我是非利害？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 倘若这具身体能够永远被释放到一个真正闲适的地方，谁能用荣辱得失来驱使我？倘若这颗心灵能够永远存在于无所作为的境地，谁能用是非利害来欺骗我？

text.ori_cn: 竹篱下、忽闻犬吠鶏鸣、恍似云中世界。芸窗中、雅聴蝉吟鸦噪、方知静里乾坤。
text.man_en: Walking along a bamboo hedge, Unexpectedly I hear a dog bark, a cock crow, And somehow I'm in a world amidst the clouds. Sitting in my booklined room, I hear the continuing cicada's cry, the crow's noisy caw, And now I perceive the universe of peace.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Under the bamboo hedge, I suddenly heard the dogs barking and chirping, like a world in the clouds. In the window, listen to the cicadas and crows, and realise that the world is quiet.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Under the bamboo fence, I suddenly heard the barking of dogs, and it seemed like a world in the clouds. In the window, you can hear the cicadas singing and the crows making noise, so you can understand the world in the quiet.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By the bamboo fence, I suddenly hear dogs barking and roosters crowing, it feels like a world in the clouds. Through the window with a book, I elegantly listen to the cicadas' songs and crows' calls, only then do I realize the tranquility within this vast universe.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 漫步竹篱，忽闻犬吠鸡鸣，恍然置身云间。坐在书斋里，听蝉鸣蝉叫，听乌鸦聒噪，此刻，我感知到了宇宙的宁静。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 沿竹篱而行，不料狗吠鸡鸣，不知怎的到了云中世界。坐在书房里，蝉鸣不绝，乌鸦啼鸣，顿觉宇宙太平。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 走在竹篱旁，忽然听到狗叫，鸡啼，不知怎的，我仿佛置身于云端的世界。坐在书房里，我听到蝉声不断，乌鸦吵闹的叫声，而现在我感受到的是宁静的宇宙。

text.ori_cn: 我不希栄、何忧乎利禄之香饵。我不竞进、何畏乎仕官之危机。
text.man_en: If I do not seek prosperity, Why should I be troubled by the sweetsmelling bait of profit or reward? If I do not compete to get ahead, Why should I fear the certain danger of working for the state?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If I do not wish to honour myself, why should I worry about the bait of profit? If I do not strive for advancement, why should I be afraid of the crisis of office?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I don't want to lose money, so why worry about the fragrant bait of wealth and wealth. If I don't compete for advancement, why should I be afraid of the crisis of being an official?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I do not seek glory, so why should I be tempted by the lure of wealth and rank? I do not strive for advancement, so why should I fear the perils of officialdom?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我若不求富贵，又何必为利益和报酬的甜言蜜语所困扰？如果我不为出人头地而竞争，又何必害怕为国家工作的必然危险？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若我不求荣华富贵，又何必为利益或报酬的香甜所困扰呢？如果我不通过竞争来取得成功，我为什么要担心为国家工作的某些危险呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我若不求繁荣，何必为利益或报酬的甜美诱饵而烦恼？我若不争先恐后，何必惧怕为国家工作所带来的必然危险？

text.ori_cn: 徜徉于山林泉石之闲、而尘心渐息。夷犹于诗书図画之内、而俗气潜消。故、君子虽不玩物丧志、亦常借境调心。
text.man_en: Rambling among the mountains and forests, springs and rocks, The mind soiled by the dust of the world gradually expires. Playing leisurely with poetry and books, paintings and sketches, The spirit of the vulgar quietly ceases. Therefore, the gentleman Does not take pleasure in material things or lose his free will; But makes use of another land and pacifies his mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Wandering in the mountains, forests, springs and stones, and the dusty heart gradually rests. In the poetry, calligraphy, painting and calligraphy, and the vulgarity of the submerged. Therefore, although the gentleman does not play with objects, but also often use the environment to adjust the heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wandering in the mountains, forests, springs and rocks, the dusty mind gradually subsides. The foreignness is still in the poems, books and paintings, but the vulgarity has disappeared. Therefore, although a gentleman does not play with things to lose his morale, he often uses circumstances to adjust his mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wandering among the serene mountains and streams, the worldly heart gradually calms. Immersed in poetry, books, and paintings, the mundane spirit quietly dissipates. Therefore, although the gentleman does not indulge in things to the detriment of his ambition, he often uses the environment to harmonize his mind.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 漫游于山林泉石之间，被世俗尘埃玷污的心灵渐渐沉寂。闲玩诗书画草图，庸俗之气悄然而止。故君子不以物喜，不以己悲，借他乡而安其心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 徜徉在山林泉石之间，被尘世尘埃玷污的心灵渐渐消逝。悠闲地把玩诗书画画，俗气悄然息息。因此，君子不贪图物质享受，不丧失自由意志；却借用他地而安其心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 徜徉于山林间，泉石之间，心灵被尘世所污染渐渐消逝。悠闲地与诗书、画卷相玩，庸俗之心悄然止息。因此，君子不以物质之物为乐，也不失去自由意志；但善用他方，安抚心灵。

text.ori_cn: 春日气象繁华、令人心神骀荡。不若秋日云白风清、兰芳桂馥、水天一色、上下空明、使人神骨倶清也。
text.man_en: Spring days have an air of prosperity and bustle, And we feel expansive and at ease. But this cannot equal the days of autumn When clouds are white and winds are pure, Orchids fragrant and the cassia sweetsmelling, The moonlight shines high in the heavens above, and is reflected in the rivers and streams below, Making us pure in body and mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In spring, the weather is so prosperous that one's mind is overwhelmed. It is not like autumn when the clouds are white and the wind is clear, the orchids are fragrant with osmanthus, the water and the sky are one colour, and the sky is clear above and below, which makes one's spirit and bones clear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The weather in spring is prosperous and exciting. It is not as good as the white clouds and clear wind in autumn, the fragrance of orchids and osmanthus, the same color of water and sky, the clear sky above and below, which makes people's spirits and bones clear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The thriving spring weather invigorates the mind. It does not compare to the autumn days with their white clouds and clear winds, the fragrance of orchids and osmanthus, the water and sky of the same hue, everything pure and bright, which cleanse the spirit and revitalize the soul.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 春天的日子有一种繁华热闹的气息，让我们感到舒展和自在。但这无法与秋天相提并论，秋天白云朵朵，秋风送爽，兰花芬芳，桂花清香，月光洒在高高的天上，映照在脚下的小河小溪，让我们身心纯净。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 春天的气息是繁华热闹的，让人心旷神怡。但这还比不上秋天的日子，云白风清，兰花桂香，月光高照上天，倒映下江河溪水，使我们身心清净。 。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 春天的日子充满繁荣与繁忙的气息，我们感到心旷神怡。但这无法与秋天的日子相比，云朵洁白，微风清爽，幽兰飘香，桂花芬芳，月光高悬于天，倒映在江河之中，使我们身心纯净。

text.ori_cn: 一字不识、而有诗意者、得诗家真趣。一偈不参、而有禅味者、悟禅教玄机。
text.man_en: If you have not memorized a single Chinese character, But possess the meaning of poetry, You have obtained poetry's substance. If you have not recited a single gatha, But possess the taste of Zen, You are awake to the mysteries of its teachings.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who knows not a single word, but has a sense of poetry, has gained the true interest of a poet. Those who have a taste for Zen without knowing a single verse will realise the mystery of Zen teaching.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who do not know a single word but have a sense of poetry have the true taste of a poet. Those who do not participate in a verse but have a Zen flavor have understood the mystery of Zen teaching.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One who does not recognize a single character, yet has poetic sentiment, grasps the true essence of poetry. One who has not comprehended a single verse, yet tastes the flavor of Zen, understands the profound mysteries of Zen teachings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你没有背诵过一个汉字，但却掌握了诗歌的含义，你就获得了诗歌的内涵。如果你没有背诵过一个偈语，但却拥有禅的味道，那么你就清醒地领悟了禅宗教义的奥秘。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你没有记住一个汉字，但具备了诗的意义，你就获得了诗的实质。如果你没有念过一首偈子，但具有禅宗的味道，你就会觉知其教义的奥秘。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你没有记住一个汉字，但拥有诗的意义，你已经掌握了诗的本质。如果你没有背诵过一个偈语，但拥有禅的意境，你已觉醒于其教义的奥秘。

text.ori_cn: 机动的、弓影疑为蛇蝎、寝石视为伏虎。此中浑是杀气。念息的、石虎可作海鸥、蛙声可当鼓吹、触处倶见真机。
text.man_en: If your nerves are agitated, You will look at the shadow of a bow and imagine a snake or scorpion. You will look at stationary rocks and suspect tigers crouched in waiting. In this frame of mind, everything contains a mortal danger. If your thoughts have been suspended, You can make violent men as gentle as seagulls, You can hear the frog's croak as the sound of drum and flute In everything you touch, you will see the play of truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Manoeuvre, bow shadow is suspected to be a snake and scorpion, bedrock is regarded as a tiger. This is a murderous spirit. The stone tiger can be used as a seagull, the sound of frogs can be used as a drum, and the touching place can be seen as a real machine.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If it is mobile, the shadow of the bow is suspected to be a snake or scorpion, and if it is sleeping on a stone, it is considered to be a crouching tiger. It's full of murderous intent. For those who are thinking of breathing, the stone tiger can be used as a seagull, the sound of a frog can be used as a drumbeat, and true meaning can be seen wherever it touches.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The moving shadows of bows are mistaken for snakes and scorpions, and the sleeping stones are seen as crouching tigers. This place is filled with murderous intent. With a calm mind, the stone tiger can be seen as a seagull, the croaking of frogs can be heard as drumbeats, and everywhere the true essence is revealed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你神经紧张，你会看着弓的影子，想象是蛇或蝎子。你会看着静止的岩石，怀疑老虎在蹲伏等待。在这种心态下，一切都蕴含着致命的危险。如果你的思想已经暂停，你就能让暴躁的人变得像海鸥一样温柔，你就能听到青蛙的呱呱叫声如同鼓声和笛声 在你接触的一切事物中，你都能看到真理的游戏。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你的神经激动，你会看着弓的影子，想象出一条蛇或蝎子。你会看到静止的岩石，怀疑老虎蹲伏着等待。在这种心态下，一切都蕴藏着致命的危险。如果你的思想被悬置，你可以让暴力的人变得像海鸥一样温柔，你可以听到青蛙的呱呱声像鼓笛的声音，在你所接触的一切中，你会看到真理的演奏。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你的神经紧张，你会把弓的影子看成蛇或蝎子。你会看着静止的岩石，怀疑那里潜伏着老虎。在这种心境下，一切都包含着致命的危险。如果你的思绪被悬置，你可以使暴力的人如海鸥般温顺，你可以将青蛙的叫声听成鼓笛之音。无论碰触什么，你都会看到真理的展现。

text.ori_cn: 身如不繋之舟、一任流行坎止。心似既灰之木、何妨刀割香涂。
text.man_en: The body is like an unmoored boat:Whether it proceeds or is thwarted Is only up to the current. The mind resembles a driedup tree: How can it be hindered By cleaving swords or daubs of cosmetics?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The body is like a boat with no link, letting it go on and on. The heart is like a tree that has been grey, why not cut it with a knife and paint it with incense?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The body is like a boat without ties, and it will stop at any time. The heart is like a gray wood, so why not cut it with a knife and paint it with fragrance?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The body is like an unanchored boat, floating freely in any rise or fall. The heart is like wood already turned to ash, undisturbed by carving or perfuming.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 身体就像一艘没有靠岸的船：是前进还是受阻，只取决于水流。心灵就像一棵干枯的树：岂是刀剑或脂粉所能阻挡？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 身体如无泊之船，前进或受阻，只取决于水流​​。心如枯树，怎能被砍剑、涂抹化妆品所阻碍？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 身体如同一只未系泊的船：无论前行或被阻 仅取决于水流。心灵类似一棵枯树：怎能被切割之剑或涂抹化妆品所阻碍？

text.ori_cn: 人情聴鴬啼则喜、闻蛙鸣则厌。见花则思培之、遇草则欲去之。倶是以形气用事。若以性天视之、何者非自鸣其天机、非自畅其生意也。
text.man_en: The human heart Listens to the nightingale sing and thereupon rejoices; Hears the frog croak and is thereupon annoyed; Observes the flowers bloom and immediately thinks of gardening; Comes upon some weeds and promptly reaches for the hoe. This approach judges a thing by feeling its form. Look carefully at an object through its true nature. Then, no matter what it may be, What does not, of its own, sing of nature's play? What does not, by itself, look to its own growth?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When this man cries, he is happy; when he hears the frogs, he is disgusted. When they see a flower, they want to cultivate it, and when they encounter grass, they want to get rid of it. This is a matter of form and energy. If we look at it from the perspective of nature and heaven, what is it that is not sounding its own heavenly chances, and what is it that is not flowing its own business?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The crow of human beings makes you happy, and the sound of frogs croaks and you feel disgusted. When you see flowers, you want to cultivate them; when you see grass, you want to get rid of them. This is the use of form and energy. If we look at it from the perspective of nature, it will not reveal its secrets and smooth its business.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Humans are pleased to hear the warbling of orioles but detest the croaking of frogs. When seeing flowers, they think of nurturing them; when encountering weeds, they want to remove them. All these are governed by physical emotions. However, if viewed through the lens of natural disposition, isn't everything expressing its innate charm and inherent vitality?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人的心灵听到夜莺歌唱就会欢欣鼓舞；听到青蛙呱呱叫就会恼羞成怒；看到鲜花盛开就会立刻想到园艺；看到杂草丛生就会立刻拿起锄头。这种方法是通过感受事物的形态来判断事物。仔细观察一个物体的真实面目。那么，无论它是什么，有什么东西本身不是在歌唱大自然的游戏呢？有什么东西不在自己的生长过程中眺望自己？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人心听夜莺歌唱而欢喜；闻青蛙呱呱，遂恼；看到花朵盛开，立即想到园艺；遇到一些杂草，立即伸手去拿锄头。这种方法通过感觉事物的形式来判断事物。仔细观察一个物体，透过它的真实本质。那么，无论它是什么，有什么不以它自己的方式歌唱大自然的戏剧呢？什么本身不寻求自身的成长？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人心听到夜莺的歌唱便感到喜悦；听到青蛙的叫声便感到烦恼；看到花儿开放便立刻想到园艺；看见杂草便马上去拿锄头。这种方式是通过感觉事物的形式来判断事情。仔细观察一个物体的真实本质。那么，无论是什么，有什么东西不是自发地歌颂大自然的游戏？有什么东西不是自行关注自身的成长？

text.ori_cn: 髪落歯疏、任幻形之雕谢、鸟吟花笑、识自性之真如。
text.man_en: Hair thinning, teeth falling out— Leave that to the withering of the temporal form. Birds singing, flowers blooming— Know this to be the true reality of your own nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The hair of the tooth, the carving of illusory shapes, the singing of birds and the laughing of flowers, the knowledge of the true nature of the self.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The hair is falling and sparse, letting the illusive shapes fade away, the birds are singing and the flowers are laughing, and I realize the true nature of my own nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With hair thinning and teeth sparse, let the illusory form fade; as birds sing and flowers smile, realize the true nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 头发稀疏，牙齿脱落--让时间的形式枯萎吧。鸟语花香--要知道这才是你本性的真实写照。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 头发稀疏，牙齿脱落——让时间形态枯萎吧。鸟儿歌唱，鲜花盛开——知道这是你本性的真实实相。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 头发稀疏，牙齿脱落——让这些随时间的流逝而凋零。鸟儿歌唱，鲜花盛开——这才是真正体现你本性的现实。

text.ori_cn: 欲其中者、波沸寒潭、山林不见其寂。虚其中者、凉生酷暑、朝市不知其喧。
text.man_en: Filled with desire, You are like waves seething over a cold abyss: Even in mountains and forests, you will not see peace. Filled with Emptiness, You are like a cool breeze born from intense heat: Even in town and market, you will not know noise.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you want to be in it, the waves will boil in a cold pool, and the mountains and forests will not see the silence. Those who want to be in it will be in the cool of the summer and will not know the clamour of the marketplace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who want to be in it will find the waves boiling in the cold pools and the mountains and forests, but they will not see their silence. Those who are short of it will suffer from severe heat, and will not be able to hear the noise of the market.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For those who desire, the wave boils in the cold pond, and the tranquility of the mountains and forests cannot be seen. For those who are content, coolness arises in the midst of scorching heat, and the hustle and bustle of the marketplace goes unnoticed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 充满欲望，你就像寒冷深渊中汹涌的波涛：即使在高山和森林中，你也看不到宁静。充满空虚，你就像从酷热中诞生的凉风：即使在城镇和市场，你也不知道喧闹。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你充满欲望，如冰冷深渊的波涛，即使在山林中，也不见平静。充满空性，你如酷暑中生出的清风：即使在城镇和市场，你也不会知道噪音。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 充满欲望时，你如波涛在寒冷的深渊中翻滚：即使在山林中，你也不会见到平静。充满空无时，你如从酷热中诞生的凉风：即使在城镇和市场中，你也不会感到喧嚣。

text.ori_cn: 多蔵者厚亡。故知富不如贫之无虑。高歩者疾颠。故知贵不如贱之常安。
text.man_en: The person who hoards much may lose enormously. Therefore know that wealth is not equal To having no apprehensions of poverty. The person who climbs high may quickly fall headfirst. Therefore know that high status is not equal To being at ease without it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The one who has a lot of money dies thickly. Therefore, it is better to be rich than to be poor. The high-footed man is not as fast as the high-footed man. Therefore, I know that it is not as easy to be rich as it is to be poor.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have too much money will perish. Therefore, we know that being rich is worse than being poor and carefree. Those who walk too high will fall quickly. Therefore, we know that the noble is worse than the humble.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who hoard excessively lose greatly. Hence, it is known that being wealthy is not as worry-free as being poor. Those who walk hastily stumble quickly. Hence, it is known that being noble is not as consistently peaceful as being humble.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 囤积居奇的人可能会损失惨重。因此，要知道财富并不等于对贫穷没有忧虑。攀高的人可能很快就会一头栽下来。所以要知道，地位高并不等于没有地位也能怡然自得。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 囤积过多的人可能会遭受巨大损失。所以要知道，富有，不等于无忧无虑。爬得高的人可能很快就会一头栽倒。所以要知道，地位高，不等于没有地位就安逸。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 积聚很多财物的人可能会损失巨大。因此要知道财富不等于没有贫穷的忧虑。爬得高的人可能会很快头朝下摔下来。因此要知道高地位不等于没有它也能安然自得。

text.ori_cn: 読易暁窗、丹砂研松间之露。谭経午案、宝磬宣竹下之风。
text.man_en: Reading the I Chingby the window at dawn, I grind red notation ink with dew from pine branches. Discussing the sutras at my desk in the afternoon, The sound of the clear gong is carried by the wind beneath the bamboo.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The window of Yomi Yi is filled with the dew of the pines, and the sand of dancers is used to study it. The winds of the bamboo are heard through the chimes of a precious stone.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Observe the dew between the pine trees and the cinnabar in the window. The Tan Wu case and the Baoqing announced the style under the bamboo.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Reading under the easy dawn, grinding cinnabar with dew between the pines. Discussing scriptures at noon, the precious chimes resonate with the breeze beneath the bamboo.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 晨起窗前读易经，松枝露水磨红墨。午后案头论经书，竹下风吹清锣鼓。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 黎明窗外读《清白》，用松枝露磨红墨。午后案上讲经，竹下风声清锣。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 黎明时分在窗前读《易经》，用松枝上的露水研磨红色的注释墨水。午后在书桌旁讨论经文，清晰的钟声随着风吹过竹林。

text.ori_cn: 花居盆内、终乏生机、鸟入笼中、便减天趣。不若山间花鸟、错雑成文、翺翔自若、自是悠然会心。
text.man_en: When flowers are put in a tray, They lose the force of life. When birds are put in a cage, Their natural instincts quickly decline. Better to Have flowers and birds in the mountains, Mix and flock together, producing their patterns, Flying about at their own free will, Spontaneously carefree and in harmony with themselves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Flowers living in pots, the ultimate lack of vitality, birds into the cage, will be less interesting. Not like the birds and flowers in the mountains, the wrong雑成文, flying freely, since it is a leisurely heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Flowers in pots will lose their vitality, and birds in cages will lose their beauty. It is not as beautiful as the flowers and birds in the mountains, flying freely and knowingly.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Flowers confined to a pot ultimately lack vitality; birds trapped in a cage lose their natural charm. Far better are the flowers and birds in the mountains, interwoven in a natural tapestry, freely soaring and embodying serene gratification.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当鲜花被放在托盘里，它们就失去了生命的力量。鸟儿被关在笼子里，自然本能也会迅速衰退。倒不如让花儿和鸟儿在山间自由翱翔，无忧无虑，和谐相处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当鲜花被放入托盘时，它们就失去了生命的力量。当鸟儿被关在笼子里时，它们的本能很快就会衰退。不如山中花鸟，杂群而生，自在飞翔，自在自在，和谐自在。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 花放在托盘里时，生命的力量消失了。鸟放在笼子里时，它们的自然本能迅速衰退。最好让花和鸟在山中，混杂在一起，形成它们的图案，自由自在地飞翔，天真无忧，与自然和谐相处。

text.ori_cn: 世人只缘认得我字太真。故多种种嗜好、种种烦悩。前人云、不复知有我、安知物为贵。又云、知身不是我、烦悩更何侵。真破的之言也。
text.man_en: Simply because people in this world rely too much on the truth of "self, " Preferences and desires are many and sundry, Many and sundry are passions and lusts. A man of former times said, If I did not know the self existed, How would I know the desirability of things? Someone also said, If you know that the body is not the self, How can lusts and passions be a bother? These are truly penetrating words.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world recognises me only because I am too true to myself. Therefore, they have all kinds of hobbies and worries. The former said, "If you no longer know that there is an I, then you will know that things are precious. He also said that if you know that your body is not me, there is no more worry. This is a true breakthrough.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People in the world only know my words because they are so true. Therefore, there are many kinds of hobbies and all kinds of annoyances. The ancients said that if you no longer know that I exist, you will know that things are precious. It goes on to say, knowing that the body is not me, how can it be invaded by boredom? Really bad words.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People only recognize my name as Tai Zhen, which is why there are various desires and worries. As the ancients said, 'If you no longer know of the self, how could you understand the value of things?' They also said, 'Knowing the body is not the self, how can worries invade?' Truly, these are words that break through illusions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只因世人太过依赖 "自我 "的真理，所以喜好和欲望纷繁复杂，激情和情欲也纷繁复杂。古人说："不知有我，焉知有物？又有人说："知身非我，情欲何患？这些话真是鞭辟入里。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只因世间人太依赖“我”的真实，所以喜好、欲望纷繁复杂，纷繁复杂，就是情欲。古人云：若不知有我，何以知事可欲？亦有人言：若知身非我，情欲何扰？这些都是真正具有穿透力的话语。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 仅仅因为这个世界上的人过于依赖“自我”的真相，喜好和欲望多种多样，激情和欲望也是多种多样。古人说过，如果我不知道自我的存在，我怎么会知道事物的可取性？还有人说，如果你知道身体不是自我，欲望和激情怎么会困扰你？这些话真是透彻。

text.ori_cn: 自老视少、可以消奔驰角逐之心。自瘁视栄、可以绝纷华靡丽之念。
text.man_en: Looking at youth from the vantage point of impending old age, You can extinguish the mind That goes chasing about, competing for fortune and fame. Looking at prosperous years from the light of someday being sick and broken, You will be able to cut off thoughts Of the gay and gaudy life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you look at the old as the young, you can eliminate the heart of running and competing. If you look at eunuchs from the perspective of exhaustion, you will be able to eliminate the idea of glamour and splendour.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Since you are old and look down on yourself, you can eliminate the desire to compete. Self-exhausted vision can eliminate all gorgeous and beautiful thoughts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By viewing the elderly as we view the young, we can dissolve the urge for competitive pursuits. By viewing the fatigued as we view the prosperous, we can eliminate the desire for extravagant splendor.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 站在即将老去的角度看青春，你就能熄灭那颗追逐名利的心。站在终有一天会病入膏肓的角度看繁华的岁月，你就能熄灭对花天酒地的思念。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 以即将年老的角度看青春，可以熄灭追逐名利的心。有一天病残之光看繁华岁月，就能断掉花花世界的念头。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 站在即将来临的老年之角度看青春，你可以熄灭那争逐财富与名声的心。站在终有一天会得病衰老的光景看繁荣岁月，你将能够斩断对奢华浮华生活的念头。

text.ori_cn: 人情世态、倏忽万端、不宜认得太真。尧夫云、昔日所云我、而今却是伊。不知今日我又属后来谁。人常作是観、便可解却胸中罥矣。
text.man_en: Social conditions and the human heart Quickly change from one thing to the next: We should not look to either for the Great Truth. Yao Fu said, In times long past, "myself" was said to be a certain person; But now, on the contrary, I believe that person was someone else. Thus, I don't know— the person I am today I may consider to be someone else in the future. If we could always use this view, The vexations we hold within would quickly disappear.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not advisable to recognise too much of the world as it is. Yao Fu said, "I used to be me, but now I am Yi. I don't know to whom I belong today. If you always think like this, you will be able to get rid of the binds in your chest.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The human condition is unpredictable and unpredictable, and it is not advisable to take it too seriously. Yaofu said, What was said about me in the past is now Yi. I don’t know who I belong to later today. If people often do this, they will be able to get rid of the pain in their chests.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Human sentiments and worldly conditions, fleeting and myriad, should not be taken too seriously. As Yao Fu said, what was once referred to as 'I' in the past, is now seen as 'He.' Who knows to whom 'I' will belong in the future? If one often reflects in this way, one can unravel the tangles in their heart.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 社会状况和人心瞬息万变：我们不应该从两者中寻找伟大的真理。尧夫说：在很久以前，"我 "被说成是某个人；而现在，我却认为那个人是另一个人。因此，我不知道--今天的我，将来可能会被认为是另一个人。如果我们能经常使用这种观点，我们内心的烦恼就会很快消失。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 社会状况和人心迅速从一件事转变为另一件事：我们不应该向任何一件事寻求伟大的真理。姚甫说：“在很久以前，‘我’被说成是某个人；现在，‘我’被说成是某个人。但现在相反，我相信那个人是另外一个人。因此，我不知道——今天的我将来可能会被认为是另一个人。如果我们能经常运用这个观点，我们内心的烦恼就会很快消失。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 社会环境和人心快速变化：我们不应该向它们寻求伟大的真理。姚枫说，曾经，“我”被认为是某个人；但现在，相反的，我相信那个人是另一个人。因此，我不知道——我今天的人，未来我可能认为是另一个人。如果我们能一直用这个观点，我们内心的烦恼将很快消失。

text.ori_cn: 热闹中、着一冷眼、便省许多苦心思。冷落处、存一热心、便得许多真趣味。
text.man_en: If in the midst of passion and din, You keep your eye cool and unmoved, You will eliminate many bitter thoughts. If in a place of hard and unfavorable circumstances, You keep your mind passionately enthused, You will obtain an abundance of true grace.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the midst of the hustle and bustle, a cold eye saves a lot of painstaking thought. In a cold place, if you have a warm heart, you will get a lot of real fun.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the midst of the excitement, a cold look will save you a lot of trouble. If you are enthusiastic in a lonely place, you will get a lot of real fun.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the midst of bustling activity, maintaining a cold eye can save much effort and trouble. In a lonely place, having a warm heart can bring much genuine pleasure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果在激情和喧闹中，你保持冷静的目光，不为所动，你就会消除许多苦闷的想法。如果在艰苦和不利的环境中，你能保持激情澎湃的头脑，你就会获得真正的恩典。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果在激情与喧嚣中，你的目光保持冷静，不为所动，你就会消除许多苦涩的想法。如果你在艰难困苦的环境中，保持一颗热忱的心，你就会得到丰盛的真恩典。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若在激情与喧闹之中，您依然保持冷静与镇定，您将消除许多痛苦的思绪。若在艰难和不利的境地，您依然保持充沛的热情，您将获得丰富的真正恩典。

text.ori_cn: 有一楽境界、就有一不楽的相対待。有一好光景、就有一不好的相乘除。只是寻常家饭、素位风光、才是个安楽的窝巣。
text.man_en: For every pleasant situation, There is an unpleasant one waiting to be its complement. For every desirable condition, There is an undesirable one checking and balancing. Just eating your daily meals And enjoying your usual surrounding— Only in this is the dwelling of peace and joy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If there is a state of happiness, there is a state of unhappiness. When there is good fortune, there is bad fortune. The only place where you can live in peace is in a common household with a common meal.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wherever there is a state of mind, there is also an unconditional treatment. Whenever there is a good situation, there is also a bad situation. It's just an ordinary home with ordinary food and scenery, which is a peaceful home.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Where there is a realm of pleasure, there is a corresponding realm of displeasure. Where there is a beautiful scene, there is a corresponding scene of mediocrity. It is only everyday home-cooked meals and the ordinary tranquility of life that make for a truly comfortable nest.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 每一种令人愉快的情况，都有一种令人不愉快的情况在等待着成为它的补充。每一种理想的状态，都有一种不理想的状态在制衡。吃好一日三餐，享受周围的一切--只有这样，才是安宁和喜悦的居所。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对于每一种愉快的情况，都会有一种不愉快的情况等待着它的补充。对于每一个理想的条件，都会有一个不理想的条件进行检查和平衡。只吃日常的饭菜，享受平常的环境——唯有在此，才是平静与喜悦的居所。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 每一个愉快的情况， 都有一个不愉快的在等待与之互补。每一种可取的条件， 都有一种不可取的在制衡。只需吃着日常的饭菜， 享受平常的环境——唯有如此，才是安乐之处。

text.ori_cn: 帘栊高敞、看青山绿水呑吐云烟、识乾坤之自在。竹树扶疏、任乳燕鸣鸠送迎时序、知物我之两忘。
text.man_en: From a latticed window looking out on a broad and lofty view, I see the blue mountains and green waters with clouds and mists passing in and out And am aware of the freedom of All That Is. In the bamboo thickets and luxurious branches and leaves, I observe nursing swallows and cooing doves greeting and sending off the seasons, And know how to forget that the external and I are two.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The curtain bar is high and spacious, and you can see the green mountains and green water swallowing the clouds, and know the freedom of Qiankun and Kunlun. The bamboo trees are sparse, and the swallows and turtles welcome the season, knowing the two oblivions of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The curtains are high and open, you can see the green mountains and green water, puffing out clouds and smoke, and feel the freedom of the world. The bamboos and trees are sparse, and the swallows are singing and the doves are greeting each other at the right time. I know the two things and forget them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The high and open window frames reveal the green mountains and rivers, inhaling and exhaling the mists, understanding the freedom of the universe. The sparse bamboo and trees let young swallows and cuckoos herald the timing of the seasons, revealing the state of forgetting both self and surroundings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从格子窗望出去，视野开阔而高远，我看到青山绿水，云雾缭绕，感悟到万物的自由。在翠竹丛中，在繁茂的枝叶间，我观察着哺育我的燕子和咕咕叫的鸽子，迎接和送走四季，并懂得忘记外部和我是两个人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 透过格子窗，视野开阔，见青山绿水，云雾出入，觉一切万有的自由。竹林繁茂中，观燕子喂奶、鸽子啼送季节，懂得忘却外在与我是两个。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从镂花的窗户望出去，我看到蓝色的山峦和绿色的流水，云雾缭绕，我意识到一切的自由。在竹林和茂盛的枝叶间，我看见哺乳的燕子和咕咕叫的鸽子迎来送往季节，知道怎么忘掉外物与我本是两种。

text.ori_cn: 知成之必败、则求成之心、不必太坚。知生之必死、则保生之道、不必过労。
text.man_en: Knowing that achievement must inevitably fall apart, The mind seeking achievement Will not be too relentless or rigid. If you know that what is born must inescapably die, The Path that prolongs life Will not necessarily be too demanding.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you know that success is bound to fail, then you need not be too firm in your pursuit of success. If you know that life is bound to die, then you need not be too diligent in the way of preserving life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you know that success must lead to failure, then you don’t have to be too determined in your pursuit of success. Knowing that life must lead to death, there is no need to go too far in order to preserve life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing that success might inevitably lead to failure, one should not be overly resolute in seeking success. Understanding that life must end in death, one should not overly exert oneself in preserving life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 明知功败垂成在所难免，追求功成名就的心就不会过于无情或刻板。如果你知道 "人生自古谁无死，留取丹心照汗青"，延年益寿的道路就不会过于苛刻。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知道成就必然会崩溃，追求成就的心就不会太无情或僵化。若知生必死，则延生之道，亦不必太苛求。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知道成就必然会分崩离析，追求成就的心就不会太执着或僵化。如果知道生者必将死，延寿之道就未必太苛求。

text.ori_cn: 古徳云、竹影扫階尘不动。月轮穿沼水无痕。吾儒云、水流任急境常静。花落虽频意自闲。
text.man_en: Ku Te said, The shadow of the bamboo sweeps the steps, but the dust is unmoved. The ring of the moon glides across the pond, but in the water there is no trace. One of our Confucian scholars said, Though the waters flow rapidly, the surroundings are always serene. Though the flowers fall repeatedly, the mind is of itself at peace. If we could always maintain these thoughts When we react to events and encounter external things, How free our bodies and minds would be.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The shadow of the bamboo sweeps away the dust. The moon wheel passes through the marsh without a trace. The flow of water is always quiet, and the flowers fall often, but the mind is free. The flowers fall frequently, but the mind is at ease.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ancient clouds and bamboo shadows swept the steps and remained motionless. The moon wheel passes through the swamp water without leaving a trace. My Confucian saying goes, the water flow is always calm even in emergency situations. Although the flowers fall frequently, I feel at ease.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Gu De once said, 'The bamboo shadows sweep the steps, yet the dust remains undisturbed. The moonlight passes through the pond, leaving no trace on the water.' Our scholars say, 'Though the water flows swiftly, the scene remains serene. Even as flowers fall frequently, the mind stays at peace.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 古德曰：竹影扫阶尘不动。月环池上，水中无痕。我们的一位儒者说：水流虽急，环境常静。花谢花飞花满天，红消香断有谁怜。如果我们在应对各种事件和遇到外界事物时，都能保持这样的心境，那么我们的身心将会多么自由。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 库特曰：竹影扫步，尘埃不为所动。月环滑过池塘，但水中却不见踪影。我们的一位儒生说过，水虽急，周围却总是宁静。花虽屡落，心自安。如果我们在面对事件、遇到外在事物时能始终保持这些想法，我们的身心该是多么自由啊。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 苦特说：竹影扫阶尘不动，月轮穿沼水无痕。一位儒学学者曾说：虽流水潺潺，四周常宁静；虽花落频频，心自安然。如果我们能时刻保持这些思想，当我们对事件作出反应并遇到外物时，我们的身心会是多么自由。

text.ori_cn: 林间松韵、石上泉声、静里聴来、识天地自然鸣佩。草际烟光、水心云影、闲中観去、见乾坤最上文章。
text.man_en: The echo of the wind through the pines; The voice of the spring flowing over the rocks: When I come to listen while at peace within, I understand they are the exquisite sounds of Heaven and Earth, of the OfItselfSo. The haze that spreads at the edge of the field; The shadow of the clouds in the waters' depths: When I go to look within while at ease without, I perceive them to be the highest patterns of Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The pine rhyme in the forest, the sound of spring on the stone, quiet 聴来, knowledge of heaven and earth natural songpei. Inter-grass smoke, water, cloud shadow, idle 観去, see Qiankun the best article.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The rhyme of pine trees in the forest, the sound of springs on rocks, the sound of singing in silence, the natural sound of heaven and earth. The light of smoke in the grass, the shadow of clouds in the center of the water, taking a leisurely stroll, seeing the best article in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The melody of pines in the forest, the sound of the spring over stones, listening in silence, one recognizes the natural harmony of the universe. The haze among the grass, the reflection of clouds on the water, observing in leisure, one sees the finest pictures of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 风吹过松树的回声；泉水流过岩石的声音：当我静下心来聆听时，我明白它们是天地万物的美妙声音。田野边缘弥漫的阴霾；水域深处的云影：当我静下心来内视时，我发现它们是天地间最高的图案。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 风吹过松林的回声；泉水流过岩石的声音：当我平静地聆听时，我知道它们是天地的美妙声音，是它自己的声音。田野边缘弥漫的阴霾；水深云影：闲外观内，觉其为天地最高规律。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 松风的回声；春水在岩石上流淌的声音：当我在内心平静时前来聆听，我明白这些是天地的绝妙之音，自然之声。田野边缘的薄雾；水深处的云影：当我在外在安逸时前来观望，我感知到这些是天地的至高之美。

text.ori_cn: 眼看西晋之荆榛、犹矜白刄。身属北邙之狐兔、尚惜黄金。语云、猛獣易伏、人心难降。谿壑易填、人心难満。信哉。
text.man_en: With their eyes they see the hazels and brambles beneath which lie the ruins of the Western Tsin; 38 Yet still they are proud of their shining swords. The bodies buried at Pe Mang are now prey for foxes and hares; Yet still more they long for their yellow gold. As the saying goes: Wild animals are easy to subjugate, But man's mind is overcome with difficulty; A canyon is easy to fill in, But man's mind is difficult to fulfill with toil. Surely this is true.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I have seen the thorns of the Western Jin Dynasty, but I still cherish the white horse. The foxes and rabbits of the Northern Mang were still cherishing gold. As the saying goes, "Fierce 獣" is easy to subdue, but hearts are hard to surrender. The squabbles are easy to fill, but the hearts of the people are hard to be destroyed. I believe it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Seeing the thorns and hazels of the Western Jin Dynasty, I feel like I have a white blade. The fox and rabbit who belong to Beimang cherish gold. As the saying goes, fierce beasts are easy to subdue, but human hearts are difficult to subjugate. Streams and ravines are easy to fill, but people's hearts are hard to calm down. Believe it or not.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Witnessing the thorny brambles of Western Jin, they still prided themselves on their white blades. Though they belonged to the foxes and rabbits of North Mang, they still cherished gold. As the saying goes, ferocious beasts are easy to subdue, but the human heart is hard to conquer. Valleys and ravines are easy to fill, but the human heart is hard to satisfy. How true this is.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他们看到榛子和荆棘下是西秦的废墟；38 但他们仍为自己闪亮的宝剑而自豪。埋葬在裴垄的尸体如今成了狐狸和野兔的猎物，但他们仍然渴望得到他们的黄金。俗话说野兽易服，人心难测；峡谷易填，苦心难成。这当然是真的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他们用眼睛看到榛子和荆棘，下面是西秦的废墟。 38 然而，他们仍然为自己闪亮的剑感到自豪。埋在 Pe Mang 的尸体现在成了狐狸和野兔的猎物。然而，他们更渴望拥有黄金。俗话说：兽欲易克，人心难克。峡谷容易填满，人心却很难用劳力填满。这当然是真的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他们的眼睛看到榛树和荆棘下躺着西晋的废墟；然而他们仍然为他们闪亮的剑感到自豪。埋葬在裴芒的尸体现在成为狐狸和兔子的猎物；但他们更渴望他们的黄金沙子。俗话说：野兽易降服，人心难克服；峡谷易填满，人心难以苦工充实。这确实如此。

text.ori_cn: 心地上无风涛、随在皆青山绿树。性天中有化育、触处见鱼跃鸢飞。
text.man_en: When over the ground of the mind, there is no wind or waves, Wherever you go, will be blue mountains and green trees. When within your innate character, there is change and growth, Wherever you are, will be jumping fish and soaring hawks.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are no winds and waves on the ground of the heart, and green hills and trees are everywhere. In the heavenly nature, there is a fecundity, and everywhere I touch, I see fish leaping and kites flying.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no wind and waves in my heart, and there are green mountains and green trees everywhere. There is transformation and education in the nature sky, and you can see fish leaping and kites flying wherever you touch it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With a tranquil heart, wherever you go, you will find green mountains and lush trees. In the nature of the mind, there is a nurturing force, seen in the leaping fish and soaring kites.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当心灵的大地上无风无浪，无论你走到哪里，都会有青山绿树。当你的内在品格有了变化和成长，无论你在哪里，都会有跳跃的鱼和翱翔的鹰。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心地之上，无风无浪，所到之处，都是青山绿树。当你的本性有变化、有成长时，无论你在哪里，都是鱼跃、鹰翔。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当心地平静，没有风浪时，无论你走到哪里，都是青山绿树。当你的内在本性有变化和成长时，无论你身处何处，都是鱼跃鹰飞。

text.ori_cn: 峨冠大帯之士、一旦睹軽蓑小笠飘飘然逸也、未必不动其咨嗟。长筵広席之豪、一旦遇疏帘净几悠悠焉静也、未必不増其绻恋。人奈何駆以火牛、诱以风马、而不思自适其性哉。
text.man_en: An official who wears an imposing hat and wide sash At some time, Watching those wrapped in light straw coats and small umbrellas, Passing their time pleasantly and lightheartedly, Must surely sigh and feel envious. The wealthy man who perches atop large mats and wide rugs At some time, Dealing with those who sit at coarse rattan blinds and plain desks, Passing their time leisurely and at peace, Must surely sour with yearning and regret. How is it that men make oxen run by setting their tails on fire, Entice horses by faraway mares in heat, But never think of the quiet calm of their own nature?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Once a man with a large crown and a large belt sees a light straw raincoat floating about, he may not be immovable in his contemplation. The man who enjoys a long banquet and a wide seat may not be uninhibited once he encounters the quietness of the curtains and the clean seats. Why do people gallop the fire ox and lure the wind horse without thinking of adapting themselves to their nature?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the people of Eguan and Dabu see the fluttering coir raincoats and small hats, they may not stop and sigh. A long banquet is held in a grand banquet, and once the curtains are sparse and the curtains are clear, it will be so leisurely and quiet that it may not be without its affection. How can a man lure an ox with fire or a horse with wind, without thinking about adapting to his own nature?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A man of high rank and wide robes, upon suddenly seeing the humble fisherman’s hat and carefree cloak, is certain to be moved by the scene. A man of luxurious banquets and grand seats, upon suddenly encountering a quiet room with simple curtains and clean tables, is sure to feel a deeper sense of attachment. Why do people drive themselves with urgency like fire-driven cattle or pursue fleeting desires like wind-blown horses, without ever considering what truly suits their nature?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 头戴威风帽、腰系宽腰带的官员，看着那些裹着轻便蓑衣、撑着小伞、轻松愉快地打发时间的人，不免会唏嘘感叹、羡慕不已。有钱人坐在大垫子和宽地毯上，看着那些坐在粗藤百叶窗和普通书桌前，悠闲安逸地消磨时光的人，心里一定会酸酸的，充满向往和遗憾。为什么人们用点燃牛尾巴的方式让牛奔跑，用远处发情的母马引诱马匹，却从未想过自己天性中的宁静平和？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 头戴威严的帽子、宽大的腰带的官员，有时，看着那些穿着轻薄草袄、撑着小伞，悠闲自在地度过时光的人们，一定会感叹和羡慕。坐在大席宽毯上的富贵人，有时，与那些坐在粗藤帘朴素书桌上的人打交道，悠然自得地度过时光，一定会酸酸的向往和遗憾。人何以烧尾而使牛奔，以远母发情引马，而不思其本性之宁静？
