text.man_en2gpt_cn: 戴着气派帽子和宽腰带的官员，有时，看着那些身穿轻便草衣、打着小伞的人，快快乐乐、无忧无虑地度日，一定会叹息并心生羡慕。居住在大垫子和宽地毯上的富人，有时，面对那些坐在粗藤帘和普通书桌旁的人，安详闲适地度日，一定会因渴望和遗憾而变得沮丧。为何人们会通过点燃牛尾巴使牛奔跑，利用远处发情的母马引诱马匹，却从不思考自己内心的宁静与安宁？

text.ori_cn: 鱼得水逝、而相忘乎水。鸟乘风飞、而不知有风。识此可以超物累、可以楽天机。
text.man_en: When the fish swims freely in water, Both water and fish forget the other. When the bird rides the wind and flies far away, It knows nothing of the wind's existence. If you understand such things, you can transcend external involvements, And enjoy all that Heaven performs.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A fish passes through the water, but forgets the water. A bird flies in the wind, but does not know that there is a wind. Knowing this, we can go beyond the material world, and we can rave about the heavens.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The fish is in the water and disappears, but forgets the water. Birds fly on the wind, unaware of the wind. Knowing this can transcend the burden of things and reveal the secrets of heaven.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Fish forget the water as they move through it; birds ride the wind, unaware of its presence. Understanding this can elevate one beyond mundane burdens and allow one to find joy in natural harmony.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当鱼在水中自由自在地游动时，水和鱼都忘记了对方。鸟儿乘风远飞，却不知风的存在。如果你明白了这些道理，你就能超越外物，享受上天赐予的一切。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当鱼在水中自由自在地游动时，水和鱼都忘记了对方。当鸟儿乘着风飞得很远的时候，它并不知道风的存在。如果你了解了这些，你就可以超越外在的束缚，而享受天行的一切。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当鱼自在地游在水中，鱼忘了水，水也忘了鱼。鸟乘风高飞，毫无知觉风的存在。如果你能明白这些道理，你就能超越外物的牵绊，并享受天地的造化。

text.ori_cn: 狐眠败砌、兔走荒台、尽是当年歌舞之地。露冷黄花、烟迷衰草、悉属旧时争戦之场。盛衰何常、强弱安在。念此令人心灰。
text.man_en: Foxes sleep on the broken paving stones, Rabbits run through the wasted tower; Here was, in years long past, a place of dances and song. The dew chills the chrysanthemums, The mists become lost in the driedup grass; Everything here, in times long ago, was witness to war. Prosperity and decline, how long can they continue? Strength and weakness, can either last for long? Thinking of this, my heart turns to ashes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The fox sleeps in the ruined masonry, the rabbit walks on the deserted platform, all are the places of songs and dances in those days. The yellow flowers in the cold dew, and the smoke in the misty grass, all belonged to the battlefield in the old days. What are the times of prosperity and decline, and where are the strengths and weaknesses? It is disheartening to think about this.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The fox sleeping in ruins and the rabbit walking on the deserted platform are all the places where singing and dancing were performed in the past. The dew is cold, the yellow flowers are gone, and the smoke is confounding the decaying grass. They all belong to the scene of old battles. Ups and downs are constant, strength and weakness are at peace. It is discouraging to think about this.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The fox slumbers on the ruined steps, the rabbit runs through the desolate terrace, all once places of song and dance. The cold dew on yellow flowers, the mist over withered grass, all scenes of former battles. How fleeting is prosperity and decline; where are the strong now? Reflecting on this brings despair.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 狐狸睡在破碎的铺路石上，兔子在荒废的塔楼上奔跑；在很久以前，这里曾是歌舞升平的地方。露水寒了菊花，薄雾迷了枯草；这里的一切，在很久以前，都是战争的见证。繁荣与衰落，还能持续多久？强盛与衰弱，能否长久？想到这些，我的心化为灰烬。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 狐狸睡在破碎的铺路石上，兔子跑过废塔；在很久以前，这里是一个歌舞升平的地方。露寒菊花，烟气消散于枯草；这里的一切，在很久以前，都是战争的见证。繁荣与衰落，还能持续多久？强与弱，谁能长久？想到这里，我的心化为灰烬。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 狐狸们睡在破碎的石铺上，兔子们在荒废的塔楼间奔跑；多年以前，这里曾是一片歌舞之地。露水冷却了菊花，迷雾在干枯的草丛中消散；很久以前，这里的一切都见证了战争。兴衰更替，又能持续多久？强弱之势，又能长久吗？想到这些，我心如灰烬。

text.ori_cn: 宠辱不惊、闲看庭前花开花落。去留无意、漫随天外云巻云舒。
text.man_en: Do not be surprised by either praise or blame; Look peacefully in the garden as flowers bloom and flowers fall. Give no regard to either leaving or staying; Ramble along after the sky as clouds fold up and clouds stretch away.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am not surprised to see the flowers blossom and fall in front of the garden. I have no intention of staying or going, and I follow the clouds outside the sky as they roll and roll.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't be surprised by favor or disgrace, just watch the flowers blooming and falling in front of the court. There is no intention to go or stay, and the clouds are rolling and relaxing in the sky.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Unperturbed by honor or disgrace, I leisurely watch the flowers bloom and wither in the courtyard. Indifferent to coming or going, I casually follow the clouds rolling and unfolding in the sky.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不为褒贬所惊，静观花开花落。去留无意，漫随天外云卷云舒。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要对赞美或责备感到惊讶；静静地看着花园里的花开花落。不顾走或留；沿着天空漫步，看着云层折叠起来，云层散开。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不以誉之喜，不以谤之惧；静观园中花开花落。无论是去留；随意闲步天上云卷云舒。

text.ori_cn: 晴空朗月、何天不可翺翔、而飞蛾独投夜烛。清泉绿卉、何物不可饮啄、而鸱鸮偏嗜腐鼠。噫、世之不为飞蛾鸱鸮、几何人哉。
text.man_en: Under a clear sky and bright moon, How many should be flitting free under the heavens: Flying moths that hurl themselves into night lanterns all alone? With clear springs and green grasses, How many other morsels should they able to peck at and eat: The owls that so love the rotted flesh of mice? Ahh, those people in this world who do not resemble the moths and owls, How many can there be?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sky is clear, the moon is clear, the sky cannot fly, and the moth is alone in the night candle. What can't be drank or pecked in a clear spring or green flower, while the owls prefer to eat rotten rats? Well, the world is not for moths and owls, how many people.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sky is clear and the moon is bright, there is no day where I can't fly, but the moth alone throws itself into the night candle. There are clear springs and green flowers, and there is nothing you can't drink and peck at, but the owl prefers rotting rats. Alas, there are not so many people in this world as moths, owls, or owls.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Under a clear sky and bright moon, there is no sky where one cannot soar, yet the moth seeks the night candle. Amidst fresh springs and green vegetation, there is nothing that cannot be drunk or pecked, yet the owl craves the decayed mouse. Alas, how many in this world are not like the moth and owl?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 清风明月下，多少飞蛾在天际自由翱翔：有多少飞蛾在夜灯下孤独地飞舞？在清泉绿草中，它们还能啄食多少美味佳肴？猫头鹰喜欢吃老鼠的腐肉？啊，这世上不像飞蛾和猫头鹰的人，能有多少呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 晴空明月下，苍天之下，该有多少飞蛾，孤身投夜灯？清泉绿草，又该啄食几口：猫头鹰那么爱吃老鼠的腐肉？啊，这世上不像飞蛾和猫头鹰的人，能有几个呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 晴朗的天空下，明亮的月光下，有多少应该在天地间自由飞舞：那些独自扑向夜灯的飞蛾？清澈的泉水和绿色的草地上，有多少其他的细碎食物可以啄食：那些如此喜爱腐烂鼠肉的猫头鹰？啊，这世间不似飞蛾和猫头鹰的人，又有多少呢？

text.ori_cn: 才就筏便思舎筏。方是无事道人。若骑驴又复觅驴、终为不了禅师。
text.man_en: After finally boarding the raft, to then think about tossing it away: This is surely an unobstructed Man of the Way. After mounting the donkey, to then go out in its search: This is, for certain, the Zen Master without a clue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I'm thinking of putting a new raft in place. That is the way of the Taoist who has nothing to do. If you ride a donkey and look for a donkey again, you are not a Zen master.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As soon as I was on the raft, I thought about the raft. Fang is a Taoist who has nothing to do. If you ride a donkey and look for a donkey again, you will never become a Zen master.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only then did he abandon the raft, realizing he had no business with it. This is truly a person who is free from all concerns. However, if he continues to seek the donkey while already riding one, he will never become an enlightened master.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 终于登上木筏后，又想着把它扔掉：这肯定是一个畅通无阻的 "道人"。骑上驴子后，又去寻觅：这肯定是一位无师自通的禅师。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 终于登上筏子，又想把它扔掉：这确实是一个无碍的大道之人。骑上驴后，出去找寻：这确实是禅师无头绪。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 最终上了筏子之后，又想着扔掉它：这肯定是个毫不妨碍的道者。骑上驴子后，又去寻找它：这肯定是个毫无头绪的禅师。

text.ori_cn: 権贵竜骧、英雄虎戦。以冷眼视之、如蚁聚膻、如蝇竞血。是非蜂起、得矢猬兴。以冷情当之、如冶化金、如汤消雪。
text.man_en: The powerful and elite clash like dragons; The brave and manly fight like tigers. If you look at this with a cool and reasoned eye, It is like ants gathering at the smell of fish, Or flies vying over blood. They swarm like hornets over right and wrong; They bristle like hedgehogs over gain and loss. If you handle this with a cool and reasoned mind, It is like changing metal in a cast, Like melting snow with hot water.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: All rights reserved. With a cold eye, they are like ants gathering in a crowd, like flies competing for blood. Right and wrong rise up like bees, and the hedgehog rises up. With a cold heart, they are like gold and snow.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The nobles, the nobles, the dragons, the heroes, the tigers, the warriors. Looking at them with a cold eye is like ants gathering together, like flies competing for blood. Right and wrong arise in droves, and arrows and hedgehogs are in full swing. Treat it with cold feelings, like smelting gold, like soup melting away snow.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The nobles are like galloping dragons, the heroes like fierce tigers. Observing with a cold eye, they are like ants gathering at a scent, like flies competing for blood. Controversies arise like bees, achievements emerge like arrows from a hedgehog. Dealing with it with a cold heart, it is like refining gold from ore, like snow melting in boiling water.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 权贵如龙，勇猛如虎。如果你冷静理智地看待这个问题，就会发现这就像蚂蚁闻到鱼腥味就会聚集在一起，又像苍蝇争先恐后地扑向鲜血。他们为了是非像大黄蜂一样蜂拥而至；他们为了得失像刺猬一样毛骨悚然。如果你用冷静理智的头脑来处理这些问题，就像在铸模中改变金属，就像用热水融化积雪。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 强者与精英，龙争虎斗；勇敢而有男子气概的人战斗如猛虎。如果你用冷静理智的眼光来看，就像蚂蚁闻鱼腥味，苍蝇争血一样。他们像黄蜂一样蜂拥而至，争论是非；他们像刺猬一样对得与失感到愤怒。如果你以冷静和理性的头脑处理这件事，就像改变铸件中的金属，就像用热水融化雪一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 强者如龙争，勇者如虎斗。若以冷静理智之眼观之，如蚁趋腥，如蝇逐血。蜂拥而争利害，怒发如刺猬。若以冷静理智之心处理，如铸模换金，如热水化雪。

text.ori_cn: 羁锁于物欲、覚吾生之可哀。夷犹于性真、覚吾生之可楽。知其可哀、则尘情立破、知其可楽、则圣境自臻。
text.man_en: If you're bridled and chained by worldly desire, You will learn how distressful life can be. If you're comfortable and at ease with your own true nature, You will learn how life can be enjoyed. Knowing how you become distressed, Your earthly desires will be destroyed; Knowing how life can be enjoyed, You will, of yourself, reach the mind of the sage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am locked up in material desires, and I see that my life can be sad. The razing in the nature of the true, 覚吾生之可楽. Knowing the sadness of it, then the dusty feelings are broken, knowing the music of it, then the holy realm is attained.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Being chained to material desires makes my life miserable. Yiyue is still in the true nature, and it is possible to understand my life. If you know it can be lamented, your earthly emotions will be broken. If you know it can be sad, you will reach the holy state.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Bound by material desires, I feel the sorrow of life. When aligning with true nature, I feel the joy of life. Recognizing its sorrow, worldly passions are shattered; understanding its joy, attaining the sage's realm comes naturally.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你被世俗的欲望束缚，你就会知道生活是多么痛苦。如果你对自己的真实本性感到舒适自在，你就会知道如何享受生活。知道了如何苦恼，你的世俗欲望就会被摧毁；知道了如何享受生活，你就会达到圣人的境界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你被世俗的欲望所束缚和束缚，你就会知道生活是多么的痛苦。如果你对自己的真实本性感到舒适和自在，你就会学会如何享受生活。知你如何忧愁，你尘世的欲望就会被摧毁；懂得如何享受人生，自然就能达到圣人的心境。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果你被世俗的欲望所束缚，你会学到生活是多么痛苦。如果你舒适并自在地享受自己的本性，你会学到生活的乐趣。知道自己为何痛苦，你的世俗欲望将被摧毁；知道生活的乐趣，你将自然而然地达到圣人的心境。

text.ori_cn: 胸中既无半点物欲、已如雪消炉焔冰消日。眼前自有一段空明、时见月在青天影在波。
text.man_en: When every sliver of earthly desire has left your breast, It will be like snow melted by the flames of a kiln, or ice melted by the sun. When the full clarity of the firmament opens before your eyes, The moon will always be in an azure sky, its reflection always on the waves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are no material desires in my heart, just as the snow disappears from the furnace and the ice disappears from the sun. There is an empty space in front of my eyes, and I can see the moon in the blue sky and the shadow in the waves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no trace of material desire in my chest, and it is like snow melting away in a stove and ice melting away the sun. There is a period of emptiness in front of my eyes, and I can see the moon's shadow in the blue sky.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With no trace of worldly desires in heart, it's like snow melting in furnace flames and ice dissolving in sunlight. A sense of clarity arises before the eyes, where the moon is often seen in the clear sky, its reflection on the water.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当尘世的每一丝欲望都离开你的胸膛，它就会像被窑炉的火焰融化的雪，或被太阳融化的冰。当澄澈的苍穹展现在你眼前时，月亮将永远挂在蔚蓝的天空中，它的倒影永远映在波涛上。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当尘世的每一丝欲望都离开你的胸膛时，它将像窑火融化的雪，或太阳融化的冰。当苍穹的清彻在你眼前展开时，月亮总是在蔚蓝的天空中，它的倒影总是在波浪上。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当每一丝尘世的欲望离开你的胸膛，它将像雪被窑炉的火焰融化，或像冰被太阳融化。当天空的清澈完全展现在你眼前，月亮总是在蔚蓝的天空中，它的倒影总是在波浪上。

text.ori_cn: 诗思在灞陵桥上、微吟就、林岫便已浩然。野兴在镜湖曲辺、独往时、山川自相映発。
text.man_en: The inspiration of poetry resides on the bridge at Pa. When singing the poems to yourself, Forests and crags will be spacious and vast. The inspiration of the rustic ideal lives in places like Lake Chien. When walking along alone, Mountains and rivers reflect each other naturally.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Poetry is on the Ba Ling Bridge, and when I recite it in a few words, the forest is already vast. The mountains and rivers reflect each other when I am alone in the Mirror Lake and the Quabe.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On the Baling Bridge, the poems and thoughts are chanted slightly, and then Lin Xiu becomes awe-inspiring. Wild things are flourishing in the winding fields of Jinghu Lake. When walking alone, the mountains and rivers reflect each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Poetic thoughts arise on the Ba Ling Bridge, and a gentle hum evokes a boundless spirit amid the forested hills. Wilderness charm is found around the bends of Jinghu Lake; when wandering alone, the mountains and rivers naturally reflect and enhance each other.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诗歌的灵感就在帕的桥上。吟诗时，森林和峭壁会变得宽广辽阔。乡村理想的灵感住在千岛湖等地。踽踽独行，山水自然相映。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 诗歌的灵感就在帕桥上。当自己吟唱诗歌时，森林和峭壁都会广阔无垠。乡村理想的灵感来自于钱湖这样的地方。独行时，山水自然倒映。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 诗意栖息在桥上的宝地。吟诵诗篇时，森林和峭壁将显得宽广辽阔。田园理想的灵感居住在如剑湖般的地方。独自漫步时，山川自然相互映照。

text.ori_cn: 伏久者、飞必高、开先者、谢独早。知此、可以免蹭蹬之忧、可以消躁急之念。
text.man_en: The bird that rests long will surely fly high; The flower that blooms first departs swiftly and alone. Knowing that, You can avoid the misery of dragging your feet; You can extinguish thoughts of impatience and haste.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who have been at it for a long time will fly high, and those who have been at it for the first time will be the only ones to give thanks. If you know this, you can avoid the worry of dabbling, and you can eliminate the idea of impatience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who stay for a long time will fly high; those who take the lead will die early. Knowing this, you can avoid the worry of stumbling, and you can calm down your impatience and impatience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who endure long will surely soar high, and those who bloom early will wither first. Understanding this can alleviate worries about setbacks and dispel thoughts of impatience.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 久停的鸟儿一定会高飞；先开的花朵会迅速而孤独地离去。明白了这一点，你就能避免拖泥带水的痛苦，你就能熄灭急躁和匆忙的念头。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 久息的鸟儿，一定会飞得更高；最先绽放的花朵，很快又孤独地凋零。知道了这一点，你就可以避免拖拖拉拉的痛苦；你可以消除不耐烦和仓促的想法。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 久栖的鸟必高飞；先开的花迅速独自凋零。知此理，便可避免拖泥带水的痛苦；便可消除急躁和心急之念。

text.ori_cn: 树木至帰根、而后知华萼枝叶之徒栄。人事至盖棺、而后知子女玉帛之无益。
text.man_en: When trees and shrubs return to their roots, They know the passing glory of flowers, blooms, shoots, and leaves. When human affairs are encased in the grave, One knows the futility of wife and child, jewels and brocades
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When trees return to their roots, they will realise that the calyx and branches are useless. When people return to the coffin, they will know that their children are not useful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The trees reach their roots, and then they know the flowers, calyx, branches and leaves. When it comes to human affairs, the coffin is closed, and then it is useless to know that the children's treasures and silk are of no use.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when a tree returns to its roots can it know that its blossoms and leaves were mere fleeting glory. Only when a person's affairs come to an end can it be understood that riches and offspring bring no lasting benefit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当树木和灌木归根，它们知道鲜花、花朵、嫩芽和叶子的荣光已逝。当世事被埋葬，人们才知道妻儿、珠宝和锦缎的虚妄
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当树木和灌木回归其根时，它们知道花、花、芽和叶的逝去的辉煌。人事入坟，知妻儿珠宝锦无用。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 树木花草归根时，它们知道花开花谢，新枝新叶的流逝人生的意义。当人类事务归于尘土时，人们意识到妻室儿女，珍宝锦缎的虚无。

text.ori_cn: 真空不空。执相非真。破相亦非真。问、世尊如何発付。在世出世、狗欲是苦、绝欲亦是苦。聴、吾侪善自修持。
text.man_en: The True Void is not Void, Attachment to phenomena is not Truth; But breaking through phenomena is also not Truth. You ask: What did the Buddha say about this? "Exist in the world, but transcend it. " Following desires is bitterness, But suppressing desires is the same. This is what follows from all of our disciplines.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Vacuum is not empty. To hold on to a phase is not true. Nor is it true to break it. Q. How does the World Honoured One put it? I am not sure if I can do that, but I am not sure if I can do that. Listen, I am good at self-cultivation.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The vacuum is not empty. The attachment is not true. The broken appearance is also not true. Ask, how does the World Honored One pay? In this world, desire is suffering, and desire is also suffering. Hey, my friends are good at self-cultivation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The vacuum is not empty. Clinging to forms is not true. Breaking forms is also not true. When asked how the World-Honored One responded, in the worldly and beyond, desires are suffering, and attaining the end of desires is also suffering. Listen, we should practice self-cultivation wisely.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 真正的虚空不是虚空，执着于现象不是真理；但突破现象也不是真理。你问：佛陀是怎么说的？"存在于世界，但超越世界。"追随欲望是苦，抑制欲望也是苦。这就是我们所有修行的结果。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真空不是空，执着不是真理；但突破现象也不是真理。你问：佛陀对此有何说法？ “存在于世间，而超越世间。”追随欲望是苦，压制欲望也是如此。这是我们所有学科的结论。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真正的空并不是真空，对现象的执著不是真理；但打破现象也不是真理。你问：佛陀对此是怎么说的？“存在于世界，但超越它。”追随欲望是痛苦，但压抑欲望也是一样。这是我们所有修行的结果。

text.ori_cn: 烈士譲千乘、贪夫争一文。人品星渊也、而好名、不殊好利。天子営家国、乞人号饔飧。位分霄壤也、而焦思、何异焦声。
text.man_en: The gallant man will decline a fief of a thousand chariots; The miser will fight over a penny. Their characters are as different as the stars and the abyss, But loving fame differs not a whit from loving profit. The emperor manages the affairs of the state; The beggar cries out for a cooked morsel or two. Their positions are as different as Heaven and Earth, But how does scorching the mind differ from scorching the voice?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Martyrs make a thousand transfers, but greedy men fight for a single penny. The character of a man is also a star, but he is more interested in fame than in profit. The son of heaven is in charge of his family and country, but the beggar is in charge of his breakfast and supper. The position in the sky and the earth is the same, but the anxious thoughts are not the same as the anxious voices.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A martyr lives a thousand chariots, a greedy husband fights for a single article. The character of the person is Xingyuan, but a good reputation is not particularly beneficial. The emperor's palace and country are full of beggars. The position is in the sky, and the thoughts of Jiao are different from the sound of Jiao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Martyrs yield thousands of chariots, while the greedy contend for a single coin. Character is like the gulf between stars, yet love of fame is no different from love of profit. The emperor manages the state, while beggars struggle for food. Positions differ as sky and earth, yet anxious thoughts are similar to anxious cries.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 英勇的人会拒绝千辆战车的封地；守财奴会为一文钱而争斗。他们的性格有如星辰与深渊，但爱名与爱利却丝毫不差。帝王管理国家大事，乞丐为一二熟食叫苦。其位如天与地，而焦心与焦声何异？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 勇敢的人会拒绝千乘的封地；守财奴会为了一分钱而打架。性格虽有星辰深渊之别，但好名与好利却无异。皇帝管理国家事务；乞丐大声喊着要一两块煮熟的食物。其位异如天地，然焦心与焦声何异？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子无意于千乘之邑，小人争斗于一钱之间。其品性如星辰与深渊之别，然爱名与爱利无丝毫之异。帝王治理国家大事，乞丐呼求一两块熟食。其地位如天壤之别，然心劳与声焦有何不同？

text.ori_cn: 饱谙世味、一任覆雨翻云、総慵开眼。会尽人情、随教呼牛唤马、只是点头。
text.man_en: Once you sample enough of the world's piquancy, You accept that human emotions may shift from rain to clouds with the flick of the wrist And resist even opening your eyes. Once you understand the nature of man, You let yourself be called a cow or a horse, And simply nod your head in assent.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am well versed in the world's flavours, and I have always been able to open my eyes to the rain and the clouds. I can do all the favours, and I just nod my head when I am taught to call the horses and cows.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Full of familiarity with the world, letting the rain and clouds turn over, and opening one's eyes carelessly. He knows how to show kindness, follow the instructions, and just nod his head.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thoroughly familiar with the vicissitudes of life, allowing the changes to unfold as they will, generally too lazy to even open my eyes. Understanding human nature completely, regardless of being commanded to call forth a cow or horse, I simply nod in response.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一旦你尝够了世间百态，你就会接受人类的情感可能会在弹指一挥间由雨变云，甚至不愿睁开眼睛。一旦你了解了人的本性，你就会让别人称你为牛或马，并点头称是。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一旦你尝够了世界的辛辣，你就会接受人类的情感可能会随着手腕的轻拂而从雨变成云，甚至拒绝睁开眼睛。一旦你了解了人性，你就可以让自己被称为牛或马，并点头表示同意。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一旦你尝遍了世间的辛辣，你便会接受人类的情感可能会在转瞬之间从雨变成云，而你甚至会抗拒睁开眼睛。一旦你理解了人性，你就会任人称你为牛马而只是点头表示同意。

text.ori_cn: 今人専求无念、而终不可无。只是前念不滞、后念不迎、但将现在的随缘、打発得去、自然渐渐入无。
text.man_en: People today seek only NoMind, But their minds, in the end, cannot attain Emptiness. Simply do not be tied down by previous thoughts, Do not go out to greet thoughts that come after. Only in taking care of things as they appear From their present cause and effect Do you naturally and gradually enter the Void.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nowadays, people try to have no thoughts, but they cannot have no thoughts. The only thing is that the previous thought is not stagnant, and the next thought is not welcome, but the present thought is just as it should be, and then it will gradually become nothing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Nowadays, people only seek to have no thoughts, but in the end they cannot have no thoughts. It's just that the previous thoughts are not stagnant and the subsequent thoughts are not welcomed, but if you can get rid of the current situation, it will naturally gradually disappear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People nowadays strive for a state of no thought, yet ultimately cannot achieve it. Just do not cling to thoughts of the past nor anticipate those of the future. Simply let the present follow its natural course, and gradually, one will naturally enter a state of no thoughts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 今天的人们只追求无念，但他们的念头终究无法达到空性。只需不为前念所缚，不为后念所迎。唯有当下因果，随遇而安，方能自然渐入虚空。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 今人只求无心，心终究不能达到空性。只要不被前念所束缚，不去迎接后念。只有当事物出现时，从它们当前的因果关系中，你才能自然地逐渐进入虚空。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们今天只追求无心，但最终他们的心无法达到空灵。只需不被之前的念头束缚，不要去迎接之后的念头。只在处理事物时，依其当前的因果，自然渐入空境。

text.ori_cn: 意所偶会、便成佳境、物出天然、才见真机。若加一分调停布置、趣味便减矣。白氏云、意随无事适、风逐自然清。有味哉、其言之也。
text.man_en: Where your mind is suddenly delighted, There significance will be; 51 Where things have come from nature, You will see true charm. Where even a portion has been interposed or arranged, Its flavor quickly declines! Po Chui said, The mind is at peace when without events; The wind is clear when it gathers of its own. Do these not contain true flavor, these words?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you want to meet by chance, you will be in a good situation, and only when things come out of nature can you see the real opportunity. If you add a point to mediate the arrangement, the fun will be reduced. Bai's cloud, the intention with nothing suitable, the wind by the natural clear. Tasteful, it is also said.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When things come together accidentally, they will become a beautiful environment. Only when things come out of nature can you see their true potential. If you add a little bit of mediation and arrangement, the fun will be reduced. Bai Shiyun said: "No matter what you want, nothing will happen. The wind will naturally be clear." It's interesting and what it says.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When inspiration strikes, it transforms into a beautiful scene; when things emerge naturally, the true essence is revealed. If there is any deliberate arrangement or adjustment, the charm is diminished. Bai Shi once said, 'The mind finds its peace in simplicity, and the breeze carries a natural clarity.' How profound his words are!
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你的心灵突然愉悦的地方，就会有意义；51 来自大自然的东西，你会看到真正的魅力。苟有缀饰，其味自衰！宝箴曰：无事则心安，自聚则风清。这些话难道不包含真味吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的心突然高兴时，就会有意义； 51、凡事源于自然，你会看到真正的魅力。即使有一部分被插入或安排，它的味道也会很快下降！柏翠曰：无事则心安；无事则心安；无事则心静。当风自行聚集时，它是清晰的。这些话难道没有真正的味道吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心意豁然之处，即是意蕴所在；自然生成之物，尽显真美。参差罗列之间，味道迅速消退！白居易说，无事而心神宁静；自然聚合而风清。此语岂非真味蕴含？

text.ori_cn: 性天澄彻、即饥喰渇饮、无非康済身心。心地沈迷、纵谭谈禅演偈、総是播弄精魂。
text.man_en: If your original nature has become clear, Though you simply eat when hungry and drink when thirsty, You will not be without peace and salvation for body and mind If your mind has become sunken and confused, Though you expound Zen doctrine and chant the sutras, All will be playing and trifling with both spirit and soul.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The nature of nature is clear and transparent, and even if one is hungry or hungry, one can drink and eat, it is not a way to protect one's body and mind. The mind is in a dreary state, and even if one talks about Zen and performs gathas, it is all a matter of cultivating one's soul.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When one's nature is clear and clear, even if one is hungry and drinks, it is nothing more than healthy for the body and mind. The mind is addicted and indulges in talking about Zen and performing verses, which is playing with the soul.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The nature of the mind is clear and pure; when one is hungry, one eats, when one is thirsty, one drinks - all these actions are merely to nourish the body and the mind. If the mind is bewildered, even speaking of Zen or chanting scriptures is simply a way of toying with one's soul.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 若本性已明，虽饥餐渴饮，也不失身心的安宁与救赎；若心性已沉，虽参禅诵经，也是精神与灵魂的嬉戏与玩弄。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你的本性已经清楚，虽然你只是饿了就吃，渴了就喝，你的身心也不会有平静和拯救；如果你的心已经沉沦了，即使你讲禅念经，所有人都将在精神和灵魂上玩耍和玩耍。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若你本性已明，饥则食渴则饮，你身心自然得安宁。若你心思沉迷，虽讲禅论佛经，精神灵魂终作戏弄。

text.ori_cn: 人心有个真境、非丝非竹、而自恬愉。不烟不茗、而自清芬。须念净境空、虑忘形释。才得以游衍其中。
text.man_en: In the human heart there is a place of Truth: Even without stringed instruments or flutes, It will, of itself, experience a peaceful joy; Even without incense or tea, It will, of itself, have a clear fragrance. Thus, make your heart pure and your mind empty; Forget ruminations and disregard material form. Only so encircled can you wander as you please.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The human heart has a true state, not silk, not bamboo, and since the pleasure. There is no smoke or tea, but it is fragrant. It is necessary to have a pure mind and an empty mind, and to be free of all worries. Only then can we travel in it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a true state in the human heart, which is neither silk nor bamboo, but it is self-satisfied. No smoke, no tea, but pure fragrance. You must think about the emptiness of the pure environment and forget about the form and explanation. Only then can I wander among them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The human heart has a true realm, neither silk nor bamboo, yet it is serene and joyful on its own. Without smoke or tea, it is naturally fragrant. One must contemplate a pure and empty state, let go of worries and physical form, only then can one wander freely within it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在人的心中，有一个真理之所：即使没有弦乐和笛声，它也会自带宁静的喜悦；即使没有香茶，它也会自带清澈的芬芳。因此，让你的心变得纯净，让你的思想变得空灵；忘却杂念，漠视物质形式。唯有如此，你才能随心所欲地徜徉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人的心中有一个真理的地方：即使没有弦乐器或笛子，它本身也会体验到一种平静的喜悦；即使没有香或茶，它本身也会有清香。如此，心清净，心空；忘记沉思并忽视物质形式。只有这样，你才能随心所欲地徘徊。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人心中有个真理之地：即使没有弦乐器或笛子，它本身也会体验到一种宁静的喜悦；即使没有香或茶，它本身也会有一种清晰的香味。因此，使你的心纯净，使你的意念空灵；忘记沉思，忽视物质形式。只有这样，你才能随心所欲地漫游。

text.ori_cn: 金自鉱出、玉従石生。非幻无以求真。道得酒中、仙遇花里。虽雅不能离俗。
text.man_en: Gold is taken from ore; Gems are produced from stone. Without illusion, there would be no seeking after Truth. The Way may be obtained within one's cups; 54 The land of enchantment met within the blossoms. Although refinement exists, we cannot part from the mundane.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Gold comes from the paraffinum liquidum, jade from the stone. There is no way to find truth without illusion. The way of the Tao is in the wine, the immortal in the flowers. Though elegant, they cannot be separated from the commonplace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Gold comes from iron, and jade comes from stone. There is no way to seek truth without illusion. Tao is found in wine, and immortals meet in flowers. Although elegant, it cannot be separated from the vulgar.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Gold comes from the mine, jade is born from stone. Without illusion, one cannot seek truth. The Way is found in wine, and immortality encountered among flowers. Though refined, it cannot separate from the mundane.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 黄金取自矿石，宝石产自石头。没有幻想，就没有对真理的追求。道在杯中可得，54 魔在花中可遇。虽有精进，不能离俗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 黄金是从矿石中提取的；宝石是由石头制成的。没有幻觉，就没有对真理的追求。道可杯中得； 54 迷人的土地在花丛中相遇。虽然精致存在，但我们不能脱离平凡。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 淘金取于矿石；宝石得自岩石。没有幻觉，就不会追求真理。道可得于杯中；54 妙境可于花间得见。尽管存在精炼，我们无法与平凡分离。

text.ori_cn: 天地中万物、人伦万情、世界中万事。以俗眼観、纷纷各异、以道眼観、种种是常。何烦分别、何用取舍。
text.man_en: The Ten Thousand Things between Heaven and Earth, The myriad emotions of human relations, The countless events in the midst of the world: When you observe them with the common eye, They are all in confusion, each different from the other. When you penetrate them with the eye of the Way, Their infinite variety is always the same. Why go to the trouble of making distinctions? Why go to the expense of picking and choosing?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are all things in heaven and earth, all human emotions, and all things in the world. To the ordinary eye, they are all different, but to the Taoist eye, they are all constant. There is no need to be separate, there is no need to take or leave.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All things in heaven and earth, all human relations, and all things in the world. With the worldly eye, they are all different, but with the Taoist eye, they are all common. Why bother distinguishing, why choose.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things in the universe, all human emotions and relationships, and all matters in the world. Viewed with common eyes, they appear diverse and complex; viewed through the lens of the Tao, they are all constant. Why bother with distinctions, why have preferences?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天地万物，人情百态，世间万象：以常人之眼观之，则纷繁杂乱，各不相同。当你用 "道 "的眼光去洞察它们时，它们的无穷变化总是相同的。为什么要费力去区分呢？为何要费尽心机地挑挑拣拣？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天地万事，人情万千，世事无数，以肉眼观察，皆是混乱，各异。当你以道眼洞察它们时，它们的无限变化总是相同的。为什么要费尽心思去区分呢？为什么要花大力气去挑选呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地之间的万物，人际关系的无数情感，世间无尽的事件：用普通的眼光观察，它们全都混乱不清，各自不同。用道的眼光透视，它们的无限变化总是相同。为何要费心作出区分？为何要花费代价挑选选择？

text.ori_cn: 神酣、布被窝中、得天地冲和之气。味足、藜羹饭后、识人生澹泊之真。
text.man_en: If the spirit is in full bloom, Though you inhabit a room wearing only rough clothes, You will obtain the harmonious energy of the universe. If what you taste is satisfactory, Though you drink only goosefoot soup, You will know the true piquancy of human simplicity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I am in a quilt, I can feel the harmony of heaven and earth. After a meal of quinoa and rice, I know the truth of life's tranquillity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The spirit is intoxicated, nestled in the quilt, and the heaven and earth are harmonious. After a meal of glutinous rice soup, you can understand the true meaning of life's indifference.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Immersed in deep sleep under coarse bedding, one obtains the harmonious aura of heaven and earth. Savoring simple meals of goosefoot soup, one comes to understand the true essence of a tranquil life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果精神盛开，即使身着粗布衣衫，也能获得宇宙的和谐能量。倘若味觉满足，即使只喝鹅蹄汤，也能体会到人间朴素的真味。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果精神盛开，即使身居简陋的房间，也能获得宇宙和谐的能量。如果你尝到了满足的滋味，虽然只喝了藜麦汤，你就会知道人性的真味。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 精神若是充沛，纵使身居粗陋之室，亦可得天地之和气。口味若是满足，纵饮藜羹，亦得人间简朴之真味。

text.ori_cn: 缠脱只在自心。心了、则屠肆糟廛、居然净土。不然、纵一琴一鹤、一花一卉、嗜好虽清、魔障终在。语云、能休尘境为真境、未了僧家是俗家。信夫。
text.man_en: Whether shackled or free, you have but one mind. If it is a mind of understanding, Then butcher stores and wine shops are paradise just as they are. But if the mind is not so, Though you play the lute and raise cranes, Though you cultivate flowers and plant grasses, Though your tastes and pleasures are pure, The goblin of interference will still be there. As the saying goes:56 If you are capable of tranquility, the world of dust becomes the world of truth; If you have not yet understood, a monk is nothing more than a vulgar man on the street. Is this not true?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is only in one's own mind. If the heart is clear, then the market place will be a pure land. Otherwise, even if you have a piano, a crane, a flower or a flower, even though your hobbies are clean, the demonic obstacles will always be there. As the saying goes, "If you can leave the dusty realm for the realm of truth, if you have not yet finished the monk's home, you are a layman's home". I believe in you.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The only way to get rid of entanglement is in your own mind. If you are careful, the slaughterhouse will turn into a pure land. Otherwise, even if there is a harp, a crane, a flower, even if the hobbies are clear, the demonic obstacles will always be there. It is said that the realm of being able to rest from the worldly world is the true realm, and the realm of being a monk is a lay realm. Nobuo.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Entanglement and detachment only lie within one's own mind. Once the mind is enlightened, even amidst the butcher's shop and the filthy marketplace, it becomes a pure land. Otherwise, even with a zither and a crane, a flower and a plant, although the inclinations may seem pure, the demonic hindrances still exist. As the saying goes, 'One who can rest in the mortal realm reaches the true realm; a monk who is not yet enlightened is just an ordinary person.' Indeed, this is true.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无论枷锁还是自由，你们只有一个心灵。如果是明心见性，那么肉店和酒肆就是天堂。倘若心不如此，纵然弹琴养鹤，纵然养花种草，纵然清心寡欲，干扰的妖精依然存在。常言道：56 若能清静无为，尘世即成真理世界；若未明心见性，出家人不过市井小民。难道不是这样吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无论是被束缚还是自由，你只有一个想法。若有明心，则肉店酒肆皆如天堂。若心不如此，虽弹琴养鹤，虽养花植草，虽诸滋味清净，干扰妖仍存在。俗话说：56若能静，则尘世为真；若能静，则尘世为真；如果你还不明白的话，和尚只不过是街上的一个庸俗之人。这不是真的吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无论被束缚还是自由，你只有一个心。如果是理解的心，那么屠夫店和酒坊本身就是天堂。但如果心不是这样，纵然你弹琴养鹤，栽花种草，虽品味高雅纯净，干扰的妖怪仍然会存在。俗话说：如果你能够宁静，尘世就会变成真理的世界；如果你还没有理解，僧侣不过是街上的俗人。这不是事实吗？

text.ori_cn: 斗室中、万虑都捐、说甚画栋飞云、珠帘卷雨。三杯后、一真自得、唯知素琴横月、短笛吟风。
text.man_en: If, in a room as small as a box, You toss away all of your ten thousand thoughts, Will you not enjoy the clouds that pass by painted eaves And the rain that falls by the bound jeweled blind? If, after three cups of wine, The One Truth is, of itself, obtained, You will perfectly know how to play An unadorned lute under the moon.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In a small room, I don't have to worry about anything, I can't even talk about flying clouds in a painted building or rolling rain in a pearl curtain. After three cups of wine, one is truly at ease, knowing only that the zither is playing across the moon and the piccolo is singing in the wind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the small room, all the money was donated, and it was said that it even painted a building with flying clouds and beaded curtains with rolling rain. After three cups, I was really content, and I only knew that the plain harp was crossing the moon and the piccolo was singing in the wind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In this small room, I abandon all worries. Who cares about the flying clouds above ornate buildings, or the rain rolling down beaded curtains? After three cups, a true tranquility arises, and I only know the ancient zither beneath the moon, and the short flute singing to the wind.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果，在一个小得像盒子一样的房间里，你抛开了万千思绪，难道你不会享受画檐边飘过的云和束缚着的珠宝百叶窗边落下的雨吗？如果三杯美酒下肚，你就能获得唯一的真理，你就能完美地懂得如何在月下弹奏一把不加修饰的琵琶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若在盒子般的小房间里，抛却万念俱灰，岂不享受画檐云过，宝帘下雨？三杯酒后，若得一真，月下弹琴便了如指掌。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若在一间如箱子般小的房间里，你抛弃你那万千思绪，难道你不会享受云彩漂过彩绘屋檐，雨滴落在镶宝珠的窗帘旁的景象吗？若在三杯酒之后，自行领悟到那唯一的真理，你将完美地知道如何在月光下弹奏一把素净的琵琶。

text.ori_cn: 万籁寂寥中、忽闻一鸟弄声、便唤起许多幽趣。万卉摧剥后、忽见一枝擢秀、便触动无限生机。可见、性天未常枯槁、机神最宜触発。
text.man_en: When all the world's sounds are silent and at peace, And you suddenly hear the playful voice of a single bird, Numerous aspects of the Mysterious are evoked. After all the world's grasses have withered and died, And you suddenly see a single branch eclipse the others and bloom, The limitlessness of life's forces is clearly felt. Thus we understand, The Original Nature does not dry up forever; The vigor of the spirit, you should touch and unfold.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the midst of all the music, the sound of a bird suddenly arouses a lot of interest. After the destruction of all the flowers, the sight of a single branch of pew pew shows that the infinite vitality has been triggered. It is evident that the nature is not always withered, and it is most suitable to touch the spirit of the mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the vast silence, suddenly hearing the sound of a bird evokes a lot of secluded interest. After all the flowers were peeled off, I suddenly saw a beautiful branch, which touched the infinite vitality. It can be seen that the nature of nature is not always withered, and the spirit of spirit is most suitable to be touched.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the midst of complete silence, suddenly hearing a bird's song evokes a sense of hidden charm. After all the flowers have withered, suddenly seeing a single branch blooming stirs boundless vitality. This shows that the natural disposition is never truly withered, and the mind is best stimulated by external triggers.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当世界万籁俱寂，一片宁静，你突然听到一只鸟儿嬉戏的声音，无数神秘的面纱被唤起。当世界上所有的草都枯萎凋零，而你突然看到一根枝条黯然失色，绽放出美丽的花朵，你会清晰地感受到生命力量的无穷无尽。由此我们明白，原始的自然不会永远枯竭；精神的活力，你应该触摸并展开。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当全世界的声音都寂静无声，你突然听到一只鸟儿嬉戏的声音，唤起许多神秘的方面。世间百草枯死后，忽见一枝黯然绽放，分明感受到生命之力的无穷。由此可知，本性不会永远枯竭；精神的活力，你应该触摸并展现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当世间所有的声音都静下来并安宁时，突然听到一只鸟的嬉戏声，许多神秘的方面被唤起。当世上的草都枯萎死去，突然看到一枝独秀并绽放，生命力量的无限性被清晰地感受到。因此我们明白，原本的自然不会永远枯竭；精神的活力，你应该接触并展开。

text.ori_cn: 白氏云、不如放身心冥然任天造。晁氏云、不如收身心凝然帰寂定。放者流为猖狂、收者入于枯寂。唯善操身心的、欛柄在手、收放自如。
text.man_en: Po Chui said, You should let go of body and mind, and entrust things unseen to the working of nature. Chao Puchih said, You should discipline body and mind, and return them encased to peace and regulation. Letting go too far results in insanity, But too much discipline leads to a withering of the self. Only the man who directs his body and mind well Can hold the hilt of the sword and leave discipline and its lack To their own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Bai's cloud, it is better to put the body and mind in meditation and let the sky create. The Chao's claim that it would be better to withdraw the body and mind and return to silence and determination. The one who releases flows into madness, and the one who withdraws enters into silence. Only those who are good at manipulating the body and mind have the handle in their hands and are free to put and take away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Bai Shiyun said, it is better to let go of your mind and body and let nature create it. Chao Shi said, it is better to collect your body and mind and stay calm. Those who let go will become rampant, and those who take in will be in silence. Only those who are good at taking care of their body and mind can hold the handle in their hand and move it freely.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Bai Shi said, 'It is better to let body and mind relax and surrender to the natural order.' Chao Shi said, 'It is better to gather body and mind and return to tranquility and contemplation.' Those who let go may become wild and unruly, while those who gather may fall into desolation. Only those who can skillfully manage their body and mind, holding the reins in their hands, can freely alternate between letting go and gathering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: Po Chui（宝翠）说，你应该放下身心，将看不见的事物交托给大自然。晁补之说：你应该约束身心，让它们回归平静和规范。太过放纵会导致精神错乱，太过自律会导致自我枯萎。只有善于引导自己身心的人，才能握住剑柄，把纪律和不纪律留给自己。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宝翠说：“你应该放下身心，把看不见的东西托付给大自然。”赵普治曰：“汝当调养身心，使之归于平和。”放得太远会导致疯狂，但太多的纪律会导致自我枯萎。只有能很好地指挥自己的身体和思想的人才能握紧剑柄，把纪律和纪律的缺失留给自己。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 白居易曰，你应当放松身心，并将看不见的事物交给自然的运作。曹普之曰，你应当管束身心，并将它们带入和平和秩序。放松过多会导致疯狂，但过分的管束会使自我萎缩。只有能很好地驾驭自己身心的人，才能握住剑柄，让管束和无管束各归其位。

text.ori_cn: 当雪夜月天、心境便尔澄彻、遇春风和气、意界亦自冲融。造化人心、混合无间。
text.man_en: On a snowbound, moonlit night, The mind echoes the same clarity and purity. With a tranquil and mild spring breeze, Feelings are softened and melt on their own. Nature and Man's mind Blend and mix, with no margin between.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the snowy night and moonlit sky, the mind will be clear, and when the spring breeze and air, the world of ideas will also be blended. The human heart is created and mixed without interruption.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On a snowy night and moonlit sky, my state of mind will become clear. When encountering the gentle spring breeze, my mind will also melt. Create the human heart and mix it seamlessly.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: On a snowy moonlit night, the mind becomes clear; encountering the gentle spring breeze, the spirit also naturally harmonizes. Nature and human hearts blend seamlessly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在白雪皑皑的月夜，心灵回荡着同样的清澈与纯净。在宁静温和的春风中，感情会自行融化。自然与人类的心灵相互交融，不分彼此。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在冰雪覆盖的月夜，心灵回响着同样的清澈和纯净。春风徐徐，心旷神怡，心情舒畅，心情舒畅。自然与人的心灵融合、融合，没有任何界限。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在一个积雪覆盖、月光洒满的夜晚，心灵回荡着同样的清晰与纯净。伴随着宁静温和的春风，情感柔和自融。自然与人的心灵交融混合，没有界限。

text.ori_cn: 文以拙进、道以拙成。一拙字有无限意味。如桃源犬吠、桑间鶏鸣、何等淳庞。至於寒潭之月、古木之鸦、工巧中便覚有衰飒气象矣。
text.man_en: Literature advances by way of the inexpert; The Way develops by the same means. But the word inexpert has limitless meaning. Sentences like The dogs barking at Peach Blossom Spring, or The rooster crowing amidst the mulberry trees, Are gentle and replete. But to write something like The moon over the cold pool, or A crow on a withered branch, Within the works of technique alone, We feel a disposition lacking in life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The writing advances by clumsiness, the way is made by clumsiness. The word "clumsy" has infinite meanings. As in the case of the dog barking in the peach orchard and the bird chirping in the mulberry tree, how simple it is. As for the cold pool of the moon, the ancient wood of the crows, workmanship, then 覚有衰飒气象矣。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Literature is advanced through clumsiness, Taoism is achieved through clumsiness. The word "yi chou" has infinite meaning. Such as the barking of dogs in Taoyuan, the singing of mulberry trees, how honest and pure. As for the moon in the cold pond, the crows on the ancient trees, and the ingenuity of the craftsmanship, there is a rustling atmosphere.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One progresses in writing through simplicity, and one achieves the way through simplicity. The word 'simplicity' carries boundless meaning. Consider the barking of dogs in paradise, the crowing of roosters among mulberry trees—how pure and unblemished it is. However, the moon over a cold pond, the crows on ancient trees—within their refinement lies a sense of desolation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 文以载道，道亦如此。但 "不谙 "二字却有无限的含义。如 "桃花源里犬吠声，桑树丛中鸡鸣声"，婉约而丰满。而写 "寒潭月"、"枯枝鸦"，仅在技法上下功夫，就会让人觉得缺乏生气。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 文学的进步是靠外行的；道以同样的方式发展。但“不专家”这个词却有着无限的意义。桃花源狗叫，桑树鸡鸣，温柔而饱满。但写《寒潭明月》、《枯枝乌鸦》，光是在技法的作品中，我们就感到一种缺乏生命的气质。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 文学通过无经验者而进步；道也以同样的方式发展。但无经验这个词有无尽的意义。像“犬吠桃花源”或“鸡鸣桑树间”的句子，都是柔和且充实的。然而，若仅仅在技巧的作品中写出类似“寒潭月”或“枯枝上的乌鸦”，我们会感到一种缺乏生气的态度。

text.ori_cn: 以我転物者、得固不喜、失亦不忧、大地尽属逍遥。以物役我者、逆固生憎、顺亦生爱、一毛便生缠缚。
text.man_en: If you can employ the external world In obtaining, you will not rejoice; In loss, you will not despair. You will travel free and easy no matter where you go. If you are employed by the external, In reverses, you'll engender enmity; In favorable conditions, you'll become attached. Thus, even something as small as a hair becomes fetters and chains.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If I turn to things, I will not be happy when I gain, nor will I be sad when I lose, and I will be free on all the earth. But if I am driven by things, I will hate them when they go against me, and I will love them when they go with me, and I will become entangled in them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who use me to change things will not be happy when they get something, and they won't be worried about losing it. The whole world will be free and happy. Those who use things to serve me will be stubborn and hateful, obedient will beget love, and a hair will be entangled.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For those who master themselves in the face of external changes, neither happiness comes from gaining nor sorrow from losing, and the vast earth becomes a realm of freedom. For those enslaved by external things, adversity gives rise to resentment, prosperity to attachment, and even a trivial matter binds them tightly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果你能利用外部世界 在得到时，你不会喜悦；在失去时，你不会绝望。无论走到哪里，你都能自由自在。如果你被外界所利用，在逆境中，你会产生敌意；在顺境中，你会变得执着。因此，哪怕是细如发丝的东西，也会成为羁绊和枷锁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若能用外在的世界来获得，则不欢喜；若能用外在的世界来获得，则不欢喜；失去时，你不会绝望。无论您去往何处，您都将自由自在地旅行。受外用，反则生敌意；受外用，反则生敌意。在有利的条件下，你会产生依恋。因此，即使是像头发那么小的东西也变成了脚镣和锁链。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若能外物得之不喜，失之不忧，随遇而安，行无拘束。若为外物所役，遇祸生怨，临福贪恋。如此，即使细如发丝，也会变成羁绊和枷锁。

text.ori_cn: 理寂则事寂。遗事执理者、以去影留形。心空则境空去。境在心者、如聚膻却蚋。
text.man_en: When principle is at peace, phenomena will be at peace. But disregarding phenomena and grasping at principle Resembles letting the shadow go, and leaving only the form. If the mind is empty, externals will be empty. But letting go of externals and retaining only the mind Is like piling up raw meat, and trying to drive away the flies.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When there is silence in reason, there is silence in things. Those who leave things behind and cling to reason leave a shadow behind. When the mind is empty, the realm is empty. If the realm is in the mind, it is like a gathering of stink but a gnat.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When reason is silent, things are silent. Those who manage the affairs of the deceased will leave behind their traces. If the heart is empty, the environment will be empty. Those who have a state of mind are like gathering together a bunch of gnats.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the mind is serene, matters become serene. Those who cling to principles after abandoning the matter are like casting away the shadow and keeping the form. When the heart is empty, the realm becomes empty too. To have the realm in the heart is like gathering insects by a heap of decay.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 原则安宁，现象也会安宁。然而，不顾现象而执着于原理，无异于如影随形。心空，则外物亦空。但舍弃外物，只保留心灵，就像堆砌生肉，试图驱赶苍蝇。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 理平静了，现象也就平静了。而不顾现象而执着原则，就如舍去影子，只留形式。心若空，则外在亦空。而放下外在，只留心，就如堆放生肉，想赶走苍蝇一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 理安而后事安，舍事而执理，如将影放，反持形焉。心空则外空，去外而守心，如堆生肉而欲驱蝇。

text.ori_cn: 幽人清事総在自适。故酒以不勧为歓、棋以不净为胜。笛以无腔为适、琴以无弦为高。会以不期约为真率、客以不迎送为坦夷。若一牵文泥迹、便落尘世苦海矣。
text.man_en: The artistic actions of mountain hermits Are appropriate for who they are. Thus, wine is enjoyed without making it too strong, Go is played best without bruising competition, The flute is timely when played without meter, The lute is most refined when played without strings, Meeting others is truly sincere when dates have not been set, And guests are at ease when not being greeted or sent off. If you are once caught up by pattern, or mired down in convention, You will fall into the dust of the world, into a bitter sea.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The soul of a man of leisure is in self-containment. That is why wine is a wonderful gift and chess is a triumph. The flute is suitable if it is free of sound, and the zither is high if it is free of strings. A meeting is genuine if you don't make an appointment, and a guest is frank if he doesn't welcome you. If one is involved in the mud track, one will fall into the sea of worldly suffering.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The secluded people are at ease with themselves. Therefore, drinking wine is based on impurity, and playing chess with impurity is the winning factor. The flute is suitable if it has no tone, and the qin is suitable if it has no strings. It will be honest to treat guests who don't expect them, and it will be frank to treat guests who don't want to see you off. If you touch the mud of writing, you will fall into the sea of ​​misery in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The solitary person's serene endeavors lie in self-contentment. Thus, wine is enjoyed without urging, chess is considered victorious without strict rules. The flute is played for pleasure without a set melody, the zither is elevated without strings. Gatherings are genuine without formal arrangements, guests are candid without ceremonial greetings and farewells. If one clings to formalities and traces, they would fall into the bitter sea of the mundane world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 山中隐士的艺术行为与他们的身份相称。酒不醉人人自醉，棋不伤人人自胜，笛无音律方为适时，琵琶无弦最是高雅，相见无期方为真心，宾客不迎不送方为自在。倘若一味循规蹈矩，一味墨守成规，就会跌入尘世，坠入苦海。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 山隐者的艺术行为，与他们的身份相适应。故酒不至浓，围棋不相争，笛不节时适，琵琶不弦时最雅，相见未定时诚，当客人不受到欢迎或送走时，他们会很放松。如果你一旦被模式所束缚，或者陷入俗套，你就会陷入世间的尘埃，陷入苦海。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 山中隐士的艺术行为 与他们的身份十分相称。 因此，他们饮酒不过量， 下棋讲求和谐而不争胜负， 长笛适时吹奏而不拘泥于节拍， 琵琶弹奏时追求无弦之音的意境， 会见他人发自真诚而不预先约定， 宾客自在而不受迎来送往的礼节束缚。 一旦你被模式所束缚， 或陷入世俗的常规， 你将落入尘世的苦海。

text.ori_cn: 试思未生之前有何象貌、又思既死之后作何景色、则万念灰冷、一性寂然、自可超物外游象先。
text.man_en: Trying to imagine what form you had before you were born And what one you will take long after you have died, Your myriad thoughts will turn to cold ashes, Your true nature will stand alone, You will naturally transcend the external world, And you will be at ease in a world beyond appearances.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you think about what you looked like before you were born and what you will look like after you die, then you will be able to transcend all thoughts and be indifferent, and then you will be able to travel beyond the world and see the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you think about the appearance before you were born, and what the scenery will be like after death, then your thoughts will be gray and cold, your nature will be silent, and you will be able to transcend the external world and wander to the first place.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Reflect upon what your form was before birth and contemplate the scene after death. As these thoughts turn to ashes and cold, your true nature will emerge serene and detached, allowing you to transcend beyond worldly matters and roam freely in the realm of the primordial.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 试着想象你生前的模样和死后的模样，你的万千思绪将化为冰冷的灰烬，你的真实本性将独树一帜，你将自然而然地超越外部世界，你将在一个超越表象的世界里逍遥自在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 试着想象一下，你生前是什么形态，死后多久，你的万念会化为冰冷的灰烬，你的本性会独立存在，你会自然而然地超越外在世界，你会在超越表象的世界中保持自在。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 试图想象你出生前的样子，以及你死后很久会变成什么样子，你无数的思绪会化为冷灰，你的本性会独自存在，你自然会超越外在的世界，并且你将安然处身于一个超越表象的世界。

text.ori_cn: 遇病而后思强之为宝、处乱而后思平之为福、非蚤智也。幸福而知其为祸之本、贪生而先知其为死之因、其卓见乎。
text.man_en: Thinking about the jewel of strength after becoming sick; Ruminating on the good fortune of peace after encountering trouble— These are not instances of foresight. Knowing beforehand that accepting a windfall is the basis of disaster; Realizing in advance that coveting life is the cause of death— These are examples of superior intelligence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not flea-wise to think of the treasure of strength after illness, or to think of the blessing of peace after chaos. Happiness is the root of misfortune, and greed for life is the cause of death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you are sick and then think about being strong, it is a treasure; when you are in chaos, then you think about peace, it is a blessing. This is not the wisdom of a flea. To be happy and know that it is the cause of disaster, to be greedy for life and to know that it is the cause of death, is so insightful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only after experiencing illness do we realize that strength is precious, and only amidst chaos do we understand that peace is a blessing; this is not early wisdom. To recognize happiness as the root of calamity, to foresee that clinging to life leads to death—such is profound insight.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生病后思考力量之宝，遇到困难后反思平安之福--这些都不是先见之明。事先知道接受意外之财是灾难的基础，事先意识到贪生是死亡的原因--这些都是卓越智慧的例子。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 病后思念力量之宝；遇事反省平安之福，非有先见之明。预先知道接受意外之财是灾难的基础；提前认识到贪图生命是死因——这些都是高智商的例子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在患病后才想到力量的宝贵；在遇到麻烦后才反思和平的幸运——这些都不算是远见。在意外之财来临之前就知道它是灾祸的根源；在贪恋生命之前就明白它是死亡的根由——这些才是卓越的智慧。

text.ori_cn: 优人傅粉调朱、效妍丑于毫端、俄而歌残场罢、妍丑何在。弈者争先竞后、较雌雄于着子、俄而局尽子收、雌雄安在。
text.man_en: The actress puts on white powder and daubs herself with rouge, And with the touch of the brush creates both beauty and crone But when the songs have been sung and the theater is closed, Where are beauty and crone then? The go player fights for the fore and contends for the rear, Competes with each stone for victory or defeat. But when the game has ended and the stones are put away, Where are victory and defeat then?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The excellent people are in the art of painting and painting, and they are in the art of painting and painting, and they are in the art of painting and painting, and they are in the art of painting and painting, and they are in the art of painting and painting. The game players compete to be the first and the last, compare the male and female in playing, and then the game is over, where are the male and female?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The excellent man uses powder to tune Zhu, and the beauty and ugliness are as good as the hair. When the song is over, where is the beauty and ugliness? Players compete for the first and the last, comparing the male and female to get the pieces. However, the game ends with all the pieces, and the male and female are at peace.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Performers meticulously applying makeup, imitating beauty and ugliness with every stroke; suddenly, the song ends and the performance concludes, where are the beauties and the clowns? Chess players vying for the lead, competing for victory with each move; suddenly, the game is over and the pieces are collected, where are the victors and the defeated now?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 女演员搽上白粉，抹上胭脂，用画笔塑造出美人和老妪，但当歌曲唱完，剧院关闭，美人和老妪又在哪里呢？棋手们争先恐后，与每块棋子争夺胜负。但当棋局结束，棋子收起，胜利和失败又在哪里？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 女演员涂上白粉，涂上胭脂，用毛笔一抹，既是美人，又是老太婆。 但当歌声唱完，戏院关门时，美人和老太婆又在哪里呢？围棋者争前争后，逐石较量胜负。但当比赛结束，石头收起时，胜利和失败又在哪里呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 演员涂上白粉，抹上胭脂， 轻轻一笔，既是美人也是老妪。 可当歌唱完毕，剧院关门， 美人与老妪又在何方？ 围棋手争先夺后，每颗棋子都拼胜负。 可当棋局终了，棋子收起， 胜负又置身何处？

text.ori_cn: 风花之潇洒、雪月之空清、唯静者为之主。水木之栄枯、竹石之消长、独闲者操其権。
text.man_en: The exquisite beauty of breeze and blossoms, The refreshing clarity of moon and snow— Only the tranquil man can enjoy them as a master. The flourishing and withering of the waters and woods, The growth and decline of the rocks and bamboo— Only the man at peace can enjoy them as a lord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Only the quiet ones are the masters of the wind and flower, the snow and moon. The water and the trees are the most precious, the bamboos and the rocks are the only ones who can do anything about it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The naturalness of wind and flowers, the emptiness of snow and moon, only the quiet one is the master. Water and trees wither, bamboos and rocks grow and decline, and those who are alone are busy with their gongs.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The elegance of the wind and flowers, the clarity of the snow and moon, only those who are serene can master them. The ebb and flow of water and wood, the waxing and waning of bamboo and stone, only those who are detached have the authority over them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 清风与百花的娇艳，明月与白雪的澄澈--唯有宁静的人，才能以主人的姿态享受它们。水木之盛衰，石竹之长短--唯宁静者能主之。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 风花之绝美，月雪之清清，唯有清静之人才能领略。水木之盛衰，石竹之盛衰，只有安宁之人才能享受为君。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 微风与花朵的精致之美，月亮与雪的清爽明晰——只有宁静的人才能享受它们作为主人。水与木的繁荣与枯萎，岩石与竹子的生长与衰败——只有平静的人才能享受它们作为君王。

text.ori_cn: 田父野叟、语以黄鶏白酒、则欣然喜、问以鼎养食、则不知。语以药袍裋褐、则油然楽、问以衮服、则不识。其天全、故其欲淡、此是人生第一个境界。
text.man_en: An old man from the country or fields, In talk about roast fowl or unrefined wine, He will be cheerful and pleased. But ask about aristocratic kettles and urns, And of this he knows nothing at all. In talk about handmedowns or old padded clothes, He will be open and gay. But ask about ceremonial robes and cloaks, And of these he will not have a clue. His nature is intact, And thus his desires are plain. This, indeed, is man's highest condition.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When a man in the field is told that he has yellow chicken and white wine, he is delighted, but when he is asked about the food, he does not know. If he is told to wear a caftan, he will be pleased, but if he is asked to wear a gun, he will not know it. This is the first state of life, in which a man's nature is perfect and his desire is light.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The father of the field, the old man, said that he wanted to drink yellow wine and white wine, but he was very happy. He asked about using the tripod to nourish food, but he didn't know. If you tell me that the medicine robe is brown, it will be oily and wet. If you ask if you want to take it, you will not recognize it. Its heaven is perfect, so its desires are weak. This is the first state of life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A farmer and an old peasant talk about yellow chickens and white wine, and they are delighted. When asked about nourishing food, they know nothing. Talking about simple clothes made of medicinal herbs makes them happy, but they do not recognize formal robes. Their natural simplicity keeps their desires modest, representing the first state of human life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个来自乡村或田野的老人，在谈起烤鸡或未提炼的葡萄酒时，他会兴高采烈。但问起贵族的水壶和瓮，他却一无所知。谈起手工缝制的衣服或旧衬垫的衣服，他会坦然自若。但要问起礼服和斗篷，他就一窍不通了。他的本性完好无损，因此他的欲望也一目了然。这的确是人的最高境界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 乡下田里的老人，谈起烤鸡或生酒，都会高兴起来。但问及贵族的壶、瓮，他却一无所知。在谈论旧衣服或旧棉衣时，他会开朗而愉快。但问礼服、氅氅，他就无从得知。其本性纯正，故其志向纯朴。这确实是人的最高境界。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个来自乡村或田地的老人，在谈论烤禽或粗酒的时候，他会开心愉快。但问他贵族的水壶和瓮的事，他一无所知。在谈到旧衣服或旧棉衣时，他会坦率而愉快。但问他仪式长袍和斗篷的事，他会茫然无措。他的天性完好，因此他的欲望简单。这，确实是人最高的境界。

text.ori_cn: 心无其心、何有于観。释氏曰観心者、重増其障。物本一物、何待于斉。荘生曰斉物者、自剖其同。
text.man_en: The True Mind is free from distracting thoughts, So why should we look into it? Shakamuni's comment that we should observe the Mind Only heaps up obstructions. All things originally being One, Why should we have them be equal? Chuang Tzu's comment about the equality of all things Itself divides their uniformity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the mind has no mind, then how can there be any Kankan? The Shishi said that if we observe the mind, we will increase the obstacles to it. The object is the same thing, so why should it be saito? Sho-sheng said that the saito object is the same as the saito object, and the saito object is the same as the saito object.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is no heart in the heart, what is there in sight? Shi said that those who look at the heart will increase their obstacles. Everything is one thing, so why wait for it? Sun Sheng said that those who look at things should distinguish themselves.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without a mind there is no perception. The Buddha said that observing the mind only increases its obstacles. Things are fundamentally one; why seek uniformity? Zhuangzi said that in equalizing things, one only discovers their sameness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 本心没有杂念，那我们为什么要观察它呢？释迦牟尼说，我们应该只观察 "心"，这是在堆砌障碍。万物本为一，何须平等？庄子的 "万物平等 "之说，分化了万物的统一性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真心无杂念，何必观其呢？释迦牟尼关于我们应该只观察心的说法是有障碍的。万物本一，为何平等？庄子关于万物平等的评论本身划分了它们的一致性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真心本无杂念，何必察之？释迦牟尼说应观心唯识，这只能增加障碍。万物本来是一，何必言其平等？庄子的平等观倒是破坏了其统一性。

text.ori_cn: 笙歌正浓处、便自払衣长往、羨达人撒手悬崖。更漏已残时、犹然夜行不休、笑俗士沈身苦海。
text.man_en: Just when the flutes and songs are at their most buoyant, He gathers his belongings, and leaves for someplace far away— How enviable, this accomplished man's strolling freely along the precipice. After the clocks have all run out, He unsteadily walks through the night without rest— How laughable, this vulgar man's sinking himself in a bitter sea.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the music and songs are in full swing, I will go long and fetch my clothes, envying the people who have left their hands on the cliffs. At the end of the day, I still travelled at night and laughed at the common people who were plunged into the sea of misery.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the music and singing were in full swing, I took off my clothes and went there, and admired the masters and let go of the cliff. When Gengluo is gone, he still walks endlessly at night, laughing at the common man sinking into a sea of ​​misery.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At the height of the song and dance, one departs lightly, envying the wise who let go at the cliff's edge. As the clepsydra runs dry, still journeying through the night, laughing at the common folk who sink into the sea of suffering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 就在笛声和歌声最欢快的时候，他收拾行装，向远方出发--多么令人羡慕，这个有成就的人在悬崖边自由漫步。钟表走完后，他蹒跚地走过黑夜，没有休息--多么可笑，这个庸俗的人在苦海中沉沦。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 就在笛声最欢快的时候，他收拾起行李，远走他乡——伟人在悬崖上自由漫步，令人羡慕。时钟都用完后，他摇摇晃晃地走了一夜，没有休息——可笑的是，这个粗俗的人把自己沉入苦海。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 就在笛声和歌声最欢快的时候，他收拾好行装，离开，去往远方——多么令人羡慕，这位成功人士自在地漫步在悬崖边。所有时钟都停摆之后，他摇摇晃晃地在夜里不停地走——多么可笑，这个粗俗的人沉浸在苦海中。

text.ori_cn: 把握未定、宜绝迹尘嚣。使此心不见可欲而不乱、以澄吾静体。操持既坚、又当混迹风尘。使此心见可欲而亦不乱、以养吾円机。
text.man_en: While you have not yet disciplined yourself, It is best not to take steps into the world of dust and din, Nor to expose the mind to desirable things and then to confusion. Thus you keep pure the self's peaceful substance. When selfcontrol is firm, Then you are ready to mix your steps with the world's wind and grit, To let your heart see what is tempting and yet not be confounded. Thus you sustain the self's versatility and grace.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are not sure of what to do, it is better to get rid of the hustle and bustle of the world. Let this mind be free from all desires, so as to clarify my body of tranquillity. If you have a firm grip on your life, you should also be in the world. To keep the mind free from desire and to keep it in order.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the grasp is uncertain, it is better to disappear from the hustle and bustle. Let this mind see no desire and not be confused, so as to clear my still body. It is important to be firm and yet to be mixed up in the dust of the world. Let this mind see what I desire but not be confused, so as to nourish my mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Grasp the uncertainty and avoid worldly distractions. Ensure that the mind feels no desire and remains undisturbed, thereby clearing one's tranquil nature. With firm resolve, blend into the mundane world. Ensure that the mind, even when encountering desire, remains undisturbed, thereby nurturing one's harmonious mechanism.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你还没有约束自己的时候，最好不要踏入尘嚣的世界，也不要让心灵接触到理想的事物，继而陷入迷茫。这样，你才能保持自我的纯净与平和。当自制力稳固时，你就能将脚步融入尘世的风尘之中，让心灵看到诱人的事物，却不被迷惑。这样，你就能保持自我的多变和优雅。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 未曾自律时，最好不要踏入尘世喧嚣，也不要让心接触到美好的事物而陷入混乱。这样你就保持了自我平静本质的纯净。当自制力坚定的时候，你就准备好将你的脚步与世界的风沙混合，让你的心看到什么是诱惑，而不是被迷惑。这样你就能维持自我的多才多艺和优雅。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在你尚未锻炼好自己时， 最好不要踏入尘嚣的世界， 也不要让心智接触令人向往的事物而陷入混乱。 如此，你便可保持自我的宁静本质。 当自控能力坚固时， 你便可以准备好在世间风尘中行走， 让你的心看到诱人的事物却不被迷惑。 如此，你便可保持自我的灵活性和优雅。

text.ori_cn: 喜寂厌喧者、往往避人以求静。不知、意在无人便成我相、心着于静便是动根。如何到得人我一视、动静两忘的境界。
text.man_en: He who rejoices in quiet and shrinks from noise Will sometimes avoid others and seek peace. He does not know that With his intention of being where men are not, he engenders the concept of self; With a mind attached to peace, he establishes the root of activity. How about reaching the point Where self and other are regarded as one, And activity and peace are both forgotten?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who prefer silence to noise tend to avoid people in order to seek silence. They don't know that if they don't have people in their sights, they will become self-conscious, and if they focus on silence, they will become the root of movement. How can we reach the state of being able to see the human being and the self, and to forget both the motion and the silence?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who like silence and dislike noise often avoid people in search of tranquility. If you don’t know, if there is no one around, you will become a self. If your mind is still, it will be the root of movement. How to reach the state where I and others can look at each other and forget both the movement and the stillness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who enjoy solitude and abhor noise often avoid people in search of silence. Little do they know that when the mind anticipates solitude, the self is emphasized; when the heart clings to stillness, the root of disturbance is planted. How can one reach a state where self and others are regarded equally, and both movement and stillness are forgotten?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 喜静而不喜闹者，有时会避开他人而寻求安宁。他不知道，"人不知而我不觉 "会产生 "自我 "的概念；"心存宁静 "会建立 "活动 "的根基。如何才能达到将自我和他人视为一体，将活动和平静都忘却的境界？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 喜安静而畏喧的人，有时会避开他人，寻求平静。他不知道，由于他打算去人类不去的地方，所以他产生了自我的概念；以寂静之心，建立活动之根。达到自我与他人合而为一，活动与平静都被遗忘的地步如何？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 喜欢安静而厌恶喧嚣之人，有时会避开他人，追求宁静。他不知道的是，当他意图远离人群时，就产生了自我的概念；心系宁静，却根植于活动的根本。何不达到这样的境界：把自我和他人看作一体，忘却活动与宁静？

text.ori_cn: 山居胸次清洒、触物皆有佳思。见孤云野鹤、而起超绝之想、遇石涧流泉、而动澡雪之思。抚老桧寒梅、而劲节挺立、侣沙鸥麋鹿、而机心顿忘。若一走入尘寰、无论物不相关、即此身亦属赘旒夷。
text.man_en: Living in the mountains, the breast is clear and pure; Whatever you touch has its own excellence. Watching a wisp of cloud or a crane in a field Wakes your thoughts to transcendence. Being among scattered rocks and flowing springs Moves the mind to purification. Gently touching the old cypress or the cold plum tree, A sense of integrity is drawn out. Accompanying the sea gull and the deer, The conniving heart is quickly forgotten. But once the city's dust is entered again, Even the things with which you have no ties Surround you and pull you down.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The mountain dweller's chest is clear, and everything he touches has good thoughts. Seeing the lonely clouds and wild cranes, he thought of transcendence, encountering stone streams and flowing springs, he thought of bathing in the snow. The old juniper and the cold plum, and the strong knots stand up, with the gulls and the elk, and the machine heart suddenly forgets. If one walks into the world, no matter how irrelevant things are, that is, this body is also superfluous.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Living in the mountains, my chest is clear and I feel good thoughts about everything I touch. Seeing lonely clouds and wild cranes brings me thoughts of transcendence; meeting rocks and flowing springs brings me thoughts of bathing in the snow. The old juniper trees and plum blossoms are standing tall and strong, and the sand gulls and elk are with each other, but the intention is forgotten. Once you enter the mortal world, regardless of whether things are related to you or not, even this body is a foreigner.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dwelling in the mountains opens the mind to clarity and inspiration is found in everything. Seeing the solitary clouds and wild cranes stirs thoughts of transcendence, encountering the rocky streams and flowing springs evokes feelings of purification. Touching the ancient cypress and cold plum tree instills a sense of resolute strength, accompanying the sandy seagulls and deer causes worldly concerns to be forgotten. But once stepping into the mundane world, everything becomes irrelevant and even one's body feels like an unnecessary burden.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 居于山中，胸怀澄澈纯净；无论触及何物，都有其过人之处。闲看云卷云舒，静观鹤唳田野，唤醒思想的超然。置身于散石流泉之间，心灵得以净化。轻抚古柏寒梅，引出正直之感。与海鸥、小鹿为伴，纵容的心很快就会被遗忘。但一旦再入城市的尘埃，即使是与你毫无瓜葛的事物，也会将你包围，将你拉倒。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 身居山中，胸怀清澈纯净；无论你接触到什么，都有它自己的卓越之处。看着田野中的一缕云或一只鹤，唤醒你的思想，达到超越。置身于散石流泉之中，使心灵得到净化。轻轻抚摸古柏或冷梅，一股浑厚之感油然而生。与海鸥和鹿为伴，纵容的心很快就被遗忘了。但一旦再次进入城市的尘埃， 连那些与你没有任何关系的事物也会包围你，将你拉倒。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 住在山中，心境清纯；触碰任何事物都有其美好。观一缕云或田间的鹤，唤起你的超越之想。置身于散石和流水间，心灵趋向净化。轻抚古柏或寒梅，发出一种正直感。伴随海鸥和鹿，狡诈之心很快被遗忘。但一旦重新进入城市的尘埃，连那些与你无关的事物也围绕着你，将你拉下。

text.ori_cn: 兴逐时来、芳草中撒履闲行、野鸟忘机时作伴。景与心会、落花下披襟兀坐、白云无语漫相留。
text.man_en: When my inclinations are in harmony with the moment, Shoeless, I walk leisurely through fragrant grasses. Then the birds put off their scolding and become, at times, my friends. When my surroundings are in accord with my mind, I loosen my collar and sit at ease beneath falling blossoms, Then the silent white clouds approach unperceived and remain at my side.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you are in the mood for something, you can walk in the grass and be accompanied by wild birds who forget their chance. The scenery and the heart will meet, under the falling flowers, the white clouds have no words to stay together.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The joy comes when the time comes, walking leisurely in the fragrant grass, wild birds as companions when forgetting the opportunity. The scenery and the heart meet, sitting under the fallen flowers, and the white clouds linger silently.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Delighting in the moment, walking leisurely among the fragrant grass, accompanied occasionally by unassuming wild birds. The scenery aligning with the heart, sitting quietly under falling blossoms, while speechless white clouds linger freely.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当我的倾向与此刻和谐一致时，"无鞋者"，我悠闲地走在芬芳的草地上。这时，鸟儿不再责备我，有时还会成为我的朋友。当周围的环境与我的心境一致时，我就会松开衣领，在落花下悠闲地坐着，然后寂静的白云就会不知不觉地靠近我，停留在我的身边。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当我的喜好与当下相协调时，赤脚，我悠闲地漫步在芬芳的草地上。然后鸟儿们就会不再责骂，有时会成为我的朋友。当周围的环境与我的心意一致时，我松开衣领，悠闲地坐在落花下，然后无声的白云不知不觉地靠近，留在我身边。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当我的心意与此刻相和时，不穿鞋，我悠闲地走在芳草地上。那时，鸟儿们停止了责骂，有时甚至还成了我的朋友。当周围环境和我的心境相契时，我松开衣领，安然地坐在飘落的花瓣下，那时无声的白云悄然靠近，停留在我身边。

text.ori_cn: 人生福境祸区、皆念想造成。故释氏云、利欲炽然、即是火坑、贪爱沈溺、便为苦海。一念清净、烈焔成池、一念警覚、船登彼岸。念头稍异、境界顿殊。可不慎哉。
text.man_en: Life's fortunes and misfortunes— All are produced by the functions of the mind. For this reason Shakamuni said, When the desire for gain burns brightly, It is nothing other than the fires of hell. When you are sunk in avarice and greed, You will surely swim in bitter seas. But if you are determined to be pure, Raging flames become cool lake waters; If you are determined to be enlightened, The boat will reach the other side. When the mind changes just a little, The world quickly becomes different, too. Is this not true?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Life's blessings and misfortunes are all caused by thoughts. Therefore, the Sakyamuni said, the desire for profit is blazing, that is, the fire pit, greed and love is drowning, that is, the sea of bitterness. A thought of purity, the fire watches into the pool, a thought of warning 覚, the ship to the other shore. A little difference in thought, the realm is suddenly different. Be careful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The blessings and disasters in life are all caused by thoughts. Therefore, Shi Shi said, burning desire for gain is a pit of fire, and addiction to greed is a sea of ​​suffering. A thought of purity makes a pond full of heat; a thought of warning makes the boat land on the other shore. The thoughts are slightly different, and the realm is suddenly different. But it's not careful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Both happiness and misfortune in life are created by thoughts. Thus, it is said in Buddhism that intense desires are like a fiery pit, and deep attachment is akin to a sea of suffering. With a single pure thought, the blazing fire turns into a pool; with a single moment of awareness, the boat reaches the other shore. As thoughts differ slightly, the situations become vastly different. How can one not be cautious?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人生的幸与不幸--都是由心灵的功能产生的。因此，释迦牟尼说："当利欲之火熊熊燃烧时，它无异于地狱之火。当你沉浸在贪婪和贪欲中时，你必将在苦海中遨游。但如果你决心清净，汹涌的火焰就会变成清凉的湖水；如果你决心觉悟，小船就会到达彼岸。只要心灵稍有改变，世界很快也会变得不同。难道不是这样吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人生的福祸，皆由心所生。是故释迦牟尼云：利欲炽盛时，无非是地狱之火。当你陷入贪婪和贪婪时，你一定会在苦海中游泳。但若立志清净，烈火化为清凉湖水；如果你决心开悟，船就会到达彼岸。当思想稍微改变时，世界也会很快变得不同。这不是真的吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人生的幸运与不幸——一切都是心的作用。所以释迦牟尼说，当求利的欲望炽烈时，那不过是地狱之火。当你陷于贪婪和欲望时，你必然会在苦海中挣扎。但是如果你决心纯洁，狂暴的火焰会变成清凉的湖水；如果你决心觉悟，船会到达彼岸。只要心稍微改变一下，世界也会随之迅速变化。这难道不是真理吗？

text.ori_cn: 绳锯木断、水滴石穿。学道者须加力索。水到渠成、瓜熟蒂落。得道者一任天机。
text.man_en: A rope pulled back and forth eventually cuts through wood; Water dropped bit by bit in time wears through stone. Studying the Way, increase your efforts in the search. Flowing water in due time carves a ditch; The melon ripening on the vine will one day fall to the ground. Obtaining the Way, leave things to the play of Heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Rope cuts through wood, water drips through stone. The learner of the Way must add force to the rope. When water is ripe, it falls. The path to enlightenment leads to a heavenly opportunity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The rope cuts through the wood, and the water drips through the stone. Those who learn the Tao must work harder. Things will fall into place when things are ripe. Those who have attained the Tao will have their destiny.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Constant effort brings success, just as a rope can saw through wood and water can wear away stone. Those who seek knowledge must persistently strive. When the conditions are right, success will come naturally, just as ripe fruit falls from its stem. Those who attain enlightenment will understand the natural order of things and can leave everything to the workings of nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 绳锯木断，水滴石穿。学道之余，更要努力探索。水到渠成，瓜熟蒂落。得道者，听天由命。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 来回拉动的绳子最终会穿过木头；水一点一滴地滴落，时间会磨穿石头。学道，加大探求力度。流水适时开沟；藤上的瓜，总有一天会落到地上。得道，事由天行。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 绳锯木断，水滴石穿。学道需加倍努力。流水最终会凿出沟渠，瓜熟蒂落。得道者，应随天意而行。

text.ori_cn: 机息时、便有月到风来、不必苦海人世。心远处、自无车尘马迹、何须痼疾丘山。
text.man_en: When your scheming is over, The moon comes up and the wind arrives, And you are no longer in the bitter sea of the human world. When the mind is far away, And the dust of wagons or horses' tracks cannot be found, Why this chronic disease of having to be in the mountains and hills?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the machine is at rest, the moon and the wind will come, and there is no need to suffer in the world of mankind. When the mind is far away, there is no need for chronic illnesses.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the opportunity rests, the moon will come and the wind will come, and there will be no need to suffer in this world. Far away from my heart, there are no traces of cars, dust or horses, so there is no need to suffer from chronic illnesses.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the machine rests, the moonlight comes with the wind; there's no need to endure the world's suffering. In a tranquil heart, there is no trace of cars or horses, so why worry about old ailments and mountains?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你心计已尽，月上柳梢头，清风徐来，你已不在人世苦海。心远地自偏，不见车尘马迹，何来 "山重水复疑无路，柳暗花明又一村 "的痼疾？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的心机结束时，月出风来，你就不再是人间苦海了。心远了，车马迹尘埃都找不到，何必得此病在山野呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 待你机关算尽，月升风起，便不再在这人间苦海。心若远离，车马痕迹已无踪迹，何必还要执念于山川之中？

text.ori_cn: 草木才零落、便露萠颖于根底。时序虽凝寒、终回阳气于飞灰。粛杀之中、生生之意、常为之主。即是可以见天地之心。
text.man_en: When grasses and trees have begun to wither and fade, Buds and sprouts appear on the roots. Though with the order of time there is freezing and cold, In the end spring returns with the flying ash. That there is life In the midst of death and decline Is an eternal principle. Thus can be seen the heart of Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The grass and trees have only just fallen, and then they reveal themselves at the root. Although the time is cold, the Yang energy returns to the ashes. Presentation is always a matter of life and death. This is the heart of heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The grass and trees are just falling apart, and their branches are exposed at the base. Although the time sequence is condensed in the cold, the Yang energy will eventually return to the flying ashes. In the midst of killing, the meaning of life is always the master. That is the heart that can see the heaven and the earth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As soon as the vegetation withers, it reveals sprouts at the roots. Although the seasons are cold, eventually the warmth returns from the flying ashes. Amidst the chill, the essence of life always prevails. This is what allows us to see the heart of heaven and earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当草木开始枯萎凋零时，根部会萌发新芽。虽然时间的长河中会有冰冻和寒冷，但终究会有春天带着飞扬的灰烬归来。在死亡和衰败中存在生命，这是永恒的原则。天地之心，由此可见。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当草木开始枯萎、褪色时，根部就会出现芽和芽。虽随时间而有冰寒，终春随飞灰而归。死亡和衰败中还有生命，这是永恒的原则。由此可见天地之心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当草木开始枯萎凋零，根部却长出嫩芽。虽时序已至冰冷严寒，春天终将伴随飞灰而来。即使在死亡和衰败中也有生命，这是一个永恒的原则。由此可见天地之心。

text.ori_cn: 雨余観山色、景象便覚新妍。夜静聴钟声、音响尤为清越。
text.man_en: If you observe the color of the mountains just after the rain, You are aware that scenery is fresh and beautiful. If you hear the sound of the bell in the evening stillness, You feel its reverberations to be all the more serene and clear.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The rain 観山色, scenery will 覚新妍. Listen to the sound of the bell at night, the sound is especially clear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: After the rain, you can see the mountain scenery, and the scenery is new and beautiful. The sound of bells and sounds is especially clear in the quiet night.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: After the rain, observing the mountain scenery, the scene appears refreshed and beautiful. In the stillness of the night, listening to the sound of the bell, the resonance becomes exceptionally clear and melodious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 观雨后山色，便觉景色清新秀丽。如果你在夜深人静时听到钟声，你会觉得钟声的回响更加宁静清脆。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你观察雨后山色，就会发现景色清新美丽。如果你在夜深人静的时候听到钟声，你会觉得它的余韵更加宁静和清晰。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若雨后观察山色，您会发现景色清新美丽。若在傍晚的寂静中听到钟声，您会觉得钟声更加宁静清澈。

text.ori_cn: 登高使人心旷、临流使人意远。読书于雨雪之夜、使人神清、舒啸于丘阜之岭、使人兴迈。
text.man_en: Climbing to high elevations makes the heart expansive; Looking out on flowing waters takes your thoughts far away. Reading books on a night of snow or rain Purifies the spirit. Leisurely singing some lines at the crest of a hill Makes your inspiration soar.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Climbing up to a high place makes one's heart feel open, and being in front of a stream makes one's thoughts far away. Reading a book on a rainy or snowy night refreshes the mind, and reading a book on a hill or mountain makes one happy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Climbing high makes people feel refreshed, and approaching current makes people far away. Reading the book on a rainy and snowy night can make people feel refreshed, and howling in the mountains of Qiufu can make people feel happy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Climbing to great heights clears the mind, while gazing at flowing waters broadens one's thoughts. Reading on a rainy or snowy night refreshes the spirit, and singing aloud on hilltops inspires enthusiasm.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 登高望远，心胸开阔；远眺流水，思绪悠远。雨雪夜读书，净化心灵。在山顶悠闲地吟唱几句，让灵感飞扬。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 登上高处，心胸开阔；眺望流水，思绪飞远。雪夜读书，净化心灵。在山顶悠闲地唱几句，让你的灵感飞扬。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 登高使心胸开阔；眺望流水使思绪飘远。雪夜或雨夜读书净化心灵。悠闲地在山顶吟诵几句诗句，使灵感飞扬。

text.ori_cn: 心旷则万钟如瓦缶、心隘则一髪似车轮。
text.man_en: When your mind is expansive, even the highest salary is like an unglazed jug. When your mind is narrow, even a single hair has the girth of a wagon wheel.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart is as open as a percussion instrument, and the heart is as dark as a wheel.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the heart is open, the bells will be like a fou; if the heart is narrow, the hair will be like a wheel.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the mind is broad, a thousand bells seem like clay pots; when the mind is narrow, a single hair appears as a cartwheel.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心胸开阔时，再高的薪水也如无釉之壶。当你的心胸狭窄时，即使是一根头发，也有车轮那么粗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你的心胸广阔时，即使是最高的薪水也像一个无釉的壶。当你的心狭隘的时候，哪怕是一根头发丝，也有车轮那么大。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你的心胸开阔时，即使是最高的薪水也像一个未上釉的陶罐。当你的心胸狭窄时，即使是一根头发也有车轮般粗大。

text.ori_cn: 无风月花柳、不成造化。无情欲嗜好、不成心体。只以我転物、不以物役我、则嗜欲莫非天机、尘情即是理境矣。
text.man_en: If there were no wind, moon, flowers, or willows, Nature itself would have no form. If there were no emotions, desires, predilections, or tastes, The mind itself would remain unformed. Only with the man who controls externals And who is not controlled by externals himself, Are predilections and desires not separate from Nature's play, Is the dust of emotions nothing other than the Truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no moon, no flowers, no creation. The heart is not made up of lusts and hobbies. If I turn to things and don't use things to serve me, then my desires are nothing but a heavenly opportunity, and dusty feelings are the realm of reason.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no wind, no moon, no flowers and willows, no luck. Heartless desires and hobbies, no spiritual body. If you only use yourself to serve things and don't use things to serve you, then your desires are not heaven's secrets, and your earthly emotions are the realm of reason.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without wind, moon, flowers, and willows, there is no creation. Without emotions and desires, there is no essence of the heart. If I influence things instead of being influenced by them, then desires can indeed be natural mechanisms, and mundane emotions can coexist with rational realms.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果没有风、月、花、柳，大自然本身就没有形态。如果没有情感、欲望、偏好或品味，心灵本身也不会成形。只有控制外部事物的人，才不会被外部事物所控制，偏好和欲望才不会脱离大自然的游戏，情感的尘埃才是真理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果没有风、月、花、柳，自然就没有形状。如果没有情感、欲望、偏好或品味，心本身就不会成形。只有控制外在的人，以及自己不受外在控制的人，偏好和欲望才不会与自然的游戏分离，情感的尘埃只不过是真理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果没有风月花柳，大自然本身就无形。如果没有情感、欲望、嗜好和品味，心灵本身就未形成。只有那控制外物而不被外物控制的人，才会让嗜好和欲望与大自然的游戏不分离，让情感的尘埃不外于真理。

text.ori_cn: 就一身了一身者、方能以万物付万物。还天下于天下者、方能出世间于世间。
