text.man_en: When you have come to an understanding of yourself, You can, for the first time, let the world take care of its own. When you return all under Heaven to itself, You can, right now, transcend society without leaving it at all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The one who has taken on the whole body is the one who can pay for all things with all things. He who returns the world to the world will be able to go out of the world to the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Only one who has one body can pay all things with all things. Only those who return the world to the world can transcend the world and live in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only by embodying unity can one entrust all things to all things. Only by returning the world to itself can one transcend the mundane world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你了解了自己，你就可以第一次让世界自己照顾自己。当你让天下万物回归自身时，你现在就可以超越社会，而根本无需离开社会。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你了解自己时，你第一次可以让世界照顾好自己。当你把天下归还的时候，你现在就可以超越社会，根本不离开社会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你了解自己时，你可以第一次让世界自行其事。当你将天下归还本源时，你可以立即超越社会，而完全无需离开社会。

text.ori_cn: 人生太闲、则别念窃生、太忙则真性不现。故士君子不可不抱身心之忧、亦不可不耽风月之趣。
text.man_en: If a man's life contains excessive leisure, Worldly thoughts will surreptitiously arise. If there is excessive occupation, His true character will not become manifest. Therefore, the gentleman Cannot but embrace the troubles of both body and mind, Yet must be steeped in the pleasures of wind and moon.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If life is too idle, then other thoughts will be born, and if it is too busy, then the true nature will not appear. Therefore, a gentleman must not be free from physical and mental worries, and must not be free from the pleasure of the moon and the wind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If your life is too leisurely, don’t think about living in vain; if you are too busy, your true nature will not be revealed. Therefore, a gentleman must not care about his physical and mental worries, nor can he not indulge in the fun of romance.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When life is too idle, extraneous thoughts arise; when too busy, one's true nature is obscured. Therefore, a gentleman should harbor concerns for his body and mind, but should also indulge in the pleasures of nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人的生活过于空闲，世俗的想法就会悄然而生。倘若职业过多，他的真性情就无法彰显。因此，君子不能不怀身心之忧，但又必须沉浸于风月之乐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人的一生如果有过多的闲暇，世俗的思想就会悄然生起。如果占有过多，他的真实品格就不会显露出来。是故君子不能不怀身心之忧，而须沉于风月之乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人的生活过于闲适，世俗的念头会偷偷产生。如果一个人过于忙碌，他的真正性情将不会显现。因此，君子不能不承受身心的烦恼，但也必须沉浸在风月之乐。

text.ori_cn: 人心多従动处失真。若一念不生、澄然静坐、云兴而悠然共逝、雨滴而冷然倶清、鸟啼而欣然有会、花落而潇然自得。何地非真境、何物无真机。
text.man_en: Many times the Truth is lost from the oscillation of the human heart. But if you refuse to let a single thought be born And meditate with a settled mind, You will leisurely move on with the rising clouds, Be purified in the chill of the falling rain, Be cheerfully satisfied with the singing birds, And wholly understand yourself with the falling flowers. In what place will Truth not exist? In what thing will Truth not move?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People's hearts are often moved in a way that is untrue. If one's mind is not born, if one sits in tranquillity, if the clouds rise and pass away leisurely, if the rain falls and is cold and clear, if the birds cry and are gladly met, if the flowers fall and are at ease, then where is the true state of mind? Where is there not a true realm, and where is there not a true opportunity?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The human heart is full of distortions. If a single thought does not arise, sit quietly and calmly, the clouds will rise and pass away together leisurely, the raindrops will be cold but clear, the birds will sing but you will be happy to have a meeting, and the flowers will fall and you will be contented. What place is not the real state, what thing has no real opportunity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The human heart often loses its truth amidst turbulence. If one can clear the mind and sit in quiet meditation, clouds drift away effortlessly, raindrops bring a refreshing clarity, birdsong brings a joyful understanding, and fallen flowers evoke a serene fulfillment. Every place is a true realm, and every object reveals a true secret.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 很多时候，真理因人心的波动而迷失。但如果你不生一念，静下心来冥想，你就会在云起时悠然前行，在雨落时寒意中得到净化，在鸟鸣时欢快满足，在花落时完全明白自己。什么地方没有真理？在什么地方真理不会存在？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 很多时候，真理会因为人心的摇摆而丢失。但如果你不让一念生起，以安定的心去冥想，你就会随着升腾的云朵悠然前行，在落下的雨滴的寒冷中得到净化，对鸟儿的歌唱感到高兴，并完全了解自己与落花。真理在什么地方不存在？真理在什么情况下不动呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 很多时候，真理在人心的摇摆中迷失。但如果你拒绝让一个念头产生，并以平静的心态冥想，你将悠闲地随云而行，在落雨的寒意中净化，在鸟鸣中愉快满足，并在落花中彻底了解自己。真理不在何处存在？真理不在何物中流动？

text.ori_cn: 子生而母危、镪积而盗窥、何喜非忧也。贫可以节用、病可以保身、何忧非喜也。故达人当顺逆一视而欣戚两忘。
text.man_en: When a child is born, the mother is in danger; when money is amassed, Thieves await their chance. What joy, then, cannot become a sorrow? Because of poverty, we use thrift; because of illness, We take care of our health. What sorrow, then, cannot become a joy? Therefore, the man of attainment Regards prosperity and reversal as the same, And forgets both joy and sorrow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When a son is born and his mother is in danger, when money is accumulated and stolen, what joy is not sorrow? If you are poor, you can save money, and if you are sick, you can protect yourself. Therefore, when a person is a great man, he should be able to see both the good and the bad and forget about the good and the bad.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When a child is born and his mother is in danger, and when his mother is in trouble and is peeping at him, there is no joy but sorrow. Poverty can be used sparingly, illness can be saved, so there is nothing to worry about but happiness. Therefore, an expert should look at both obedience and adversity and be happy and forgetful at the same time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a child is born but the mother is in danger, or when wealth is accumulated but thieves eye it, what joy is there that is not accompanied by sorrow? Poverty can teach frugality, and illness can lead to self-preservation; what sorrow is there that is not coupled with joy? Therefore, a wise person should treat success and failure equally and forget both joy and sorrow.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孩子出生了，母亲就会有危险；钱财积累了，盗贼就会伺机而动。何乐而不为？因为贫穷，所以节俭；因为疾病，所以健康。那么，还有什么忧愁不能变成快乐呢？因此，有成就的人视盛衰如一，忘却喜怒哀乐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孩子出生，母亲就有危险；当钱积累起来时，小偷就会等待机会。那么，有什么欢乐不会变成悲伤呢？因为贫穷，我们用节俭；因为贫穷，我们用节俭；因为贫穷，我们用节俭。因为生病，所以我们要照顾好自己的健康。那么，什么悲伤不能变成快乐呢？是故有成之人，视盛衰为一，而忘掉喜怒哀乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孩子出生时，母亲处于危险之中；积累财富时，小偷伺机而动。那么，什么欢喜不能变成悲伤？因为贫穷，我们节俭；因为疾病，我们注意健康。那么，什么悲伤不能变成欢喜？因此，有成就的人把繁荣和逆境看作是一样的，并且忘记了欢喜和悲伤。

text.ori_cn: 耳根似颷谷投响、过而不留、则是非倶谢。心境如月池浸色、空而不着、则物我两忘。
text.man_en: Our sense of hearing resembles a whirlwind hurling itself down the valley: If it passes on without lingering, Both good and evil will go with it. Our mind is like the moon submerging its colors in a pool: If it is empty and unattached, It will forget both self and the outside world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The ear is like the sound of a soaring valley; if it passes by without staying, then it is right and wrong. The mind is like a moon pool dipped in colours; if it is empty and does not have any attachment to it, then it forgets both things and itself.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The roots of the ears are like the sound of the ears, passing by but not staying, which is wrong. The state of mind is like a moon pool soaked in color, empty but not connected, then both things and myself are forgotten.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If our ears, like the wind through a valley, catch sounds but do not retain them, then right and wrong both pass away. If our mind, like the moon reflecting on water, remains empty without attachment, then the distinction between self and things disappears.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们的听觉就像一阵旋风，从山谷中呼啸而过：如果它不作停留，善与恶都将随之而去。我们的心灵就像月亮在水池中沉浸自己的颜色：倘若它空洞无物，就会忘却自我和外界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我们的听觉就像一股旋风从山谷里吹下来，如果它不停留，善恶都会随之而去。我们的心如月色入池，若空无着，就会忘记自我，忘记外在世界。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们的听觉如同狂风呼啸穿越山谷：如果它不停留，善与恶都会随之而去。我们的心灵如同月亮将光辉沉浸在池水中：如果它空明无挂，便会忘却自我与外界。

text.ori_cn: 世人为栄利缠缚、动曰尘世苦海。不知云白山青、川行石立、花迎鸟笑、谷答樵讴。世亦不尘、海亦不苦、彼自尘苦其心尔。
text.man_en: People of this world wrap themselves in chains For the sake of profit and gain, Then talk of the world of dust, the sea of bitterness. They do not know that Clouds are white, mountains blue. Rivers run, rocks stand tall. Blossoms invite, birds laugh. The valley responds, the woodcutters sing. This world, after all, is not of dust; The sea, after all, is not bitter. It is only that, on their own, people put dust and bitterness in their hearts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world is bound by ego, and they say that the world is a sea of misery. They do not know that the clouds are white, the mountains are green, the rivers run along the rocks, the flowers welcome the birds, the valleys answer the woodcutter's song. The world is not dusty and the sea is not bitter, but they are suffering from their own dust.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The world is entangled and bound by profit, and it is said that the world is a sea of ​​suffering. I don’t know that the clouds are white, the mountains are green, the rivers are flowing with standing stones, the flowers are welcoming the birds’ laughter, and the valleys are listening to the woodcutter’s singing. The world is not dusty, the sea is not bitter, and the dust is bitter in its heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The people of the world are ensnared by the pursuit of glory and profit, and they often lament the suffering sea of this dusty world. Little do they realize that the clouds are white, the mountains are green, rivers run by solid rocks, flowers greet the birds with smiles, and valleys echo the woodcutter's songs. The world is not truly dusty, nor is the sea truly bitter; they merely burden their hearts with such dust and suffering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世人为利禄，自缚枷锁，谈尘世，说苦海。他们不知道，云是白的，山是蓝的。河水奔流，岩石高耸。花在邀，鸟在笑。山谷回应，樵夫歌唱。这世界，终究不是尘埃；这大海，终究不是苦涩。只是，人们自己把尘埃和苦涩装进了心里。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 世间之人，为利益而锁链，遂谈尘世苦海。他们不知道云是白的，山是蓝的。河流奔腾，岩石巍然。花开邀，鸟笑。山谷回应，樵夫歌唱。这个世界毕竟不是尘埃；毕竟，大海并不苦。只是人们靠着自己，在心里埋下了尘埃和苦涩。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这个世界上的人为了利益和收获把自己裹在锁链中，然后谈论尘世，苦海。他们不知道，云是白的，山是蓝的。河川流淌，岩石耸立。花朵邀请，鸟儿欢笑。山谷回应，樵夫歌唱。这个世界，毕竟，不是尘埃；大海，毕竟，不是苦涩。只是人们自愿在心中放置尘埃和苦涩。

text.ori_cn: 花看半开、酒饮微酔。此中大佳趣。若至烂漫骸醄、便成悪境矣。履盈満者、宜思之。
text.man_en: Viewing flowers in partial bloom, Drinking wine to only mild inebriation— Within such things there is a strong sense of refinement. But if you only treasure full bloom Or drink until you fall down drunk, You enter evil territory. The man who strides toward saturation Should think this over more than once.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The flowers are half bloomed, and the wine is made slightly quicker. This is a great pleasure. If you are in a state of excessive and unruly behaviour, you will be in a very difficult situation. If you are a man with a strong heart, you should think about it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The flowers are half-opened and the wine is slightly drunk. Great fun in this. If it reaches the state of romance, it will become a state of despair. Those who are tired of walking should think about it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Admire flowers when they are half-bloomed, drink wine when you are mildly tipsy. There is great pleasure in this. If the flowers are in full bloom or you are completely drunk, it becomes a bad situation. Those who have reached fullness should reflect on this.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 赏花只赏残花，饮酒只饮微醉--在这些事物中，有一种强烈的精致感。但如果你只珍惜盛开的花朵，或饮酒至醉倒，你就进入了邪恶的领域。大步迈向饱和的人，应该反复思考这个问题。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 赏花残花，饮酒微醉，其中有浓浓的儒雅之感。但若只珍惜盛开，或饮酒至醉，则入恶境。迈向饱和的人应该不止一次地思考这一点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 观花只得半开，饮酒只到微醉——这些事情中有一种强烈的雅致。若只珍惜花开全盛或喝酒至醉倒，就进入了恶劣的境地。赶着追求极致的人，应该多加思考。

text.ori_cn: 山肴不受世间潅漑、野禽不受世间拳养、其味皆香而且冽。吾人能不为世法所点染、其臭味不迥然别乎。
text.man_en: Mountain vegetables will not thrive under cultivation or manmade compost; Birds of the field will not respond to human nurturing and care. The taste of such things is savory and fresh. If we human beings were able to remain untainted by greed and fame, Our dispositions would likely have similar qualities.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The taste of mountain food is fragrant and refreshing, even though it is not subject to the greenspan of the world, and the wild fowl are not raised by the world. Can we not be tainted by the ways of the world, and not have a different flavour?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Mountain delicacies are not subject to worldly cares, wild birds are not subject to worldly care, and their taste is both fragrant and pungent. How can we not be stained by the laws of the world and not be completely different from their stench?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mountain delicacies grow without the irrigation of the mundane world, and wild birds are not reared by human hands; their taste is both fragrant and pure. If we can remain untainted by worldly conventions, would not our essence be distinctly different?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 山野菜不会在人工栽培或人工堆肥下茁壮成长；田野里的鸟儿也不会对人类的培育和呵护做出回应。这些东西的味道是鲜美可口的。如果我们人类能够不被贪婪和名利所玷污，我们的性情也会有类似的特质。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 山地蔬菜在耕种或人造堆肥下无法生长；田野里的鸟类不会对人类的养育和照顾做出反应。这些东西的味道鲜美可口。如果我们人类能够不被贪婪和名誉所污染，我们的性情可能也会有类似的品质。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 野山菜在耕种或人工施肥下不会茁壮成长；田野中的鸟儿不会对人类的培育和照料做出反应。这些东西的味道是鲜美而清新的。如果我们人类能够不被贪婪和名利所污染，我们的性情很可能也会有类似的品质。

text.ori_cn: 栽花种竹、玩鹤観鱼、亦要有段自得处。若徒留连光景、玩弄物华、亦吾儒之口耳、释氏之顽空而已。有何佳趣。
text.man_en: Planting flowers, raising bamboo, Taking pleasure in cranes, observing fish— Still, you need a bit of selfunderstanding. When you are vainly addicted to the scenery before you, Or take pleasure only in the external environment, It is what the Confucians call Learning that comes in the ears And goes right out the mouth. Or what the Buddhists call Obstinately grasping the void. What kind of refinement is this?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: You have to enjoy yourself by planting flowers and bamboos, playing with cranes and fish. If you just stay in the scenery and play with things, you are just like the Confucians' mouth and ears, and the Sakya's stubbornness and emptiness. It is not interesting.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Planting flowers and bamboos, playing with cranes and watching fish should also be a source of contentment. If you just linger on the scenery and play with the beauty of things, it is just like the words and ears of my Confucians and the stubbornness of the Buddhists. What fun.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Planting flowers and bamboo, playing with cranes and watching fish, one must find a place for personal enjoyment. If one merely lingers over the scenery and toys with nature's wonders, it is merely the talk of us scholars or the emptiness of Buddhists. What delight is there in that?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 种花、养竹、赏鹤、观鱼--还是需要一点自知之明。当你妄自沉迷于眼前的景色，或只以外部环境为乐时，这就是儒家所说的 "学从耳入，学从口出"，或佛家所说的 "执空"。或者佛家所说的执着于虚空。这是一种怎样的修炼？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 种花、养竹、赏鹤、观鱼——还是需要一点自我了解。当你徒然沉迷于眼前的风景，或只享受外在的环境时，儒家所说的学问，是从耳中来，从口中出的。或者佛家所说的执着空性。这是怎样的精致？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 植花种竹，喜鹤观鱼——但你依然需要一些自知之明。当你沉迷于眼前的景色，或仅仅对外部环境感到满意时，这就是儒家所说的“入耳即出口的学问”，或佛家所称的“执着于空”。这算哪门子的修养呢？

text.ori_cn: 山林之士、清苦而逸趣自饶、农野之夫、鄙略而天真浑具。若一矢身市井伹侩、不若転死沟壑神骨犹清。
text.man_en: Recluses living in mountains and forests practice pure poverty, But their transcendence is of itself abundant. Men toiling on the farms and in the fields are vulgar and plain, But possess a natural sincerity that is complete. Even once losing yourself to the brokers of village and town Does not equal falling to your death in a ravine and leaving behind a pure body and soul.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man of the mountains and the forests is a man of hardship and enjoyment; the man of the countryside is a man of meanness and innocence. If you are a slow and clumsy businessman, it is not as if you have turned to die in a gully and the bones of God are still clear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The people in the mountains and forests are poor and happy, while the people in the fields are contemptuous and naive. If a arrow is thrown into the marketplace, it will be like a fool, but if it is not as good as death in a ravine, the bones of the spirit will still be clear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Men of the mountains and forests, though living a humble and austere life, are rich in leisure and charm; farmers and villagers, though simple and crude, embody a natural and unpretentious innocence. To live as a merchant in the city, amidst the din and trade, is less desirable than to die in the ditches, retaining the purity of one's spirit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生活在山林中的隐士纯粹清贫，但他们的超脱本身就很充实。在农田里劳作的人粗俗朴素，但他们拥有一种自然的真诚。即使曾经迷失在村镇的掮客中，也不等同于坠落峡谷而死，留下纯洁的肉体和灵魂。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 山林隐士虽清贫，其超脱自足。耕田劳作的人，虽然粗俗朴素，却有着十足的天然真诚。即使曾经迷失于乡镇的掮客手中，也不等于跌入深谷而死，留下纯净的肉体和灵魂。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 隐居山林的人们修炼纯粹的贫穷，但他们的超然本身就是丰盈的。在农田里辛勤劳作的人们虽然质朴，但却拥有完全的自然真诚。即使有一次迷失在乡村和城镇的中介人中，也不如掉进山谷中丧命，留下纯净的身体和灵魂。

text.ori_cn: 非分之福、无故之获、非造物之钓饵、即人世之机妌。此处着眼不高、鲜不堕彼术中矣。
text.man_en: Fortune beyond your status, Things entrusted to you for no reason— If these are not snares set by the Creator of Things, They are traps laid by the world at large. With such encounters, if you do not fix your eyes high, You will rarely fail to fall for their tricks.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The blessings of the world are not shared, nor are they gained for no reason, nor are they the bait of creation, that is, the opportunities of the world. If you do not have a high view here, you will seldom fall into his art.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Blessings that are not part of the world, gain without reason, bait that is not created, are opportunities in this world. The focus here is not high, and it is rare to fall into that technique.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Unwarranted blessings and unearned gains are either the bait of fate or machinations of the world. If one does not aim high, it is easy to fall into their trap.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 超出你地位的财富，无缘无故托付给你的东西--如果这些不是造物主设下的陷阱，那就是整个世界布下的陷阱。面对这样的遭遇，如果你不擦亮眼睛，就很难不上当受骗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 超越地位的财富，无缘无故托付给你的东西，如果不是造物主设下的网罗，那就是世人设下的陷阱。遇到这样的事情，如果你不把目光放高，很少会中他们的诡计。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 超出你身份的财富，无缘无故托付给你的事物— 如果这些不是造物主设下的陷阱，它们就是整个世界布下的陷阱。有了这些遭遇，如果你不把眼光放高，你很少能避免掉进它们的圈套。

text.ori_cn: 人生原是一傀儡。只要根蒂在手。一线不乱、巻舒自由、行止在我。一毫不受他人提掇、便超出此场中矣。
text.man_en: The human is, at bottom, nothing more than a marionette. You need only to have your hands at the source To let no string become tangled, To pull and release each freely, To have stop and go reside in yourself, And not to allow even a thin hair to be manipulated by another. In this way, you can surely transcend this place.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Life is a puppet. As long as the root is in the hand. The line is unruffled, the makings are free, the behaviour is mine. If I am not subjected to others, then I am beyond this field.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Life is a puppet. Just have the basics in hand. The line is not chaotic, the volume is comfortable and free, and the movement and stop are all mine. If you are not encouraged by others, you will be beyond this field.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Life is originally a puppet. As long as the strings are in hand, nothing is disordered, and unrolling or coiling is at my will, actions and stops depend on me. Not being manipulated by others in the slightest, one transcends this sphere.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从根本上说，人不过是一个提线木偶。你只需将双手放在源头，不让任何一根线缠绕，自由地拉扯和释放每一根线，让停与走都在自己心中，不允许哪怕是一根细小的头发被他人操纵。这样，你就一定能超越这里。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人，归根结底不过是一个牵线木偶。你只要把手放在源头，不让任何一根绳子缠结，拉扯自如，放开自如，走走停停都在自己身上，不让一根细毛为他人所动。这样一来，你就一定能够超越这个地方了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人类归根结底只是一个提线木偶。你只需要控制源头，确保每根线不打结，自如地拉动和释放，让行动和停止由你自己掌握，不允许任何一丝一毫被他人操控。这样，你就一定能超越此地。

text.ori_cn: 一事起则一害生。故天下常以无事为福。読前人诗云、勧君莫话封候事、一将功成万骨枯。又云、天下常令万事平、匣中不惜千年死。虽有雄心猛气、不覚化为冰霰矣。
text.man_en: When one event takes place, one injury will surely follow. Therefore, in this world it has always been that happiness Arises from the lack of events. If you read the poetry of a man of earlier times, you will find this: I advise you, friend, do not talk of appointments and fiefs. The fame of one general is built from the bones of ten thousand. It is also said that In the world forever move all things toward peace. Then famous swords may rust in their boxes for ten thousand years without regret. Thus, though one may be ambitious and wild, He will, unawares, melt away like ice and sleet.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When one thing starts, another harm is born. Therefore, the world is often blessed with nothing. To read the poem of a former poet, "Don't talk to me about the matter of the official position, for I have accomplished a great deal of work and I will die. It has also been said that the world is always peaceful, but one does not want to die for a thousand years in the box. Although there is ambition and vigour, it is not 覚reduced to ice and snow.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When something happens, it will cause harm. Therefore, the world always regards nothing as a blessing. According to the poems of the predecessors, Sir Xiu should not talk about sealing and waiting for things to happen. One general can achieve great success and ten thousand bones will wither. It is also said that everything in the world is always in peace, and there is no need to die for a thousand years in the box. Although he was ambitious and fierce, he turned into ice and snow.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When one matter arises, one harm follows. Therefore, the world often regards the absence of events as a blessing. Reading the poetry of predecessors says, 'I urge you not to talk of titles and honors; for a general's success comes at the cost of countless bones.' It also says, 'If the world can always be at peace in all things, I would not mind the sword lying dead in its sheath for a thousand years.' Although there may be a fierce and ambitious spirit, it unconsciously turns into ice and sleet.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一件事的发生，必然会带来伤害。因此，在这个世界上，幸福总是源于缺乏事件。如果你读读古代人的诗歌，就会发现这一点：朋友，我劝你不要谈论任命和封地。一将功成万骨枯。又曰："世间万物，永向和平。那么，名剑可在匣中生锈万年而不悔。因此，即使一个人野心勃勃、狂放不羁，他也会在不经意间如冰雪消融。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当一件事情发生时，必然会发生一种伤害。所以，这个世界上，幸福从来都是源于无事。如果你读古人的诗，你会发现：朋友，我劝你不要谈论任命和封地。一将之名，是万骨之成。也有人说，世界上的万物永远走向和平。那么名剑就可以在盒子里生锈万年而无悔。因此，即使一个人野心勃勃，野心勃勃，他也会在不知不觉中像冰雨一样消融。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一事未成，一伤必随。因此，世上幸福常源于无事。如果你细读前人的诗句，你会发现：我劝你，朋友，不要谈论官职和封地。一将功成万骨枯。也有人说，这世间永远走向和平。那时，名剑可以在盒子里生锈千年而无憾。所以，即使一个人雄心壮志，野心勃勃，他也会在不知不觉中像冰雪一样消融。

text.ori_cn: 淫奔之妇、矫而为尼、热中之人、激而入道。清净之门、常为淫邪之渊薮也如此。
text.man_en: A lascivious woman in her extremity Will become a nun. A hotblooded man in his exasperation Will enter the Buddhist Way. Thus the gates to purity and ablution Are forever the haunts and lairs of the licentious and lewd.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The woman who runs away with lust becomes a nun, and the man who is in the heat of the moment is stirred up to enter the Way. The gate of purity is often the abode of lust and wickedness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A promiscuous woman will pretend to be a nun, and a passionate person will enter the Tao in a hurry. The same is true with the gate of purity, which is often the abyss of sexual immorality.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A woman indulging in licentious behavior becomes a nun through pretense; a person driven by passion enters the path of the Tao when agitated. Thus, the pure and tranquil path often becomes a haven for debauchery and vice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 淫荡的女人到了极点会出家。热血男儿恼羞成怒，也会进入佛门。因此，清净和沐浴之门永远是放荡和淫荡者的出没之地和巢穴。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个淫荡的女人在她的极端将成为一个修女。热血之人，在愤怒中，将进入佛道。因此，纯洁和沐浴之门永远是放荡和淫荡者的出没和巢穴。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个淫荡的女人在极端情况下会成为一个修女。一个热血的男人在极度愤怒中会皈依佛门。于是，纯洁和净化的大门永远是放荡和淫乱之人的藏身之处。

text.ori_cn: 波浪兼天、舟中不知惧、而舟外者寒心。猖狂骂坐、席上不知警、而席外者咋舌。故君子身虽在事中、心要超事外也。
text.man_en: When surging waves reach the heavens, Those aboard a ship have no sense of fear, While those not on the ship are struck cold with terror. When a howling drunk rails against friends seated with him, Those at the table pay him no mind, While those at a distance bite their tongues in disgust. Therefore, the gentleman, Though sailing bodily amidst events, Should pass far beyond them in his mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Waves and sky, the boat does not know fear, but those outside the boat are chilled. The man in the boat does not know how to be afraid, but those outside of the boat are cold-hearted. Therefore, even though the gentleman's body is in the middle of the matter, his heart should be beyond the matter.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The waves are as big as the sky, and those in the boat have no fear, while those outside the boat are chilled. He scolded those sitting at the table wildly, and those at the table were unaware of the police, while those outside the table were speechless. Therefore, although a gentleman's body is involved in things, his mind should be above things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the waves merge with the sky, those within the boat feel no fear, whereas those outside the boat are apprehensive. Amidst reckless rebuke, those at the table remain unalarmed, while those outside the table are astonished. Thus, a gentleman, though physically involved in the matter, must keep his mind elevated beyond it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当汹涌的波涛直冲云霄，船上的人毫无惧色，而不在船上的人却吓得浑身发抖。当一个醉汉咆哮着抨击同座的朋友时，同桌的人毫不理会，而远处的人却厌恶地咬牙切齿。因此，绅士虽然身体在事件中航行，但他的思想应该远远超越事件。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 滔天巨浪冲天，船上者无惧，不在船者惊寒。醉酒者嚎啕大骂同桌的朋友，同桌的人不理他，远处的人则厌恶地咬着舌头。因此，君子虽身在事中航行，心却应远超事事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 狂浪高卷时，船上人不觉惊恐，岸上人却吓得心寒。醉汉在席间对友人大发雷霆，同桌的人不以为意，远处的人却咬紧牙根，心生厌恶。因此，君子，虽身处世事中，心应超然物外。

text.ori_cn: 人生减省一分、便超脱一分。如交游减便免纷扰、言语减便寡愆尤、思虑减则精神不耗、聡明减则混沌可完。彼不求日减而求日増者、真桎梏此生哉。
text.man_en: When you decrease or curtail some things a bit, Life is transcended by the same amount. If meetings with friends are decreased, confusion is avoided. If words and utterances are decreased, errors are greatly reduced. If thoughts and reflections are decreased, the spirit is not dissipated. If cleverness is decreased, the Great Nebulous can be brought to perfection. Those who seek daily not to decrease, but to add, Truly bring to their lives fetters and chains.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The less one saves in life, the more one transcends. If you reduce your travelling, you will be free from disturbance; if you reduce your speech, you will have fewer offences; if you reduce your thinking, your spirit will not be depleted; if you reduce your knowledge, you will be able to complete your chaotic life. He who seeks to increase rather than to decrease is really shackled to this life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The less you save in life, the more you become transcendent. If communication is reduced, trouble will be avoided; if speech is reduced, there will be less confusion, especially if thinking is reduced, the energy will not be exhausted; if clarity is reduced, chaos will be over. Those who do not seek daily decrease but seek daily increase are truly shackles in this life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In life, the more one reduces, the more one achieves transcendence. Reducing social interactions frees one from entanglements, speaking less helps avoid errors, thinking less conserves energy, and being less clever allows for a serene mind. Those who seek daily increases instead of daily reductions are truly shackling their lives.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你减少或削减一些事情时，生活也会随之超越。如果减少与朋友的会面，就能避免混乱。减少言语，错误就会大大减少。减少思考和反省，精神就不会涣散。聪明若减，大叵测可成。那些每天不求减少，只求增加的人，真的会给他们的生活带来束缚和枷锁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你稍微减少或限制一些事情时，生命就会被同样程度地超越。如果减少与朋友的会面，就可以避免混乱。如果单词和话语减少，错误就会大大减少。思虑减少，精神不消散。聪明减了，大云就能圆满。那些每天寻求的不是减少而是增加的人，真正给他们的生活带来了束缚和锁链。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你减少或缩减某些事物时，生活就由此而超越。如果减少与朋友的聚会，可以避免混乱。如果减少言语和话语，错误就会大大减少。如果减少思想和反思，精神就不会消散。如果减少聪明机智，可以使大清晰完善起来。那些每天追求不减少，而是增加的人，确实给他们的生活带来了枷锁和锁链。

text.ori_cn: 天运之寒暑易避、人世之炎凉难除。人世之炎凉易除、吾心之冰炭难去。去得此中之冰炭、则満腔皆和气、自随地有春风矣。
text.man_en: The heat and cold of Heaven's revolutions are easy to avoid; The flames and frigidity of society are difficult to elude. Even if the flames and frigidity of society are easy to elude, The freezing and charring of your mind are difficult to remove. If you are able to remove the freezing and charring from within, All within your breast will be in harmony: Wherever you go, spring breezes will follow of themselves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is easy to avoid the cold and heat of heavenly fortune, but it is hard to get rid of the heat and cold of the world. It is easy to get rid of the heat and cold of the world, but it is hard to get rid of the ice and charcoal in my heart. If I can get rid of the ice and charcoal in my heart, then all of my people will be in harmony, and there will be a spring breeze everywhere.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The cold and heat of destiny are easy to avoid, but the heat and cold of the human world are difficult to eradicate. The heat and coldness of the world are easy to remove, but the ice and charcoal in my heart are hard to remove. If you get rid of the ice and charcoal in it, your voice will be harmonious, and there will be a spring breeze everywhere.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The cold and heat of celestial time is easy to avoid, but the warmth and bitterness of the mortal world are hard to remove. The warmth and bitterness of the mortal world are easy to remove, but the burning and freezing within my heart are difficult to dispel. If I could dispel the burning and freezing within, then my whole being would be filled with harmony, and spring breezes would naturally follow me wherever I go.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天道之寒暑易避，社会之炎凉难避。即使社会的烈焰和寒冷容易躲避，但你心灵的冰冻和焦灼却难以消除。如果你能消除内心的冰冷和焦灼，你胸中的一切都会变得和谐：无论你走到哪里，春风都会自来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天行之热、冷，是容易避免的；社会的火焰和冷漠是难以回避的。即使社会的火焰和冷漠很容易摆脱，但你心灵的冰冻和烧焦却很难消除。若能除内寒焦，则胸内一切和谐，所到之处，春风自至。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天道的寒暑尚且容易躲避，社会的冷暖却难以逃避。即使社会的冷暖容易逃避，心神的冻伤与炙烤却难以消除。如果能将内心的冻伤与炙烤消除，内心便能和谐：无论你去往何处，春风自会追随。

text.ori_cn: 茶不求精而壶亦不燥。酒不求冽而樽亦不空。素琴无弦而常调、短笛无腔而自适。纵难超越羲皇、亦可匹俦荆嵆阮。
text.man_en: I do not wish for the finest tea, but the jar is never empty. I do not ask for the purest wines, but the cask is never dry. My plain lute is without strings, but always in tune. My short flute is not hollow, but is just right for itself. Though it would be difficult to play as well as Emperor Hsi, I can count myself an equal to Chi and Yuan.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Tea does not need to be refined, but the pot is not dry. Wine does not need to be cold, but the bottle is not empty. The zither is always in tune without strings, and the piccolo is comfortable without an accent. Even if it is difficult to surpass Hsi Huang, it can be compared with Jing Storage Ruan.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The tea is not refined and the pot is not dry. The wine does not need to be strong and the bottle does not need to be empty. The plain qin has no strings but is constantly tuned, while the piccolo has no tune and is self-tuning. Even if it is difficult to surpass Emperor Xi, he can still marry Jing Jing and Ruan.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The tea does not seek refinement, yet the pot remains unblemished. The wine does not seek coldness, yet the cup is never empty. The simple zither has no strings but always holds its tune; the short flute has no fixed chambers but brings its satisfaction. Though it is difficult to surpass the ancient sages, one can still be a match for the likes of Jing, Ji, and Ruan.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我不求最好的茶，但茶缸里的茶永远不会空。我不奢求最纯正的葡萄酒，但酒桶里的酒永远不会干。我的琵琶没有弦，但总是合拍。我的短笛不空心，却恰到好处。我的琴声虽难与羲皇媲美，却可与戚继光、元好问并驾齐驱。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我不求最好的茶，但罐子永远不会空。我不求最纯的酒，但木桶永不干。我的普通鲁特琴没有琴弦，但总是调准。我的短笛不是空心的，而是恰到好处。虽然很难演得像熹帝，但我可以认为自己可以与池、元相提并论。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我不希望有最好的茶，但罐子从未空过。我不要求最纯的酒，但酒桶从未干过。我的普通琵琶没有弦，但总是调得很准。我的短笛并非中空，但对它自己来说恰到好处。虽然很难像帝尧那样出色地演奏，但我可以认为自己与夷和原齐名。

text.ori_cn: 释氏随缘、吾儒素位。四字是渡海的浮嚢。盖世路茫茫、一念求全、则万绪纷起。随寓而安、则无入不得矣。
text.man_en: Shakamuni's "Following one's karma"; Our Confucian "Adapting to one's position"— These two phrases are the water wings you may use to cross the sea. The world's road is wide. If you have even a single thought of seeking total satisfaction, Every possible desire will leap up in confusion. Be at ease following your temporary circumstances, And there will be no situation where you cannot yourself be.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Sakyamuni follows its own destiny, and my Confucianism has a vegetarian position. The four words are the follicles for crossing the sea. Covering the world's path is vast, a thought of seeking perfection, then all kinds of things rise. With the apartment, then no entry can not be carried out.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Shi family follows fate, and I am a Confucian scholar. The four characters are floating boats crossing the sea. The road to success is vast, and if you seek perfection with just one thought, everything will arise. As long as you live in peace, there will be nothing you can't get into.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Following destiny as Buddha teaches, or maintaining one's proper place as Confucius advises. These four words are like a floatation device for crossing the sea. In the vast uncertainties of the world, a single thought of seeking perfection can stir up countless troubles. But if one adapts and finds peace in any situation, then there is no situation one cannot overcome.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 释迦牟尼的 "随缘"，儒家的 "因位"--这两句话是渡海的水翼。世界的道路是宽广的。若有一念求全满，万般欲念皆乱跳。随遇而安，无往不利。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 释迦牟尼的《随缘》；我们儒家的“因势利导”——这两句话就是你渡海的水翼。世界的路是宽阔的。如果你有一丝想要完全满足的念头，所有可能的欲望都会在混乱中跳跃。随遇而安，无事不成。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 释迦牟尼的“随顺因缘”；我们的儒家“随遇而安”——这两个词句是你渡海时可以使用的浮水翼。世界的道路广阔无边。如果你有一丝一毫追求完美满足的念头，各种欲望就会纷纷攘攘。安心随顺一时的境遇，这样就没有你不能安身的地方。

text.ori_cn: 福莫福于少事，祸莫祸于多心。唯苦事者，方知少事之为福；唯平心者，始知多心之为祸。
text.man_en: There is no happiness like the happiness of having few affairs. There is no misfortune like that of having many worries. Only the man who is troubled with affairs ultimately knows the happiness having few affairs brings. Only the man whose mind is at peace gets to know the misfortune having many worries entails.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Fortunes come from doing few things, and woes come from being over-ambitious. Only he who suffers will know the blessing of little; only he who is fair-minded will know the curse of many hearts.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: No blessing comes from doing less, and no disaster comes from having too many thoughts. Only those who work hard will know that doing less is a blessing; only those with a calm mind will know that having too much mind is a disaster.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is no greater blessing than having fewer concerns, and no greater misfortune than being overly worried. Only those who have endured hardships understand the blessing of fewer worries; only those with a calm heart realize the misfortune of overthinking.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 没有什么幸福比得上事务少的幸福。没有什么不幸比得上烦恼多的不幸。只有事务缠身的人，才能最终体会到事务少带来的幸福。只有心境平和的人，才能知道烦恼多带来的不幸。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 没有什么幸福能比得上少有情事的幸福了。没有比忧虑多的不幸了。只有被事务困扰的人才最终知道少事务带来的幸福。只有心平气和的人，才知道多愁善感的不幸。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 世上没有什么幸福比得上无事一身轻；没有什么不幸比得上忧虑重重。只有被琐事缠身的人，才能体会到无事一身轻的幸福；只有内心平静的人，才能了解忧虑重重的不幸。

text.ori_cn: 处治世宜方，处乱世宜圆，处叔季之世，当方圆并用；待善人宜宽，待恶人宜严，待庸众之人，当宽严互存。
text.man_en: When living in a time of order, one should act with propriety When living in a time of confusion, one should adapt to circumstances. In these degenerate days It is best to act in both ways. When dealing with good men, one should be magnanimous. When dealing with bad men, one should be strict. In commerce with the ordinary run of men, It is best to be both harmoniously.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In a world of governance, it is appropriate to be square, in a world of chaos, it is appropriate to be round, in the world of Shu Ji, when the square and the round are used together; to treat the good people should be lenient, to treat the bad people should be strict, to treat the mediocre people, when leniency and strictness of mutual coexistence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When dealing with the world, it is appropriate to be square, when dealing with troubled times, it is appropriate to be round, and when living in the age of Shu Ji, both square and round should be used; when treating good people, it is appropriate to be lenient, when dealing with evil people, it is appropriate to be strict, and when dealing with mediocre people, lenient and strict should coexist.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In times of peace and stability, one should adhere to principles; in times of chaos, one should be adaptable. In an era of transition, one should be both principled and adaptable. When dealing with good people, one should be lenient; when dealing with wicked people, one should be strict. When dealing with the common folk, leniency and strictness should be balanced.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生活在秩序井然的时代，就应该行为得体；生活在混乱不堪的时代，就应该随机应变。在这个堕落的时代，最好是两面兼顾。与好人相处，应宽宏大量。与坏人打交道时，应该严格要求自己。在与普通人打交道时，最好是两者兼顾。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 治之时，应礼而行之；乱之时，应因势利导。在这些堕落的日子里，最好两全其美。与好人相处，应该有大度。对待坏人，一定要严厉。在与普通人做生意时，最好两者和谐相处。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在有序的时代，应该以礼行事。在混乱的时代，应该随机应变。在这些堕落的日子里，最好两者兼顾。对待好人，应该宽宏大量。对待坏人，应该严格。在与普通人打交道时，最好和谐共处。

text.ori_cn: 我有功于人不可念，而过则不可不念；人有恩于我不可忘，而怨则不可不忘。
text.man_en: You should forget the service you have rendered to others, But not the troubles you have caused. You should not forget the favors others have done for you, But discard feelings of enmity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I must not forget what I have done to others, but I must not forget what I have done to them; I must not forget what they have done to me, but I must not forget what they have done to me.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I should not forget my merits to others, but I should not forget my faults; I should not forget the kindness of others to me, but I should not forget my grievances.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One should not dwell on the good deeds they have done for others, but must remember their own faults; one should never forget the kindness received from others, but must always remember any grievances.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你应该忘记为他人提供的服务，但不能忘记自己带来的麻烦。你不应忘记他人对你的恩惠，但应摒弃敌意。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你应该忘记你为别人提供的服务，但不应该忘记你给别人带来的麻烦。不可忘记别人对你的恩惠，但要舍弃敌意。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你应当忘记你对别人提供的服务，但不要忘记你引起的麻烦。你不应当忘记别人对你的恩惠，但要摒弃敌意。

text.ori_cn: 施恩者，内不见己，外不见人，则斗粟可当万钟之惠；利物者，计己之施，责人之报，虽百镒难成一文之功。
text.man_en: When doing a favor, If inwardly you put no value on your own action And outwardly do not calculate the feelings of the other, Then a spoonful of grain will equal the blessings of a hundred bushels. When your actions benefit another, If you measure your own charity And press the other for recompense, Then a thousand in payment have scarcely the merit of a few coins.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who give favours, not seeing themselves inside and not seeing others outside, can take the favours of ten thousand bells for a bucket of corn; those who benefit things, counting their own charity and blaming others for their rewards, can hardly achieve the merit of a single article even though they have a hundred taels to their name.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who give favors do not see themselves internally and do not see others outside, so a bucket of millet can be regarded as a favor; while those who benefit from things are calculated to benefit themselves and repay others, even if a hundred yi can hardly make one penny's merit.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who show kindness without seeing themselves internally or others externally can consider a pint of grain equivalent to a gift of ten thousand bushels; those who benefit others but calculate their own contributions and demand returns from others, even with a hundred gold coins, cannot accomplish the value of a single penny.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你帮助他人时，如果内心不重视自己的行为，外表也不考虑他人的感受，那么一勺谷物就等于一百蒲式耳的祝福。当你的行为造福他人时，如果你衡量自己的施舍，并向对方索要报酬，那么一千个报酬的价值也不及几个硬币。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 行善时，如果内心不重视自己的行为，表面上不计较他人的感受，那么一勺谷物就等于一百斗的福气。当你的行为有益于他人时，如果你衡量自己的施舍，并要求对方给予报酬，那么一千的报酬还不到几个硬币的功德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在行善时，如果心里不看重自己的行为，外在也不计较别人的感受，那么一勺粮食的福报可以等同于一百斗。当你的行为对他人有益时，如果你衡量自己的善意并逼迫他人偿还，那么即使得到千金作为报偿，其功德也不过如几枚钱币。

text.ori_cn: 人之际遇，有齐有不齐，而能使己独齐乎？己之情理，有顺有不顺，而能使人皆顺乎？以此相观对治，亦是一方便法门。
text.man_en: Among the circumstances in which people find themselves, Some are satisfactory and others are not. How can you want only your own to be replete? As for the workings of your heart, It is at some times in order and at other times not. How can you expect the heart of others to be always so constant? Look deeply into relativity and harmonize things accordingly. This will be a convenient way to the gate of truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: How can we make ourselves alone in the same situation as others? How can we make our own feelings agreeable or disagreeable, and how can we make all others agreeable? This is also a convenient way of healing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The encounters between people may be both uneven and uneven, but how can we make ourselves unique? One's own feelings and principles may be favorable or unfavorable, but how can one make everyone agree? Treating it with this phase is also a method of convenience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In human affairs, there are times of alignment and misalignment. Can one always ensure one's own alignment? In one's emotions and reasoning, there are moments of accordance and discord. Can one make everyone agree with oneself? Viewing and addressing these aspects this way is also a convenient method of practice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在人们所处的环境中，有的令人满意，有的却不尽人意。你怎么能只希望自己的生活充实呢？至于你的内心世界，它时好时坏。你怎么能期望别人的心总是如此恒定呢？深入探究相对性，并据此协调事物。这将是通往真理之门的便捷之路。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在人们发现自己所处的环境中，有些是令人满意的，有些则是不满意的。你怎么能只想要自己的东西被填满呢？至于你内心的运作，有时是有序的，有时则不是。你怎么能指望别人的心永远如此不变呢？深入研究相对论并相应地协调事物。这将是通往真理之门的便捷途径。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在人们所处的各种环境中，有些是令人满意的，有些则不然。你怎么能只希望自己的生活充实呢？至于你内心的运作，有时是有序的，有时则不。你怎么能期待别人的心总是如此恒定呢？仔细观察相对性并据此调和万物。这将是通向真理之门的便捷之路。

text.ori_cn: 心地清净，方可读书学古。不然，见一善行，窃以济私，闻一善言，假以覆短，是又藉寇兵而赍盗粮矣。
text.man_en: Having purified your mind, read books and study the ancients. If you do not study in this way, When you see a good act, You'll purloin it to make yourself look good. Hearing a good word, You'll borrow it to cover your own shortcomings. This is lending weapons to the enemy And bringing food to the thief.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart is pure, can read and learn ancient. Otherwise, see a good deed, steal to help private, heard a good word, false to cover the short, is again through the invasion of the army and a gift of stolen grain carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Only when your mind is pure can you study and learn from ancient times. Otherwise, if you see a good deed and steal it for personal benefit, if you hear a good word and use it to make up for your shortcomings, you will steal food through the enemy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only with a pure heart can one truly study and learn from the ancients. Otherwise, upon seeing a virtuous act, one might usurp it for personal gain; upon hearing a wise word, one might use it to cover one's shortcomings. Such behavior is like providing weapons to bandits and food to thieves.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 清心寡欲，读书学习古人。如果你不这样学习，当你看到一个好的行为时，你就会剽窃它来让自己看起来很好。听到一句好话，你会借用它来掩饰自己的缺点。这就是把武器借给敌人，把食物送给小偷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 净化心灵，读书古人。如果你不这样学习，当你看到好的行为时，你就会窃取它来让自己好看。听到好话，就会借它来掩盖自己的缺点。这是借武器给敌人，给贼送食物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心地已清净，然后读书习古人之所以言行。若不如此，一见贤人之善行，而窃以饰己；一闻善言，而假以掩过。此乃借敌人之兵，而食盗贼之粮也。

text.ori_cn: 奢者富而不足，何如俭者贫而有余；能者劳而府怨，何如拙者逸而全真。
text.man_en: The prideful live rich lives but are not satisfied. How can they equal the frugal man who lives as a pauper but has a surplus? The able exert themselves but reap the hostility of others. How can they equal the inept man who lives in idleness but consummates Truth? 27
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the extravagant are rich but not enough, how is it that the frugal are poor but have more than enough; if the capable are labouring and complaining, how is it that the clumsy are escaping and are in full truth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The extravagant person is rich but not enough, so is the thrifty person who is poor but has more than enough; the capable person is tired and resentful, but the clumsy person is relaxed and true.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The extravagant are wealthy yet unsatisfied, how is it compared to the frugal who are poor but have enough; the capable toil and harbor resentment, how is it compared to the clumsy who are at ease and preserve their true nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 傲慢的人生活富足，但并不满足。他们怎能与生活俭朴却有盈余的人相提并论？能干的人竭尽全力，却收获他人的敌意。他们怎能与无所事事却能完成真理的无能者相提并论？27
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 骄傲的人过着富裕的生活，但并不满足。他们怎么能与那些穷困潦倒却有盈余的节俭之人相比呢？能努力的人，却会受到别人的敌意。他们怎能与那些无所事事却圆满真理的无能之人相提并论呢？ 27 号
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 骄傲的人生活富裕但不满足。他们怎么能比得上虽然过得像穷人但仍有盈余的节俭人呢？能干的人努力工作却受到他人的敌意。他们怎么能比得上虽然闲散但能实现真理的无能人呢？

text.ori_cn: 读书不见圣贤，为铅椠佣；居官不爱子民，为衣冠盗；讲学不尚躬行，为口头禅；立业不思种德，为眼前花。
text.man_en: Reading books but not seeing the wisdom and intelligence within— This is being a slave to paper and print. Being of high rank but not loving the people— This is a thief wearing ceremonial robes. Lecturing on learned subjects but not giving proper respect to putting them into action— This is Zen of the mouth alone. Performing great achievements but giving no thought to the seeds of virtue for the future— This is only flowers blooming and withering right before your eyes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Reading books do not see the sages, for the lead commission; official does not love the people, for the clothes thief; lectures do not Shang Shang practice, for the mantra; business does not think of planting virtues, for the flowers in front of the eyes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you read without seeing sages, you will become a servant; if you hold an official position and do not love the people, you will become a thief of clothes; if you lecture instead of doing it, you will become a man of words; if you establish a career without thinking about cultivating virtue, you will become a flower in front of your eyes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Reading without learning from sages makes one a mere copyist; serving as an official without loving the people makes one a clothed thief; teaching without practicing makes one a talker of empty words; establishing a career without nurturing virtue makes one bloom only for the moment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 读万卷书而不见其内在的聪明才智--这是纸张和印刷品的奴隶。身居高位却不爱民--这是穿礼袍的贼。讲学却不重视付诸行动--这是口禅。立下赫赫战功，却不考虑为未来播下美德的种子--这只是眼前的花开花谢。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 读了书却看不到里面的智慧和智慧——这就是成为纸张和印刷品的奴隶。地位高而不爱民，这是披袍贼。只讲学而不尊重行，这是唯口禅。成就大事而不顾未来的善种，这不过是眼前的花开花落。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 读书而不见其智慧与巧智——这就是做书的奴隶。身居高位但不爱人民——这是一名穿着礼服的小偷。讲授学术却不尊重实践——这只是嘴上功夫的禅。成就伟大事业却不为未来播下美德的种子——这只是眼前开花谢花。

text.ori_cn: 人心有一部真文章，都被残编断简封锢了；有一部真鼓吹，都被妖姬艳舞湮没了。学者须扫除外物，直觅本来，才有个真受用。
text.man_en: In every human heart there is one volume of the Book of Truth But all is packed away on the shelves, Pages here and pages there. In every human heart there is one score for the Music of Veracity. But all is buried under Popular songs and glamorous dances. The person who studies should sweep away externals And immediately seek what has been there from the beginning. Only then will he be able to put this truth to use.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a true article in the human heart, are the remnants of the broken Jane confinement; there is a true advocate, are the siren dance obliterated. Scholars must sweep away the external things and look for the original, and only then have a real use.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a true article in people's hearts, but it has been sealed by fragments and fragments; there is a true propaganda, but it has been buried in the dance of the enchantress. Scholars must sweep away the exclusions and go straight to the original source to gain real benefit.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is a genuine article in the human heart, but it has been sealed by fragmentary and incomplete knowledge; there is a true melody, but it has been drowned out by the enchanting dances of concubines. A scholar must clear away external distractions and seek the original essence directly to attain true benefit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 每个人心中都有一卷真理之书，但都被束之高阁，这里一页，那里几页。每个人心中都有一本《真理之书》的乐谱。但一切都被埋没在流行歌曲和华丽舞蹈之下。学习的人应该扫除外在的东西，立即寻找从一开始就存在的东西。只有这样，他才能将这一真理付诸实践。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 每个人心中都有一卷《真理之书》，但所有的书都被打包在书架上，这里一页一页，那里一页一页。每个人心中都有一首真实之乐的乐谱。但一切都被流行歌曲和迷人的舞蹈所掩埋。修学之人，应扫除外在，立即追寻本已存在的事物。只有这样，他才能运用这个真理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在每个人的心中都有一卷《真理之书》，但都被收藏在书架上，页面散落在这里和那里。在每个人的心中都有一篇《真实音乐》的乐谱，但都被流行歌曲和华丽的舞蹈埋没。学习的人应当扫除外物，立即寻求自始以来一直存在的东西。只有这样，他才能够将此真理付诸实践。
